story:
Summary

  • Parents and kids know that they need to save energy but they don't have a roadmap to follow.  That's why more than 60 impassioned University of Central Florida interns have created The Green Actioneers Workbook: The Definitive Family Guide to Going Green, Saving Money for Families and Saving the Planet for Kids and the supporting website. When you support the project you get a signed first edition of our 250 page, spiral-bound roadmap with over 100 actions you can take at home to save energy, water, money and, ultimately, the Earth. Your contribution helps us complete and publish this vital workbook and  the website of choice for families who want to "go green."  

 

  • Let's all go green in quarantine - While we're quarantined at home with our families it is the perfect time to begin to save money and energy with simple actions that can make a big difference.  This book, in English and Spanish, will be a coloring book for your youngest family members, will provide relevant word games for older students and will be linked to a very thorough website where each of the 100+ actions is explained in great detail, sort of a "Wikipedia™ of Green."  It is a great project to start now while we're all together at home.
  • This book will be fun for the kids and we trust it will be equally engaging for the grownups.  "Mom, let's do this one next" should be something parents hear all the time as kids help parents discover the pathway to a clean and green future that work for them.  Our book has been "crowd-sourced" with the help of over over 60 interns in the sustainability program at University of Central Florida, and their Professor, Dr. Richard Plate.  Here's just one semester's crew, from Spring 2019.  They helped with research on over 100 actions.  

Here is the Fall 2019 crew of interns, helping to design this fund-raiser, shoot some test videos, begin to create puzzles and games and help polish the manuscript.

This is our current group of 20 interns helping with writing extensive blogs, social media marketing, creating games and puzzles for every page, helping with Spanish translation and helping promote this campaign.

  • Steps to a Green Future - We are mobilizing the world's two most powerful energy sources, the love of parents for their children and the incredible persuasive (nagging) power of kids.  About 50% of the carbon we put into the air comes from household energy use, food, transportation and the consumer goods we buy.  Cutting that number will be incredibly helpful to insure our kids have a livable future.  Families that participate in this program work in companies and for government agencies where they can carry the message upward.  We expect this transformation to a clean and green future will "bubble up" to leaders from families all over the country as they go step by step to sustainability. All the other plans we have heard about assume that the transformation to a sustainable future will "trickle down" from our leaders.  How is that transformation going so far?

For mankind to take giant leaps, individuals must take small steps.

    The Story of Watson Elementary (It's Elementary, Watson!)

    The story our artist, Jim Haynes, is creating for us with his wit and drawing ability is incredibly engaging.  For instance he has created two space characters, Kandou and Kantdou, from MOUGA (Make Our Universe Green Again) who are observing Earth and wondering whether we're going to be able to accomplish the goals that our hero, Professor Green, has set for the kids at Watson Elementary.

     

    Professor Green conducts activity classes for every grade level. Each grade gets to study one animal, such as monarch butterflies, bees, manatees, sea turtles, dolphins, black bears, polar bears, penguins or puffins, stressing the problems that creature faces because of people.  These activity sessions use music and games and other experiential learning techniques.  Here are kids lining up to go to their activity session.

    And here's Professor Green helping students experience the problems that frogs face because of humans.

    In the all-school assembly at the end of the day Professor Green tells the kids about Family Night that same evening.

     

     

     

    Here's the Professor making his presentation at Family Night.

     

    We're sure you can see how engaging the faces and how animated the characters are even in these preliminary sketches.  We explain in the book that the "Professor Green" who comes to the school might be a man or a woman.  Everyone who delivers a Green Actioneers program is "Professor Green."  You can become "Professor Green."  If your students are already aware of the need to "go green," you can skip right to Family night, pass out the books and challenge families to get to work.

    Once we get into the discussion of steps families can take to "go green" he brings the space travelers back in visual jokes, like when they mistake a washing machine for a long-lost relative.  This "Where's Waldo" type feature makes it fun to leaf through the book and look for Kandou and Kantdou who are often hiding.

    Or when they fall asleep on the thick insulation in the attic.

     

    Here's are a few pieces of finished art so you can see the quality.

    Houseplants can clean your air.

    Buy in Thrift stores and donate your unneeded items.

    Carry your own water from home.

    Compost your kitchen waste.

    Help your community compost waste wisely.

    Here's a typical two-page spread with English and Spanish on the parent's or left hand page and the coloring book and a word puzzle on the right hand page.

    Meanwhile back to the character development and storyline.  Early on we decided to create a story with close attention to issues of equity.  That is where the Green Actioneers cape comes in.  If they wish, each classroom teacher will have a cape that will be worn up until first recess by the student who, in the early morning, tells her or his classmates what their family has done to "go green."  

    In our example Bobby's family consists of three adopted kids and two Moms who live in an apartment in the downtown area and they don't have a car, so Bobby gets to wear the cape first, because his less affluent family is already acting in a very environmentally conscious manner.

    Here's Lakesha's suburban house.  By contrast, her family has three cars for two drivers.  They have a long way to go because their carbon footprint is huge, but they are dedicated to this transformation and we get to see them make some pretty consequential decisions as they put solar panels on their house, give their older cars to charity and buy an electric van.

    I know you are wondering about the third family.  They live on a mini-farm and help feed organic food to the entire town.  They even have created a fish farm using aquaponics. They are the Chens, and their son, Ken, helps set up a Community Supported Agriculture system to share their bounty with his classmates' families.  This is a preliminary sketch of their family, which includes several generations.

     

    If you've read this far I know we can count on you to order at least one book, and you probably are  entranced by Jim Haynes' artwork.  So please do order a book for yourself, one to give to a local elementary or K-8 school and you might want to spring for a piece of Jim's finished art, suitable for framing.  And because I was formerly a professional juggling instructor who visited over 2,000 schools in 46 states and 12 countries in my 30 year career, I've included some of my juggling DVDs, books and US made Juggle-eze juggling scarves as premiums.  These items are not available anywhere else, so get them while they last.

    •  How the Green Actioneers Handbook is organized - Our book is unique because it appeals to both kids and parents.  There are over 100 potential actions families can take to go green.  Every two-page spread describes one action with the parents' page on the left that tells briefly about some of the benefits of that action, and the kids' page on the right with a coloring book and a crossword puzzle, or other challenge for older kids.  The book will be bilingual in English and Spanish from the start.  The link on each page leads to much more thorough information on the website.
    • The story in the book - The story line follows three families, Bobby's urban family living in an apartment and dependent on public transportation, Lakesha's suburban family with a big house and three cars and Ken Chen's rural family with a mini-farm on the urban fringe.  Their kids are all in the same classroom at Watson Elementary school and the book follows each of these families as they "go green." Readers can follow the adventures of a family similar to their own, or select from all three. 
    • The book will connect families to The Green Actioneers website - Using links and QR codes we connect each action in the book to a much longer description of that action on our website.  What we are creating might be called "The Wikipedia™ of Green" for families and we expect to continue to research and expand the actions for years to come with the help of sustainability students from many colleges.  So anyone can become a researcher for the website.
    • Green businesses in every community can be involved - Local businesses that agree to provide rebates to schools for actions by families will be added to this program.  It is up to your school to approach local "green" businesses.  After their school has activated this feature, if a family installs solar on their roof or purchases or leases an electric vehicle, re-insulates their home, adds double-paned windows, or a reflective roof, then the school will get a rebate from participating vendors.

    What You Get

    • Green Actioneers Workbook - Contribute $20 to get a signed book as soon as it is published.  
    • The Zen of Juggling - For $10 you get a signed copy of The Zen of Juggling by Dave Finnigan.
    • Juggletime DVD - For $15 you can get a Parents Choice Award-winning DVD with 46 two-minute instructional songs designed for elementary school children covering scarves, balls, rings, clubs spinning plates, devil sticks, diabolo, and cigar box manipulation.
    • Juggling Step By Step DVD - For $15 you get our two hour classic DVD with instructions on juggling scarves, passing with a partner and juggling 3,4,5 and more balls, rings, and clubs, plus instruction on spinning plates, devil sticks, diabolo, and cigar box manipulation.
    • Juggle-eze non-woven juggling scarves - These are American made scarves and you can buy 5 sets of 3 scarves for $20, or $4 per set of three.  However for bulk purchasers each pack of 24 sets of three costs only $50, or $2 per set of three.  Give them as gifts or use them in classes with your juggling students.
    • Family Pack - For $25 we've got a very special deal for families - the Juggletime DVD plus 5 sets of Juggle-eze American made slow-moving juggling scarves.
    • Home School Pack - For $50 you get the Family Pack plus a copy of the Green Actioneers Workbook and a copy of The Zen of Juggling.
    • Teachers' Pack - For $99 you get all of the above.  A Green Actioneers Workbook, a copy of The Zen of Juggling, the Juggletime DVD, The Juggling Step By Step DVD and a pack of 24 sets of 3 Juggle-eze American made juggling scarves. 
    • Artist's Sketch - For $100 you get one of the 100+ original sketches by Jim Haynes.
    • Final Art - For $200 you get  one of the pages of final art for the book, signed by the artist and suitable for framing.
    • Green Actioneers school program - For a contribution of $5,000 Dave Finnigan will come to your town and deliver a full day Green Actioneers program in a school that you designate, plus give you all the items described above, and 200 books that you can resell, and provide a half day of training for teachers or parents from other schools so they can present the program on their own.  For a description of the program please check our website here.  Here is a link to our program brochure, and here is a five minute YouTube video that describes the program.  
    • If we don't reach our goal - We'll still use every cent toward the creation and publication of the book and the e-book.

    Impact

    • This workbook can serve as a "cookbook" for going green, saving money for families, making money for schools and helping kids create a clean and green future.
    • Your PTA or other sponsor can keep half the money from sale of the book. Contact us about how your organization can buy books in quantities of 100 at wholesale for as little as $10 (plus shipping), and sell it to families for $20.
    • Links in the book connect to "The website of choice for families who want to 'go green.'" 
    • Actions by families can provide substantial rebates to schools from local "green" businesses, once set in motion by the school.
    • The book can lead to the creation of a closed social network for every classroom where kids can post their "wins" and show their friends how they are doing.
    • This book does not mention the negative consequences of doing nothing.  It is in no way scary or accusatory.  It never mentions climate change or global warming or sea-level rise.  We don't say "Here's how bad it could be if we did everything wrong."  We say "Here's how great it will be when we do everything right!"

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • Get the word out about this campaign on social media. We can be found at https://www.facebook.com/greenactioneers/ and https://www.linkedin.com/company/greenactioneers/
    • Go to your local school and talk to the PTA, the Principal and interested teachers about the program, then get in touch with us and we'll follow up with them.
    • Talk to religious groups, scouts, the "Y", 4-H clubs, homeschool groups and other youth or family organizations about introducing a Green Actioneers program.
    • Anyone can become Professor Green.  A teacher or parent in your school or students from a nearby university can bring in the books, hold Family Night, and start a program.
    • Anyone from your school can work with local "green" businesses to set up a relationship where your PTA or other organization gets significant rebates when families from your school make purchases from these partners. 
    • Please use the Indiegogo share tools with your friends and colleagues!

    You can introduce this program yourself in your own school using the instructions in the book, however, if you want to get trained to go to schools and introduce the program and the book, please get in touch with us.  Thanks in advance for sharing this campaign widely and encouraging everyone you know to pre-buy a book (or two).  With hard work and a focus on the end results we can make a huge difference in the future of our beloved Earth.  

    Thanks for your help and support.  

    Dave Finnigan

story:
Echipa “Let’s Do It, Romania!” duce voluntariatul in era digitala! Vrem sa cream o aplicatie mobila, “Let`s Do It! mobile app”, cat si o platforma de administrare pentru a curata mai intai tara, apoi lumea, de reziduuri si deseuri ilegale. Poti fi voluntar cu un smartphone si o conexiune wi-fi. 

Cum functioneaza?

Pe scurt, curatarea deseurilor implica momentan doua obstacole:
1. Deseurile sunt raspandite ilegal pe teritoriul tarii si nu avem o harta completa a lor pentru a le curata.
2. Nu exista o procedura usoara pentru tine, ca cetatean, sa raportezi autoritatilor deseurile ilegale descoperite.

Aplicatia noastra te ajuta sa marchezi pe harta oricand, orice deseu intalnit in oras sau in natura. In campaniile “Let’s Do It, Romania” din ultimii 5 ani sute de oameni au facut eforturi personale pentru a cauta si gasi aceste deseuri fiindca nu exista o harta concreta a lor. Dezvoltand aplicatia, oricine va contribui in timp real la asamblarea unei Harti a Deseurilor cu fiecare click.

In momentul in care gasesti o zona afectata de reziduuri, aplicatia genereaza prin intermediul unui formular o sesizare oficiala catre autoritatile responsabile de curatarea ei. Conform legislatiei din Romania, autoritatile au obligatia de a reveni cu un raspuns la fiecare sesizare in maximum 30 de zile. Sesizarea ramane in istoricul aplicatiei tale si vei primi actualizari constant pana la solutionarea problemei semnalizate.

AVEM NEVOIE DE AJUTORUL TAU!

Ajuta-ne sa implinim visul: vrem sa folosim tehnologia pentru a avea o tara si o planeta mai curate. Vrem sa facem voluntariat mai repede, mai usor, cu un simplu smartphone. Un singur click chiar poate schimba lumea!
Doneaza oricat ai posibilitatea aici! Fiecare dolar conteaza!

EN

You already know illegal waste is poisoning our planet and your favorite spots in nature or neighborhood as well. Globally, 2 billion tons (1.000.000.000 times the load of an average truck) of garbage are disposed of yearly. Almost 1 million seabirds and 100,000 marine mammals die each year from eating plastic, many species becoming extinct.

“Let's Do It!” is the environmental mass movement worldwide created as a response to the statistics above. Over 12 million volunteers from 112 countries cleaned the world in the last 7 years. At “Let’s Do It, Romania!” we have cleaned 22,500 tons of trash and engaged over 1 million volunteers. But we need to do more, faster.

What’s our mission?

We want to use technology to amplify our efforts and help you clean your neighborhood and your favorite nature spots.  We are building an innovative platform & mobile app to easily identify and locate illegal waste, creating a connection between citizens and authorities responsible for clearing it up. The platform would run as a pilot in Romania and then we want  to extend it for being used worldwide.

Your donations will be matched - dollar for dollar

QUALITANCE accepted the challenge as our software partner by building the technology and contributing with 1 dollar for every dollar donated.

Why do you need this app for?

At the moment, cleaning the waste from your streets, parks, forests, beaches and rivers presents two major issues this application can solve:

1. You will now be able to report illegal waste and contribute to creating an accurate mapping and planning. Currently, volunteers go through an exhausting process of individually searching for trash points: they use personal cars, bikes and a GPS to find garbage spots, write down their coordinates and details by hand then return home from their quests and introduce data into our system via computer to create a partially complete clean-up map.

2. Your reports will be routed to local authorities in charge with cleaning up garbage.  In most cases contacting authorities is a confusing bureaucratic procedure that nobody knows how to use.


With your help, we could rely on next generation software to make both locating the garbage and involving authorities faster, easier and making volunteering available anytime, to anyone who simply owns a smartphone.

How does it work?

You have the chance to help save and clean the planet with the tip of your finger, literally! Just use the “Let’s Do It!” app every time you stumble upon a pile of garbage and don’t let it go unnoticed: report it immediately!

No WI-FI? No problem!

You can use the app offline too. When you reach an internet hot spot, the information automatically uploads itself to the “Let's Do It!” mapping platform, awaiting to be reviewed by the authorities.

You only need to use the mobile app that has a super-friendly user interface, but behind it there’s a complex platform that helps the “Let's Do It!” teams to coordinate cleaning campaigns, supervise the actions of the authorities and monitor all activity.

What do you get for your contribution?

First of all, a clean environment for you, your friends, family and our future generations. Also, our deep and sincere gratitude! But besides that, we’ve also got an awesome selection of eco-friendly perks.

Where and when will the app be available?

The project and app will pilot in Romania: we'll officially launch it on the 1st of July for our own little corner of the Earth. We're the first happy country to test out mapping and functions.

What's next? The rest of the world, of course! we want our project to become the official platform of "Let's Do It, World!". We want to make volunteering easy as a swipe for everyone in the world. That means starting with August 2015 we're giving away our app to other countries as well. Yours could be next!

LET’s DO THIS!  Let’s build a cleaner world together!

We’ve counted on your support so many times, now we’re counting on you again. Claim your perk on the right of this page to make digital volunteering happen. Be one of our first digital volunteers by contributing to the creation of this concept and donate now. We appreciate ANY kind of support.

How are the costs split up?

The platform has a complex back-end system to which the mobile app connects. Your funds will go directly into building both the mobile app and the platform behind it.  For every 1 dollar  you donate, QUALITANCE (our technology partner) will be contributing with 1 dollar  as well. The more we raise, the more features we can build to make volunteering smarter, easier, and more efficient!

Where we are and where we could be with YOUR help?

Frequently Asked Questions

Who are you?

"Let`s Do It, Romania!" is a social movement that started in 2009 with a group of people from different professional fields (IT, communication, finance, NGO) who decided to organize a National Clean Up Day. The legal entity behind this movement is called “Viitorul in Zori” and it is a non governmental apolitical association.

Why would I donate to your cause?

1. Because we’ve had tangible results over the last 5 years (1 million volunteers involved, 22 500 tons of trash collected) and we have showed credibility and trust all along the way. In Romania, we have a clean, trustworthy image and “Let`s Do It!” is a powerful brand with one of the biggest communities of dedicated volunteers locally. Also, we are part of an international movement that has a huge impact and relevant results: “Let`s Do It, World!” started in 2008, involving more than 11 millions volunteers and 112 countries in their clean ups all around the world.

2. Because our app is essential for the digital era we live in, helping you have a clean planet, a cleaner city or even neighborhood, a dream shared by millions of people worldwide. It’s easy to use, it helps you save nature in half the time with half the effort and you can be a volunteer anywhere, anytime, with just a swipe on your smartphone!  

Why is the app developed first in Romania?

“Let`s Do It, Romania!” team came up with this idea: we wanted to bring this social movement to the next level. Romania is one of the first countries that organized a National Clean Up Day and one of the strongest countries in the “Let`s Do It, World!” community, being a role model and a source of inspiration for other countries involved. Thus, Romania is going to be simply the first happy country to test it - more countries will follow in the next months. Right now we need your support for building it so everyone around the world can benefit!

How is the budget split up?

Everything you donate will go directly into building the mobile app and the software administration platform behind it, which will be used to sustain and update live the Garbage Map and automatically generate reports based on your pins for the local authorities in charge. You can see our budget split above with full transparency.

How did you start the partnership with QUALITANCE?

After coming up with the idea of the app, we made some research to find out what companies would be capable to develop the platform. We discussed with several companies in Romania and we immediately chose to work with QUALITANCE for 3 reasons:

- they came up with a well structured plan and a very creative solution to our brief

- they offered not only to build our platform and app but also to partially support the costs (for every dollar you donate, QUALITANCE will contribute with 1 dollar as well)

- they have a great team, strong professionals, very friendly and helpful

What if you raise more money than planned?

If more money than required is raised we’re building even more features for the app and platform, making volunteering even easier for you.

How will QUALITANCE help you in this process?

QUALITANCE will not only help us develop the mobile app and the entire software platform behind it, but also match all the donations 1 to 1.

Who can use this app?

The app will be available for free in Google Play or App Store starting 1st of July for Android and iOS. For using our app and being a digital volunteer, you simply need a smartphone and a wi-fi connection or mobile internet.

What happens when I pin a pile of trash with the app?

The pile will be uploaded to the Garbage Map instantly over WI-FI and updated later when you hit a hot spot if you don’t have a connection.  "Let`s Do It, Romania!" team checks it, approves it and generates an official report sent to the authorities in charge to clean it.

The "Let`s Do It, Romania!" team will monitor every report until the pile is cleaned: also, you receive regular updates and notifications about the status of the pile.

Echipa “Let’s Do It, Romania!” duce voluntariatul in era digitala! Vrem sa cream o aplicatie mobila, “Let`s Do It! mobile app”, cat si o platforma de administrare pentru a curata mai intai tara, apoi lumea, de reziduuri si deseuri ilegale. Poti fi voluntar cu un smartphone si o conexiune wi-fi. Cum functioneaza?Pe scurt, curatarea deseurilor implica momentan doua obstacole:1. Deseurile sunt raspandite ilegal pe teritoriul tarii si nu avem o harta completa a lor pentru a le curata.2. Nu exista o procedura usoara pentru tine, ca cetatean, sa raportezi autoritatilor deseurile ilegale descoperite.Aplicatia noastra te ajuta sa marchezi pe harta oricand, orice deseu intalnit in oras sau in natura. In campaniile “Let’s Do It, Romania” din ultimii 5 ani sute de oameni au facut eforturi personale pentru a cauta si gasi aceste deseuri fiindca nu exista o harta concreta a lor. Dezvoltand aplicatia, oricine va contribui in timp real la asamblarea unei Harti a Deseurilor cu fiecare click.In momentul in care gasesti o zona afectata de reziduuri, aplicatia genereaza prin intermediul unui formular o sesizare oficiala catre autoritatile responsabile de curatarea ei. Conform legislatiei din Romania, autoritatile au obligatia de a reveni cu un raspuns la fiecare sesizare in maximum 30 de zile. Sesizarea ramane in istoricul aplicatiei tale si vei primi actualizari constant pana la solutionarea problemei semnalizate.AVEM NEVOIE DE AJUTORUL TAU!Ajuta-ne sa implinim visul: vrem sa folosim tehnologia pentru a avea o tara si o planeta mai curate. Vrem sa facem voluntariat mai repede, mai usor, cu un simplu smartphone. Un singur click chiar poate schimba lumea!Doneaza oricat ai posibilitatea aici! Fiecare dolar conteaza!ENYou already know illegal waste is poisoning our planet and your favorite spots in nature or neighborhood as well. Globally, 2 billion tons (1.000.000.000 times the load of an average truck) of garbage are disposed of yearly. Almost 1 million seabirds and 100,000 marine mammals die each year from eating plastic, many species becoming extinct.“Let's Do It!” is the environmental mass movement worldwide created as a response to the statistics above. Over 12 million volunteers from 112 countries cleaned the world in the last 7 years. At “Let’s Do It, Romania!” we have cleaned 22,500 tons of trash and engaged over 1 million volunteers. But we need to do more, faster. You will now be able to report illegal waste and contribute to creating an accurate mapping and planning. Currently, volunteers go through an exhausting process of individually searching for trash points: they use personal cars, bikes and a GPS to find garbage spots, write down their coordinates and details by hand then return home from their quests and introduce data into our system via computer to create a partially complete clean-up map.2. The project and app will pilot in Romania: we'll officially launch it on the 1st of July for our own little corner of the Earth. We're the first happy country to test out mapping and functions.What's next? The rest of the world, of course! we want our project to become the official platform of "Let's Do It, World!". We want to make volunteering easy as a swipe for everyone in the world. That means starting with August 2015 we're giving away our app to other countries as well. story:
Short Summary

The Assemblage Union is a collection of salvaged materials that are donated in exchange for store points.  This encourages reuse behavior of things like plastics that are otherwise unable to be recycled, i.e. figurines, laminated or painted objects, packaging, and so on which would just end up in the waste stream, most likely the ocean.  Plastic is a major source of water pollution, and many times when an object is deemed broken or unusable, and cannot be donated as is the case with toys or games with missing pieces, these things are simply discarded.  They do not biodegrade, and remain in the environment indefinitely, causing devastation to the biosphere and it’s wildlife. 

The premise of the Assemblage Union as a center for steampunk art forms is a celebration of the medium known as ‘mixed media assemblage’, wherein found objects are arranged into art, decor, wearables, and even functional pieces.  This is an ideal solution to the problem of plastics which cannot be recycled, but can be reused and revalued through art and design.  The Union issues tax credit and store credit for such objects, which may be acquired through cleaning, dumpster diving, leftovers from art projects, packaging, freecycling, or overruns from manufacturing processes.  Assigning a value to these materials encourages people to take the time to remove them from the waste stream, and collect on their reward, and making them available in bulk then facilitates entrepreneurship.

As a community fixture the Union provides workspace for entrepreneurs, meeting space, and hosts a variety of workshops and excursions.  One focus of this is on material usage, where patrons can gain knowledge and inspiration on the potential applications of the found objects.  Another is on the safe and legal acquisition of salvaged materials, and expeditions will be led in practices such as antiquing, ‘picking’, architectural salvage, and dumpster diving.  The Rivet Fleet, which hosts a number of vendor centric steampunk events throughout Metro Detroit will be managed through the Union, where it will continue to provide affordable opportunities for local small businesses to show their wares.  

  In addition to physical products, the Union will also generate an array of digital goods, such as stock photos, templates, textures, and other digital materials.  The evolution of this will expand into the territory of 3D scanning, and ultimately self serve printing.  This will enable us to take found objects that were donated, scan them in as components, and then sell the models for use in video game design, product design, environmental rendering, animation, film, and art.  There will also be a host of in house services such as digital photography, retouching, graphic design, formatting, print ordering, business resources, and rendering of 3D ecommerce environments in an initiative known as ‘The Arcade’.

  The world is moving toward the ability to print objects on demand, rather than rely on manufacturing in mass quantities, and ultimately this will be a more sustainable practice.  But there are so many objects already in circulation with limited life spans, that were produced without coordinating demand, or are broken and no longer useful.  The Assemblage Union will serve as a transition hub, revaluing and utilizing existing objects and removing them from their trajectory in the waste stream, and then making digital technologies available to the tinkers and inventors of tomorrow.  It will educate and empower the community with the skills they need to reimagine objects and their relation to us as humans, call attention to the issue of waste, and offer ways to eliminate it altogether by reassigning the hierarchy of values and popularizing salvage. 

What We Need & What You Get

At this stage of development, we need to establish the vision as a nonprofit and position ourselves to pursue other sources of funding.  We require $2500 to pay the initial registration and administrative costs, and to host a kickoff event to inspire and engage with the community to garner support.  This event is called A Day at the Races, it is also part of Etsy's Craft Party day which celebrates the entrepreneurs who make up the backbone of our team.  A combination of effective ecommerce platforms, and in person sales is the key to establishing a strong steampunk brand, earning income and getting the most out of the salvage experience!  

Some of the perks pertain to the event and include special bonuses, such as the exclusive 'Queen for a Day!' perk which coronates you the matriarch of our indie/handmade wedding good show section, and grants you authority over judgement of the Puppy Promenade all breed dog show, and Beauty in Bloom floral design competition!  

Another set of the perks relates to the Arcade, a digital frontier to reshape the shopping experience!  It allows you to live the fantasy of owning a storefront and appealing to customers in the third dimension, without the risk or overhead of a brick and mortar store.  Let your imagination run wild without the expense or restraints of conventional construction, and display your product in an optimal setting.  The Arcade is the first of its kind, a virtual mall filled with the finest steampunk wares.  Store fronts can be purchased in 25’x25’ units in any configuration desired, and decked out to the owner’s specifications. Whether it’s inspired by things they have seen and liked, or totally custom fixtures born from their unique needs, the Arcade is limited only by your own imagination!  

The Arcade will ultimately be a service hosted by the Assemblage Union.  As the project evolves, and our capabilities increase, we strive toward the ultimate user interface goal of a fully 3-D interactive world in which you can inspect merchandise, try it on a virtual avatar, and share the shopping experience with friends before proceeding to simple and secure checkout options.  Mall-goers will be able to create and share wishlists out of the dozens of stores, making outfit budgeting and gifting easier than ever whilst still being able to shop local and support small businesses.  And YOU can be the proud owner of your own custom storefront by sponsoring this initiative!

If we do not reach the entire goal at this stage, the funding will go toward hosting the best show possible with our artisans and nonprofits, and empowering them to keep reaching out about our cause.  We will continue to explore other funding, and anticipate establishment by mid summer, at which point we turn our attention to establishing the brick and mortar warehouse, and beginning to collect donated materials!  Exceeding our goals will hasten us toward this eventuality.

    The Impact

    I have been hosting shows for 3 years now, and there is a moment at every single one that touches me and let's me know how important opportunities like that are.  Whether it's a crafter who is showing for the first time, or debuting a new product and getting live positive feedback, or a vendor who has a condition that prevents them from conventional employment who has found success in the show circuit and freedom to look out for their health.  That is an incredible feeling, to create a space where opportunity is real, and it is safe and constructive to take risks and experiment.  Small businesses build resilience in the economy, and encourage innovation that wouldn't otherwise be possible in large companies.  So the value of that unknown is impossible to put a value to, but critical for our future.

    Especially here in Michigan where our water resources are so very precious, we need out of the box thinkers to have the tools they need to find solutions to difficult problems such as plastic pollution.  Midway Island is a haunting example of how discarded items, are never really gone, and can destroy innocent lives.  So please consider funding this initiative, removing these dangers and giving them new life as treasures! 

      Risks & Challenges

      As with any nonprofit, there will be much more work than hands to do it.  Our plan to address this issue is to establish full time staff.  Though this will create overhead, many revenue sources have been built into the business model to assure income.  Many organizations rely heavily on volunteers, but without full time staff who are completely immersed in the needs of the org, it is difficult to coordinate them effectively!  So we plan to build strong alliances in the community, and commit ourselves 100% to this cause.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        Come check us out at a Rivet Fleet event!  We host quarterly shows in Metro Detroit, see what we are all about and support our talented vendors and performers at an upcoming festival: http://rivetfleet.weebly.com/events.html

story:
What is Trees 4 School?

Tree4School is a Tree Adoption Uganda initiative that aims to jointly combat climate change, unemployment and provide/supplement school fees for underprivileged children.

So, how do we plan to do this?

The children in need of school fees set up tree nurseries (with the help of Tree Adoption Uganda)  and take care of them for a period of six months. Once the saplings have been planted, Tree Adoption Uganda acts as a buffer between the students and various Corporations who are encouraged to purchase the saplings from the nurseries as part of their Corporate Social Responsibility. The money obtained by the students from this is used for their school fees. This money will also be used as start-up capital to enable the children and their caretakers to start up businesses from which the proceeding tuition/ school fees will be obtained. Because the saplings planted will be fruit bearing trees, the trees will act as a sustainable sources of income as produce can be sold by children and will supplement the nutrition of the children in the communities.


What will the money be used for?

The money raised in this campaign will be solely used to buy the seedlings that will be planted in the different communities.
By helping to raise this money you will:
  • Help children stay in school
  • Help more children get into school in the first place
  • Directly impact economic development in the communities involved in the programme .
  • Help in the process of reforesting Uganda, which currently has high deforestation rates 

Other Ways You Can Help

Click here to find out more about Trees 4 school and Tree Adoption Uganda 

Click here to find out about amazing volunteer opportunities!

And that's all there is to it!
story_txt:
What is Trees 4 School?

Tree4School is a Tree Adoption Uganda initiative that aims to jointly combat climate change, unemployment and provide/supplement school fees for underprivileged children.So, how do we plan to do this?The children in need of school fees set up tree nurseries (with the help of Tree Adoption Uganda)  and take care of them for a period of six months. Once the saplings have been planted, Tree Adoption Uganda acts as a buffer between the students and various Corporations who are encouraged to purchase the saplings from the nurseries as part of their Corporate Social Responsibility. The money obtained by the students from this is used for their school fees. This money will also be used as start-up capital to enable the children and their caretakers to start up businesses from which the proceeding tuition/ school fees will be obtained. Because the saplings planted will be fruit bearing trees, the trees will act as a sustainable sources of income as produce can be sold by children and will supplement the nutrition of the children in the communities.What will the money be used for?
 
The money raised in this campaign will be solely used to buy the seedlings that will be planted in the different communities.
By helping to raise this money you will:
 
Help children stay in school
Help more children get into school in the first place

Directly impact economic development in the communities involved in the programme .
 Help in the process of reforesting Uganda, which currently has high deforestation rates 



    Other Ways You Can Help Click here to find out more about Trees 4 school and Tree Adoption Uganda 
Click here to find out about amazing volunteer opportunities!
   And that's all there is to it!

story:
PLAN B - OCCUPY THE PLANET

How to build your own personal Karmameter and save the planet.

Year after year, governments worldwide try new plans and programs to save the climate and our planet. Every time, we see no real results. And every time we hear that there is no Plan B!

So here’s our Plan B: Ordinary people take action. We need ordinary people to stop following the status quo and explore new ways to save the planet.

The way from idea to reality.

I, Philip Dudzinski, have owned the café/bar Den Smagløse Café(DSC), www.densmagloesecafe.dk, in Odense, Denmark, for more than 20 years. Our café and its customers are dedicated to sustainability and put that into practice in our daily lives and business.

As part of this, DSC worked with some of our suppliers to raise nearly $10,000 annually for different community purposes. The annual amount we receive from our suppliers is spent on cultural initiatives and projects by the staff and our customers.

We want our suppliers to do the same with the thousands of customers they have all over the world. And they are all very interested in starting a worldwide green wave. Then thousands of suppliers can give away millions of dollars to customer/users through retailers. The customer/users can then use those millions of dollars to plant trees, support cancer research or what other purpose is lying close to their heart. The suppliers love the idéa.

With this project we combine donation, marketing and sponsorship into sustainable marketing.

Karmameter: The world's easiest way to measure “doing good” activities.

Every user and business have a Karmameter on Plan B - Occupy the Planet.

The Karmameter is an overview of your activities (or your business’ activities) on the site and on endorsements given to you by other people. You’ll be able to see your own Karma History, showing the activities you have DONE to make the world a better place.  

A company donates money. A user makes an activity. The users Karma will increase on the Karmameter.

Examples of other customer/user action:

  • Planting trees locally or globally
  • Support orangutangs in Borneo
  • Support cancer research
  • Supporting orphans locally or globally
  • Carbon reduction/compensation
  • Etc.

Endorsement: How to increase your personal Karma.


The customer/user helps out and give time to a local sports club.

Other examples:

  • Give time helping orphans locally
  • Visiting friend at nursing homes
  • Collecting waste in the nature
  • Plastic use management,
  • Etc.

Reward: How to get rewarded for your efforts in saving the Planet.

The Karmameter encourages you to make little changes in your everyday life.You will then also get rewarded for your efforts by companies and celebrities and can spend your collected money on:

  • Sport
  • Museum
  • Music
  • News media
  • And much more

As a user, you can earn money and start to build your Karmameter. The money cannot be pulled out of the system. It must be spent within the platform.

Users have the opportunity to earn money by carrying out a number of activities on the site, including (but not limited to):

  • Acquiring knowledge
  • Reading articles
  • Viewing learning videos
  • Testing your knowledge in quizzes
  • Volunteering your time
  • Coming up with sustainable solutions
  • And more……

If people spend time building their Karmameter, they most likely will be more aware of their debate tone while surfing the internet.

How you can help saving the Planet and make a difference.

In order to complete the project, we kindly ask for $110,000. The portal will be in Danish and English in the first version. If more funding is achieved, the portal will be opened in other languages and with offices around the world.

The more money donated, the more countries and people we can reach. The goal is to start up in as many languages and countries as possible.

The world is under pressure. Time is running out.

We’ll create an overall Karmameter that measures all the positive activities of as many people on the planet as possible. Let’s improve the world’s Karma, one small change at a time.

The people and company behind the project “Plan B - Occupy the Planet”.

Founder - Philip Dudzinski - Entrepreneur and Owner of "Den Smagløse Cafe"

Founder - Dan Lykkegaard - Entrepreneur

Founder - Sebastian Mernild - PhD in Geography

Bo Lange - Online Marketing & Social Media Advisor

WebCoders - Design and website

story:
Atlantic Waste & Power System


  • My name is Christopher Onwuasoanya and I am the President of Atlantic Waste &Power System, Inc and also the President of AWPS Renewable Energy Ltd, Nigeria. In the last 2 years w have been a solar power provider to people in Nigeria and Ghana. Prior to that I was a VP of Investments at JP Morgan Chase. Nigeria with a population of about 177 million people produces about 3500 MW of  electricity. They need over 100000 MW. To compensate people have resorted to self generation with generators. Generators are expensive, noisy, pollute and are deadly. We are trying to remove as many generators as we can
  • We are looking to raise funds so that we can hire and train sales and technical staff. We need inventory of Inverters and controllers to meet real time demand. We have over 20 installations in Nigeria and Ghana and we need full time support staff to manage them and a sales team to spread the word.
  • We can give people jobs, train them and provide better and real time service to our customers if we meet our campaign target. We will reduce generators deaths (entire families have died from carbon monoxide poisoning), save people money and improve the quality of life by providing electricity 24 hours a day with no fuel, noise or pollution


We need $30,000

  • $30,000 is what we need. $15,000  to purchase inverters and controllers, $5000 for training, training material and safety gear, $10,000 salaries for the 5 technical and 3 sales staff
  • Each person that gives $100 gets a T-shirt that says "I connected West Africans to the Sun" $250 gets a Polo Shirt with the company logo and $500 or more gets a wireless Bluetooth headphone with a built in FM Radio
  • If we fall short the funds will go to training and salaries.

Making a difference

  • Solar allows us to deploy electricity to parts of world that don't have it for pennies on the dollar. Nigeria as the 26th largest economy consumes 145 kwh of electricity per capita vs the US with a consumption of 13246. They have some of the lowest consumption of electricity in the world. People are using generators to make up the difference, with devastating consequences. There are daily stories of families that have perished from carbon monoxide poisoning. Recently the younger brother of a friend suffered burns from his generator and died weeks later. They are spending money they could save for retirement or food to purchase fuel for their generators. There has been an increase in lung cancer diagnosis and respiratory ailments. The noise from these cheap generators is enough to make any sane person crazy. With your help we will be reducing the number of generators, reducing the carbon foot print, reducing noise, pollution and saving lives.  A news story about generator death
  • We have installed over 20 systems in Nigeria and are growing very fast Visit our webpage www.atlanticwastepower.com for pictures
  • This is a passion that I have to make a difference. I am in my way being my own change agent

Risks & Challenges

  • Risk. If I died the the company would not continue. 
  • Quality employees that can do quality work and follow instructions.
  • A customs regime that lack transparency. 
  • The cost of importing every item we need to install our systems in Nigeria.
  • We have instituted a training program that is mandatory for every employee, they have a detailed checklist they have to follow for each job they do. A supervisor must sign off on each critical step before the job can proceed A manager must sign off before the system is commissioned.  Customs challenge: We now pay a little more and have a third party air freight delivery to our warehouse. We have also sourced local suppliers for some of the key components we need. We have introduced some them to our manufacturers so they can have the components on hand when we need them.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please help us by spreading the word. We are changing the way power is provided in West Africa and we need your help to do so. If you can't spare money please spread the word. Share us on Facebook or discussion tools. You can use the share tools on Indiegogo to spread the word. Thank you

story:
There is pleasure in the pathless woods, there is rapture in the lonely shore, there is society where none intrudes, by the deep sea, and music in its roar; I love not Man the less, but Nature more. ~Lord Byron.

Summary:

The intent of this project is to reforest areas of the Palani Hills range of the Western Ghats, Tamil Nadu, India, which have been damaged by the practice of Hill Burning.  By planting Indigenous tree species I hope to help revitalize biodiversity and reverse the effects of soil erosion in the area, while working with local people providing them with alternative opportunities for sustainable and ecologically-oriented sources of income.

My name is Senthil Kumar, I am 27 years old and I have been lucky enough to live the majority of my life in the Tevankari Watershed- a beautiful valley in the Palani Hills of the Western Ghats, Tamil Nadu, India.

For the past two decades I have watched the forests disappear, turning from lush green ecosystems full of life into barren rock faces.  In some places, the rivers no longer flow, streams have dried, and ponds have vanished.  Diverse wildlife species- including barking deer, wild boars, bison, elephants, hares, flying squirrels, giant squirrels, snakes and songbirds- have been displaced and endangered.  Having lived in this valley almost all my life and having studied Ornithology, I can say with assurance that over the past decade, ecological diversity in this valley has plummeted and continues to do so at an ever increasing rate.

The main cause of ecological destruction in this area is the practice of Hill Burning, that is, large-scale forest fires started by humans for the purpose of cash cropping.  Once started, the fires spread across vast areas, fuelled by dry grasses, displacing wildlife, burning vegetation and exposing the soil.  When the rains come, with no vegetation to hold the soil in place, it is washed down the hills and into the rivers.  Over an extended period of time, this causes major soil erosion, leading to the desertification of the hills and eutrophication of the waters.  As a result, vegetation can no longer grow on the hills, waters are polluted, rivers are damned, and ecosystems, which have sustained a diversity of life since time immemorial, are thrown out of balance.

For many years, others and myself have risked our lives fighting these fires with what little we have, with few resources and no support.  Several years ago, I participated in a socio-ecological survey, which discerned that Hill Burning has laid waste to hundreds of hectares of land.  I started to explore solutions that would be beneficial to both the land and those who depend on it.  I found that not only do Indigenous tree species prevent the spread of fires, but they will also help to reverse the process of desertification, revitalize the nutrient rich forest soils, and restore damaged ecosystems.  After I gained this understanding, I started actively planting trees and working with local NGOs such as the Vatakanal Trust and the Palani Hills Conservation Society.

Now, I want to start a nursery in order to build a sapling base so I can start planting trees and looking after them in the areas that have been damaged by Hill Burning, in partnership with local people.  By working with local people to reforest the areas damaged by Hill Burning, I hope to provide them with an alternative source of income, so they do not have to burn the hills to sustain their livelihoods, but can earn money through tree planting instead.  I have a small farm from where I can base these activities and have already planted over 1 500 trees in and around the area.  However, I have exhausted my limited resources doing so. 

I have calculated that it would cost roughly $3.75 per sapling, including the costs of infrastructure, tools, labour, and transportation.  I intend to grow, plant, and maintain about 10 000 trees, over a 100 square km area.

 

I have friends and experts in the field of reforestation who are ready to help.  With my experience with Hill Burning and fire fighting, my friends’ expertise in tree planting, and the support of local people, I am very confident that this project will be a success.  Even if I do not raise the target funds, I intend to start the nursery with the little I do raise.  I have given up my job in a corporate company and even closed down my trekking company to dedicate myself completely to this project.

Please contribute what you can and spread the word.  You can keep an eye on your tree if you are contributing $50. You will be saving a child of the local tribal community during this winter if you contribute $100. Please share this project with your friends through Indiegogo.

Sincerely,

Senthil

story:
Can we condition naive frogs to have a better chance of surviving in the wild?

My name is Christina Morgan and I am a Biology graduate student at Tarleton State University and I need your help!  I want to investigate whether or not conditioning frogs reared in captivity improves their rate of survival when they meet a real predator.  Answering this question could improve amphibian conservation programs all over the world!

Studies have shown that amphibians are capable of basic learning and even complex behaviors.  Research has also shown that most captive breeding reintroduction efforts fail, and one of the biggest challenges is predation.  Many amphibian species are facing extinction worldwide and have been taken into captivity so that they have a chance to be reintroduced to the wild.  Often, animals raised in captivity simply don't know how to avoid predators in the wild, and even for frogs, not all antipredator behaviors are innate.   When they encounter a predator for the first time, they don't know how to respond and have a much higher risk of being captured and eaten. 

I plan to raise frogs from tadpoles or eggs and then condition them by exposing them to different stimuli, ranging from snake models to real snakes.  I will then test the frogs in an arena with a real snake to see if conditioning improves their rate of survival.  If conditioned frogs survive more often than naive (unconditioned) frogs, then conditioning could be a new tool for amphibian captive breeding conservation programs.  Amphibians are incredibly important to their ecosystems and I want to give conservation programs the best chance at reintroduction success possible! 

I will be using the northern cricket frog (Acris crepitans) and garter snakes to complete my research.  Norther cricket frog populations are generally doing well in southern states, but in some northern states in the U.S. and in some areas of Canada, they have completely disappeared!  This makes them an excellent model species for this study and they may even need conservation programs for their species to survive one day.

    The biggest challenge my research faces right now is FUNDING!

    I have already invested nearly $1000.00 of my own money into my research but I cannot fund this project on my own.  I received a small grant from my university, but it won't be enough.  I need aquarium tanks, filters, gravel, aquarium plants, food for tadpoles, housing for frogs and snakes,  food for the snakes, UV lamps, crickets to feed the frogs, housing for the crickets, food for the crickets, and more.  I have already purchased many of these things with my own money, but I still need more supplies.  To feed the frogs I need for this project for only 6 months will cost over $2000.00 and that is only if I can successfully breed and hatch a portion of the crickets on my own! 

    None of your donations will pay for the facility I use, nor for an income for myself.  All money will be spent on materials or services for this project.  I am still applying for other research grants, but most grant processes are painstakingly slow and I need funding now to continue my research.  Please help me help amphibian conservation programs!

    If you can't donate, please forward this campaign to family, friends, and colleagues who might be able to do so or who might just be interested in finding out more.  Tell them about it, email them, share this campaign on Facebook!  Anyone who wants contact me before or after donating is welcome to do so by emailing me at christina.morgan@go.tarleton.edu.  Every little bit helps and is greatly appreciated.

I will be using the northern cricket frog (Acris crepitans) and garter snakes to complete my research.  Norther cricket frog populations are generally doing well in southern states, but in some northern states in the U.S. and in some areas of Canada, they have completely disappeared!  This makes them an excellent model species for this study and they may even need conservation programs for their species to survive one day.  The biggest challenge my research faces right now is FUNDING! 
I have already invested nearly $1000.00 of my own money into my research but I cannot fund this project on my own.  I received a small grant from my university, but it won't be enough.  I need aquarium tanks, filters, gravel, aquarium plants, food for tadpoles, housing for frogs and snakes,  food for the snakes, UV lamps, crickets to feed the frogs, housing for the crickets, food for the crickets, and more.  I have already purchased many of these things with my own money, but I still need more supplies.  To feed the frogs I need for this project for only 6 months will cost over $2000.00 and that is only if I can successfully breed and hatch a portion of the crickets on my own!  
None of your donations will pay for the facility I use, nor for an income for myself.  All money will be spent on materials or services for this project.  I am still applying for other research grants, but most grant processes are painstakingly slow and I need funding now to continue my research.  Please help me help amphibian conservation programs!
If you can't donate, please forward this campaign to family, friends, and colleagues who might be able to do so or who might just be interested in finding out more.  Tell them about it, email them, share this campaign on Facebook!  Anyone who wants contact me before or after donating is welcome to do so by emailing me at christina.morgan@go.tarleton.edu.  Every little bit helps and is greatly appreciated.

story:
Summary

The huge problems faced by wildlife and the natural environment are well known. But all too often, the approach of film makers has been to show only the 'Doom-and-Gloom'. This can lead to a sense of personal helplessness and a feeling of "what's the point". Some film makers have gone the other way and shown only a very 'pretty' version of the world. We want to make a unique film about the enormous problems faced by natural systems, but to do this by showing what  is being done to solve some of the many environmental issues we face - it's not too late !! This will be the story (both good and bad) of CONSERVATION.

We are a team of passionate conservation practitioners, ecologists and film makers with the required range of skills and knowledge to make this unique 2-part film series. There has never been a film like this. And with your help, once the film is made, we will distribute it 'ethically' - free to networks around the world and in developing countries.

Why 'Fifty thousand voices for CONSERVATION' ? 

 We want fifty thousand people to make a small donation to have a BIG effect. By donating to the making of our unique film, you will be contributing towards:  (1) scripting and pre-production, (2) travel to interview a range of people, communities and organisations, (3) editing and post-production, (4) purchase of additional film material e.g. specific habitats and landscapes, (5) translation into six languages, and (6) ethical distribution. 

Getting involved

There are many ways in which you can support our film (even if you are unable to make a personal donation):
  • Tell your friends and family on social media.
  • Inform your colleagues in professional networks.
  • Contact your local newspapers, radio and television.
  • Put a link on your website.
  • Use the IndieGoGo 'Share Tools'.
Impact of the film

 The film will move global perceptions away from the normal 'impending disaster' view of the world. Whilst we will not shy away from extremely difficult narratives, the film will tackle these issues in a positive way, show-casing a range of local, national and international solutions.

As well as helping to fund the CONSERVATION film, we will use your donation to act as leverage for the production of a book of the film. This will also be ethically distributed to provide an accessible (and beautiful) record of the key issues in the film.

Risks & challenges

With over 30 years experience in the conservation sector and film/television industry, our highly skilled project team have the knowledge and creativity to mange the risks and challenges of this unique project. The key risk is the level of funding achieved. To address this, we have created a 'sliding scale' project budget so we can produce a film in different ways e.g. making the film in one part rather than two. The key challenge will be telling the central story in a succinct, non-preachy, highly accessible way whilst not be drawn into the doom-and-gloom approaches of other films. There are many positive stories to tell from around the world and we will have to make hard choices about what to put in and what to leave out!!

story:
Short Summary

The Sonora region of Mexico and USA, is experiencing massive water problems due to the over use of water in the region and drought. Water from the River Colorado no longer flows to the Sea of Cortez. Help EnergyLab raise £500,000 to develop a desalination facility which could deliver water to the regions cities and save farming, industry and its cities. California, Arizona and Sonora(N.Mexico) are in the danger zone where water is now at critical levels. Desalinated water is one of the solutions to save the regions industry and cities. What seens expensive now will be cheap by 2030.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise £500,000 to permit and environmental studies on land we already own in Sonora, Mexico.
  • Option more land for solar power and a natural gas power station.
  • You will be part of an exciting project to provide water to the region starting in Sonora, Mexico
  • We will use any money raised using Indiegogo to promote the project and raise the £500,000 we need at this stage.

The Impact

  • Your support will help EnergyLab go one step close to develop a desalination plant to supply water to the Sonora, Mexico, region.
  • We have already bought some land to start the project.
  • EnergyLab has been working in Mexico since 2010.
  • Please support the project.

Risks & Challenges

  • The EnergyLab team has great contacts in Mexico
  • EnergyLab had 5yrs in Mexico and already owns land to build a desalination facility.
  • Convincing the regional inhabitants to act now is difficult and desalinated water is perceived as expensive., but long term it is not.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute please tweet out our campaign
  • or use the Indiegogo share tools!


The Big Story in the Region - #Water

Summary

EnergyLab is based in UK, and  EnergyLab is a project development company which owns land in Sonora, Mexico. EnergyLab wants to develop and permit for a 50,000MT desalination plant powered by natural gas and solar. The facility will get bigger as more water off-takers are buying water. The land is located very close to the Sea of Cortez and the desalination facility will supply potable water regionally to cities and business, in the Sonora region of North America. The Sonora region covers not only Sonora, Mexico but up over the boarder 60 miles in to the USA and more. Water can be piped under the rail system to all the major cities in the region or for special water off-takers rail roaded to industry or mines.

It is widely known the South West of America and Northern Mexico have been in a long term drought and added to this the main water supply from the River Colorado has been over used. Water no longer reaches the Sea of Cortez or the Mexicali delta, where wildlife suffers from the lack of water. The Colorado can no longer fill Lake Mead a water reservoir for Arizona and the risk of a water shortage from Lake Mead jumps to 75 percent in 2017, so Arizona will have water shortages from 2018. At nearly 1,081 feet, Lake Mead’s water level is 148 feet below capacity and dropping -- an elevation not seen since 1937, according to the U.S. Department of the Interior’s Bureau of Reclamation. Lake Mead is one of the most important water resources in the West. Created in the 1930s, it ensures a steady water supply for Arizona, Nevada, California, and northern Mexico by holding back the flow of the Colorado River behind the Hoover Dam. It is one of the largest water reservoirs in the world. When full, the lake contains roughly the same amount of water as would have otherwise flowed through the Colorado River over a two-year period: roughly 36 trillion liters (9.3 trillion gallons). As of May 2003, Lake Mead was at roughly two-thirds of this capacity.

Already California has had to reduce water use by 25% to stave off disaster in the big cities and with $500USD fines for watering lawns. California’s drought emergency, is now in its fourth year so Governor Jerry Brown (D) ordered on April 1, 2015, a state wide 25 percent cut in urban water use, even though 80% of all water is used by farming. There is no snow in the Sierra Nevada mountains to supply water to the Colorado

Due to intensive farming, water is being polluted by nitrates and now the Saltern Sea in Imperial County, California, is drying up and will begin to cause environmental problems. Farmers have jumped in to cash crops like cashew and wall nuts which need lots of water to grow and massive irrigation networks. If the drought continues, California’s reservoirs will be empty in a year, NASA water scientist Jay Famiglietti wrote in an op-ed published in the Los Angeles Times. Many of the region’s major aquifers have been drained, so low they no longer supply water to residents on the our skirts of cites and now they have to connect to mains systems as they can no longer use their own wells. California has been pumping groundwater at prodigious rates. About 75 percent of lost surface water in the Central Valley has been replaced by groundwater. That’s a one-time fix, using water that accumulated over hundreds of years. Farmers are now blocked from drilling new wells or bringing back land into use if it requires any new water irrigation. Some of the very over used aquifers are leaching cyanide from the bed rocks something we normally equate with fracking disasters or suffer nitrate pollution from farming fertilizers. In Sonora, Mexico two major mining pollution incidents in the last 12 months have seen tons of iron ore waste put in the Sonora River. Last Xmas 2014 , a gold mine lost tones of cyanide waste from a holding tank into the Caborca Aquafer, which is a salt aquafer and is next to the Sea of Cortez.

It’s easy to see just from reading this intro the region has massive water problems and water desalination could be part of the solution. Imagine the lost business and real estate values after 2017 when Arizona announced water cutbacks which has a 75% change of now happening. The Arizona Department of Water Resources' 2014 study of water supply sustainability suggests Arizona is likely to be short, 1 million acre-feet in roughly that timeframe or 1,233,500,000MT or 3,380,000MT daily.

This does not count the potential water required for Sonora which could be 250,000MT daily if the Jacqui tribe blocks water from their tribal lands into Hermosillo. This does not count any of the problems Imperial County will have by 2020 and the Saltern Sea is drying out and creating environmental problems. Mexico has water legislation going through congress at this time which when finished will allow Sonora’s municipalities to buy water from private suppliers.

In the United States, a $1 billion plant is being built in Carlsbad, Calif., to provide about 7 percent of the drinking water needs for the San Diego region. When it goes online in late 2015 it will be the biggest in North America, with a 50-million-gallon-per-day capacity or 190,000MT/M3. California currently has about 16 desalination plant proposals in the works. A thousand gallons of freshwater from a desalination plant costs the average U.S. consumer $2.50 to $5, compared to $2 for conventional freshwater. Scientists predict California will need 11 trillion gallons of water to recover from the drought -- the equivalent of 1 1/2 Lake Meads.

Phil Gordon, former mayor of Phoenix, has been an advocate of the desalination since he visited the Middle East and saw how it has altered the landscape and economy of countries like Dubai. He has proposed negotiating with Mexico to create desalination plants on the Sea of Cortez that would benefit both countries.

“We could turn a barren desert into farmland,” Gordon said. “Water, being such a precious and critical component to growth and survival, is something we need to make sure we have sufficient amounts of water.”


And that's all there is to it.

story:
Introduction

CaribShare Biogas is a social enterprise and registered charity in Jamaica turning organic waste from hotels and small pig farms into biogas (type of biofuel) and fertilizer.  The biogas is used to produce clean electricity.  And, through our “Waste to Cash” program, up to 50% of our surplus revenues are shared with our participating farmers to provide meaningful income.  In this way, we are helping to solve the challenges of renewable energy, climate change, and rural poverty in Jamaica and the Caribbean.

Our Solution

From winning the Inter-American Development Bank’s 2012 IDEAS Energy Innovation Contest and receiving funding assistance from the Development Bank of Jamaica, we have enough monies to cover 85% of the cost of constructing our biogas plant.  We have also received financial advisory services from membership with the Branson Center for Entrepreneurship – Caribbean.  And, we need your help to the raise the remaining US $20K so we can start operating in Dec 2015. 

The pilot digester that we are currently constructing in Montego Bay will be the first biogas plant in Jamaica to produce electricity on a sustained basis.  It will process over 1,400 tons of organic waste annually from the Sandals, Iberostar, Half Moon, and RIU resorts, as well as over 50 small pig farms from seven communities in Northern Trelawny – Stewart Town, Jackson Town, Clarks Town, Duncans, Marta Brae, Stewart Castle, Bounty Hall.  Organic waste collected includes kitchen scraps, left over buffet food, spoilt food, cooking oils, and pig poo.

By participating in our “Waste to Cash” program, a farmer with 50 pigs on average should earn initially at least US$1000 per year which will go a great way towards helping his or her family to access better schooling and healthcare.

Fortunately, we already have the right partnerships in place to succeed. 

Our agreement with our biogas customer and energy beneficiary ensures our financial sustainability.  Hear from them.


See also testimonials from our farming partner,

And, from your hotel beneficiaries.

Everyone who donates at least $20 is invited to tour our biogas facility.  For greater contributions, you will also have the chance to win monies towards airfare to Jamaica.  We want you to come and share our excitement in creating our unique waste recycling program.

We will be recycling and diverting tremendous quantities of organic waste from landfills to produce clean energy, and are thrilled about using it as a valuable resource for rural development.  We plan to develop additional biogas plants in Jamaica and other Caribbean countries to broaden our socio-economic impact across the region.

So, support our crowdfund by making a contribution and sharing our campaign page with your network.  With your help, we can make business a force for social good.


Sincerely,

Carol Lue

Founder & Executive Director

story:
Working in the cleaning industry, I was dismayed to discover that the supermarket bought cleaning products I was purchasing for my family contained harmful chemicals, even those marketed as ‘green’. After further research I realised that cleaning brands legally don’t need to disclose their ingredients, even if they’re potentially harmful. This was pretty alarming considering the residue from these products come into contact with our skin and food everyday. 


That’s why we developed the Nue Clean technology, to protect families and future generations. This truly unique innovation gives anyone the power to make safe, yet powerful cleaning solutions at home using only salt and water. 


Your contribution will assist us in producing our initial stock of D1500 Nue Clean kits, and give us the resources to share it with the world. We have a goal of reaching $500,000 in funding to meet our stock and launch requirements; but we also want you to benefit too - we are offering our Nue Clean D1500 Kits and other great products in return for your contributions. 

Whether you help fund us, or simply share our page, you will be actively helping us to reduce harmful chemicals from our homes and businesses, as well as reducing harmful pollution and waste from our land and waterways. 

From the team at Nue Clean we’d like to thank you for your valuable time; for more information visit: nueclean.com.au.










45a Albemarle Street, Williamstown North, VIC 3016, Australia
T 1300 NUE CLEAN    |    info@nueclean.com.au
nueclean.com.au
