Any Questions? Email Tim at skipper@newageofsail.com, email Susanne at firstmate@newageofsail.com, or visit our website: https://newageofsail.com
With Warm Aloha from Tim, Susanne, Victor, Jack, Lucky, and Rose

story:
Version Française - PDF

Versión en Español - PDF

 

Less than 20 years ago, Cambodia was a country largely devoid of plastic waste.   The local markets packaged food using banana leaf or other natural and biodegradable materials.

How times have changed.  A recent Fondazione ACRA survey has found that the average person living in Cambodia uses about ten times the number of plastic bags as their counterparts in China and Europe.   As a result, the Cambodian countryside is now awash in plastic.

Making the problem worse is the fact that rubbish removal is only available in the largest cities.  This leaves most rural Cambodians with no choice other than to burn their trash, which is largely made up of plastic.  Many Cambodians are unaware that plastic releases toxic gas when burned and allow their children to play among the smoldering rubbish.

 

What is the solution to these problems?

Creating good jobs that encourage people to utilize the waste plastic instead of burning it.

Meet Naga Earth  A non-profit that has been working to solve environmental problems in Cambodia for the last ten years.  At our factory in Siem Reap, our engineers turn rubbish into usable products. 

Our latest and most exciting initiative is dealing directly with the problems of waste plastic and poverty in the Cambodian countryside.   Naga Earth is building small-scale plastic recycling machines that rural Cambodians can use to turn trash into useful products.   They will be simultaneously cleaning up the countryside and providing for their families.

The machines are inexpensive and Naga Earth will set up micro-finance programs that will make them affordable to the average Cambodian.  

Plastic Heated Press

The easiest and most inexpensive machine is a heated press that costs less than $300 and will convert used plastic bags into awnings, umbrellas or plastic tarps.

Initially Naga Earth will set up a production and training area at our factory to build table umbrellas.   Then we will start marketing the umbrellas to our network of partners in the hospitality industry.   The stylish, recycled plastic umbrellas will be made from sustainably grown bamboo provided by Bambusa Global Ventures. 

There is a strong market for this product in Cambodia: Umbrellas are used by all hotels and restaurants with outdoor areas to protect against the sun, and rain during monsoon season. Through our biodiesel project we work with businesses in the hospitality industry around Cambodia and have excellent insight into the environmental and social consciousness throughout the sector. Some of our clients have already started inquiring as to when the product will be available for purchase.

We will work with our partner NGOs to identify Khmer families that would benefit from these machines and be able to provide for their families by operating the machines and building umbrellas.  We will help set up micro-financing for qualified individuals and provide free training to help them understand how to safely operate the machine.  We will also provide training to make sure the user understands how to make high-quality umbrellas.

We expect someone using this machine daily to be able to pay back their micro-finance loan in less than six months.

Precious Plastic Machines

For dealing with hard plastic waste, Naga Earth has started building small-scale recycling machines based on the open-source Precious Plastic model.

These machines will be utilized at our factory to recycle plastic waste from the hospitality industry.  Plastic previously getting burned or ending up in the public landfill will be converted into useful items.

Naga Earth story from the people at Precious Plastic

Potential Products

With the extrusion machine it is possible to make recycled plastic filament which can be used in a 3D printer.   The molding machine is capable of making any number of plastic products.

 

How you can help this project

Make a donation to the campaign.  Help to create micro-businesses in Cambodia that will reduce poverty, clean up the countryside and prevent plastic pollution.

How much is needed?

While we are already under way building our first machines, we need additional funding of $5,000 to realize this project.

How the money will be used

Building Plastic recycling machines - $2,000

Plastic Shredder

Plastic Extruding Machine
Injection Molding Machine

Setting up work area for manufacturing and training - $1,000

Benches/Tables/Chairs
Fabrication tools and equipment
Fans, lighting, electrical

Business licensing and permits - $1,000

Government licensing fee (Changing from NGO to registered business)
Tax licensing
Business liaison
Work permits (local staff and volunteers)

Marketing & Crowdfunding Expenses - $1,000

Marketing expenses, prizes for people who contribute to this campaign and shipping costs from Cambodia.

Stretch Goal + $2,500

We have plans at Naga Earth to set up larger scale plastic recycling that includes 3D printing and making larger items with a compressing oven.   By reaching our stretch goal we will build an additional plastic shredder, a compressor oven and purchase a 3D printer.  This will allow us to significantly increase our capabilities to recycle plastic.


What you will get in return for your contribution:

$5 to $24 – You will receive a personalized thank you email and updates as the project moves forward.

 

$25 to $49 – You will receive a John McDermott print on banana trunk paper made by our friends at Stamp and updates as the project moves forward.

 

$50 to $99 – You will receive a Naga Earth 26 oz. stainless steel water bottle, a John McDermott print on banana trunk paper made by our friends at Stamp, and updates as the project moves forward.

 

$100 to $249 – You will receive a Naga Earth tote bag made by our partner NGO Friends International that is perfect for reducing your own plastic consumption, a Naga Earth 26 oz. stainless steel water bottle, a John McDermott print on banana trunk paper made by our friends at Stamp and updates as the project moves forward.

 

$250 to $499 – You will receive a  beautiful one meter hand-made floor mat from recycled plastic bags by our friends at Rehash Trash, a Naga Earth tote bag made by our partner NGO Friends International that is perfect for reducing your own plastic consumption, a Naga Earth 26 oz. stainless steel water bottle, a John McDermott print on banana trunk paper made by our friends at Stamp and updates as the project moves forward.

 

$500 and over– You will receive an amazing two meter round floor mat made by Osmose from water hyacinth, a  beautiful one meter hand-made floor mat from recycled plastic bags by our friends at Rehash Trash, a Naga Earth tote bag made by our partner NGO Friends International that is perfect for reducing your own plastic consumption, a Naga Earth 26 oz. stainless steel water bottle, a John McDermott print on banana trunk paper made by our friends at Stamp and updates as the project moves forward.

 

 

Why Naga Earth?

So who is Naga Earth and what makes us so qualified to initiate this project?  Well, we have been successfully running environmental projects in Cambodia for ten years.

Location

As a volunteer based organization, we are in an amazing location that is quite desirable to live and work.  Our volunteers are a ten-minute bike ride from downtown Siem Reap and a ten-minute bike ride the other direction to the amazing Angkor Wat temple complex.

Factory

We have a large factory with plenty of open floor space

 

Volunteers

Due to the desirability of our location and the quality of our projects we are able to attract a large number of very talented volunteers.  With almost everyone else in Siem Reap focused on tourism, engineers looking to volunteer find Naga Earth to be an interesting opportunity. 

We have an agreement with a technical university in France that consistently provides Naga Earth with interns who are working on their master’s degree in engineering and are looking for a quality work experience. 

We partner with Concert Cambodia who place volunteers with non-profits in Siem Reap.   Our website describes current volunteer opportunities.

 

Volunteer Testimonials

Current Volunteers

Cambodian Staff

Management of Naga Earth

Tim Waterfield is the American-born director of Naga Earth.  He has ten years’ experience working in Cambodia and speaks Khmer fluently.  Passionate about environmental causes, Tim hails from Boulder, Colorado, and now calls Siem Reap home.   In Boulder, Tim was the factory manager of Hirsh Precision Products and was responsible for organizing daily operations and managing 50 employees.

Hirsh Precision Products – Boulder, Colorado
story_txt:
Version Française - PDF
Versión en Español - PDF
 
Less than 20 years ago, Cambodia was a country largely devoid of plastic waste.   The local markets packaged food using banana leaf or other natural and biodegradable materials.

How times have changed.  A recent Fondazione ACRA survey has found that the average person living in Cambodia uses about ten times the number of plastic bags as their counterparts in China and Europe.   As a result, the Cambodian countryside is now awash in plastic.

Making the problem worse is the fact that rubbish removal is only available in the largest cities.  This leaves most rural Cambodians with no choice other than to burn their trash, which is largely made up of plastic.  Many Cambodians are unaware that plastic releases toxic gas when burned and allow their children to play among the smoldering rubbish.

 
What is the solution to these problems?
Creating good jobs that encourage people to utilize the waste plastic instead of burning it.
Meet Naga Earth  A non-profit that has been working to solve environmental problems in Cambodia for the last ten years.  At our factory in Siem Reap, our engineers turn rubbish into usable products. 

Our latest and most exciting initiative is dealing directly with the problems of waste plastic and poverty in the Cambodian countryside.   Naga Earth is building small-scale plastic recycling machines that rural Cambodians can use to turn trash into useful products.   They will be simultaneously cleaning up the countryside and providing for their families.
The machines are inexpensive and Naga Earth will set up micro-finance programs that will make them affordable to the average Cambodian.  
Plastic Heated Press 
The easiest and most inexpensive machine is a heated press that costs less than $300 and will convert used plastic bags into awnings, umbrellas or plastic tarps.

Initially Naga Earth will set up a production and training area at our factory to build table umbrellas.   Then we will start marketing the umbrellas to our network of partners in the hospitality industry.   The stylish, recycled plastic umbrellas will be made from sustainably grown bamboo provided by Bambusa Global Ventures. 
There is a strong market for this product in Cambodia: Umbrellas are used by all hotels and restaurants with outdoor areas to protect against the sun, and rain during monsoon season. Through our biodiesel project we work with businesses in the hospitality industry around Cambodia and have excellent insight into the environmental and social consciousness throughout the sector. Some of our clients have already started inquiring as to when the product will be available for purchase.

We will work with our partner NGOs to identify Khmer families that would benefit from these machines and be able to provide for their families by operating the machines and building umbrellas.  We will help set up micro-financing for qualified individuals and provide free training to help them understand how to safely operate the machine.  We will also provide training to make sure the user understands how to make high-quality umbrellas.
We expect someone using this machine daily to be able to pay back their micro-finance loan in less than six months.
Precious Plastic MachinesFor dealing with hard plastic waste, Naga Earth has started building small-scale recycling machines based on the open-source Precious Plastic model.

These machines will be utilized at our factory to recycle plastic waste from the hospitality industry.  Plastic previously getting burned or ending up in the public landfill will be converted into useful items.

Naga Earth story from the people at Precious Plastic

With the extrusion machine it is possible to make recycled plastic filament which can be used in a 3D printer.   The molding machine is capable of making any number of plastic products.

story:
¡Ya tenemos 300 "Árboles de Amor" sembrados!

¡Alguno de ellos puede ser tuyo!

 

Para Mónica, por supuesto.

Evocando la historia de “El Amor en los Tiempos del Cólera” recordarás que la única forma en que Florentino Ariza y Fermina Daza pueden vivir su idílico amor es navegando el río Magdalena de ida y vuelta para "Toda la vida". Ahora, debido al cambio climático y la deforestación, los árboles han soltado la tierra, el río se ha sedimentado y el barco “Nueva Fidelidad” en el que navegaba este eterno amor ha quedado encallado, tal situación ha vuelto los días de la pareja rutinarios, pues a diferencia de cuando navegaban hoy no pueden disfrutar de la emocionante vida natural y cultural que florece en toda la geografía ribereña, tal monotonía está acabando con el amor por el cual Florentino Ariza esperó 53 años, 7 meses y 11 días con sus noches; cuanta razón tenía su tío León XII cuando le decía:

“Sin navegación fluvial no hay amor” 

Es por ello que necesitamos de tu ayuda con el fin de reforestar la cuenca del río Magdalena para así retener la tierra, mejorar el hábitat de las especies y brindar un bello paisaje, lo que permitirá a la pareja de enamorados seguir navegando un río Magdalena que gracias a tu contribución volverá a ser el lugar de fantasía que algún día fue.

Al contribuir con la siembra de árboles avivarás el amor de la pareja, que al igual que el tuyo crecerá  y se fortalecerá a medida que tú árbol crezca pues su fruto es precisamente: EL AMOR.

 

59.110 millones de arboles

Gabriel García Márquez escribió en el año de 1981 para el diario El País de España “La rehabilitación del Magdalena solo será posible con el esfuerzo continuado e intenso de por lo menos cuatro generaciones conscientes: un siglo entero realizando la siembra técnica de 59.110 millones de árboles", llamado que de haberse atendido en tal época estaríamos cumpliendo en estos momentos 36 años en labores de reforestación, un poco más de un tercio del siglo mencionado, por lo que es apremiante empezar dicha labor cuanto antes, no lo podemos seguir postergando, ninguna ayuda es poca puesto que con cualquiera de ellas sembraremos árboles y cada vez la meta será más alcanzable.

Primer jornada de "Siembra Amor" con 300 árboles plantados, abril 29/2017 

Además de ésto demostraremos que es posible desarrollar proyectos donde no solo se obtiene una rentabilidad económica, sino también una rentabilidad ambiental, cultural y social; ambiental por estar contribuyendo con la reforestación de la cuenca del río Magdalena, cultural por estar rindiendo un homenaje a la obra del Nobel, inspirada a su vez en la emocionante vida cultural que florece en la geografía ribereña, y social porque son las comunidades locales las que se beneficiarán de una actividad radicalmente opuesta a la que algunos aún realizan en éstos bosques tropicales, como es la deforestación.

 

El río de la vida está muriendo

http://w.elespectador.com/noticias/temadeldia/salvar-el-magdalena-articulo-309609

http://www.wwf.org.co/?261830/Navegar-o-no-navegar-los-dilemas-del-Magdalena

 

Río Magdalena: El protagonista

El río Magdalena, más que un simple escenario o telón de fondo, es un verdadero protagonista en la obra de Gabriel García Márquez, tal como lo fue en su vida, pues él mismo lo recorrió varias veces en su años de estudio, dichos viajes los describió como una maravillosa experiencia, a bordo de buques repletos de estudiantes con los cuales se sentaban a ver pasar la vida, aprendiendo de ella "más y mejor", por lo tanto, si el barco se retrasaba algunos días por un encallamiento u otra circunstancia, no había ningún inconveniente, pues la fiesta de la vida se prolongaba y los capitanes de la época te elaboraban y sellaban una justificada excusa por la demora.

 

Cartas de amor

Si bien recuerdas, Florentino Ariza se ha caracterizado por escribir alentadoras cartas de amor con un gran "poder de deslumbramiento", con las cuales ha ayudado a perpetuar la unión de abundantes parejas, alcanzando a reunir tantos escritos que cuando tuvo los recursos propios para publicar un libro le costó trabajo admitir la realidad de que habían pasado de moda; te imaginarás la felicidad y la ilusión que le embarga en estos momentos al saber que sus cartas de amor han recobrado importancia y podrá obtener de ellas un inmenso beneficio, ya que serán su compensación a los enamorados del mundo que contribuyan con la reforestación de la cuenca del río Magdalena.

“Su recuerdo más grato de aquella época fue el de una muchachita muy tímida, casi una niña, que le pidió́ temblando escribirle una respuesta para una carta irresistible que acababa de recibir, y que Florentino Ariza reconoció́ como escrita por él la tarde anterior. La contestó con un estilo distinto, acorde con la emoción y la edad de la niña, y con una letra que también pareciera de ella, pues sabía fingir una escritura para cada ocasión según el carácter de cada quien. La escribió́ imaginándose lo que Fermina Daza le hubiera contestado a él si lo quisiera tanto como aquella criatura desamparada quería a su pretendiente. Dos días después, desde luego, tuvo que escribir también la replica del novio con la caligrafía, el estilo y la clase de amor que le había atribuido en la primera carta, y fue así́ como terminó comprometido en una correspondencia febril consigo mismo. Antes de un mes, ambos fueron por separado a darle las gracias por lo que él mismo había propuesto en la carta del novio y aceptado con devoción en la respuesta de la chica: iban a casarse”. El Amor en los Tiempos del Cólera.

 

La felicidad estará de moda

Si bien ya se han descrito algunos beneficios racionales y emocionales del proyecto, debemos mencionar adicionalmente que en los años en que Gabriel García Márquez se encontraba escribiendo “El Amor en los Tiempos del Cólera” manifestaba que su propósito era: "Poner de moda la felicidad", análogamente este proyecto busca generar éste mismo intangible emocional en todos los "enamorados, del mundo" que contribuyan con la causa así como en todas las personas que participen de una u otra forma en su realización.

 

 

5000 árboles

Nuestro objetivo es sembrar 5000 árboles nativos en el Magdalena Central Colombiano, a través de cien familias campesinas lideradas por Chavita; todas las ayudas contribuirán con la siembra de éstos árboles cubriendo los costos de gestión y operación en que se incurren generando además un beneficio económico para las comunidades locales que se encargaran de la siembra y cuidado de ellos; sin embargo y dado el propósito a largo plazo que debemos alcanzar, se busca dotar al proyecto de una plataforma tecnológica que nos permita acceder a una masa global de usuarios, propiciando así su escalabilidad.

Primer jornada de "Siembra Amor" con 300 árboles plantados, abril 29/2017 

Por lo anterior, si logramos  la meta de US$100.000.oo no solo habremos iniciado la labor de reforestación en la cuenca del río Magdalena, sino también obtener unas utilidades que se invertirán en tecnologías de la información y las comunicaciones.  En caso de lograr la meta parcialmente, los fondos recogidos serán destinados a la siembra de árboles cubriendo los costos de gestión, así como los de operación y utilidad para las comunidades locales.

 

Turismo literario... naturalmente

En nuestro ejercicio profesional en Colombia y con el objetivo de diseñar productos turísticos innovadores y diferenciados, hemos desarrollado la línea de turismo literario donde sobresale nuestro Nobel Gabriel García Márquez y su obra, en la cual nuestra exhuberante naturaleza cobra vida. Por su parte “Chavita” desde su ejercicio como gestora ambiental, es una líder innata con reconocidos procesos de repoblamiento y reforestación en diferentes escenarios naturales del país, algunos de los cuales son protagonistas de la obra literaria del Nobel, como lo es en éste caso el Río Magdalena.

https://www.radionacional.co/noticia/cultura/las-rutas-del-turismo-literario-colombia

http://www.eltiempo.com/archivo/documento/CMS-15642239

http://columnavip.com/2015/10/cabeto-creador-de-campana-realismo-magico-asesora-a-la-guajira/

Teniendo en cuenta la relación histórica entre el Turismo y La Paz, así como los factores de competitividad de la llamada industria sin chimeneas: Tecnología, Innovación y Colaboración; estamos desarrollando desde nuestra organización "PAZAppORTE", una plataforma digital con el mismo nombre:

La fuerza del amor

Vale la pena recordar algunos movimientos en los que se ha demostrado la fuerza del amor; uno de ellos inspirado en el personaje imaginario de Julieta de la obra “Romeo y Julieta” en el cual hoy en día deben disponer de 15 mujeres que la personifican como símbolo del amor, dedicadas exclusivamente a responder las cartas que llegan diariamente de todo el mundo a la ciudad de Verona solicitando consejos del corazón. 

Otro caso es el de los “Candados del Amor” derivado de la obra literaria: “Tengo ganas de ti” de Federico Moccia, en donde las parejas cierran un candado en los puentes y arrojan las llaves al río significando que su amor queda sellado eternamente, lo que ha generado serios inconvenientes en diferentes plataformas del mundo por el peso que tienen que soportar de los miles y en algunos casos millones de cerrojos, razón por la cual han debido retirarlos de los puentes del Arzobispado y de Las Artes en París; lo que nos conduce a pensar que si la fuerza del amor es tal que ha llegado a amenazar tan cimentadas estructuras, porque no utilizarla en ejercicios más loables como la reforestación de la cuenca del río Magdalena. 

"Los días siguientes fueron calurosos e interminables. El río se volvió turbio y se fue haciendo cada vez más estrecho, y en vez de la maraña de árboles colosales que había asombrado a Florentino Ariza en su primer viaje, había llanuras calcinadas, desechos de selvas enteras, por la noche no los despertaban los cantos de sirenas de los manatíes en los playones, en lugar de la algarabía de los loros y el escándalo de los micos invisibles que en otro tiempo aumentaban el bochorno del medio día, solo quedaba el vasto silencio de la tierra arrasada". El Amor en los Tiempos del Cólera.

¡Ayudános a difundir nuestra campaña!

Los árboles sembrados también 

te permitirán recoger su fruto:

"El Amor"

 

Este proyecto es un homenaje al Nobel Gabriel García Márquez y su obra literaria.

 

 

 

English Version

    

¡We already have 300 "Trees of Love" planted!

¡Some of them can be yours!

 

For Mónica, of course.

Evoking the story “Love in the Time of cholera”, you will remember that the only way in which Florentino Ariza and Fermina Daza can live their idyllic love is sailing the river Magdalena round trip for Lifetime. Now, due to climate change and deforestation, trees have released the land, the river has silted and the ship “New Fidelity” in which this eternal love was sailing has been aground. This situation has turned the couples days humdrum because unlike when they were sailing, now they can´t enjoy the thrilling natural and cultural life that flourishes along the waterfront geography. Such dreariness is ending with the love for which Florentino Ariza waited 53 years, 7 months and 11 days with their nights. How right his uncle Leon XII was, when he said:

“Without fluvial sailing there is no love” 

It is therefore that we need your help with the purpose of reforest the river Magdalena basin so the soil can be hold, the species habitat can be improve and to offer a beautiful landscape, which will allow the loving couple to keep sailing a river Magdalena that thanks to your contribution will be again the fantasy place it used to be.

Contributing with the tree sowing you will stoke the couple´s love, which like yours, will grow up as your tree grows because its fruit is precisely: LOVE. 

 

59.110 million trees

In 1981, Gabriel García Márquez wrote for the newspaper El Pais, in Spain: “The rehabilitation of the Magdalena will only be possible with the continuous and deep effort of by at least four aware generations: a whole century doing the technical sowing of 59.110 million trees”. A call that if it had been heeded at that moment we would be meeting at this time 36 years of sowing labour, just a bit more than a third of the mention century. This is why it is so imperative to start as soon as possible, we can´t keep deferring it. Each aid is important because with all of it we will sow trees and every time the goal will be more attainable.

First day of "Sow Love" with 300 trees planted, April 29, 2017

Besides, we will demonstrate that it is possible to develop projects where not only you can obtain profitability, but also an environment, cultural and social profit. Environmental because we will be contributing with the tree sowing of the Magdalena´s river basin; cultural because we will be paying tribute to the Nobel´s work, inspired at the same time in the thrilling cultural life that flourishes in the waterfront geography. And social because it’s the local communities the ones who will be benefit from an activity completely opposite to that that some of them still do in these tropical forests, as deforestation.

 

 

The river of life is dying

http://www.elespectador.com/noticias/temadeldia/salvar-el-magdalena-articulo-309609

http://www.wwf.org.co/?261830/Navegar-o-no-nave...

 

River Magdalena: The protagonist

The river Magdalena, more than a simple scenario or background curtain, is a real main character in Gabriel García Márquez work, as it was in his life, since he roamed it several times during his studying years. These trips described them as a wonderful experience aboard ships full of students with whom he sat down to see life pass through, learning from it “more and better”. Thus if the ship had any delay for several days because of an aground or any other circumstance, there was no problem because the feast of life would extend and the captains of those days would elaborate and stamped an excused absence for the delay. 

 

Love letters

If you well remember, Florentino Ariza has been characterized for writing encouraging love letters with a great “dazzling power”, with which he has helped to perpetuate the love of plentiful couples, reaching so many writings that when he had his own means to published a book it was hard for him to admit the reality that they were no longer trendy. Can you imagine the happiness and illusion that overwhelms him now to know that his love letters have recovered importance and will be able to receive a great benefit from them, due to that they will be his compensation to all the world lovers that contribute with the sowing of the Magdalena´s river basin.

“His fondest memory from that time was that of a very timid little lady, almost a girl, that trembling asked him to write an answer for an irresistible letter she had just receive, and that Florentino Ariza recognized as written by him the evening before. He answered it with a different style, according with the emotion and the age of the girl, and with a letter that also resemble hers, because he knew how to make believe a handwriting for each occasion according to the character of each one. He wrote it imagining what Fermina Daza would have answer him if she love him so much like that helpless creature love her wooer. Two days later, of course, he also had to write the answer of the boyfriend with the calligraphy, style and the type of love he had used in the first letter, and it was so that he ended up involved in a feverish correspondence with himself. Before a month, both went on their own to thank him for what he had proposed in the boyfriends letter and accepted with passion in the answer of the girl: they were going to get married”. Love in the Times of cholera. 

 

Happiness will be in fashion

While several rational and emotional benefits of the project have been described, we must also mentioned that in those years in which Gabriel García Márquez was writing “Love in Times of cholera” he said that his purpose was to put Happiness trendy. Similarly this project seeks to generate this same emotional intangibly in all those in love around the world that contribute with the cause as well as in all those people that participate in one or other form in accomplishing it.

 

5000 trees

Our target is to plant 5000 native trees at the Colombian Central Magdalena, through 100 peasant families headed by "Chavita"; all your help will contribute with the tree sowing, covering administration and operation fees in which one incurs generating by the way an economical benefit for the local communities who will be in charge of the sowing and care. Nevertheless and given the long term purpose we must achieve, we are looking forward to provide the project with a technological platform that will allow us to access to a global mass of users providing with it its scalability.

First day of "Sow Love" with 300 trees planted, April 29, 2017

By the above, if we reach the goal of 100.000 dollars we will have not only started the sow tree labors in the Magdalena´s river basin, but also gain some utility that will be invested in technologies for information and communications.  In case the goal is partially achieved, the funds collected will be destined to the tree sowing covering the administration fees as well as those for operation and utility for the local communities.

 

Literary tourism... naturally

In our professional exercise in Colombia and with the purpose of designing innovative and differentiator  touristic products, we have develop the literary tourism line where our Nobel Gabriel García Márquez and his work stands out, In which our exuberant nature comes to life. For its part "Chavita" since its exercise as an environmental manager, is an innate leader with recognized processes of repopulation and reforestation in different natural scenarios of the country, some of which are protagonists of the literary work of the Nobel, as it is in this case The Magdalena River.

https://www.radionacional.co/noticia/cultura/las-rutas-del-turismo-literario-colombia

http://www.eltiempo.com/archivo/documento/CMS-15642239

http://columnavip.com/2015/10/cabeto-creador-de-campana-realismo-magico-asesora-a-la-guajira/

Taking into account the historical relationship between Tourism and Peace, as well as the competitiveness factors of the so-called industry without chimneys: Technology, Innovation and Collaboration; We are developing from our organization "PAZAppORTE", a digital platform with the same name:

 

The strength of love

It´s worth it to remember some of the movements where the strength of love has been demonstrated. One of them inspired on the imaginary character of Juliet from the work Romeo and Juliet, in which now a days there must be 15 ladies that embodied her as a love symbol, exclusively dedicated to answer the letters that arrived daily to the city of Verona from all over the world asking for heart advices.

Another case is that of the “Love Padlocks” derivable from the literary work “I desire you”, by Federico Moccia, where the couples close a padlock on the bridges and throw the keys into the river meaning that their love will be eternally seal. This has produced serious obstacles in different platforms around the world because of the weigh they have to hold up from the thousands and millions of steel bolts, having to make the decision of removing them as in the case of the Archbishops and The Arts bridges in Paris. This is what makes us think that if the strength of love is such that has threatened cemented structures, why not then use such strength in more commendable exercises as the tree sowing in the Magdalena´s river basin.

“The following days were hot and endless. The river turned muddy and became more and more narrow, and instead of the undergrowth of colossal trees that used to amaze Florentino Ariza during his first trip, there were calcined plains, rubbished of whole jungles, during the night they were not awaken by the mermaid songs from the sea cows on the beaches, instead of the parrot gabble and the scandal of the invisible monkeys that once boost the midday sultriness, it only remained the vast silence from the scorched earth”. Love in Times of cholera.

¡Help us to spread our campaign!

The sow trees will also allow you

to crop its fruit:

"Love"

This project is a tribute to the Nobel Gabriel García Márquez and his literary work.
story_txt:
¡Ya tenemos 300 "Árboles de Amor" sembrados!¡Alguno de ellos puede ser tuyo! Para Mónica, por supuesto.Evocando la historia de “El Amor en los Tiempos del Cólera” recordarás que la única forma en que Florentino Ariza y Fermina Daza pueden vivir su idílico amor es navegando el río Magdalena de ida y vuelta para "Toda la vida". Ahora, debido al cambio climático y la deforestación, los árboles han soltado la tierra, el río se ha sedimentado y el barco “Nueva Fidelidad” en el que navegaba este eterno amor ha quedado encallado, tal situación ha vuelto los días de la pareja rutinarios, pues a diferencia de cuando navegaban hoy no pueden disfrutar de la emocionante vida natural y cultural que florece en toda la geografía ribereña, tal monotonía está acabando con el amor por el cual Florentino Ariza esperó 53 años, 7 meses y 11 días con sus noches; cuanta razón tenía su tío León XII cuando le decía:“Sin navegación fluvial no hay amor” Es por ello que necesitamos de tu ayuda con el fin de reforestar la cuenca del río Magdalena para así retener la tierra, mejorar el hábitat de las especies y brindar un bello paisaje, lo que permitirá a la pareja de enamorados seguir navegando un río Magdalena que gracias a tu contribución volverá a ser el lugar de fantasía que algún día fue.Al contribuir con la siembra de árboles avivarás el amor de la pareja, que al igual que el tuyo crecerá  y se fortalecerá a medida que tú árbol crezca pues su fruto es precisamente: EL AMOR. 59.110 millones de arbolesGabriel García Márquez escribió en el año de 1981 para el diario El País de España “La rehabilitación del Magdalena solo será posible con el esfuerzo continuado e intenso de por lo menos cuatro generaciones conscientes: un siglo entero realizando la siembra técnica de 59.110 millones de árboles", llamado que de haberse atendido en tal época estaríamos cumpliendo en estos momentos 36 años en labores de reforestación, un poco más de un tercio del siglo mencionado, por lo que es apremiante empezar dicha labor cuanto antes, no lo podemos seguir postergando, ninguna ayuda es poca puesto que con cualquiera de ellas sembraremos árboles y cada vez la meta será más alcanzable.Primer jornada de "Siembra Amor" con 300 árboles plantados, abril 29/2017 Además de ésto demostraremos que es posible desarrollar proyectos donde no solo se obtiene una rentabilidad económica, sino también una rentabilidad ambiental, cultural y social; ambiental por estar contribuyendo con la reforestación de la cuenca del río Magdalena, cultural por estar rindiendo un homenaje a la obra del Nobel, inspirada a su vez en la emocionante vida cultural que florece en la geografía ribereña, y social porque son las comunidades locales las que se beneficiarán de una actividad radicalmente opuesta a la que algunos aún realizan en éstos bosques tropicales, como es la deforestación. El río de la vida está muriendohttp://w.elespectador.com/noticias/temadeldia/salvar-el-magdalena-articulo-309609http://www.wwf.org.co/?261830/Navegar-o-no-navegar-los-dilemas-del-Magdalena Río Magdalena: El protagonistaEl río Magdalena, más que un simple escenario o telón de fondo, es un verdadero protagonista en la obra de Gabriel García Márquez, tal como lo fue en su vida, pues él mismo lo recorrió varias veces en su años de estudio, dichos viajes los describió como una maravillosa experiencia, a bordo de buques repletos de estudiantes con los cuales se sentaban a ver pasar la vida, aprendiendo de ella "más y mejor", por lo tanto, si el barco se retrasaba algunos días por un encallamiento u otra circunstancia, no había ningún inconveniente, pues la fiesta de la vida se prolongaba y los capitanes de la época te elaboraban y sellaban una justificada excusa por la demora. Cartas de amorSi bien recuerdas, Florentino Ariza se ha caracterizado por escribir alentadoras cartas de amor con un gran "poder de deslumbramiento", con las cuales ha ayudado a perpetuar la unión de abundantes parejas, alcanzando a reunir tantos escritos que cuando tuvo los recursos propios para publicar un libro le costó trabajo admitir la realidad de que habían pasado de moda; te imaginarás la felicidad y la ilusión que le embarga en estos momentos al saber que sus cartas de amor han recobrado importancia y podrá obtener de ellas un inmenso beneficio, ya que serán su compensación a los enamorados del mundo que contribuyan con la reforestación de la cuenca del río Magdalena.“Su recuerdo más grato de aquella época fue el de una muchachita muy tímida, casi una niña, que le pidió́ temblando escribirle una respuesta para una carta irresistible que acababa de recibir, y que Florentino Ariza reconoció́ como escrita por él la tarde anterior. La contestó con un estilo distinto, acorde con la emoción y la edad de la niña, y con una letra que también pareciera de ella, pues sabía fingir una escritura para cada ocasión según el carácter de cada quien. La escribió́ imaginándose lo que Fermina Daza le hubiera contestado a él si lo quisiera tanto como aquella criatura desamparada quería a su pretendiente. Dos días después, desde luego, tuvo que escribir también la replica del novio con la caligrafía, el estilo y la clase de amor que le había atribuido en la primera carta, y fue así́ como terminó comprometido en una correspondencia febril consigo mismo. Antes de un mes, ambos fueron por separado a darle las gracias por lo que él mismo había propuesto en la carta del novio y aceptado con devoción en la respuesta de la chica: iban a casarse”. El Amor en los Tiempos del Cólera. La felicidad estará de modaSi bien ya se han descrito algunos beneficios racionales y emocionales del proyecto, debemos mencionar adicionalmente que en los años en que Gabriel García Márquez se encontraba escribiendo “El Amor en los Tiempos del Cólera” manifestaba que su propósito era: "Poner de moda la felicidad", análogamente este proyecto busca generar éste mismo intangible emocional en todos los "enamorados, del mundo" que contribuyan con la causa así como en todas las personas que participen de una u otra forma en su realización.
 


 

5000 árbolesNuestro objetivo es sembrar 5000 árboles nativos en el Magdalena Central Colombiano, a través de cien familias campesinas lideradas por Chavita; todas las ayudas contribuirán con la siembra de éstos árboles cubriendo los costos de gestión y operación en que se incurren generando además un beneficio económico para las comunidades locales que se encargaran de la siembra y cuidado de ellos; sin embargo y dado el propósito a largo plazo que debemos alcanzar, se busca dotar al proyecto de una plataforma tecnológica que nos permita acceder a una masa global de usuarios, propiciando así su escalabilidad.Primer jornada de "Siembra Amor" con 300 árboles plantados, abril 29/2017 Por lo anterior, si logramos  la meta de US$100.000.oo no solo habremos iniciado la labor de reforestación en la cuenca del río Magdalena, sino también obtener unas utilidades que se invertirán en tecnologías de la información y las comunicaciones.  En caso de lograr la meta parcialmente, los fondos recogidos serán destinados a la siembra de árboles cubriendo los costos de gestión, así como los de operación y utilidad para las comunidades locales. Turismo literario... naturalmenteEn nuestro ejercicio profesional en Colombia y con el objetivo de diseñar productos turísticos innovadores y diferenciados, hemos desarrollado la línea de turismo literario donde sobresale nuestro Nobel Gabriel García Márquez y su obra, en la cual nuestra exhuberante naturaleza cobra vida. Por su parte “Chavita” desde su ejercicio como gestora ambiental, es una líder innata con reconocidos procesos de repoblamiento y reforestación en diferentes escenarios naturales del país, algunos de los cuales son protagonistas de la obra literaria del Nobel, como lo es en éste caso el Río Magdalena.https://www.radionacional.co/noticia/cultura/las-rutas-del-turismo-literario-colombiahttp://www.eltiempo.com/archivo/documento/CMS-15642239http://columnavip.com/2015/10/cabeto-creador-de-campana-realismo-magico-asesora-a-la-guajira/Teniendo en cuenta la relación histórica entre el Turismo y La Paz, así como los factores de competitividad de la llamada industria sin chimeneas: Tecnología, Innovación y Colaboración; estamos desarrollando desde nuestra organización "PAZAppORTE", una plataforma digital con el mismo nombre:La fuerza del amorVale la pena recordar algunos movimientos en los que se ha demostrado la fuerza del amor; uno de ellos inspirado en el personaje imaginario de Julieta de la obra “Romeo y Julieta” en el cual hoy en día deben disponer de 15 mujeres que la personifican como símbolo del amor, dedicadas exclusivamente a responder las cartas que llegan diariamente de todo el mundo a la ciudad de Verona solicitando consejos del corazón. Otro caso es el de los “Candados del Amor” derivado de la obra literaria: “Tengo ganas de ti” de Federico Moccia, en donde las parejas cierran un candado en los puentes y arrojan las llaves al río significando que su amor queda sellado eternamente, lo que ha generado serios inconvenientes en diferentes plataformas del mundo por el peso que tienen que soportar de los miles y en algunos casos millones de cerrojos, razón por la cual han debido retirarlos de los puentes del Arzobispado y de Las Artes en París; lo que nos conduce a pensar que si la fuerza del amor es tal que ha llegado a amenazar tan cimentadas estructuras, porque no utilizarla en ejercicios más loables como la reforestación de la cuenca del río Magdalena. "Los días siguientes fueron calurosos e interminables. El río se volvió turbio y se fue haciendo cada vez más estrecho, y en vez de la maraña de árboles colosales que había asombrado a Florentino Ariza en su primer viaje, había llanuras calcinadas, desechos de selvas enteras, por la noche no los despertaban los cantos de sirenas de los manatíes en los playones, en lugar de la algarabía de los loros y el escándalo de los micos invisibles que en otro tiempo aumentaban el bochorno del medio día, solo quedaba el vasto silencio de la tierra arrasada". El Amor en los Tiempos del Cólera.¡Ayudános a difundir nuestra campaña!Los árboles sembrados también te permitirán recoger su fruto:"El Amor" Este proyecto es un homenaje al Nobel Gabriel García Márquez y su obra literaria.   English Version    ¡We already have 300 "Trees of Love" planted!¡Some of them can be yours! For Mónica, of course.Evoking the story “Love in the Time of cholera”, you will remember that the only way in which Florentino Ariza and Fermina Daza can live their idyllic love is sailing the river Magdalena round trip for Lifetime. Now, due to climate change and deforestation, trees have released the land, the river has silted and the ship “New Fidelity” in which this eternal love was sailing has been aground. This situation has turned the couples days humdrum because unlike when they were sailing, now they can´t enjoy the thrilling natural and cultural life that flourishes along the waterfront geography. Such dreariness is ending with the love for which Florentino Ariza waited 53 years, 7 months and 11 days with their nights. How right his uncle Leon XII was, when he said:“Without fluvial sailing there is no love” It is therefore that we need your help with the purpose of reforest the river Magdalena basin so the soil can be hold, the species habitat can be improve and to offer a beautiful landscape, which will allow the loving couple to keep sailing a river Magdalena that thanks to your contribution will be again the fantasy place it used to be.Contributing with the tree sowing you will stoke the couple´s love, which like yours, will grow up as your tree grows because its fruit is precisely: LOVE.  59.110 million treesIn 1981, Gabriel García Márquez wrote for the newspaper El Pais, in Spain: “The rehabilitation of the Magdalena will only be possible with the continuous and deep effort of by at least four aware generations: a whole century doing the technical sowing of 59.110 million trees”. A call that if it had been heeded at that moment we would be meeting at this time 36 years of sowing labour, just a bit more than a third of the mention century. This is why it is so imperative to start as soon as possible, we can´t keep deferring it. Each aid is important because with all of it we will sow trees and every time the goal will be more attainable.First day of "Sow Love" with 300 trees planted, April 29, 2017Besides, we will demonstrate that it is possible to develop projects where not only you can obtain profitability, but also an environment, cultural and social profit. Environmental because we will be contributing with the tree sowing of the Magdalena´s river basin; cultural because we will be paying tribute to the Nobel´s work, inspired at the same time in the thrilling cultural life that flourishes in the waterfront geography. And social because it’s the local communities the ones who will be benefit from an activity completely opposite to that that some of them still do in these tropical forests, as deforestation.  The river of life is dyinghttp://www.elespectador.com/noticias/temadeldia/salvar-el-magdalena-articulo-309609http://www.wwf.org.co/?261830/Navegar-o-no-nave... River Magdalena: The protagonistThe river Magdalena, more than a simple scenario or background curtain, is a real main character in Gabriel García Márquez work, as it was in his life, since he roamed it several times during his studying years. These trips described them as a wonderful experience aboard ships full of students with whom he sat down to see life pass through, learning from it “more and better”. Thus if the ship had any delay for several days because of an aground or any other circumstance, there was no problem because the feast of life would extend and the captains of those days would elaborate and stamped an excused absence for the delay.  Love lettersIf you well remember, Florentino Ariza has been characterized for writing encouraging love letters with a great “dazzling power”, with which he has helped to perpetuate the love of plentiful couples, reaching so many writings that when he had his own means to published a book it was hard for him to admit the reality that they were no longer trendy. Can you imagine the happiness and illusion that overwhelms him now to know that his love letters have recovered importance and will be able to receive a great benefit from them, due to that they will be his compensation to all the world lovers that contribute with the sowing of the Magdalena´s river basin.“His fondest memory from that time was that of a very timid little lady, almost a girl, that trembling asked him to write an answer for an irresistible letter she had just receive, and that Florentino Ariza recognized as written by him the evening before. He answered it with a different style, according with the emotion and the age of the girl, and with a letter that also resemble hers, because he knew how to make believe a handwriting for each occasion according to the character of each one. He wrote it imagining what Fermina Daza would have answer him if she love him so much like that helpless creature love her wooer. Two days later, of course, he also had to write the answer of the boyfriend with the calligraphy, style and the type of love he had used in the first letter, and it was so that he ended up involved in a feverish correspondence with himself. Before a month, both went on their own to thank him for what he had proposed in the boyfriends letter and accepted with passion in the answer of the girl: they were going to get married”. Love in the Times of cholera.  Happiness will be in fashionWhile several rational and emotional benefits of the project have been described, we must also mentioned that in those years in which Gabriel García Márquez was writing “Love in Times of cholera” he said that his purpose was to put Happiness trendy. Similarly this project seeks to generate this same emotional intangibly in all those in love around the world that contribute with the cause as well as in all those people that participate in one or other form in accomplishing it. 5000 treesOur target is to plant 5000 native trees at the Colombian Central Magdalena, through 100 peasant families headed by "Chavita"; all your help will contribute with the tree sowing, covering administration and operation fees in which one incurs generating by the way an economical benefit for the local communities who will be in charge of the sowing and care. Nevertheless and given the long term purpose we must achieve, we are looking forward to provide the project with a technological platform that will allow us to access to a global mass of users providing with it its scalability.First day of "Sow Love" with 300 trees planted, April 29, 2017By the above, if we reach the goal of 100.000 dollars we will have not only started the sow tree labors in the Magdalena´s river basin, but also gain some utility that will be invested in technologies for information and communications.  In case the goal is partially achieved, the funds collected will be destined to the tree sowing covering the administration fees as well as those for operation and utility for the local communities. Literary tourism... naturallyIn our professional exercise in Colombia and with the purpose of designing innovative and differentiator  touristic products, we have develop the literary tourism line where our Nobel Gabriel García Márquez and his work stands out, In which our exuberant nature comes to life. For its part "Chavita" since its exercise as an environmental manager, is an innate leader with recognized processes of repopulation and reforestation in different natural scenarios of the country, some of which are protagonists of the literary work of the Nobel, as it is in this case The Magdalena River.https://www.radionacional.co/noticia/cultura/las-rutas-del-turismo-literario-colombiahttp://www.eltiempo.com/archivo/documento/CMS-15642239http://columnavip.com/2015/10/cabeto-creador-de-campana-realismo-magico-asesora-a-la-guajira/Taking into account the historical relationship between Tourism and Peace, as well as the competitiveness factors of the so-called industry without chimneys: Technology, Innovation and Collaboration; We are developing from our organization "PAZAppORTE", a digital platform with the same name: The strength of loveIt´s worth it to remember some of the movements where the strength of love has been demonstrated. One of them inspired on the imaginary character of Juliet from the work Romeo and Juliet, in which now a days there must be 15 ladies that embodied her as a love symbol, exclusively dedicated to answer the letters that arrived daily to the city of Verona from all over the world asking for heart advices.Another case is that of the “Love Padlocks” derivable from the literary work “I desire you”, by Federico Moccia, where the couples close a padlock on the bridges and throw the keys into the river meaning that their love will be eternally seal. This has produced serious obstacles in different platforms around the world because of the weigh they have to hold up from the thousands and millions of steel bolts, having to make the decision of removing them as in the case of the Archbishops and The Arts bridges in Paris. This is what makes us think that if the strength of love is such that has threatened cemented structures, why not then use such strength in more commendable exercises as the tree sowing in the Magdalena´s river basin.“The following days were hot and endless. The river turned muddy and became more and more narrow, and instead of the undergrowth of colossal trees that used to amaze Florentino Ariza during his first trip, there were calcined plains, rubbished of whole jungles, during the night they were not awaken by the mermaid songs from the sea cows on the beaches, instead of the parrot gabble and the scandal of the invisible monkeys that once boost the midday sultriness, it only remained the vast silence from the scorched earth”. Love in Times of cholera.¡Help us to spread our campaign!The sow trees will also allow youto crop its fruit:"Love"This project is a tribute to the Nobel Gabriel García Márquez and his literary work.

story:
Are Bees Really That Important?

In 1900 a census of beekeepers revealed there were around 1 million honeybee hives in the UK.

In 2015 that number had dropped by almost 75%.

More recently, on 12th April 2018, The Independent newspaper revealed the decline in bees is putting the supply of raw materials for businesses at risk. [link: The Independent, Declining bee populations]

Einstein allegedly warned that without bees the human race will survive for only 4 years. Whether that's true or not, we do know for sure that honeybees are responsible for providing us with one third of the food we eat. They pollinate crops for food, biofuel, habitat for nature and flowers in the beautiful world we live. 

There are several causes of the decline of the honeybee population but one key factor is that less people are keeping bees. We are dedicating our farm life to becoming bee farmers; a dying breed of farming with an average age of 63, so we plan to site 250 more honeybee hives here in England over the next 5 years.

We currently care for bees for some of the most iconic brands in Britain, including: ‘The Ned’ hotel, 'Nobu Hotel Shoreditch' and ‘Restaurant Story’ in London; ‘Prevost’ and ‘Sophie Allport’ in Peterborough and have recently installed and manage the new apiary at Burghley House in Stamford.

From hotels to head offices, our beehive adoption plans are helping to reverse the decline of the honeybee, whilst simultaneously encouraging corporate social responsibility, all while providing our customers with their own-brand, 100% British, artisan, raw honey.

It's Not Just About The Bees...

Jez and Caroline moved from their suburban 3-bed semi to a dilapidated farm in Lincolnshire just 18 months ago with a mission to reinstate the farm and become bee farmers, helping reverse the decline of the honeybee.

My wife and I say that we don't "keep" bees; we care for them. We don't clip the queen's wings (so if they want to swarm, they can do, demonstrating natural behaviours) and practice ethical beekeeping.

With bees come a number of additional benefits, which you'll be helping to support:

  • We are working with land owners to sow organic, bee-friendly flowers to provide critical forage sources for honeybees and other pollinators. This also helps to positively enhance biodiversity.
  • We're providing employment and rehabilitation opportunities in gardening, beekeeping and honey processing for adults with educational and social needs; those recovering from stroke or mental health crisis and wounded members of our armed forces, too. 
  • We're championing British, raw honey; something that we export more as a country than we consume! It's completely unlike supermarket honey and converts almost all people who think they don't like honey!.... including me!
  • More honeybee hives means more opportunities for businesses to embrace and engage in an innovative and unique corporate social responsibility (CSR) solution.
  • Championing innovative British farming: like a lot of historical practices operating in a modern world, farming is having to change. This is our way of uniting society with nature and making a positive difference for both.

For Us, For You

Why don't we go to the bank or continue to seek more adopters? The truth is, we could go to the bank to get funding but one of our core purposes is to bring people together to share and celebrate in being a part of something for the greater good.

Supporting our campaign means you own a share in a real living honeybee hive (and you can come to visit it, too!); you'll be doing your bit to put more bees into the environment (without any of the mess or fuss - we take care of all of that!) and that our project is true to our aims: people working together, in whatever way, to bring immediately positive benefits to the environment, increase British honey production and provide employment and rehabilitation opportunities for those in need.

We want supporters to feel a part of our story because helping the environment and the planet on which we live and rely on, is for all of us to consider.

We're offering a number of exciting perks as a sincere "thank you" for helping us, helping the bees, helping people who need a stepping stone for the future, helping the environment and ultimately - helping you...

Where Does The Money Go?

It turns out that helping the environment isn't cheap. The cost to install one beehive is approximately £450 and there are ongoing maintenance expenses each year, too - that's all before you factor in specialist equipment or even a salary. 

Your support goes specifically to buying new colonies of bees, queens and new beehives, hand made here in England. Our orders help support local, artisan crafts people. With more beehives and colonies of bees, we can provide more adoption plans to engage communities and organisations. The income from those adoption plans pays for the ongoing maintenance and support (disease management and feeding of the bee colonies, for example) and organic seed to sow.

Our salaries come from the income generated from beekeeping workshops and experience days that we run on the farm, which we hope will benefit from the additional interest gained through this campaign.

The Impact

Although our project on the farm is relatively new, we've been keen from the start to make an impact and be true to our mantra of: "100% Ethical, 100% British, 100% Trying To Do The Right Thing".

Our workshops, experience days and honey sold online consistently receive 5 star reviews. We are members of the Guild of Fine Food; received the Ethical Shopping Award from the Good Shopping Guide; were awarded 5 stars from the Soil Association 'Organic Served Here' project; we've been awarded a Silver award from the Green Tourism Board and our farm is licensed as 'organic in conversion' by the Soil Association.

Being chosen to install and manage the apiary at Burghley House was a huge honour for us - it is the first time in more than 100 years that honeybees have been kept on the estate - and one we carry out with a great sense of privilege. Our clients love working with us and we love working with them, too, continually surprising them and delighting them with the wonder of their adopted honeybees. All of our clients to date have chosen to continue to adopt their hives year on year and we like to think that's because our dedication and passion show... although it probably has a lot to do with the delicious honey, too!

We're not going anywhere soon, so stick around and be a part of our exciting journey with the remarkable honeybee...

What Could Possibly Go Wrong?

Keeping honeybees is working with nature and sometimes nature plays a mighty hand.

There is the possibility that honeybees could die (especially during risky weather periods such as over winter) or due to disease. We have a a very strict policy on sourcing our bees from trusted, true-progeny bee farmers. This means that the bees aren't cross bred and that the breeding is controlled as much as possible to ensure true progeny to the strain of bees we keep here. Buckfast bees were bred over the course of 70 years to have a calm temperament and high honey yield and they are a joy to work with.

Ethical bee keeping is about trying to be one step ahead of natural behaviours and as such we monitor and treat our bees against the most common bee diseases in the UK, part of which involves only taking excess honey, which they naturally make. All of our honey farm operation, including the bees, is insured. We operate a professional CCTV system at the farm and have a trusted network of bee farmers with the same ethical values as us to support our year-round supply of honey should our bees not produce quite enough. When you're dealing with nature, having backups is essential as you never quite know what it's going to do!

We are of course professionally insured, too.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know first hand just how expensive helping the environment is and that for many, doing the right thing speaks to their heart but they can't offer financial help.

  1. We understand that and would be grateful for you sharing the campaign online with your friends and family - use the IndieGoGo social media sharing tools, or copy and paste the URL to your own news feed.
  2. Tell your boss and ask if your employer would be interested in helping support the campaign, or adopting one of our hives (full details and our free Guide to Honeybee Hive Adoption Plans available on our website www.BeesforBusiness.com)
  3. If you've a Birthday or special occasion coming up, why not ask for donations to our page and enjoy the benefits of our campaign that way?
story_txt:
Are Bees Really That Important?
In 1900 a census of beekeepers revealed there were around 1 million honeybee hives in the UK.
In 2015 that number had dropped by almost 75%.
More recently, on 12th April 2018, The Independent newspaper revealed the decline in bees is putting the supply of raw materials for businesses at risk. [link: The Independent, Declining bee populations]
Einstein allegedly warned that without bees the human race will survive for only 4 years. Whether that's true or not, we do know for sure that honeybees are responsible for providing us with one third of the food we eat. They pollinate crops for food, biofuel, habitat for nature and flowers in the beautiful world we live. 
There are several causes of the decline of the honeybee population but one key factor is that less people are keeping bees. We are dedicating our farm life to becoming bee farmers; a dying breed of farming with an average age of 63, so we plan to site 250 more honeybee hives here in England over the next 5 years.
We currently care for bees for some of the most iconic brands in Britain, including: ‘The Ned’ hotel, 'Nobu Hotel Shoreditch' and ‘Restaurant Story’ in London; ‘Prevost’ and ‘Sophie Allport’ in Peterborough and have recently installed and manage the new apiary at Burghley House in Stamford.
From hotels to head offices, our beehive adoption plans are helping to reverse the decline of the honeybee, whilst simultaneously encouraging corporate social responsibility, all while providing our customers with their own-brand, 100% British, artisan, raw honey.
It's Not Just About The Bees...
Jez and Caroline moved from their suburban 3-bed semi to a dilapidated farm in Lincolnshire just 18 months ago with a mission to reinstate the farm and become bee farmers, helping reverse the decline of the honeybee.

My wife and I say that we don't "keep" bees; we care for them. We don't clip the queen's wings (so if they want to swarm, they can do, demonstrating natural behaviours) and practice ethical beekeeping.
With bees come a number of additional benefits, which you'll be helping to support:

We are working with land owners to sow organic, bee-friendly flowers to provide critical forage sources for honeybees and other pollinators. This also helps to positively enhance biodiversity.
We're providing employment and rehabilitation opportunities in gardening, beekeeping and honey processing for adults with educational and social needs; those recovering from stroke or mental health crisis and wounded members of our armed forces, too. 
We're championing British, raw honey; something that we export more as a country than we consume! It's completely unlike supermarket honey and converts almost all people who think they don't like honey!.... including me!
More honeybee hives means more opportunities for businesses to embrace and engage in an innovative and unique corporate social responsibility (CSR) solution.
Championing innovative British farming: like a lot of historical practices operating in a modern world, farming is having to change. This is our way of uniting society with nature and making a positive difference for both.


For Us, For You
Why don't we go to the bank or continue to seek more adopters? The truth is, we could go to the bank to get funding but one of our core purposes is to bring people together to share and celebrate in being a part of something for the greater good.
Supporting our campaign means you own a share in a real living honeybee hive (and you can come to visit it, too!); you'll be doing your bit to put more bees into the environment (without any of the mess or fuss - we take care of all of that!) and that our project is true to our aims: people working together, in whatever way, to bring immediately positive benefits to the environment, increase British honey production and provide employment and rehabilitation opportunities for those in need.
We want supporters to feel a part of our story because helping the environment and the planet on which we live and rely on, is for all of us to consider.
We're offering a number of exciting perks as a sincere "thank you" for helping us, helping the bees, helping people who need a stepping stone for the future, helping the environment and ultimately - helping you...
Where Does The Money Go?
It turns out that helping the environment isn't cheap. The cost to install one beehive is approximately £450 and there are ongoing maintenance expenses each year, too - that's all before you factor in specialist equipment or even a salary. 
Your support goes specifically to buying new colonies of bees, queens and new beehives, hand made here in England. Our orders help support local, artisan crafts people. With more beehives and colonies of bees, we can provide more adoption plans to engage communities and organisations. The income from those adoption plans pays for the ongoing maintenance and support (disease management and feeding of the bee colonies, for example) and organic seed to sow.
Our salaries come from the income generated from beekeeping workshops and experience days that we run on the farm, which we hope will benefit from the additional interest gained through this campaign.

The Impact
Although our project on the farm is relatively new, we've been keen from the start to make an impact and be true to our mantra of: "100% Ethical, 100% British, 100% Trying To Do The Right Thing".
Our workshops, experience days and honey sold online consistently receive 5 star reviews. We are members of the Guild of Fine Food; received the Ethical Shopping Award from the Good Shopping Guide; were awarded 5 stars from the Soil Association 'Organic Served Here' project; we've been awarded a Silver award from the Green Tourism Board and our farm is licensed as 'organic in conversion' by the Soil Association.
Being chosen to install and manage the apiary at Burghley House was a huge honour for us - it is the first time in more than 100 years that honeybees have been kept on the estate - and one we carry out with a great sense of privilege. Our clients love working with us and we love working with them, too, continually surprising them and delighting them with the wonder of their adopted honeybees. All of our clients to date have chosen to continue to adopt their hives year on year and we like to think that's because our dedication and passion show... although it probably has a lot to do with the delicious honey, too!
We're not going anywhere soon, so stick around and be a part of our exciting journey with the remarkable honeybee...

What Could Possibly Go Wrong?
Keeping honeybees is working with nature and sometimes nature plays a mighty hand.
There is the possibility that honeybees could die (especially during risky weather periods such as over winter) or due to disease. We have a a very strict policy on sourcing our bees from trusted, true-progeny bee farmers. This means that the bees aren't cross bred and that the breeding is controlled as much as possible to ensure true progeny to the strain of bees we keep here. Buckfast bees were bred over the course of 70 years to have a calm temperament and high honey yield and they are a joy to work with.
Ethical bee keeping is about trying to be one step ahead of natural behaviours and as such we monitor and treat our bees against the most common bee diseases in the UK, part of which involves only taking excess honey, which they naturally make. All of our honey farm operation, including the bees, is insured. We operate a professional CCTV system at the farm and have a trusted network of bee farmers with the same ethical values as us to support our year-round supply of honey should our bees not produce quite enough. When you're dealing with nature, having backups is essential as you never quite know what it's going to do!
We are of course professionally insured, too.

Other Ways You Can Help
We know first hand just how expensive helping the environment is and that for many, doing the right thing speaks to their heart but they can't offer financial help.

We understand that and would be grateful for you sharing the campaign online with your friends and family - use the IndieGoGo social media sharing tools, or copy and paste the URL to your own news feed.

Tell your boss and ask if your employer would be interested in helping support the campaign, or adopting one of our hives (full details and our free Guide to Honeybee Hive Adoption Plans available on our website www.BeesforBusiness.com)
If you've a Birthday or special occasion coming up, why not ask for donations to our page and enjoy the benefits of our campaign that way?

story:
Hi, we’re Mo and Jo!

We are embarking on an epic journey- hiking 1,200 miles along the California Coastal Trail. Once completed, the California Coastal Trail will run the entire length of the California coastline from Oregon to Mexico. The vision is for the entire trail to be within sight, sound, or smell of the Pacific Ocean. Currently, the trail is about halfway complete.

We’ve teamed up with the California Coastal Trail Association (CCTA) to help spread the word about the trail; they’ve been advocating for CCT completion for over 30 years. This summer, we will be representing the CCTA as official Trail Ambassadors for the California Coastal Trail!

Our goal is to tell as many people as possible about the CCT, so that we can reinvigorate the movement to get the trail completed.

The California Coastal Trail will provide a continuous public right-of-way along the California coastline, improving people’s ability to access the coast and enjoy the unique beauty, tranquil vibes, and opportunities for grand adventure that it provides.

During our three month through-hike, we’ll be hosting a public outreach campaign to share our journey, highlighting coastal conservation and the importance of public access to the coast. Along the entire coastline, we aim to build a connected community of coastal stewards, and work together to care for the coast we love.


Haven't heard of the California Coastal Trail?

Imagine a ribbon of coastal protection stretching 1,200 miles down California’s magnificent coastline from Oregon to Mexico. This is the California Coastal Trail (CCT). At present, the trail is approximately halfway complete. If you have been to the beaches of California, you have probably visited an existing segment of the CCT, which includes paths ranging from the Lost Coast Trail to the Venice Beach Boardwalk. The dream is to connect these fragmented segments into a braided network of public walking and biking paths spanning the entire coast.

California has been trying to carve out the California Coastal Trail (CCT) since the 1976 Coastal Act required local jurisdictions to include the CCT in their Local Coastal Programs.

The CCT inspires both coastal use and stewardship, so that the scenic and natural resources are celebrated, appreciated, and conserved for generations to come.

Who is MoJo?

We are Morgan Visalli (Mo) and Jocelyn Enevoldsen (Jo): coastwalkers, sea sisters, ocean freaks, and beach lovers. We met in graduate school, and have been hard at work for the past few years, buffing up our skills in marine science, policy, and conservation at the UCSB Bren School and as California Sea Grant State Fellows. When we first heard about the dream to build a trail along the entire California coastline we were instantly inspired, and knew it was time to put our knowledge and skills to work to find innovative ways to make this dream a reality.

What is the California Coastal Trail Association?

The California Coastal Trail Association (CCTA) originated as Coastwalk, a 501 (c) (3) nonprofit organization. It was founded in 1983 by grassroots supporters of coastal public access, coastal preservation and a statewide California Coastal Trail (CCT). By building a strong alliance of the public, state and local government, coastal nonprofits, and business supporters, the CCTA seeks to ensure that the California Coastal Trail is recognized as a conduit to the coast and as a beloved public space where all people can revel in the beauty of coastal California.

How will your donation be used? 

MoJo Coastwalk will be one part epic adventure, and one part publicity and outreach tour. Our aim is to connect with YOU, fellow California coast lovers! We want to share our stories from the trail with you. In order to have the greatest impact, we need a little bit of support to help get this expedition off on the right foot!

Here is how you will be supporting us with your donation to MoJo Coastwalk:

  • Support vehicle: Our third partner and best friend, Alisan, will be staying close by for “on the ground” support with this project. Facilitating a successful outreach campaign takes a whole team! She will be using the support vehicle to transport heavy outreach materials to help spread the word about the CCT. She will also help organize meetings with CCTA members, and will serve as a liaison with CCTA headquarters and the press.

Alisan will be meeting us along the hike to provide superior friendship, moral support, and surfboards when the swell is up :)

Tragically, the van we were planning to use broke down just 2 weeks before the hike. If you are in a place to donate or let us borrow a van or larger vehicle for this expedition, we would be eternally grateful. Please contact us at mojocoastwalk@gmail.com.

The MoJo minivan transmission failed just 2 weeks before our expedition start date!

  • Outreach Materials: We are hosting a multimedia outreach campaign and in-person outreach events focused on generating widespread awareness about the trail. This requires a lot of gear, including: cameras, audio recorders, pamphlets, swag, tables, signs, and banners.

With your donation, you will be supporting a vision for public coastal access, and promoting stewardship and care for one of the most cherished and admired features of California. The California Coastal Trail is a legacy in the making: connecting trails and communities all along the California coastline for generations to come.

Perks! 

We can’t thank you enough for your contributions to MoJo Coastwalk! All supporters will be receive a shout out on our Facebook page and be featured on a Friends of MoJo page on our website.

We've also got some awesome swag to thank our supporters! Reppin’ the CCT is a great way to start a conversation about the Trail and introduce it to folks who don’t know about it.

$15 or more: CCT sticker. Bring awareness to the California Coastal Trail via your car, reusable water bottle, laptop... 

$25 or more: CCT Koozie. Perfect for those hot days lounging beachside!


$75 or more: CCT canvas tote bag. Carry your groceries in style! 


Other ways to help MoJo Coastwalk

  • Share our campaign! Email your friends, post on Facebook, tag pictures of the CA coastline with #MoJoCoastwalk… anything to get the word out!

  • Follow our journey on Facebook, Instagram, and our blog on mojocoastwalk.com.

  • Use Indiegogo’s Share tools to let your friends know about MoJo Coastwalk.

  • Join us in person on the coast! Check out our itinerary to see when we’ll be in your area. We’re planning some specific county events to meet up with the public; they’ll be announced on all of our media channels.

See ya on the trail!
