story:
Click here for english version !

 

 

 

 

 

Para Mónica, por supuesto.

Evocando la historia de “El Amor en los Tiempos del Cólera” recordarás que la única forma en que Florentino Ariza y Fermina Daza pueden vivir su idílico amor es navegando el río Magdalena de ida y vuelta para "Toda la vida". Ahora, debido al cambio climático y la deforestación, los árboles han soltado la tierra, el río se ha sedimentado y el barco “Nueva Fidelidad” en el que navegaba este eterno amor ha quedado encallado, tal situación ha vuelto los días de la pareja rutinarios, pues a diferencia de cuando navegaban hoy no pueden disfrutar de la emocionante vida natural y cultural que florece en toda la geografía ribereña, tal monotonía está acabando con el amor por el cual Florentino Ariza esperó 53 años, 7 meses y 11 días con sus noches; cuanta razón tenía su tío León XII cuando le decía:

“Sin navegación fluvial no hay amor” 

Es por ello que necesitamos de tu ayuda con el fin de reforestar la cuenca del río Magdalena para así retener la tierra, mejorar el hábitat de las especies y brindar un bello paisaje, lo que permitirá a la pareja de enamorados seguir navegando un río Magdalena que gracias a tu contribución volverá a ser el lugar de fantasía que algún día fue.

Al contribuir con la siembra de árboles avivarás el amor de la pareja, que al igual que el tuyo crecerá  y se fortalecerá a medida que tú árbol crezca pues su fruto es precisamente: EL AMOR.

 
 

59.110 millones de arboles

Gabriel García Márquez escribió en el año de 1981 para el diario El País de España “La rehabilitación del Magdalena solo será posible con el esfuerzo continuado e intenso de por lo menos cuatro generaciones conscientes: un siglo entero realizando la siembra técnica de 59.110 millones de árboles", llamado que de haberse atendido en tal época estaríamos cumpliendo en estos momentos 35 años en labores de reforestación, un poco más de un tercio del siglo mencionado, por lo que es apremiante empezar dicha labor cuanto antes, no lo podemos seguir postergando, ninguna ayuda es poca puesto que con cualquiera de ellas sembraremos árboles y cada vez la meta será más alcanzable.

Además de ésto demostraremos que es posible desarrollar proyectos donde no solo se obtiene una rentabilidad económica, sino también una rentabilidad ambiental, cultural y social; ambiental por estar contribuyendo con la reforestación de la cuenca del río Magdalena, cultural por estar rindiendo un homenaje a la obra del Nobel, inspirada a su vez en la emocionante vida cultural que florece en la geografía ribereña, y social porque son las comunidades locales las que se beneficiarán de una actividad radicalmente opuesta a la que algunos aún realizan en éstos bosques tropicales, como es la deforestación.

 

El río de la vida está muriendo

Periódico El Espectador: ¡A salvar el Magdalena!

WWF. Navegar o no navegar: los dilemas del Magdalena

 

Río Magdalena: El protagonista

El río Magdalena, más que un simple escenario o telón de fondo, es un verdadero protagonista en la obra de Gabriel García Márquez, tal como lo fue en su vida, pues él mismo lo recorrió varias veces en su años de estudio, dichos viajes los describió como una maravillosa experiencia, a bordo de buques repletos de estudiantes con los cuales se sentaban a ver pasar la vida, aprendiendo de ella "más y mejor", por lo tanto, si el barco se retrasaba algunos días por un encallamiento u otra circunstancia, no había ningún inconveniente, pues la fiesta de la vida se prolongaba y los capitanes de la época te elaboraban y sellaban una justificada excusa por la demora.

 

Cartas de amor

Si bien recuerdas, Florentino Ariza se ha caracterizado por escribir alentadoras cartas de amor con un gran "poder de deslumbramiento", con las cuales ha ayudado a perpetuar la unión de abundantes parejas, alcanzando a reunir tantos escritos que cuando tuvo los recursos propios para publicar un libro le costó trabajo admitir la realidad de que habían pasado de moda; te imaginarás la felicidad y la ilusión que le embarga en estos momentos al saber que sus cartas de amor han recobrado importancia y podrá obtener de ellas un inmenso beneficio, ya que serán su compensación a los enamorados del mundo que contribuyan con la reforestación de la cuenca del río Magdalena.

“Su recuerdo más grato de aquella época fue el de una muchachita muy tímida, casi una niña, que le pidió́ temblando escribirle una respuesta para una carta irresistible que acababa de recibir, y que Florentino Ariza reconoció́ como escrita por él la tarde anterior. La contestó con un estilo distinto, acorde con la emoción y la edad de la niña, y con una letra que también pareciera de ella, pues sabía fingir una escritura para cada ocasión según el carácter de cada quien. La escribió́ imaginándose lo que Fermina Daza le hubiera contestado a él si lo quisiera tanto como aquella criatura desamparada quería a su pretendiente. Dos días después, desde luego, tuvo que escribir también la replica del novio con la caligrafía, el estilo y la clase de amor que le había atribuido en la primera carta, y fue así́ como terminó comprometido en una correspondencia febril consigo mismo. Antes de un mes, ambos fueron por separado a darle las gracias por lo que él mismo había propuesto en la carta del novio y aceptado con devoción en la respuesta de la chica: iban a casarse”. El Amor en los Tiempos del Cólera.

 

La felicidad estará de moda

Si bien ya se han descrito algunos beneficios racionales y emocionales del proyecto, debemos mencionar adicionalmente que en los años en que Gabriel García Márquez se encontraba escribiendo “El Amor en los Tiempos del Cólera” manifestaba que su propósito era: "Poner de moda la felicidad", análogamente este proyecto busca generar éste mismo intangible emocional en todos los "enamorados, del mundo" que contribuyan con la causa así como en todas las personas que participen de una u otra forma en su realización.

 

5000 árboles

Nuestro objetivo es sembrar 5000 árboles nativos en el Magdalena Central Colombiano, a través de cien familias campesinas lideradas por Chavita; todas las ayudas contribuirán con la siembra de éstos árboles cubriendo los costos de gestión y operación en que se incurren generando además un beneficio económico para las comunidades locales que se encargaran de la siembra y cuidado de ellos; sin embargo y dado el propósito a largo plazo que debemos alcanzar, se busca dotar al proyecto de una plataforma tecnológica que nos permita acceder a una masa global de usuarios, propiciando así su escalabilidad.

Por lo anterior, si logramos  la meta de US$100.000.oo no solo habremos iniciado la labor de reforestación en la cuenca del río Magdalena, sino también obtener unas utilidades que se invertirán en tecnologías de la información y las comunicaciones.  En caso de lograr la meta parcialmente, los fondos recogidos serán destinados a la siembra de árboles cubriendo los costos de gestión, así como los de operación y utilidad para las comunidades locales.

 

Turismo literario... naturalmente

En nuestro ejercicio profesional en Colombia y con el objetivo de diseñar productos turísticos innovadores y diferenciados, hemos desarrollado la línea de turismo literario donde sobresale nuestro Nobel Gabriel García Márquez y su obra, en la cual nuestra exhuberante naturaleza cobra vida. Por su parte “Chavita” desde su ejercicio como gestora ambiental, es una líder innata con reconocidos procesos de repoblamiento y reforestación en diferentes escenarios naturales del país, algunos de los cuales son protagonistas de la obra literaria del Nobel, como lo es en éste caso el Río Magdalena.

Las rutas del turismo literario en Colombia

Labor ambiental de "Chavita"

Turismo literario: Legado de nuestra propuesta

 

La fuerza del amor

Vale la pena recordar algunos movimientos en los que se ha demostrado la fuerza del amor; uno de ellos inspirado en el personaje imaginario de Julieta de la obra “Romeo y Julieta” en el cual hoy en día deben disponer de 15 mujeres que la personifican como símbolo del amor, dedicadas exclusivamente a responder las cartas que llegan diariamente de todo el mundo a la ciudad de Verona solicitando consejos del corazón. 

Otro caso es el de los “Candados del Amor” derivado de la obra literaria: “Tengo ganas de ti” de Federico Moccia, en donde las parejas cierran un candado en los puentes y arrojan las llaves al río significando que su amor queda sellado eternamente, lo que ha generado serios inconvenientes en diferentes plataformas del mundo por el peso que tienen que soportar de los miles y en algunos casos millones de cerrojos, razón por la cual han debido retirarlos de los puentes del Arzobispado y de Las Artes en París; lo que nos conduce a pensar que si la fuerza del amor es tal que ha llegado a amenazar tan cimentadas estructuras, porque no utilizarla en ejercicios más loables como la reforestación de la cuenca del río Magdalena. 

"Los días siguientes fueron calurosos e interminables. El río se volvió turbio y se fue haciendo cada vez más estrecho, y en vez de la maraña de árboles colosales que había asombrado a Florentino Ariza en su primer viaje, había llanuras calcinadas, desechos de selvas enteras, por la noche no los despertaban los cantos de sirenas de los manatíes en los playones, en lugar de la algarabía de los loros y el escándalo de los micos invisibles que en otro tiempo aumentaban el bochorno del medio día, solo quedaba el vasto silencio de la tierra arrasada". El Amor en los Tiempos del Cólera.

 

¡Ayudános a difundir nuestra campaña!

Los árboles sembrados también 

te permitirán recoger su fruto:

"El Amor"

 

Este proyecto es un homenaje al Nobel Gabriel García Márquez y su obra literaria.

Agradecimientos especiales:

Liliana Vélez de Restrepo

Nicolás Rincón

 

 

 

 

 

                                              

English version

 

For Mónica, of course.

Evoking the story “Love in the Time of cholera”, you will remember that the only way in which Florentino Ariza and Fermina Daza can live their idyllic love is sailing the river Magdalena round trip for Lifetime. Now, due to climate change and deforestation, trees have released the land, the river has silted and the ship “New Fidelity” in which this eternal love was sailing has been aground. This situation has turned the couples days humdrum because unlike when they were sailing, now they can´t enjoy the thrilling natural and cultural life that flourishes along the waterfront geography. Such dreariness is ending with the love for which Florentino Ariza waited 53 years, 7 months and 11 days with their nights. How right his uncle Leon XII was, when he said:
 

“Without fluvial sailing there is no love” 

It is therefore that we need your help with the purpose of reforest the river Magdalena basin so the soil can be hold, the species habitat can be improve and to offer a beautiful landscape, which will allow the loving couple to keep sailing a river Magdalena that thanks to your contribution will be again the fantasy place it used to be.

Contributing with the tree sowing you will stoke the couple´s love, which like yours, will grow up as your tree grows because its fruit is precisely: LOVE. 

 

59.110 million trees

In 1981, Gabriel García Márquez wrote for the newspaper El Pais, in Spain: “The rehabilitation of the Magdalena will only be possible with the continuous and deep effort of by at least four aware generations: a whole century doing the technical sowing of 59.110 million trees”. A call that if it had been heeded at that moment we would be meeting at this time 35 years of sowing labour, just a bit more than a third of the mention century. This is why it is so imperative to start as soon as possible, we can´t keep deferring it. Each aid is important because with all of it we will sow trees and every time the goal will be more attainable.
 
 
Besides, we will demonstrate that it is possible to develop projects where not only you can obtain profitability, but also an environment, cultural and social profit. Environmental because we will be contributing with the tree sowing of the Magdalena´s river basin; cultural because we will be paying tribute to the Nobel´s work, inspired at the same time in the thrilling cultural life that flourishes in the waterfront geography. And social because it’s the local communities the ones who will be benefit from an activity completely opposite to that that some of them still do in these tropical forests, as deforestation.
 
 

 

The river of life is dying

Newspaper El Espectador: ¡To save the Magdalena!

WWF. To sail or not to sail. The Magdalena quandaries

 

River Magdalena: The protagonist

The river Magdalena, more than a simple scenario or background curtain, is a real main character in Gabriel García Márquez work, as it was in his life, since he roamed it several times during his studying years. These trips described them as a wonderful experience aboard ships full of students with whom he sat down to see life pass through, learning from it “more and better”. Thus if the ship had any delay for several days because of an aground or any other circumstance, there was no problem because the feast of life would extend and the captains of those days would elaborate and stamped an excused absence for the delay. 

 

Love letters

If you well remember, Florentino Ariza has been characterized for writing encouraging love letters with a great “dazzling power”, with which he has helped to perpetuate the love of plentiful couples, reaching so many writings that when he had his own means to published a book it was hard for him to admit the reality that they were no longer trendy. Can you imagine the happiness and illusion that overwhelms him now to know that his love letters have recovered importance and will be able to receive a great benefit from them, due to that they will be his compensation to all the world lovers that contribute with the sowing of the Magdalena´s river basin.
 
 
“
His fondest memory from that time was that of a very timid little lady, almost a girl, that trembling asked him to write an answer for an irresistible letter she had just receive, and that Florentino Ariza recognized as written by him the evening before. He answered it with a different style, according with the emotion and the age of the girl, and with a letter that also resemble hers, because he knew how to make believe a handwriting for each occasion according to the character of each one. He wrote it imagining what Fermina Daza would have answer him if she love him so much like that helpless creature love her wooer. Two days later, of course, he also had to write the answer of the boyfriend with the calligraphy, style and the type of love he had used in the first letter, and it was so that he ended up involved in a feverish correspondence with himself. Before a month, both went on their own to thank him for what he had proposed in the boyfriends letter and accepted with passion in the answer of the girl: they were going to get married”. Love in the Times of cholera. 
 
 

Happiness will be in fashion

While several rational and emotional benefits of the project have been described, we must also mentioned that in those years in which Gabriel García Márquez was writing “Love in Times of cholera” he said that his purpose was to put Happiness trendy. Similarly this project seeks to generate this same emotional intangibly in all those in love around the world that contribute with the cause as well as in all those people that participate in one or other form in accomplishing it.

 

5000 trees

Our target is to plant 5000 native trees at the Colombian Central Magdalena, through 100 peasant families headed by "Chavita"; all your help will contribute with the tree sowing, covering administration and operation fees in which one incurs generating by the way an economical benefit for the local communities who will be in charge of the sowing and care. Nevertheless and given the long term purpose we must achieve, we are looking forward to provide the project with a technological platform that will allow us to access to a global mass of users providing with it its scalability.

By the above, if we reach the goal of 100.000 dollars we will have not only started the sow tree labors in the Magdalena´s river basin, but also gain some utility that will be invested in technologies for information and communications.  In case the goal is partially achieved, the funds collected will be destined to the tree sowing covering the administration fees as well as those for operation and utility for the local communities.

 

Literary tourism... naturally

In our professional exercise in Colombia and with the purpose of designing innovative and differentiator  touristic products, we have develop the literary tourism line where our Nobel Gabriel García Márquez and his work stands out, In which our exuberant nature comes to life. For its part "Chavita" since its exercise as an environmental manager, is an innate leader with recognized processes of repopulation and reforestation in different natural scenarios of the country, some of which are protagonists of the literary work of the Nobel, as it is in this case The Magdalena River.

The literary tourism routes in Colombia

"Chavita" environmental work

Literary tourism: Legacy of our proposal

 

The strength of love

It´s worth it to remember some of the movements where the strength of love has been demonstrated. One of them inspired on the imaginary character of Juliet from the work Romeo and Juliet, in which now a days there must be 15 ladies that embodied her as a love symbol, exclusively dedicated to answer the letters that arrived daily to the city of Verona from all over the world asking for heart advices.

Another case is that of the “Love Padlocks” derivable from the literary work “I desire you”, by Federico Moccia, where the couples close a padlock on the bridges and throw the keys into the river meaning that their love will be eternally seal. This has produced serious obstacles in different platforms around the world because of the weigh they have to hold up from the thousands and millions of steel bolts, having to make the decision of removing them as in the case of the Archbishops and The Arts bridges in Paris. This is what makes us think that if the strength of love is such that has threatened cemented structures, why not then use such strength in more commendable exercises as the tree sowing in the Magdalena´s river basin.

“The following days were hot and endless. The river turned muddy and became more and more narrow, and instead of the undergrowth of colossal trees that used to amaze Florentino Ariza during his first trip, there were calcined plains, rubbished of whole jungles, during the night they were not awaken by the mermaid songs from the sea cows on the beaches, instead of the parrot gabble and the scandal of the invisible monkeys that once boost the midday sultriness, it only remained the vast silence from the scorched earth”. Love in Times of cholera.

¡Help us to spread our campaign!

The sow trees will also allow you

to crop its fruit:

"Love"

 

This project is a tribute to the Nobel Gabriel García Márquez and his literary work.

Special thanks:

Liliana Vélez de Restrepo

Nicolás Rincón
story_txt:
Click here for english version !     Para Mónica, por supuesto.Evocando la historia de “El Amor en los Tiempos del Cólera” recordarás que la única forma en que Florentino Ariza y Fermina Daza pueden vivir su idílico amor es navegando el río Magdalena de ida y vuelta para "Toda la vida". Ahora, debido al cambio climático y la deforestación, los árboles han soltado la tierra, el río se ha sedimentado y el barco “Nueva Fidelidad” en el que navegaba este eterno amor ha quedado encallado, tal situación ha vuelto los días de la pareja rutinarios, pues a diferencia de cuando navegaban hoy no pueden disfrutar de la emocionante vida natural y cultural que florece en toda la geografía ribereña, tal monotonía está acabando con el amor por el cual Florentino Ariza esperó 53 años, 7 meses y 11 días con sus noches; cuanta razón tenía su tío León XII cuando le decía:

“Sin navegación fluvial no hay amor” 
Es por ello que necesitamos de tu ayuda con el fin de reforestar la cuenca del río Magdalena para así retener la tierra, mejorar el hábitat de las especies y brindar un bello paisaje, lo que permitirá a la pareja de enamorados seguir navegando un río Magdalena que gracias a tu contribución volverá a ser el lugar de fantasía que algún día fue. 
Al contribuir con la siembra de árboles avivarás el amor de la pareja, que al igual que el tuyo crecerá  y se fortalecerá a medida que tú árbol crezca pues su fruto es precisamente: EL AMOR.

 
 
59.110 millones de arboles


Gabriel García Márquez escribió en el año de 1981 para el diario El País de España “La rehabilitación del Magdalena solo será posible con el esfuerzo continuado e intenso de por lo menos cuatro generaciones conscientes: un siglo entero realizando la siembra técnica de 59.110 millones de árboles", llamado que de haberse atendido en tal época estaríamos cumpliendo en estos momentos 35 años en labores de reforestación, un poco más de un tercio del siglo mencionado, por lo que es apremiante empezar dicha labor cuanto antes, no lo podemos seguir postergando, ninguna ayuda es poca puesto que con cualquiera de ellas sembraremos árboles y cada vez la meta será más alcanzable.

Además de ésto demostraremos que es posible desarrollar proyectos donde no solo se obtiene una rentabilidad económica, sino también una rentabilidad ambiental, cultural y social; ambiental por estar contribuyendo con la reforestación de la cuenca del río Magdalena, cultural por estar rindiendo un homenaje a la obra del Nobel, inspirada a su vez en la emocionante vida cultural que florece en la geografía ribereña, y social porque son las comunidades locales las que se beneficiarán de una actividad radicalmente opuesta a la que algunos aún realizan en éstos bosques tropicales, como es la deforestación.




 
El río de la vida está muriendo

Periódico El Espectador: ¡A salvar el Magdalena!
WWF. Navegar o no navegar: los dilemas del Magdalena 
Río Magdalena: El protagonista
El río Magdalena, más que un simple escenario o telón de fondo, es un verdadero protagonista en la obra de Gabriel García Márquez, tal como lo fue en su vida, pues él mismo lo recorrió varias veces en su años de estudio, dichos viajes los describió como una maravillosa experiencia, a bordo de buques repletos de estudiantes con los cuales se sentaban a ver pasar la vida, aprendiendo de ella "más y mejor", por lo tanto, si el barco se retrasaba algunos días por un encallamiento u otra circunstancia, no había ningún inconveniente, pues la fiesta de la vida se prolongaba y los capitanes de la época te elaboraban y sellaban una justificada excusa por la demora.

 
Cartas de amor
Si bien recuerdas, Florentino Ariza se ha caracterizado por escribir alentadoras cartas de amor con un gran "poder de deslumbramiento", con las cuales ha ayudado a perpetuar la unión de abundantes parejas, alcanzando a reunir tantos escritos que cuando tuvo los recursos propios para publicar un libro le costó trabajo admitir la realidad de que habían pasado de moda; te imaginarás la felicidad y la ilusión que le embarga en estos momentos al saber que sus cartas de amor han recobrado importancia y podrá obtener de ellas un inmenso beneficio, ya que serán su compensación a los enamorados del mundo que contribuyan con la reforestación de la cuenca del río Magdalena.

“Su recuerdo más grato de aquella época fue el de una muchachita muy tímida, casi una niña, que le pidió́ temblando escribirle una respuesta para una carta irresistible que acababa de recibir, y que Florentino Ariza reconoció́ como escrita por él la tarde anterior. La contestó con un estilo distinto, acorde con la emoción y la edad de la niña, y con una letra que también pareciera de ella, pues sabía fingir una escritura para cada ocasión según el carácter de cada quien. La escribió́ imaginándose lo que Fermina Daza le hubiera contestado a él si lo quisiera tanto como aquella criatura desamparada quería a su pretendiente. Dos días después, desde luego, tuvo que escribir también la replica del novio con la caligrafía, el estilo y la clase de amor que le había atribuido en la primera carta, y fue así́ como terminó comprometido en una correspondencia febril consigo mismo. Antes de un mes, ambos fueron por separado a darle las gracias por lo que él mismo había propuesto en la carta del novio y aceptado con devoción en la respuesta de la chica: iban a casarse”. El Amor en los Tiempos del Cólera.
 
La felicidad estará de moda

Si bien ya se han descrito algunos beneficios racionales y emocionales del proyecto, debemos mencionar adicionalmente que en los años en que Gabriel García Márquez se encontraba escribiendo “El Amor en los Tiempos del Cólera” manifestaba que su propósito era: "Poner de moda la felicidad", análogamente este proyecto busca generar éste mismo intangible emocional en todos los "enamorados, del mundo" que contribuyan con la causa así como en todas las personas que participen de una u otra forma en su realización.

Nuestro objetivo es sembrar 5000 árboles nativos en el Magdalena Central Colombiano, a través de cien familias campesinas lideradas por Chavita; todas las ayudas contribuirán con la siembra de éstos árboles cubriendo los costos de gestión y operación en que se incurren generando además un beneficio económico para las comunidades locales que se encargaran de la siembra y cuidado de ellos; sin embargo y dado el propósito a largo plazo que debemos alcanzar, se busca dotar al proyecto de una plataforma tecnológica que nos permita acceder a una masa global de usuarios, propiciando así su escalabilidad. 

Por lo anterior, si logramos  la meta de US$100.000.oo no solo habremos iniciado la labor de reforestación en la cuenca del río Magdalena, sino también obtener unas utilidades que se invertirán en tecnologías de la información y las comunicaciones.  En caso de lograr la meta parcialmente, los fondos recogidos serán destinados a la siembra de árboles cubriendo los costos de gestión, así como los de operación y utilidad para las comunidades locales.


 
Turismo literario... naturalmente
En nuestro ejercicio profesional en Colombia y con el objetivo de diseñar productos turísticos innovadores y diferenciados, hemos desarrollado la línea de turismo literario donde sobresale nuestro Nobel Gabriel García Márquez y su obra, en la cual nuestra exhuberante naturaleza cobra vida. Por su parte “Chavita” desde su ejercicio como gestora ambiental, es una líder innata con reconocidos procesos de repoblamiento y reforestación en diferentes escenarios naturales del país, algunos de los cuales son protagonistas de la obra literaria del Nobel, como lo es en éste caso el Río Magdalena.

"Los días siguientes fueron calurosos e interminables. El río se volvió turbio y se fue haciendo cada vez más estrecho, y en vez de la maraña de árboles colosales que había asombrado a Florentino Ariza en su primer viaje, había llanuras calcinadas, desechos de selvas enteras, por la noche no los despertaban los cantos de sirenas de los manatíes en los playones, en lugar de la algarabía de los loros y el escándalo de los micos invisibles que en otro tiempo aumentaban el bochorno del medio día, solo quedaba el vasto silencio de la tierra arrasada". El Amor en los Tiempos del Cólera.

Our target is to plant 5000 native trees at the Colombian Central Magdalena, through 100 peasant families headed by "Chavita"; all your help will contribute with the tree sowing, covering administration and operation fees in which one incurs generating by the way an economical benefit for the local communities who will be in charge of the sowing and care. Nevertheless and given the long term purpose we must achieve, we are looking forward to provide the project with a technological platform that will allow us to access to a global mass of users providing with it its scalability. 

By the above, if we reach the goal of 100.000 dollars we will have not only started the sow tree labors in the Magdalena´s river basin, but also gain some utility that will be invested in technologies for information and communications.  In case the goal is partially achieved, the funds collected will be destined to the tree sowing covering the administration fees as well as those for operation and utility for the local communities.
 
Literary tourism... naturally
In our professional exercise in Colombia and with the purpose of designing innovative and differentiator  touristic products, we have develop the literary tourism line where our Nobel Gabriel García Márquez and his work stands out, In which our exuberant nature comes to life. For its part "Chavita" since its exercise as an environmental manager, is an innate leader with recognized processes of repopulation and reforestation in different natural scenarios of the country, some of which are protagonists of the literary work of the Nobel, as it is in this case The Magdalena River.

The literary tourism routes in Colombia
"Chavita" environmental work
Literary tourism: Legacy of our proposal
 

The strength of love
It´s worth it to remember some of the movements where the strength of love has been demonstrated. One of them inspired on the imaginary character of Juliet from the work Romeo and Juliet, in which now a days there must be 15 ladies that embodied her as a love symbol, exclusively dedicated to answer the letters that arrived daily to the city of Verona from all over the world asking for heart advices. 
Another case is that of the “Love Padlocks” derivable from the literary work “I desire you”, by Federico Moccia, where the couples close a padlock on the bridges and throw the keys into the river meaning that their love will be eternally seal. This has produced serious obstacles in different platforms around the world because of the weigh they have to hold up from the thousands and millions of steel bolts, having to make the decision of removing them as in the case of the Archbishops and The Arts bridges in Paris. This is what makes us think that if the strength of love is such that has threatened cemented structures, why not then use such strength in more commendable exercises as the tree sowing in the Magdalena´s river basin.

“The following days were hot and endless. The river turned muddy and became more and more narrow, and instead of the undergrowth of colossal trees that used to amaze Florentino Ariza during his first trip, there were calcined plains, rubbished of whole jungles, during the night they were not awaken by the mermaid songs from the sea cows on the beaches, instead of the parrot gabble and the scandal of the invisible monkeys that once boost the midday sultriness, it only remained the vast silence from the scorched earth”. Love in Times of cholera.
¡Help us to spread our campaign!
The sow trees will also allow you
to crop its fruit:
"Love"
 
This project is a tribute to the Nobel Gabriel García Márquez and his literary work.
Special thanks:
Liliana Vélez de Restrepo
Nicolás Rincón

story:
NAME : CONSU-ME




POUR LIRE LE TEXTE EN FRANÇAIS DEFILEZ VERS LE BAS



ENGLISH TEXT

So now lets talk about ecology? No Wait !! Don’t run off! I promise you, I shave my underarms and sometimes i eat meat!

No, I'm not here to proclaim to you from the top of my rock, my beard whitened by years, wearing hemp head to toe, the vegan Sharia, the 10 commandments of the perfect citizen of mother Earth or the next program EDP, however there's something that bothers me anyway.

A consumer myself, i am also consumed by the same chubby giant with pockets full of dosh - lets call him capitalism - I ended up asking questions .... many questions, so many questions i can at times give up and twiddle my thumbs or play cup and ball and so loose my head.

But tell me ... Wait a minute, am i a ham?... Yes that's it! I am a big pig! fattened by the farm,  bred so that my hunger is never satisfied, i am full of antibiotics, a freak among nature, unnatural. I CONSUME and CONSUME… The trouble is, I begin to have trouble digesting …troubles keeping it down like a baby throwing up…

Nothing goes down, Factory farmed cows belching and farting out methane warming up an ever warming atmosphere, CFS’s  injuring my ozone layer or the fragile biodiversity destroyed and exploded before it gets a chance. Pesticides infiltrating natural habitats, or the Costa Rican bananas that give me prostate cancer, or relocated factories that open underpaid job offers only to under 12 years old kids. Or the concept of profit at any price, or food waste, or the suffering of the horse in a race it can not win or have choice over if it competes or not. Me, little piglet that serves footrest to the shareholders of this world, I implode and explode at once !!! I know I'll end up in the slaughter house... And you can not do anything about it, since you do not pull the strings of this rotten world and that, that makes me angry big time! It's the end of modern civilization! The end of progress, the Apocalypse is imminent !! Rael had warned us! Paco Rabanne too! Even Jesus knew we would end all by himself between killing.


Are we able to change the course of events? To stop the tragedy?

One day I started to think what my “piglesque” life would be if I was free of my own choices ... That’s it! I see myself in the mud, giggling with joy, healthy, eating organic non-calibrated tasty vegetables, using no more plastics, repairing and reusing my old favorite clothes.

You too, I feel that you want to share my dream ... Do not lie, I see you breaking your pear separating your waste for the recycling, you are so good!

Leave a moment the barn if you will, and seek a way out together ... What are the means at our disposal, the system to raise awareness !! Of course !! Education and culture !!! Let's face it ... the cop 22 23 24 67 won’t change much, so we must take the problem head on! Yes we ! You, me squatters of this beautiful planet!

You volunteer? Not the masses? Don’t worry my friends and I are dancers of energy!

Here we go !!! We create a dance show 100% green, it reaches out to schools, it promotes the exchange, discussion, we give food for thought, it allows the free will of the little heads appear expensive cerebellum ...

We are not going to create anarchists that leave in the trees but responsible people, conscious about their surroundings and even if we meet very strong fingers, they will do better than we …

Owly Great ! I can not wait to put on my little spats in the name of ecology! It remains for me to rent a rehearsal studio and a theatre, buy costumes and accessories, invest in advertising. Oh yes ! Also, provide enough pay for this fine team!

Uh ... But it costs a crazy amount! How do we value it? I really wonder who could help us? If only I could rely on family, friends, friends of friends, friends of friends of friends, colleagues and other knowledge that would have the heart to help his beautiful planet and become a key player on this project ... If only ….

TEXTE EN FRANCAIS

Et si nous parlions d’écologie ? Non ! Attendez !! Ne partez pas en courant ! Je vous promets que je me rase sous les bras et qu’il m’arrive encore de manger de la viande!

Non, je ne suis pas ici pour vous clamer, tout en haut de mon rocher, la barbe blanchie par les années, vêtu de chanvre de la tête au pieds, la Charia Vegan, les 10 commandements du parfait citoyen de la terre ou le prochain programme EELV...
Mais... C’est qu’il y a un truc qui me chiffonne quand même... Moi consommateur consommé, -consumé même - par ce géant grassouillet aux poches remplies de flouze, j’ai nommé le capitalisme, je finis par me poser des questions... Mais des tas de questions ! Ça en est tellement interrogeant que je finis par perdre la tête et jouer au bilboquet avec...

Dis donc... Attends une minute ? On ne nous prendrait pas pour des jambons? Oui ! C’est ça ! Je suis un gros cochon ! On m’engraisse pour que je la ferme, on m’écartèle l’estomac pour que je ne sois jamais rassasié ! C’est que j’aime ça moi, CONSOMMER !
Le souci, c’est que là, je commence à avoir du mal à digérer....Pire! Je régurgite comme un petit bébé...

Plus rien ne passe, ni les pets de vaches d’usines qui font bobo à ma couche d’ozone, ni la biodiversité qui se fait la malle parce dès qu’on en a l’occasion, on explose à coup de tractopelle et de pesticide son habitat naturel, ni le concept du profit à tout prix, ni le gaspillage alimentaire, ni la souffrance du cheval qui finit en lasagne, ni la banane martiniquaise qui me donne le cancer de la prostate, ni la délocalisation qui certes, libère des offres d’emplois pour les enfants de moins de 12 ans à l’autre bout de la terre... Moi, petit porcelet qui sert de repose-pieds aux actionnaires de ce monde, j’implose et explose à la fois ! Je sais que je finirai à l’abattoir et vous ne pourrez rien y faire, puisque vous ne tirez pas les ficelles de ce monde de merde et ça ! Ça me rend méga en colère! C’est la fin de la civilisation moderne! L’apocalypse est imminente ! Raël et Paco Rabanne nous avaient prévenu ! Même Jésus savait qu’on finirait par s’entre-tuer... 

Est-on capable de changer le cours des choses ? Ne puis-je pas stopper ma tragédie? Un jour, je me suis mis à penser ce que serait ma vie cochonesque si j’étais libre de faire mes propres choix... Ça y est ! Je me vois me roulant dans la boue, gloussant de joie, en bonne santé, réutilisant mes vieilles fringues, réduisant mes déchets, mangeant Bio des légumes non calibrés ayant du goût! Vous aussi, je sens que vous voudriez bien partager mon rêve...Ne mentez pas ! Je vous vois vous fendre la poire en faisant le tri sélectif ! Vous êtes si bien ...

Quittons un moment la porcherie si vous voulez bien et cherchons un porte de sortie ensemble.... Quels sont les moyens que met à notre disposition le système pour éveiller les consciences ? Bien évidemment ! L’éducation et la culture! Ne nous leurrons pas, la cop 22 23 24, 67 n’y fera pas grand chose. Prenons nous même le problème à bras le corps ! Oui nous !toi, moi, André Rémi Yolanda, squatteurs de cette si belle planète!

Tu es volontaire? Pas des masses ? T’inquiètes, moi et mes potes danseurs, on a de l’énergie à revendre !

C’est parti ! On crée un spectacle de danse 100% écolo ! On va à la rencontre de l’école, on favorise l’échange, le débat, on donne des pistes de réflexion, on permet au libre arbitre de se distinguer dans le cervelet de nos chères petites têtes...
Nous n’en ferons pas des anarchistes qui vivent dans les arbres mais au pire, des personnes responsables, soucieuses de ce qui les entourent et même que si on croise très fort les doigts, ils feront mieux que nous !

Chouette ! J’ai tellement hâte de chausser mes petites guêtres au nom de l’écologie! Il ne me reste plus qu’à louer un studio de répétition et un théâtre, acheter des costumes et des accessoires, investir dans la pub. Ah oui ! Aussi, prévoir de quoi défrayer cette fine équipe !

Euh... Mais ça coute un pognon dingue tout ça! Comment va- t- on faire ? Je me demande vraiment qui pourrait nous aider ? Si seulement, je pouvais compter sur la famille, les amis, les amis de mes amis, les amis d’amis de mes amis, les collègues et autre connaissance qui aurait le cœur d’aider sa jolie planète et de devenir un des acteurs clés de ce projet...Si seulement....





ABOUT US :

We are a collective of 3 dancers from 3 different countries and cultures with different experiences and backgrounds, all connected by an equal agenda.

                        Fanny Barrouquère 

I have travelled a lot, with my line of work, and witnessed environmental problems all over the world, first hand. What concerns me is that in countries where we have the tools and resources to consume in a more sustainable way, we do not always use them, and I believe it has a big impact on us all, since we still need the earth to survive.

                       Branislav Basista

During my travels around the world I have experienced many beautiful moments, but I have also seen a lot of disrespect towards the nature around us often based on inconsiderate and unconscious habits. This campaign allows me to share my thoughts with you.

                       Eva Honings

I always felt that I had a concern for, and a connection with, nature. The fact that how we treat our planet has garnered a broader interest in the media, and amongst the general population, only invigorates this concern. I hope to spread my love for nature, and lend my voice to it through my art form and this digital platform.  

          Mirec O'tec Janík

When I was a kid, my cousin never went across the grass to protect nature. It seemed absurd. Today, when I am a man,  seems to me absurd that people don't want to be as my cousin. I am a creative body and through my work I want to say to humanity, why is my cousin super.


FINANCIAL DETAILS :

Studio rental

Theater rental

Props

Travel expenses

Advertisement

Remuneration of the artists

story:
Short Summary

We will manufacture Green Septic Systems in the United States which will eventually put an end to sewage production by the entire population of our planet. Imagine a world which is free of sewage production at all in the near future! GS Systems use heat to take away the moister from sewage and turns it into pulverized dust! This project will also help create jobs in the U.S!

 

Hi, my name is Tom F. Saat

All my life I always wanted to improve things for the world. When I was in Junior High School, I wanted to produce energy from water. I mixed water with any chemical I could get to see if it will turn water into an energy source. Later on in my life, I built a small steel box which can turn water into hydrogen energy by separating Oxygen and Hydrogen. The technology is out there but is not used as much as our demand requires. Hydrogen is more powerful than natural gas or gasoline, does not produce smoke and only produces water which can be used over and over again. Learning all of this from working on the Hydrogen unit allowed me to continue to pursue other sources of energy .

My next project is to eliminate sewage that is produced every day in order to make the world more sustainable. I built a mechanism and applied for a patent to turn sewage into pulverized dust.

It can be easily installed into mobile, motor and tiny homes. It will not require the user to unload sewage at stop stations. It can also replace the city sewage lines and conventional septic tanks at homes and buildings in the near future. Our rivers, drinking wells, oceans and planet will be protected from sewage and its negative effects. With this unit, we will leave a cleaner world for our future generations.

Our contributors will be a part of this new global movement. We will all be the pioneers for a cleaner world.

We will annihilate sewage from our planet!

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help by contributing to make our project real!

You get:

               to be a part of this movement!

               to be able to share your ideas and stories!

               to be the person who changes the world for the best!

               to be able to start using GS systems in your motor homes, tiny homes, country                                      homes, yachts, boats, in the near future, in your buildings and cities.

              to be a reason to create jobs in the U.S.

          

 

Funds and Distribution

       We need $600,000 to open up a manufacturing facility in the U.S.. This will create jobs in our country and hopefully inspire many other ideas to be manufactured here at home! 

       We do need manufacturing jobs to come back to our country. (We're also making a documentary regarding to that. Please see the website regarding how much we need manufacturing facilities now!  www.mcdoc.org and it will be completed by December 2016)

       We will be filming the entire process of fund raising, opening up the manufacturing facility, production of the units and installation of them.

       Every single contributor's name will be in the credits of this film. We will interview some of our contributors in front of a camera and we will also support our contributors with their ideas and dreams.

      Our efforts shown in the documentary will inspire many other to pursue their own extraordinary ideas.

      All funds will be used to pursue the goals stated.

 

 

 

We need your help to spread the word with all your social network power and please also use the Indiegogo share tools!

We need your support creating a brand new society which takes action together and shares ideas for a better life and world!

       We need $600,000 to open up a manufacturing facility in the U.S.. This will create jobs in our country and hopefully inspire many other ideas to be manufactured here at home! 
       We do need manufacturing jobs to come back to our country. (We're also making a documentary regarding to that. Please see the website regarding how much we need manufacturing facilities now!  www.mcdoc.org and it will be completed by December 2016)
       We will be filming the entire process of fund raising, opening up the manufacturing facility, production of the units and installation of them.
       Every single contributor's name will be in the credits of this film. We will interview some of our contributors in front of a camera and we will also support our contributors with their ideas and dreams.
      Our efforts shown in the documentary will inspire many other to pursue their own extraordinary ideas.
      All funds will be used to pursue the goals stated.
 
  We need your help to spread the word with all your social network power and please also use the Indiegogo share tools!We need your support creating a brand new society which takes action together and shares ideas for a better life and world!

story:
Social and Sustainable Community Development Fund

This fund was formed as a response to the national foreclosure crisis: a groundbreaking program that acquires pools of underwater mortgages at large discounts and provides homeowners with principal reductions and one-on-one counseling to protect them from displacement.

SASCDF launched the fund in June of 2017 as a Public Benefit Corporation focused on creating affordable housing for low-income and distressed communities, but also doing it in a socially and environmentally responsible way. SASCDF will partner with local counseling agencies in each market to ensure the struggling homeowners are financially prepared to maintain ownership as they enter a newly modified mortgage at a principal they can afford.

SASCDF will also disburse already-vacant properties acquired via the program to local community developers to restore as affordable housing. By keeping homeowners in their homes and turning around properties that have already become vacant, SASCDF not only creates or restores hundreds of affordable homes but stabilizes their surrounding neighborhoods, counteracting the blight and socioeconomic decline that has plagued many high-foreclosure communities.

 

 

Stabilizing Communities

 

While the SASCDF seeks to achieve positive outcomes and a stronger long-term financial situation for all participating families, the impacts of the fund will also be felt at the community level. SASCDF has the potential to propel the stabilization of at-risk neighborhoods by reducing their foreclosure rates and reoccupying their vacant properties as quickly as possible, which will elicit many positive neighborhood outcomes proven to be associated with a stabilizing housing market.

 

 

A National Model

 

The implementation of our fund can serve as a national model for revitalizing distressed communities and jump-starting housing markets all across the United States. This unique, socially motivated initiative will reduce principal balances for families in need without any upfront public subsidy. The program is designed to be self-sustaining due to its ability to cover upfront costs and repay investors through the future sale of re-performing mortgage loans.

Homeowners who begin to make reoccurring, on-time payments on their restructured mortgages will provide evidence for the effectiveness of early foreclosure interventions. This strategy can help families before they are foreclosed out of their homes and their properties become vacant and abandoned. It also will demonstrate the value of tying financial education to principal reduction as a means of strengthening the capabilities of families to remain homeowners.

story:
Poison in the Water!

Glyphosate (Round-up) is the most widely used herbicide  in the world. Any form of spill or discharge, even if unintentional, can be transferred to the water due to its high solubility.

Public awareness of worldwide increased herbicide use and their adverse effects on ecosystems has been growing over the past decade. Recent studies indicate that these chemicals are carcinogenic to humans. They also modify food chains and change the stability and resilience of ecosystems Worldwide. There is a real need to extract it from water. the problem is glyphosate formulations simply do what they are formulated to do.....Kill photosynthetic organisms. 

Dry glyphosate particles can be blown around the environment and are found consistently in rain samples in the United States Midwest and other places tested. The amount of Glyphosate formulations and AMPA, the degraded form of glyphosate, found in lakes, streams, rivers and reservoirs is staggering. Agricultural runoff is causing havoc in rivers, lakes, streams, reservoirs, and even the ocean throughout America. It is a major cause contributing to harmful algae blooms and other water ecological imbalances. Until now, there has been no effective way to remove it from water.

What is the solution?

Magnetic Nanotechnology research has proven in laboratory tests to remove up to 98% of glyphosate formulations and AMPA from water.  Global Environmental Legacy Foundation is taking it to the next step. Magnetic Nanotechnology and Capacitive deionization extraction will be tested at a United States federal facility in New Mexico starting October 1st, 2015. The objectives of the testing are to move the technologies out of the lab and into real world environments and to scale up the application to accommodate large water bodies throughout the United States.


 


What is Global Environmental Legacy Foundation?

Global Environmental Legacy researches and develops new products and services to improve the quality of the environment. We form alliances with brilliant minds that create functional environmental products and apply them to real world problems.

Why are we doing this?

The foundation's founder, Brett Danson, was poisoned in Hawaii on Kauai’s west side. He was walking his dog when he noticed a truck, across the street, moving slowly, with a man standing on the tailgate, wearing a hazardous material suit, holding a fire hose, spraying the sea wall. There were no signs, just the guy spraying. Much of the spray went directly into the ocean. http://www.healthyorganicwoman.com/the-solution-to-pollution-cleaning-up-our-water/

Why is this technology so important?

This technology affects everybody and every living thing that comes in contact with glyphosate or side effects of glyphosate on the environment. Whether you`re swimming, drinking, bathing, or washing food or dishes, we need to make sure this carcinogen is removed from water. Testing will expose details and help us  engineer effective extraction strategies.


How will this money be used?

Your donations will help pay for tests where glyphosate formulations and degradations are extracted from large water bodies. Each formulation of Glyphosate will be individually tested and validated results will be made public. These tests will determine the effectiveness of the treatment. In the end, it will be determined how long it will take to remove each type of glyphosate mixture from water from each technology tested and the most effective way to do it.

Your funds will pay for testing, engineering, technicians, validation, & insurance.  This is your chance to help save the world! Your contribution will help make our water safe for many generations to come. Thank you!

Other Ways You Can Help

Contribute by spreading the word about Global Environmental Legacy Foundation by telling your friends and colleagues about this exciting process now underway. Support us and others by liking our Facebook page, connecting with us on Twitter, and Instagram.

For more information, contact us at: www.GlobalEnvironmentalLegacy.org

story:
Check out one of our team members, Euan Ramsay testing the heavy pay loader!!


Example: of 2.2 pound system with spot light and Hi-Res Camera (above)

Exclusive Features

Long Flight Times: We are aiming to reach 30-40 minute flight times to ensure that we can get to the victims, no matter where they are.

Universal Mounting System: We are working with a manufacturer to design a universal mounting component to change equipment faster with more efficiency.  So when the situation changes, searchers can unmount and re-mount the proper equipment, without the need for any tools for the job.

GPS Capabilities: We want the drones to not only be able to cover a lot of ground, but the ability to cover it more efficiently using our GPS capabilities.  Our system will drop a tracker to the lost person making them visible on mobile apps and the laptop computers at base.  GPS is packaged in a water resistant case, in a flood this could be the difference in life or death.  If the victim is swept into the water we could track their movements and plan a course to retrieve them more quickly.

Payload Dropper: We are looking to increase our payload capabilities with a pay load dropper that can carry up to almost 9 pounds.  We are also using magnet systems that will not interfere with GPS capabilities. (See Below)


Our SAR Drones in the Real World

No one wants to think about what may be the worst day of their lives or the life of someone they love.  But the reality is: crises, natural disasters and missing persons happens every single day and there isn't a technology that will ever prevent it, however our technology can severely reduce the fatalities involved.

Disasters, accidents and crises happen everyday:

  • Every 40 seconds in the United States, a child becomes missing or is abducted.
  • An astounding 2,300 Americans are reported missing every day, including both adults and children.
  • In 2013, 357 natural triggered disasters were registered, national casualty annual average: 107,000 people, victims: 268 million world wide.  
  • On average 53% of victims were from floods, 27 % from droughts and 16 % from storms. The country the most affected was China with 36% of victims, worldwide.
  • Each year avalanches kill more than 150 people worldwide but a person found within 15 minutes has a 90% chance of survival.
  • People often ask: Can't a helicopter do the same thing?  The answer is yes but, at a much higher operating cost.  Plus it risk the lives of at least 4 other people, a pilot, co-pilot and two spotters.  When our ProSearch EXF  UAV can search more cost effectively and save the Helicopter for the actual rescue and pick up.

NOTE ABOUT PLEXIDRONE:

Our perk listed for Plexidrone is the Plexidrone Pro package with Plexipack Mini.

Contributors getting this perk package will be receiving the following:

1  Plexidrone

1  Plexipack Mini

1  Camera Stabilizer (Gimbal)

1  Plexihub

1  Battery

1  Battery Charger

Plus our GPS Tracker

Plus our DTTR Fleet Commander T-Shirt

You can also find us on Wall Street Journal: http://online.wsj.com/article/PR-CO-20141121-909855.html

WE WILL BE THERE WHEN NO ONE ELSE CAN BE....

But we need your help, we need funding in order to move forward!!


Has graciously donated an Inspire1, to help inspire YOU to share this message with your friends and family.  The person that brings in the most contributions after making any contribution can win this great Multi-rotor.

Make Any Contribution, afterwards just share the link as per instructions and your referrals will be track automatically with Google analytics.  Who ever makes a contribution and helps the most with this important project and raises the most contributions from the link provided will win one of these great donated prizes.       

                      Please visit our great sponsors that have supported

story:
Who are we and What does Arroyo Rescue mean?

The Santa Fe Watershed Association (SFWA) has worked tirelessly since 1997 to protect and restore the health and vibrancy of the Santa Fe River and its watershed for the benefit of people and the environment.  Through education, restoration, stewardship, and advocacy, the SFWA is achieving this mission.

For over 12 years, the SFWA has been taking care of 18 miles of the Santa Fe River corridor through its Adopt-the-River program in partnership with the City and County of Santa Fe, along with local businesses, foundations and community members and volunteers.  Over 1 million pounds of trash have been removed from the river bed - like pulling out 40 school buses from the river! Other restoration efforts like removing non-native elms and planting native cottonwood trees have transformed the Santa Fe River through the Adopt-the-River program! 

Santa Fe’s arroyos, however, which feed directly into the Santa Fe River and have been largely neglected, are filled with trash, and have been left to erode.  Their soils, neighboring banks and channels, are slipping away, setting the scene for dangerous storm events and floods.  They need rescuing – now – trash needs to be removed, and water needs to slow down on its way through – to protect the people and environment, and to help our precious water infiltrate and join the groundwater to replenish our vital aquifer.

The impact of this work cannot be overestimated, especially as the climate becomes drier and hotter.  Our watershed is life to Santa Fe, and together we can help the arroyos become what they should be.

What we will do to rescue the arroyos with your help

Your donations will enable us to develop the Adopt an Arroyo program, based on our highly successful Adopt the River program.  There are over 80 miles of arroyo in and around the City of Santa Fe.  Previous work by staff at the SFWA identified the arroyos most in need of intervention. We will start working within 5 reaches of these arroyos, developing volunteer teams to adopt the reaches, enlisting sponsors to provide sustainable funding for them, and establishing management plans for each reach to counteract erosion with simple measures like one-rock dams, Zuni bowls and waddles. 

In order to achieve this goal, we need $10,000 to cover the development stage of the program and the first year of work in the arroyos.  We can then develop partnerships with sponsors for the long-term running of the program and its expansion to include more arroyo reaches.

What happens if we don’t reach $10,000? Not to worry! We will rescue as many arroyos as we can! We have designed our program to be easily scaled up or down depending on funding. Each $2,000 we raise will cover the rescue of one arroyo reach.  The more funding we receive, the more arroyos we can rescue!


Gifts you get

Not only will you be a pioneer in arroyo rescue, but you get access to our exclusive and exciting perks! These include our brand new Water is Life t-shirt (available in navy blue or charcoal, in men's and women's sizes), tickets to our much-anticipated launch of the River Brew Hefeweizen beer in partnership with Santa Fe Brewing, at Del Charro (June 10th from 5pm-7pm) featuring music by a local talent, snacks and great company, a commemorative Klean Kanteen stainless steel pint glass with our logo (to be received full of River Brew Hefeweizen at the beer launch), an exclusive MP3 download of a La Llorona arroyo story as told by local legend Joe Hayes for our supporters, opportunities to hike and dine with SFWA staff, and an arroyo Reach sponsorship with your own personalized sign next to an arroyo!

More on the Klean Kanteen stainless steel pint from their website:

"Put down the plastic and pick up a pint―steel that is. Made of 18/8, food-grade stainless steel, the 16oz Kanteen Steel Pint Cup is durable, reusable, and won't break like glass, or fill the garbage like the ubiquitous red cup. Multi-use and ready for any occasion, use them for parties, camping, boating, or hiking deep into the backcountry. Cheers, to the beginning of the end of the plastic cup!"

 

Take a closer look at our brand-new Water is Life Tshirt - trust us, it looks just as great in charcoal! 


The Impact

The Adopt-An-Arroyo program will strive to clean up the intrinsic and necessary drainages by removing litter and providing a safe place for people to recreate in and around.  Additionally, any soil erosion reduction measures that can be implemented will reduce sedimentation and excessive flooding in the entire watershed.  Importantly, the repeated presence of the volunteers can lead to an “Ownership” of the arroyo by the Steward Team, providing a real relationship with our arroyos and the Santa Fe River.

Based upon the successful Adopt-the-River program, the Adopt an Arroyo program would designate a Steward Team of volunteers whose mission it is to monitor the health of arroyos in the Santa Fe River watershed, removing debris, and advising the SFWA as to potentially damaging situations within each arroyo.  Coupled with the Steward Team is a Sponsor entity who contributes the funding to provide for the on-going management and potentially necessary restoration measures.

Risks and Challenges

The path to arroyo rescue success can be rocky and filled with quick sand at times.  One year of funding won’t be enough to make a difference to the long-term health of our arroyos – we need a program that can sustain itself and be in it for the long haul. 

We at the Santa Fe Watershed Association are well equipped to deal with this challenge and overcome it.  Our Adopt-the-River program is in its 12th year and sustains itself in large part thanks to Sponsors of the program that we have developed over the years, many of which have supported us since the program’s inception.  Adopt-the-River is well loved by all involved, and we will work to set up a similar support structure for Adopt an Arroyo within a year of our crowdfunding campaign. 


Spread the word and join the movement as an Arroyo Steward

We understand that not everyone can contribute to causes with dollar amounts – there are so many other ways you can help!  Make as much noise about our Arroyo Rescue as you can – share our campaign with all your friends and colleagues or become an Arroyo Steward!

We will need dedicated Stewards to adopt Arroyo Reaches, and your contribution in time and work is the most valuable contribution of all.  Get in touch with our Volunteer Coordinator to let us know you want to be part of our clean-up and restoration crew!

Besides picking up trash at least 5 times per year, the Stewards report on any human activities, any dangerous utility situations, and any unusual erosion scenarios.  There will be an initial training Session for all Steward Teams as well as regular “check-in’s” to monitor the morale of the team.  In order to acknowledge the Steward Team, there will be a sign prominently posted along the reach of the arroyo acknowledging the Team’s commitment.

More on the Santa Fe Watershed Association

Find out more about our organization and its importance by visiting our webpage, liking us on Facebook, and following us on Twitter.

Our Partners

Joe Hayes Storyteller

Inn of the Governors

Adopt the River Sponsors

Adopt the River Stewards

arroyos in the Santa Fe River watershed, removing debris, and advising the SFWA
as to potentially damaging situations within each arroyo.  Coupled with the Steward Team is a Sponsor
entity who contributes the funding to provide for the on-going management and
potentially necessary restoration measures.   
Risks and Challenges

The path to arroyo rescue
success can be rocky and filled with quick sand at times.  One year of funding won’t be enough to make a
difference to the long-term health of our arroyos – we need a program that can
sustain itself and be in it for the long haul. 

We at the Santa Fe
Watershed Association are well equipped to deal with this challenge and
overcome it.  Our Adopt-the-River program
is in its 12th year and sustains itself in large part
thanks to Sponsors of the program that we have developed over the years, many
of which have supported us since the program’s inception.  Adopt-the-River is well loved by all
involved, and we will work to set up a similar support structure for Adopt an
Arroyo within a year of our crowdfunding campaign. 



Spread the word and join the movement as an Arroyo Steward 
We understand that not
everyone can contribute to causes with dollar amounts – there are so many other
ways you can help!  Make as much noise
about our Arroyo Rescue as you can – share our campaign with all your friends
and colleagues or become an Arroyo Steward! 
We will need dedicated
Stewards to adopt Arroyo Reaches, and your contribution in time and work is the
most valuable contribution of all.  Get
in touch with our Volunteer Coordinator to let us know you want to be part of
our clean-up and restoration crew!
Besides
picking up trash at least 5 times per year, the Stewards report on any human
activities, any dangerous utility situations, and any unusual erosion
scenarios.  There will be an initial training
Session for all Steward Teams as well as regular “check-in’s” to monitor the
morale of the team.  In order to
acknowledge the Steward Team, there will be a sign prominently posted along the
reach of the arroyo acknowledging the Team’s commitment.More on the Santa Fe Watershed AssociationFind
out more about our organization and its importance by visiting our webpage, liking us on Facebook, and following us on Twitter.Our Partners
Joe Hayes StorytellerInn of the Governors
Adopt the River Sponsors
Adopt the River Stewards

story: We want to place 20 billboards with messages about clean water in order to inspire community engagement, education and action. Join us! For $9000 we can rent 20 billboards for 30 days along West Virginia highways. We have some great designs. If you contribute over $500, you can help us design a billboard if you like; we have in house artists at Our Common Voice and Kid in the Background, INC. Join us on Facebook and Twitter, or email us at friendsofwater14@gmail.com

story:
Les objectifs premiers de cette opération sont de (The Main objectives of this social operation are to) :

* Terminer et améliorer le système d’irrigation du champ de bananiers 

(Terminate and ameliorate the irrigation system of the banana trees farming),

* Traiter  et sauver les bananiers contre les parasites et les bactéries qui les attaquent 

(Treate and save the banana trees against parasites and bacterias that attack them),

* Construire une usine de conditionnement de bananes plantains et de poules africaines,  un bureau local et un point de vente local 

(Build a conditioning factory of african bananas and african chickens, a local office and a local shop),

*  Payer les salaires de nos ouvriers agricoles jusqu’à la première récolte et les premiers profits et accroitre leur pouvoir d’achat et leur niveau de vie 

(Pay the salaries of our farm workers until the first harvest and the first profits and increase their purchasing power and their standard of living).

* Maintenir une qualité optimale de nos plants de bananes et de nos poules 

(Maintain an optimal quality of our banana trees products and chickens),

*  Préparer la vente locale et l'exportation de nos produits un peu partout dans le Monde 

(Prepare the local selling and the exportation of our products all over the world),

*  Booster la productivité et la performance de nos outils de travail et de nos ouvriers et améliorer leurs conditions de travail 

(Boost the productivity and the performance of our working Tools and workers and ameliorate their working conditions),

*  Créer de nouveaux emplois agricoles et techniques au Cameroun 

(Create operating and farming jobs in Cameroon),

Nos principales ambitions sont ainsi de (Our principale ambitions are to) :

*  Utiliser des méthodes de production respectant autant que possible l'environnement dans un principe de développement responsable et durable 

(Use production methods respecting the environment as possible in a principle of responsible and sustainable development),


* Etre capable de distribuer localement et d'exporter nos produits un peu partout dans le Monde 

(Be capable of distributing locally and exporting our products all over the world),

*  Participer à notre niveau au développement économique et social et à l’amélioration du niveau de vie et du pouvoir d’achat au Cameroun 

(Participate at our level in Cameroon's economic and social development and in cameroon’s purchasing power and standard of living amelioration).

*  Offrir des opportunités d'emplois, de développements entrepreneuriaux et de croissance économique au Cameroun 

(Offer employment, entrepreuneurial and economic growth opportunities in Cameroon).

story:
Recognising the threat of polluted water and plastic waste to health and the environment in India, Amrutdhara was formed to tackle these issues. A technological solution that could be implemented in the market was designed in the form of a water vending machine where users could refill their bottles. When we cut out the bottle, we found we could cut costs, and offer what consumers had really wanted all along, clean water, at half the price per liter of bottled water making safe drinking water more affordable for all. We envision a network of refill stations starting in our town of Pondicherry and expanding across India, making it easy to give up buying bottled water forever.

HOW FAR WE’VE COME

We’ve designed and built a prototype for a vending machine that will enable shopkeepers in public spaces to sell drinking water to consumers with refillable bottles. When we overcome our limited resources, we plan to launch a pilot in Pondicherry over the next 3 months.

Founders Min and Akshay talking to citizens about their attitudes towards water.

We’re a growing, close-knit team based mainly out of Auroville, India and have been straining to promote this solution with minimal funding and without wages since early 2013. The founders, Min Ameen and Akshay Roongta, have now hit the limit to what can be achieved with part-time engagement, and are looking to come on board full-time come March 2015. We are also starting to hire a small team for design, research and operations.

This is the most crucial moment yet in the life of our start-up. The mountains we climb in the next few months will take us over the tipping point of our organisation into the full swing of the solution. Implementing a pilot over the next few months will prove to interested organisations that with long term funding, we can change the face of water in India. We have established July 2015 as the horizon to raise about $160,000 in funding through grants and investment for the longer term, given that we’ve stepped up efforts now. You can help us get there and be one of the original supporters of a company that will go international.


OUR JOURNEY

In October 2012 we dreamed of a cleaner world, free of plastic waste. We started as activists campaigning to ‘Ban the Bottle’, lobbying the Pondicherry government to ban the sale of packaged drinking water. Our friends in local social and ecological organisations urged us to create viable alternatives before pursuing action through policy.

A few months later we sat down to design a simple solution that filtered water on site, tested water quality in real-time and allowed a shopkeeper to sell water to consumers bringing their own bottles.We started with a stand-alone water kiosk.

In August 2013, our co-founder and CEO Min, was selected to be part of Villgro’s Entrepreneur-in-residence programme. Their guidance finely tuned our operations to be more dynamic and we applied the structural principles of a lean startup: conducting continuous experiments in the field to gain insight into consumer and the market to perfect the product long before its launch.


Our early experiments were a window into consumers thoughts on drinking unpackaged water and carrying their own bottles. As we tested our stand-alone kiosk, looking at the role of marketing campaigns, and price in uptake, we realised convenience was of the upmost importance to users. If we wanted people to buy unpackaged water, they would need to have easy access wherever they were. 

With the kiosk, capital costs were too high and and logistics too complicated. We needed a cheaper, simpler and more mobile idea that could fit in any common shop so users could refill anywhere.

We pivoted and focused on modular vending machines that would allow us to quickly build a dense network in a city, fully optimising convenience for consumers. Fuelled by the funding provided to us by Villgro and grant money we won through an IIHS competition, we launched full throttle into developing the vending machine.


THE PROTOTYPE & THE PILOT

Working closely with partners over the last 8 months, we have developed a working prototype that transforms a standard bubble top dispenser into a water ATM. The consumer puts in coins, and the machine  dispenses filtered water. A small display on the front shows the results of testing the  water real-time to ensure that it has been through a functioning RO system.

We’re now working with an experienced manufacturer of vending machines based in Delhi, to improve this prototype, in preparation for a 3 month pilot in Pondicherry to test the market and evaluate performance of the product.

The 3-month pilot consists of:

  • Setting up 10 machines in various shops in Pondicherry
  • Bringing on a partner for sales, distribution and operations
  • Conducting in-depth research around user behaviour and preferences to inform product design, sales and marketing
  • Applying logistical research to facilitate the whole administrative system including maintenance and operations

UPDATE (23rd Feb): 

Here's a quick update from what we've been upto in the last month or so. The prototype has been set up in an ice cream shop on the Pondicherry promenade, where it's been doing good business in the evenings especially. Here's a short video showing a few consumers quenching their thirst. 


NEXT PHASE

This is where you come in and make all the difference in the fight against clean water scarcity and plastic waste. In the next four months as the pilot allows us to prove the viability of the product to long term investors and donors.

This is what your contribution will allow us to do:

  • Conduct the pilot rigorously and possibly expand the size
  • Set up a small office as our headquarters in Auroville
  • Double our man power by hiring 2 interns and a lead for sales and marketing and bringing our co-founder Akshay, who will drop out of his master’s program, to come on-board full-time
  • Bringing on partners for product design and developing the next version of electronics
Please Note: We are working with a registered non-profit 'Natural Innovation .org' for this campaign and other fundraising efforts. The remarks on your credit card/bank account might reflect that.

What else you can do:

  • Give us a like on Facebook or follow us on Twitter to hear more and get our message out there!
  • Check out our sparkling new website!
  • If you'd like to invest in the business then do write to us at info@amrutdhara.in

  • Pledge to carry a refillable bottle instead of buying new bottles of plastic water. Together we can move mountains!

story:
OPDL is an organization made for and by Haitian peasant farmers. Their organization grows by the idea of "starting with an egg". An egg by itself is gone quickly, but with the care of a community, it can grow to be a chicken, who can be cared for and can eventually produce more eggs and more wealth. In this way, the peasant farmers have been able to create wealth for themselves and are in the process of creating their own building as a headquarters, all with wealth the organization has amassed for itself through farming.

Your donation will go toward expanding the farm and purchasing new livestock for the organization. Every small donation counts, as much wealth can come from a small egg. I was lucky enough to visit the farm and gardens in Haiti along with a group of LMU students on an Alternative Breaks trip. It is amazing how much can be achieved with so little. 

The aid donated to Haiti in the past has often been wrongly allocated and controlled by foreign groups and largely hurtful rather than beneficial for sustainable growth. You have the opportunity to make a donation that really goes to the people and will be controlled and utilized by Haitians for Haitians.
