story:
GARBAGE UNIVERSITY

The first Garbage University, generating environmental and social awareness.

Due to the pollution humans are generating by leaps and bounds, a transformation is needed in people’s understanding to redefine the concept of waste. Over eighty percent of the materials that go to landfills, rivers and seas from the various cities in Colombia can be reused.

The transformation of knowledge to redefine garbage must be a new life culture, where the challenge will be to get people to find innovative ideas built from waste products. Using new art and design creations will be a key factor in this.

The Garbage University was born from this idea: a space created for environmental education generating products useful to society.

The main thrust is to create an educational model to generate knowledge among people, while they care for the environment.

INNOVATIVE DESIGNS

The aim is that through knowledge of discarded materials and intensive design training people will generate new product ideas, develop them and reintegrate these materials into society.

What can be achieved with waste? The first thing to be done is a selection by quality, i.e., an initial separation at the source. After classification, the properties, shapes, patterns, and compositions of materials have to be looked at to begin designing and creating, searching for a homogenization of forms that creates structures and new elements. The lamps created from PET (polyethylene terephthalate), a type of plastic widely used in beverage cans and textiles, are a tangible example.


MATERIALS USED TO CREATE NEW PRODUCTS

We have redefined various waste materials by converting them into these products:

Vertical Garden created with PET Bottles

Structure with parts of amber PET Bottles


Ceiling lamp made from glass PET bottles

Chandelier from glass PET bottles.

The City of Cali flag where 22,000 PET bottles were used.

Landscaping held in Acunares kindergartens, sensitizing children through work with soil and recycling. Project carried out with the District Secretary for Social Integration (SDIS)

The Colombian flag, made with 40,000 PET bottles recovered from the Cauca River. Developed for the Andino Shopping Mall in the city of Bogotá.

ENVIRONMENTAL AND SOCIAL BENEFITS

Quantifying the benefits for the planet and future generations of increasing environmental awareness is perhaps a mathematical formula that would lead to infinite expressions, and its outcome as paradoxical as wanting to quantify the satisfaction we feel when we help or save someone. But we do want to list a few of its many benefits:

1.  Preserving nature

2.  Salubrity in our environment

3.  Health

4.  Resource savings

5.  Social inclusion

6.  Economic benefits

7.  Development of new, socially useful products.

8.  Generation of environmental knowledge

ENVIRONMENTAL FACTS

Every human being produces 8.5 tons of garbage in his or her life, actually throwing away more packaging than the products we actually consume.

Biodegradation http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biodegradation

REFRAMING, REUSING AND RECYCLING

These are the three basic rules that govern the model of knowledge transfer at Garbage University:

REFRAMING

The process by which materials thrown out as waste by people are collected and once again given a useful purpose in society.

REUSING

Reusing is the action of used goods or products again, and of giving them another use.

http://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reutilización

RECYCLING

Recycling is a process aimed at turning waste into new products to prevent discharge of potentially useful materials, reduce the consumption of new raw materials, and reduce energy usage, reduce air pollution (by incineration) and water pollution (through landfills), by reducing the need for conventional waste systems and by reducing emissions of greenhouse gases, compared to the production of plastics. Recycling is a key component in reducing contemporary waste and is the third component of the 3Rs ("Reduce, Reuse, Recycle").

http://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reciclaje

CLOSING THE CYCLE

This model seeks to complete the production cycle and thus not generate waste but raw materials, which will be reused in new products and create a reduction in the consumption of natural resources, while avoiding accumulation of these materials in rivers, seas and forests. Products will be fully recovered by the end of their useful life.

COEXISTENCE REQUIREMENT

The idea is to generate awareness among people so that garbage becomes a desired element, through knowledge of materials that will respect their end disposal.

INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN

Garbage University is a Colombian idea, developed by the Error314 brand and the GSU recycling company, who joined in a common purpose to create an environmental and social model that generates a positive impact on our society.

We are a team of people committed to the environment and social awareness: Julio Cesar Rodriguez, the project creator, is an industrial designer focused on the production of art using waste materials with his Error314 brand (www.error314.com); Juan Manuel Erazo is a Business Administrator with interests in sustainable alternatives, who worked with the Australian Environment Protection Authority - EPA; Juan Carlos Rodriguez is an industrial engineer with experience in the food and consumer industry who has worked the last 10 years in the financial sector, giving him statistical approach and clear and sustainable work objectives; and Alexander Beltran is a recycler by trade and an expert in the management of waste materials.

GOALS

At present there are a number of prototype products that are marketed. Assembling the production line requires training more staff, developing new products, and having a workspace. With this we will be ready to begin production at Garbage University. Our goals for the Garbage University campaign are:

USD $ 1,000,000

Coverage of costs for establishing the entire production line and the manufacture of the first series of products, destined to pioneer IndieGoGo contributors.

$ 1,300,000

Creation of new products and improvements in production.

$ 1,900,000

Establishing the Garbage University with a Research and Development Center that focuses on educating people, especially in the use of waste materials to generate new products.

CHOOSE YOUR PRODUCT

When choosing a product we must not think we are buying only the good we will receive, the true gift is the satisfaction of helping the cause by the nature and value each product received must have. This is your donation to improving the environment.

ORDERING

When you give your contribution, make a copy of the transaction confirmation and send it to us at gsusas@outlook.es, with the shipping information.

SHIPPING COSTS

We do not cover delivery costs for products purchased by persons involved in the IndieGoGo campaign; these will be charged to the product at the time of shipment.

THIS IS ONLY THE BEGINNING

Garbage University is the result of a dream for a better world for future generations. We are proud of what we have created, and we firmly believe it is a huge step in the right direction to benefit the environment and the most vulnerable population groups. Its unique point of view is an initiative that brings together the fight against pollution and against unemployment.

Over the coming months we will be working on finishing the last details, organization of production, shipments, and management of random contingencies. In all this, your contribution will make a difference.

If we can help you become aware of what is happening today and you want to be part of the solution, consider becoming a player in the success of this campaign! Support us with a donation, and share our model of environmental education with everyone, or just talk with friends and family, share our campaign and let the world know about us!

UNIVERSIDAD DE LA BASURA

La primera Universidad de la Basura, generando conciencia ambiental y social.

Debido a la contaminación que los seres humanos estamos realizando a pasos agigantados, se ve necesario una transformación al conocimiento de las personas para resignificar el concepto de basura. Puesto que en un porcentaje de más del ochenta por ciento del material que va a parar a los botaderos, ríos y mares, de las diferentes ciudades de Colombia se puede reutilizar.

La transformación del conocimiento para resignificar la basura, debe ser una nueva cultura de vida, donde se debe buscar como reto que las personas tengan como objetivo indagar en ideas innovadoras de productos construidos a través de los residuos. Para ello es importante utilizar nuevas creaciones a partir del arte y el diseño.

De esta idea nace la Universidad de la Basura, un espacio creado para la educación ambiental generando productos útiles a la sociedad.

La idea principal es crear un modelo de educación para generar conocimiento en las personas, mientras cuidan el medio ambiente. 

DISEÑOS INNOVADORES

Se busca que a través del conocimiento de los materiales desechados y una capacitación intensiva en diseño que las personas generen ideas de productos nuevos, para desarrollarlos y reintegrarlos a la sociedad.

¿Qué se puede hacer con los residuos? Lo primero que se debe hacer es una selección de la calidad, es decir, una separación inicial en la fuente. Luego de la clasificación se debe mirar las propiedades de los materiales, formas, esquemas, estructuras que tiene el mismo para empezar a diseñar y crear, buscando una homogenización de las formas para crear estructuras e ir fabricando nuevos elementos. Un ejemplo tangible son las lámparas creadas a partir de PET (más conocido por sus siglas en inglés PET, polyethylene terephtalate,  que es un tipo de plástico, muy usado en envases de bebidas y textiles).

MATERIALES USADOS PARA CREAR NUEVOS PRODUCTOS

Hemos resignificado diversos materiales de desecho convirtiéndolos en los siguientes productos:

Jardín Vertical creado con Botellas de PET


Estructura con partes de Botellas PET ámbar

Lámpara de techo fabricada con botellas PET cristal



Lámpara de techo a partir de botellas de PET cristal.

La bandera de Cali donde se utilizaron 22 mil botellas PET.

La ambientación realizada en los jardines infantiles de Acunares, sensibilizándose a los niños a través del trabajo de la tierra y el reciclaje. Trabajo realizado en conjunto con la Secretaria Distrital de Integración Social (SDIS)

La bandera de Colombia, hecha con 40 mil botellas PET recuperadas del río Cauca. Realizada para el centro comercial Andino, en la ciudad de Bogotá. 

BENEFICIO AMBIENTAL Y SOCIAL

Cuantificar los beneficios que tiene para el planeta y las futuras generaciones, el lograr tener conciencia ecológica, tal vez sea una formula matemática que nos lleve a expresiones infinitas y resultaría tan paradójico su resultado como querer cuantificar la  satisfacción que sentimos cuando ayudamos o salvamos a alguien. Pero si queremos escribir los beneficios en un listado, estos solo serían algunos de muchos:

1.  Preservar la naturaleza

2.  Sanidad en nuestro entorno

3.  Salud

4.  Economía de recursos

5.  Inclusión social

6.  Beneficios monetarios

7.  Desarrollo de productos nuevos, útiles a la sociedad.

8.  Generación de conocimiento ambiental

HECHOS AMBIENTALES

Cada ser humano produce 8.5 toneladas de basura en su vida, al final terminamos botando mas empaques que los productos que realmente consumimos.

Biodegradación http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biodegradation

RESIGNIFICAR, REUSAR Y RECICLAR

Estas son las tres reglas básicas que regirán el modelo de transmisión de conocimiento por la Universidad de la Basura:

RESIGNIFICAR

Proceso por el cual se toma los materiales desechados por las personas y se les vuelve a dar un significado útil para la sociedad.

REUSAR 

Reutilizar es la acción de volver a utilizar los bienes o productos, y darles otro uso.

http://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reutilizaci%C3%B3n

RECICLAR

El reciclaje es un proceso cuyo objetivo es convertir desechos en nuevos productos para prevenir el desuso de materiales potencialmente útiles, reducir el consumo de nueva materia prima, reducir el uso de energía, reducir la contaminación del aire (a través de la incineración) y del agua (a través de los vertederos) por medio de la reducción de la necesidad de los sistemas de desechos convencionales, así como también disminuir las emisiones de gases de efecto invernadero en comparación con la producción de plásticos. El reciclaje es un componente clave en la reducción de desechos contemporáneos y es el tercer componente de las 3R (“Reducir, Reutilizar, Reciclar”).

http://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reciclaje

CERRANDO EL CICLO

Por medio de este modelo se busca completar el clico de producción y como resultado que no se produzcan desechos, sino materia prima, que será reutilizada en nuevos productos, generando una reducción en el consumo de recursos naturales y evitando acumulación de estos materiales en los ríos, mares y bosques. Para que los productos se recuperen por completo al final de su vida útil.

REQUISITO DE CONVIVENCIA

La idea es generar conciencia en las personas para generar que la basura se convierta en un material deseado, a través del conocimiento de los materiales para respetar su disposición final. 

LA CAMPAÑA DE INDIEGOGO

La Universidad de la Basura es una idea colombiana, desarrollada por la marca Error314 y la empresa de reciclaje G.S.U, que se unieron con un propósito en común para crear un modelo ambiental y social que genere un impacto positivo en nuestra sociedad.

Somos un equipo de personas comprometidas con el medio ambiente y la parte social: Julio Cesar Rodriguez, el creador del proyecto, es diseñador industrial enfocado en la producción de arte utilizando materiales de desecho con su marca Error314 (www.error314.com); Juan Manuel Erazo, Administrador de Empresas con intereses en alternativas sostenibles, trabajo en Australia en la Environment Protection Authority – EPA; Juan Carlos Rodriguez ingeniero industrial, trabajo en empresas de alimentos y consumo masivo y los últimos 10 años trabajo en el sector financiero lo cual le da un enfoque estadista y trabajar bajo objetivos claros y sostenibles; Alexander Beltran reciclador de oficio y es experto en el manejo de los materiales desechados. 

METAS

En la actualidad existe una serie de prototipos de productos que son comercializados. Para montar la línea de producción se necesita capacitar más personal, desarrollar nuevos productos y contar con un espacio de trabajo, con esto estaremos listos para iniciar la producción en la Universidad de la Basura. Estos son nuestros objetivos para la campaña de la Universidad de la Basura:

Usd $ 1.000.000

La cobertura de los costos de preparación de toda la línea de producción y la producción de la primera serie de productos, destinados a los contribuyentes IndieGoGo pioneras.

1.300.000 $

La creación de nuevos productos y mejoras en la producción.

1.900.000 $

El montaje de la Universidad de la Basura con su centro de investigación y desarrollo, centrado a educar a las personas especialmente en la utilización de materiales de desecho para la generación de nuevos productos.

ELIGE TU PRODUCTO

Cuando se elige un producto se debe pensar que no estamos comprando el bien que vamos a recibir, el verdadero regalo es la satisfacción de ayudar a la causa por la naturaleza y el valor que debe tener cada producto recibido es tu donación para el mejoramiento del medio ambiente

HACER UN PEDIDO

Cuando realices tu contribución realiza una copia de la confirmación de la transacción y no la envías al correo electrónico gsusas@outlook.es , con los datos de envío. 

GASTOS DE ENVÍO

No cubrimos los gatos de envío de los productos comprados por los las personas que participen en la campaña de Indiegogo, estos serán cargados al producto al momento del envío.

ES SOLO EL INICIO

La Universidad de la Basura es el resultado de la ilusión de un mundo mejor para nuestras futuras generaciones. Estamos orgullosos de lo que hemos creado, creemos firmemente que es un gran paso en la dirección correcta para el beneficio del medio ambiente y de las poblaciones más vulnerables, desde cualquier punto de vista es una iniciativa que suma a la lucha contra de la contaminación y el desempleo.

Durante los próximos meses vamos a estar trabajando en terminar los últimos detalles, la organización de la cadena de producción, los envíos, y la gestión de todas las contingencias aleatorias. Y en todo esto, su contribución hará la diferencia.

Si logramos que sea consciente de lo que sucede hoy en día y quiere formar parte de la solución, considere ser un protagonista en el éxito de esta campaña! Apoyarnos con una donación, y comparte con todo el mundo nuestro modelo de educación ambiental o simplemente habla con tus amigos y familiares, comparte nuestra campaña, y que el mundo sepa acerca de nosotros!

Recompensas

1 $ 

Gracias

15 $

Certificado donación Universidad de la Basura

25 $

Video Instructivo para fabricar tu Lámpara 

40 $

Cartilla para realizar diseños básicos (medio magnético)

100 $

Instrumento decorativo para mesa (No incluye gastos de envío)

150 $

Lámpara pequeña (No incluye gastos de envío)

225 $

Lámpara de techo para centro del comedor (No incluye gastos de envío)

1.250 $ 

Los nombre de los donantes en su orden de llegada y monto serán gravados en una escultura de donantes y agradecimientos de la primera sede de la Universidad de la Basura, partiendo de este monto en adelante.

1.800 $ 

Jardín o huerto vertical de 2 m2 (No incluye gastos de envío)

3.800 $

El nombre del donante será usado en los nombres que llevaran los primeros diseños trabajados en la Universidad de la Basura

5.000 $

Asesoría en el país, cuidad y lugar de donde se presente la donación para hacer una bandera  o aviso gigante con materia reciclado (Esto cubre hasta US 1.000 en tiquetes aéreos, no incluye los gatos de estadía del diseñador)

10.000 $ o más

Entrada a las instalaciones de la Universidad de la Basura a conocer el modelo de educación y participación en los talleres de capacitación.
story_txt:
GARBAGE UNIVERSITY 
The first Garbage University,
generating environmental and social awareness.
Due to the pollution humans are
generating by leaps and bounds, a transformation is needed in people’s
understanding to redefine the concept of waste. Over eighty percent of the
materials that go to landfills, rivers and seas from the various cities in
Colombia can be reused.
The transformation of knowledge to
redefine garbage must be a new life culture, where the challenge will be to get
people to find innovative ideas built from waste products. Using new art and
design creations will be a key factor in this.
The Garbage University was born from
this idea: a space created for environmental education generating products
useful to society.
The main thrust is to create an
educational model to generate knowledge among people, while they care for the
environment.
INNOVATIVE DESIGNS
The aim is that through knowledge of
discarded materials and intensive design training people will generate new
product ideas, develop them and reintegrate these materials into society.
What can be achieved with waste? The
first thing to be done is a selection by quality, i.e., an initial separation
at the source. After classification, the properties, shapes, patterns, and
compositions of materials have to be looked at to begin designing and creating,
searching for a homogenization of forms that creates structures and new elements.
The lamps created from PET (polyethylene terephthalate), a type of plastic widely
used in beverage cans and textiles, are a tangible example.



MATERIALS USED TO CREATE NEW PRODUCTS
We have redefined various waste
materials by converting them into these products:






Vertical Garden created with PET
Bottles




Structure with parts of amber PET
Bottles





Ceiling lamp made from glass PET
bottles 




Chandelier from glass PET bottles.




The City of Cali flag where 22,000
PET bottles were used.


Landscaping held in Acunares kindergartens,
sensitizing children through work with soil and recycling. Project carried out
with the District Secretary for Social Integration (SDIS)




The Colombian flag, made with 40,000
PET bottles recovered from the Cauca River. Developed for the Andino Shopping Mall
in the city of Bogotá.
ENVIRONMENTAL AND SOCIAL BENEFITS
Quantifying the benefits for the
planet and future generations of increasing environmental awareness is perhaps
a mathematical formula that would lead to infinite expressions, and its outcome
as paradoxical as wanting to quantify the satisfaction we feel when we help or
save someone. But we do want to list a few of its many benefits:
1.  Preserving nature
2.  Salubrity in our environment
3.  Health
4.  Resource savings
5.  Social inclusion
6.  Economic benefits
7.  Development of new, socially useful
products.
8.  Generation of environmental knowledge
ENVIRONMENTAL FACTS
Every human being produces 8.5 tons
of garbage in his or her life, actually throwing away more packaging than the products
we actually consume.


Biodegradation http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biodegradation
REFRAMING, REUSING AND RECYCLING
These are the three basic rules that
govern the model of knowledge transfer at Garbage University:
REFRAMING
The process by which materials thrown
out as waste by people are collected and once again given a useful purpose in
society.
REUSING
Reusing is the action of used goods
or products again, and of giving them another use.
http://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reutilización
RECYCLING
Recycling is a process aimed at
turning waste into new products to prevent discharge of potentially useful
materials, reduce the consumption of new raw materials, and reduce energy
usage, reduce air pollution (by incineration) and water pollution (through landfills),
by reducing the need for conventional waste systems and by reducing emissions
of greenhouse gases, compared to the production of plastics. Recycling is a key
component in reducing contemporary waste and is the third component of the 3Rs ("Reduce,
Reuse, Recycle").
http://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reciclaje
CLOSING THE CYCLE
This model seeks to complete the
production cycle and thus not generate waste but raw materials, which will be
reused in new products and create a reduction in the consumption of natural
resources, while avoiding accumulation of these materials in rivers, seas and
forests. Products will be fully recovered by the end of their useful life.


COEXISTENCE REQUIREMENT
The idea is to generate awareness
among people so that garbage becomes a desired element, through knowledge of
materials that will respect their end disposal.
INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN 
Garbage University is a Colombian
idea, developed by the Error314 brand and the GSU recycling company, who joined
in a common purpose to create an environmental and social model that generates
a positive impact on our society.
We are a team of people committed to
the environment and social awareness: Julio Cesar Rodriguez, the project
creator, is an industrial designer focused on the production of art using waste
materials with his Error314 brand (www.error314.com); Juan Manuel Erazo is a
Business Administrator with interests in sustainable alternatives, who worked
with the Australian Environment Protection Authority - EPA; Juan Carlos
Rodriguez is an industrial engineer with experience in the food and consumer industry
who has worked the last 10 years in the financial sector, giving him statistical
approach and clear and sustainable work objectives; and Alexander Beltran is a recycler
by trade and an expert in the management of waste materials.
GOALS
At present there are a number of
prototype products that are marketed. Assembling the production line requires
training more staff, developing new products, and having a workspace. With this
we will be ready to begin production at Garbage University. Our goals for the Garbage
University campaign are:
USD $ 1,000,000
Coverage of costs for establishing
the entire production line and the manufacture of the first series of products,
destined to pioneer IndieGoGo contributors.
$ 1,300,000
Creation of new products and
improvements in production.
$ 1,900,000
Establishing the Garbage University
with a Research and Development Center that focuses on educating people,
especially in the use of waste materials to generate new products.
CHOOSE YOUR PRODUCT
When choosing a product we must not think
we are buying only the good we will receive, the true gift is the satisfaction
of helping the cause by the nature and value each product received must have.
This is your donation to improving the environment.
ORDERING
When you give your contribution,
make a copy of the transaction confirmation and send it to us at gsusas@outlook.es, with the shipping information.
SHIPPING COSTS
We do not cover delivery costs for
products purchased by persons involved in the IndieGoGo campaign; these will be
charged to the product at the time of shipment.
THIS IS ONLY THE BEGINNING
Garbage University is the result of a
dream for a better world for future generations. We are proud of what we have
created, and we firmly believe it is a huge step in the right direction to
benefit the environment and the most vulnerable population groups. Its unique
point of view is an initiative that brings together the fight against pollution
and against unemployment.
Over the coming months we will be
working on finishing the last details, organization of production, shipments,
and management of random contingencies. In all this, your contribution will
make a difference.
If we can help you become aware of
what is happening today and you want to be part of the solution, consider
becoming a player in the success of this campaign! Support us with a donation,
and share our model of environmental education with everyone, or just talk with
friends and family, share our campaign and let the world know about us!
UNIVERSIDAD DE LA BASURA
La primera Universidad de la Basura, generando conciencia
ambiental y social.
Debido a la contaminación que los seres humanos estamos
realizando a pasos agigantados, se ve necesario una transformación al
conocimiento de las personas para resignificar el concepto de basura. Puesto
que en un porcentaje de más del ochenta por ciento del material que va a parar
a los botaderos, ríos y mares, de las diferentes ciudades de Colombia se puede
reutilizar.
La transformación del conocimiento para resignificar la basura,
debe ser una nueva cultura de vida, donde se debe buscar como reto que las
personas tengan como objetivo indagar en ideas innovadoras de productos
construidos a través de los residuos. Para ello es importante utilizar nuevas
creaciones a partir del arte y el diseño. 
De esta idea nace la Universidad de la Basura, un espacio
creado para la educación ambiental generando productos útiles a la sociedad. 
La idea principal es crear un modelo de educación para
generar conocimiento en las personas, mientras cuidan el medio ambiente. 

DISEÑOS INNOVADORES 
Se busca que a través del conocimiento de los materiales
desechados y una capacitación intensiva en diseño que las personas generen
ideas de productos nuevos, para desarrollarlos y reintegrarlos a la sociedad. 
¿Qué se puede hacer con los residuos? Lo primero que se debe
hacer es una selección de la calidad, es decir, una separación inicial en la
fuente. Luego de la clasificación se debe mirar las propiedades de los
materiales, formas, esquemas, estructuras que tiene el mismo para empezar a
diseñar y crear, buscando una homogenización de las formas para crear
estructuras e ir fabricando nuevos elementos. Un ejemplo tangible son las
lámparas creadas a partir de PET (más conocido por sus siglas en inglés
PET, polyethylene terephtalate,  que
es un tipo de plástico, muy usado en envases de bebidas y textiles).
MATERIALES USADOS PARA CREAR NUEVOS PRODUCTOS
Hemos resignificado diversos materiales de desecho
convirtiéndolos en los siguientes productos:





Jardín Vertical creado con Botellas de PET





Estructura con partes de Botellas PET ámbar





Lámpara de techo fabricada con botellas PET cristal




Lámpara de techo a partir de botellas de PET cristal.



La bandera de Cali donde se utilizaron 22 mil botellas PET.



La ambientación realizada en los jardines infantiles de
Acunares, sensibilizándose a los niños a través del trabajo de la tierra y el
reciclaje. Trabajo realizado en conjunto con la Secretaria Distrital de
Integración Social (SDIS)



La bandera de Colombia, hecha con 40 mil botellas PET
recuperadas del río Cauca. Realizada para el centro comercial Andino, en la
ciudad de Bogotá.  
BENEFICIO AMBIENTAL Y SOCIAL
Cuantificar los beneficios que tiene para el planeta y las
futuras generaciones, el lograr tener conciencia ecológica, tal vez sea una
formula matemática que nos lleve a expresiones infinitas y resultaría tan
paradójico su resultado como querer cuantificar la  satisfacción que sentimos cuando ayudamos o
salvamos a alguien. Pero si queremos escribir los beneficios en un listado, estos
solo serían algunos de muchos:
1. 
Preservar la
naturaleza
2. 
Sanidad en
nuestro entorno
3. 
Salud
4. 
Economía de recursos
5. 
Inclusión social
6. 
Beneficios
monetarios
7. 
Desarrollo de
productos nuevos, útiles a la sociedad.
8. 
Generación de
conocimiento ambiental
HECHOS AMBIENTALES 
Cada ser humano produce 8.5 toneladas de basura en su vida,
al final terminamos botando mas empaques que los productos que realmente
consumimos. 


Biodegradación
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biodegradation
RESIGNIFICAR, REUSAR Y RECICLAR
Estas son las tres reglas básicas que regirán el modelo de transmisión
de conocimiento por la Universidad de la Basura:
RESIGNIFICAR 
Proceso por el cual se toma los materiales desechados por las
personas y se les vuelve a dar un significado útil para la sociedad. 
REUSAR  
Reutilizar es la acción de volver a utilizar los bienes o
productos, y darles otro uso. 
http://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reutilizaci%C3%B3n
RECICLAR
El reciclaje es un proceso cuyo objetivo es convertir
desechos en nuevos productos para prevenir el desuso de materiales
potencialmente útiles, reducir el consumo de nueva materia prima, reducir el
uso de energía, reducir la contaminación del aire (a través de la incineración)
y del agua (a través de los vertederos) por medio de la reducción de la
necesidad de los sistemas de desechos convencionales, así como también
disminuir las emisiones de gases de efecto invernadero en comparación con la
producción de plásticos. El reciclaje es un componente clave en la reducción de
desechos contemporáneos y es el tercer componente de las 3R (“Reducir, Reutilizar,
Reciclar”).
http://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reciclaje
CERRANDO EL CICLO
Por medio de este modelo se busca completar el clico de
producción y como resultado que no se produzcan desechos, sino materia prima,
que será reutilizada en nuevos productos, generando una reducción en el consumo
de recursos naturales y evitando acumulación de estos materiales en los ríos,
mares y bosques. Para que los productos se recuperen por completo al final de
su vida útil. 


REQUISITO DE CONVIVENCIA
La idea es generar conciencia en las personas para generar
que la basura se convierta en un material deseado, a través del conocimiento de
los materiales para respetar su disposición final.  


LA CAMPAÑA DE INDIEGOGO
La Universidad de la Basura es una idea colombiana, desarrollada por la marca Error314 y la empresa de reciclaje G.S.U, que se unieron con un propósito en común para crear un modelo ambiental y social que genere un impacto positivo en nuestra sociedad.
Somos un equipo de personas comprometidas con el medio ambiente y la parte social: Julio Cesar Rodriguez, el creador del proyecto, es diseñador industrial enfocado en la producción de arte utilizando materiales de desecho con su marca Error314 (www.error314.com); Juan Manuel Erazo, Administrador de Empresas con intereses en alternativas sostenibles, trabajo en Australia en la Environment Protection Authority – EPA; Juan Carlos Rodriguez ingeniero industrial, trabajo en empresas de alimentos y consumo masivo y los últimos 10 años trabajo en el sector financiero lo cual le da un enfoque estadista y trabajar bajo objetivos claros y sostenibles; Alexander Beltran reciclador de oficio y es experto en el manejo de los materiales desechados. 
METAS
En la actualidad existe una serie de prototipos de productos
que son comercializados. Para montar la línea de producción se necesita
capacitar más personal, desarrollar nuevos productos y contar con un espacio de
trabajo, con esto estaremos listos para iniciar la producción en la Universidad
de la Basura. Estos son nuestros objetivos para la campaña de la Universidad de
la Basura:
Usd $ 1.000.000
La cobertura de los costos de preparación de toda la línea de
producción y la producción de la primera serie de productos, destinados a los
contribuyentes IndieGoGo pioneras.
1.300.000 $
La creación de nuevos productos y mejoras en la producción.
1.900.000 $
El montaje de la Universidad de la Basura con su centro de
investigación y desarrollo, centrado a educar a las personas especialmente en
la utilización de materiales de desecho para la generación de nuevos productos.
ELIGE TU PRODUCTO
Cuando se elige un producto se debe pensar que no estamos
comprando el bien que vamos a recibir, el verdadero regalo es la satisfacción
de ayudar a la causa por la naturaleza y el valor que debe tener cada producto
recibido es tu donación para el mejoramiento del medio ambiente
HACER UN PEDIDO
Cuando realices tu contribución realiza una copia de la
confirmación de la transacción y no la envías al correo electrónico gsusas@outlook.es , con los datos de envío. 

GASTOS DE ENVÍO
No cubrimos los gatos de envío de los productos comprados por
los las personas que participen en la campaña de Indiegogo, estos serán
cargados al producto al momento del envío.
ES SOLO EL INICIO 
La Universidad de la Basura es el resultado de la ilusión de
un mundo mejor para nuestras futuras generaciones. Estamos orgullosos de lo que
hemos creado, creemos firmemente que es un gran paso en la dirección correcta
para el beneficio del medio ambiente y de las poblaciones más vulnerables,
desde cualquier punto de vista es una iniciativa que suma a la lucha contra de
la contaminación y el desempleo.

Durante los próximos meses vamos a estar trabajando en terminar los últimos
detalles, la organización de la cadena de producción, los envíos, y la gestión
de todas las contingencias aleatorias. Y en todo esto, su contribución hará la
diferencia.

Si logramos que sea consciente de lo que sucede hoy en día y quiere formar
parte de la solución, considere ser un protagonista en el éxito de esta
campaña! Apoyarnos con una donación, y comparte con todo el mundo nuestro
modelo de educación ambiental o simplemente habla con tus amigos y familiares,
comparte nuestra campaña, y que el mundo sepa acerca de nosotros!



Recompensas
1 $  
Gracias
15 $ 
Certificado donación Universidad de la Basura
25 $ 
Video Instructivo para fabricar tu Lámpara  
40 $ 
Cartilla para realizar diseños básicos (medio magnético)
100 $ 
Instrumento decorativo para mesa (No incluye gastos de envío)
150 $ 
Lámpara pequeña (No incluye gastos de envío)
225 $ 
Lámpara de techo para centro del comedor (No incluye gastos de
envío) 
1.250 $  
Los nombre de los donantes en su orden de
llegada y monto serán gravados en una escultura de donantes y agradecimientos
de la primera sede de la Universidad de la Basura, partiendo de este monto en
adelante.
1.800 $  
Jardín o huerto vertical de 2 m2 (No incluye gastos de envío)
3.800 $ 
El nombre del donante será usado en los nombres que llevaran los
primeros diseños trabajados en la Universidad de la Basura 
5.000 $ 
Asesoría en el país, cuidad y lugar de donde se presente la donación
para hacer una bandera  o aviso gigante
con materia reciclado (Esto cubre hasta US 1.000 en tiquetes aéreos, no incluye
los gatos de estadía del diseñador)
10.000 $ o más 
Entrada a las instalaciones de la Universidad de la Basura a conocer
el modelo de educación y participación en los talleres de capacitación.

story:
Some of my fondest memories of growing up in Trinidad and Tobago (T&T) are of pickup cricket games played on hard-packed seashores when the afternoon tides had receded. 

As a bit of a sports fanatic, I’d live for our beach trips, so I distinctly remember when my innocent excitement faded into sobered awareness as the first of countless oil spills devastated our coasts.

In truth, T&T is much more industrialized  than the laid back island paradise many imagine it to be. The country produces ~0.1% of the world’s oil - a staggering amount considering the tiny islands’ population of just over 1.3M - and its energy sector accounts for ~45% of GDP.

But the numbers that truly impact me as a citizen are the estimates of the damage done to our ecosystem: hundreds of thousands of gallons spilled, 500 species of fish at risk and entire mangrove forests destroyed. Where there should be an abundance of crabs and chip chips there are none. Even the pieces of driftwood we’d use to make our cricket wickets I now find stained by thick, black muck. It’s disturbing.

This is why I’m thrilled to be among the applicants selected to join the 2041 Foundation on the "Leadership on the Edge" Antarctic Expedition, which will give me the opportunity to explore the issues of climate change and sustainability alongside expert conservationists. I’ll also learn about the moratorium on Antarctic mining and oil drilling, prohibitions which end in 2041, with the goal of emerging a better equipped ambassador for education, the environment and sustainability. For context, 2041 only accepts ~2% of 5000+ global applications so this is truly a unique opportunity.

I expect this epic expedition to both test my limits and to open my eyes.

Though subsidized by 2041, the cost to safely make this arduous, two-week journey ranges from ~$16,500 - $25,000+, including accommodations, transportation, gear and meals. Without a doubt, I’ve requested the package with the least creature comforts and intend to personally cover as much of the cost as possible. However, as a graduate student and aspiring entrepreneur, I could really use your support.

I've listed a few perks that I hope will allow us to share the experience of celebrating this wonderful world we call home :)

Big or small, I'm truly grateful for each and every contribution. Thank you!

Feel free to email at dookeran [at] stanford [dot] edu with any questions.

Relishing the gentle snowfall on Patagonia's peaks

story:
The Issue - The Hidden Slaughter Of Endangered Animals


Iceland is one of the very few nations that still allow the commercial killing of some of nature's most impressive and vulnerable animals - the great whales.

Every year Icelandic whalers are allowed to kill up to 229 minke whales and up to 154 endangered fin whales.

Due to the remoteness and inaccessibility of the whale hunts in Iceland, whaling operations are largely shielded from public scrutiny and the public perception of whaling activities is very much shaped by the information that the whaling industry itself provides.

The industry recognizes of course that whaling is far from uncontroversial. Not only has the whale watching industry been growing in recent years, drawing thousands of tourists to Iceland who want to observe these majestic individuals in their natural habitat, but an overwhelming majority of Icelanders have expressed their concern for animal welfare. Images of animals that are hunted with explosive-spiked harpoons and blown up to (allegedly) induce immediate cardiac arrest make for very bad publicity and make it very hard to maintain the “humane whaling” narrative.

To protect its own activities and to dispel concerns about the ethicality of the slaughter of whales, who are killed for strictly commercial purposes, the whaling industry has waged a systematic misinformation campaign. By deliberately controlling what information about this hunt is released to the public, the pro-whaling lobby has so far managed to quell an honest and critical debate about the defensibility of whaling in Iceland.

Due to the absence of a strong voice that counters the “humane whaling" narrative, the Icelandic pro-whaling lobby has so far been quite successful at getting its desired message across. This was, for instance, attested by a 2013 poll according to which almost 60 percent of Icelanders believe that the whale hunt is carried out in a humane manner.

Although most Icelanders know that whales are still being hunted in Iceland, the brutal practice of killing a whale itself remains a big mystery - and without a doubt, the whaling industry wants to keep it that way. We believe that the whaling industry’s deliberate misinformation policy is directly responsible for the ongoing quiet acquiescence of the whale hunt in Iceland. To change this, in 2014 we threw down the gauntlet and began to directly challenge the Icelandic whaling industry’s information monopoly.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Campaign - The Whaler Watching Approach


Exposure & Attention - Effective tools against commercial whaling

Hard To Port’s Whaler Watching campaign uses a new approach in order to draw attention to the annual carnage of Icelandic wildlife. We believe that legally-obtained, detailed documentation and media coverage has the potential to kick-start a much-needed public debate on the defensibility of commercial whaling in Iceland. Our initiative focuses on the gathering and distribution of comprehensive data on the whaling operations. We believe that the Icelandic public and the rest of the international community have a right to receive unrestricted information about this controversial industry and about the sad and disturbing fate of these iconic animals. We are confident that as we make our uncensored information more widely available, more people will join the call to end whaling in Iceland.


Education Is The Key To Change

During the first phase of our Whaler Watching Campaign our team had the opportunity to talk to many Icelanders. We greatly appreciate the constructive exchange of opinions and information. As much as we are opposed to the cruel killing of these fascinating animals, we try to approach everyone with the same amount of respect, regardless of his or her opinion on whaling. We understand that to some Icelanders the issue of commercial whaling is a very sensitive topic. In addition to our planned sea-based documentation work Hard To Port will set up a mobile contact point where people can argue and debate their views with us. We will make sure that everyone, regardless of their views on whaling, is allowed to express their opinion, provided that all available information, evidence and footage is on the table.


Working With Local Communities & Businesses

Collaboration and cooperation play a central role in our efforts to protect the whales in Iceland. Although the Icelandic government likes to portray the whaling industry as a national industry, many Icelanders are in fact highly critical if not outright opposed to commercial whaling. By working with local businesses and individuals who share our concern for the well-being of these fascinating animals, Hard To Port is building a strong and diverse coalition of voices who collectively speak out against whaling.


Media coverage of our Whaler Watching Campaign 2015

The news coverage of the first part of our Whaler Watching Campaign has been amazing. Our work and documentation footage has been mentioned, among others, on the websites of the following newspapers and magazines:


Watch our documentary trailer

The first phase of our 'Whaler Watching' campaign has been accompanied by a film team of Blackrabbit Images. Please watch this powerful trailer from the upcoming documentary about our work in Iceland this past sumer.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Outcome - Our expectations and hopes

We believe that the second phase of our Whaler Watching campaign can become a real game changer in the effort to put an end to commercial whaling in Iceland once and for all.

A recent poll shows that local support for whaling in Iceland is decreasing. Although this is a positive and promising development, more than 30 % of Icelanders remain undecided in their opinion about the slaughter of whales in their country.

We firmly believe that by making the brutal killing of these majestic animals visible to the Icelandic public, we will convince more people to join the call for the abolition of the horrific annual slaughter.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Your Support - What we do with your contribution

Our goal for this crowdfunding campaign is to cover the basic costs of the 2016 Whaler Watching Campaign in Iceland. 20 % of our financial target of 50.000 € will allow us to pay for accommodation, logistics, campaign provisions and transportation on the ground in Iceland.

Exceeding our crowdfunding goal

Any additional financial help beyond our 10.000 Euro target would allow us to get sooner into campaign mode and spend more time on the preparation of this challenging campaign.


Sea Documentation

  • research boat
  • fuel
  • insurance
  • sea worthy clothing
  • safety equipment
  • emergency fund (repairs, etc.)

Outreach & Education

  • information stall
  • printed outreach material (recycled paper)
  • additional presentation tools
  • giveaways (fairtrade/recyclable)

Equipment

  • additional camera equipment
  • equipment protection (splash guard, etc.)
  • improved & suitable UAV

Basic Costs

  • accommodation
  • logistics (ferry costs, etc.)
  • campaign provisions (strictly vegan)
  • land transportation (vehicle, insurance, fuel)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What's in it for you?

The success of our work in Iceland depends heavily on the generosity of people like you. As a token of our gratitude for the immense trust that you place in us by donating to our campaign, our Hard To Port volunteers have come up with some great campaign-related perks through which we would like to express our great appreciation for your support.

(All perks can be viewed individually in the image gallery.)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Sharing is Caring - Tell your friends about us



Social media is a great tool to spread the word about our young organization and our efforts to protect the whales in Iceland. Connect with us to keep in touch and stay informed about our ongoing work and the progress of our campaigns. We invite you to follow us on Facebook and Twitter and to share and/or re-tweet our posts and this crowdfunding campaign. Check us out on Vimeo, Instagram and Flickr for photos and videos from our 2015 campaign. We look forward to connecting with you!
story_txt:
The Issue - The Hidden Slaughter Of Endangered Animals





Iceland is
one of the very few nations that still allow the commercial killing of
some of nature's most impressive and vulnerable animals - the great
whales. 
Every year Icelandic whalers are allowed to kill up to 229 minke whales
and up to 154 endangered fin whales.
Due to the
remoteness and inaccessibility of the whale hunts in Iceland, whaling
operations are largely shielded from public scrutiny and the public
perception of whaling activities is very much shaped by the information
that the whaling industry itself provides.
 The industry
recognizes of course that whaling is far from uncontroversial.
Not only has the whale watching industry been growing in recent
years, drawing thousands of tourists to Iceland who want to observe
these majestic individuals in their natural habitat, but an overwhelming
majority of Icelanders have expressed their concern for animal
welfare. Images of animals that are hunted with explosive-spiked harpoons and
blown up to (allegedly) induce immediate cardiac arrest make for
very bad publicity and make it very hard to maintain the “humane
whaling” narrative.


To protect
its own activities and to dispel concerns about the ethicality
of the slaughter of whales, who are killed for strictly commercial
purposes, the whaling industry has waged a systematic misinformation
campaign. By deliberately controlling what information about this
hunt is released to the public, the pro-whaling lobby has so far managed
to quell an honest and critical debate about the defensibility
of whaling in Iceland. 


Due to the
absence of a strong voice that counters the “humane whaling" narrative, the
Icelandic pro-whaling lobby has so far been quite successful at getting its
desired message across. This was, for instance, attested by a 2013 poll
according to which almost 60 percent of Icelanders believe that the whale hunt
is carried out in a humane manner.
 Although
most Icelanders know that whales are still being hunted in Iceland, the
brutal practice of killing a whale itself remains a big mystery -
and without a doubt, the whaling industry wants to keep it that way. We
believe that the whaling industry’s deliberate misinformation
policy is directly responsible for the ongoing quiet acquiescence of the whale hunt in Iceland. To change this, in 2014 we threw down the gauntlet and began to directly
challenge the Icelandic whaling industry’s information monopoly.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------   The Campaign - The Whaler Watching Approach



Exposure & Attention - Effective tools against commercial whaling

Hard To Port’s Whaler Watching campaign uses a new approach
 in order to draw attention to the annual carnage of Icelandic wildlife.
 We believe that legally-obtained, detailed documentation and media 
coverage has the potential to kick-start a much-needed public debate on 
the defensibility of commercial whaling in Iceland. Our initiative focuses on the gathering and distribution of comprehensive data on the 
whaling operations. We believe that the Icelandic public and the rest of the international 
community have a right to receive unrestricted 
information about this controversial industry and about the sad and 
disturbing fate of these iconic animals. We are confident that as we 
make our uncensored information more widely available, more people will 
join the call to end whaling in Iceland.

Education Is The Key To Change
During the first phase of our Whaler Watching Campaign our team had the 
opportunity to talk to many Icelanders. We greatly appreciate the 
constructive exchange of opinions and information. As much as we are 
opposed to the cruel killing of these fascinating animals, we try to 
approach everyone with the same amount of respect, regardless of his or 
her opinion on whaling. We understand that to some Icelanders the issue 
of commercial whaling is a very sensitive topic. In addition to our planned sea-based documentation work Hard To Port will set up a mobile contact point where people can argue and debate their views with us. We will make sure that everyone, regardless of their views on whaling, 
is allowed to express their opinion, provided that all available 
information, evidence and footage is on the table.

Working With Local Communities & Businesses 

Collaboration and cooperation play a central role in our efforts to 
protect the whales in Iceland. Although the Icelandic government likes 
to portray the whaling industry as a national industry, many Icelanders 
are in fact highly critical if not outright opposed to commercial 
whaling. By working with local businesses and individuals who share our 
concern for the well-being of these fascinating animals, Hard To Port is
 building a strong and diverse coalition of voices who collectively 
speak out against whaling.

Media coverage of our Whaler Watching Campaign 2015
The news coverage of the first part of our Whaler Watching Campaign has been amazing. Our work and documentation footage has been mentioned, among others, on the websites of the following newspapers and magazines: 









Watch our documentary trailer 

The first phase of our 'Whaler Watching' campaign has been accompanied by a film team of Blackrabbit Images. Please watch this powerful trailer from the upcoming documentary about our work in Iceland this past sumer.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------The Outcome - Our expectations and hopes






We believe that the second phase of our Whaler Watching campaign can become a real game changer in the effort to put an end to 
commercial whaling in Iceland once and for all.A recent poll shows that local support for whaling in Iceland is decreasing. Although this is a positive and promising development, more than 30 % of Icelanders remain undecided in their opinion about the slaughter of whales in their country.
We firmly believe that by making the brutal killing of these majestic animals visible to the Icelandic public, we will convince more people to join the call for the abolition of the horrific annual slaughter.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    Your Support - What we do with your contribution
Our goal for this crowdfunding campaign is to cover the basic costs of the 2016 Whaler Watching Campaign in Iceland. 20 % of our financial target of 50.000 € will allow us to pay for accommodation, logistics, campaign provisions and transportation on the ground in Iceland. 
Exceeding our crowdfunding goal
Any additional financial help beyond our 10.000 Euro target would allow us to get sooner into campaign mode and spend more time on the preparation of this challenging campaign. 




Sea Documentation

research boat

fuel
insurance
sea worthy clothing 

safety equipment
emergency fund (repairs, etc.)


Outreach & Education

information stall
printed outreach material (recycled paper)
additional presentation tools
giveaways (fairtrade/recyclable)


Equipment 


additional camera equipment 

equipment protection (splash guard, etc.)
improved & suitable UAV


Basic Costs 


accommodation
logistics (ferry costs, etc.)
campaign provisions (strictly vegan)
land transportation (vehicle, insurance, fuel)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
What's in it for you? 

The success of our work in Iceland depends heavily on the generosity of people like you. As a
token of our gratitude for the immense trust that you place in us by 
donating to our campaign, our Hard To Port volunteers have come up with some great campaign-related perks through which we would like to
express our great appreciation for your support.



(All perks can be viewed individually in the image gallery.)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Sharing is Caring - Tell your friends about us
Social media is a great tool to spread the word about our young 
organization and our efforts to protect the whales in Iceland. Connect 
with us to keep in touch and stay informed about our ongoing work and the progress of our campaigns. We invite you to follow us on Facebook and Twitter and to share and/or re-tweet our posts and this crowdfunding campaign. Check us out on Vimeo, Instagram and Flickr for photos and videos from our 2015 campaign. We look forward to connecting with you!

story:
South Carolina's first sharing library

A library of things is a community sharing space filled with commonly needed, but not often used items such as home improvement and gardening tools, kitchen countertop appliances,  sewing machines and camping gear. Instead of buying and storing these things, you borrow them like a library book. (For visual examples from around the world keep scrolling.) 

There are other sharing libraries around the world and a few exist in the southeast, but none yet exist in South Carolina. Charleston Library of Things is so excited to be the first, but we can't do it without your help! 

Our membership model benefits YOU:

Tool libraries and sharing libraries around the world have different fee structure models depending on what works best for them and for their community. Charleston Library of Things has chosen to have a sliding scale fee structure based on income.

For a low annual fee you can check out as much stuff as you want all year long. What that means is that you pay $1 for every thousand dollars you make annually and that’s your annual fee. So if your annual salary is $150,000 your annual fee is $150. If it’s $40,000 then your annual fee is $40. This makes the library accessible to the entire community at any income level. To put it in perspective, an annual fee of $150 is equivalent to the purchase of just one $3 coffee at your local cafe per week. (Simple math: 52 weeks in a year. 52 x $3 = $156)

You'll never have to prove your income. It's honor system and we trust everyone to behave responsibly. Other communities have implemented this sliding scale fee to their sharing libraries and it works! The collective range of contributions averages out and many people tend to give MORE than they need to once they see the value that the library brings to the community. 

Once you’re signed up as a member, it works just like a book library. You check out an item for a set amount of time and bring it back before its due date so the next borrower can use it. It’s that simple.

Beyond the library, here's how we're building COMMUNITY:

This is the REALLY exciting part! In addition to having the library available to the community, our goal is to build community.

  • Repair cafes: We will be offering repair cafes so you can extend the life of the things you already own. We'll let you know ahead of each event what our team of experts can help fix for you. You bring the thing and sip some coffee while we repair.
  • Community classes: We plan to offer new skills for using those items you’re borrowing. These classes will be community driven. You tell us what you want to learn the most and we'll curate a class offering to fit the biggest need.
  • Sharing blog: We’ll have a blog on our website where you can brag about what you made or did with the items you borrowed! Did you go on a fun camping trip with your family? Maybe you discovered a talent you have that lends itself to you starting your own home grown business. Whatever you do. We want you to share it with us. Lifting up our community is what we're all about.

Why do we need a sharing library?

1. We want to add value to your life by freeing you of the financial and spacial burden of ownership. The less "stuff" you own, the happier and more free you are as an individual. 

2. We believe in the circular economy. "A circular economy is an alternative to a traditional linear economy (make, use, dispose) in which we keep resources in use for as long as possible, extract the maximum value from them whilst in use, then recover and regenerate products and materials at the end of each service life." (source: wrap.org.uk) 

If we want to preserve the earth for generations to come, the time is now to take action. Sharing libraries are a FUN way to participate in doing our part as responsible citizens!

(image source: wrap.org.uk)​

Proof of concept around the world:

If you skipped the video above, here are just a few of the spaces shown worldwide:

Library of Things, London:

Station North, Baltimore:

Sharing Depot, Makerspace + tool library, Toronto:

Reykjavík Tool Library, Iceland:

What happens with your contribution:

The graph above shows initial first year start up and operating expenses. The bulk of the funding from this campaign will be used to purchase a bus so we can begin serving you as a mobile library. Though the goal is to eventually have at least one brick and mortar location, by starting mobile we can visit neighborhoods, farmer’s markets, and other community spaces in order to broaden our reach. The remainder of the finds will be used to pay for other operating expenses in order to get started such as insurance, gas, office supplies, and maintenance/large equipment purchases. 

This is what we had in mind for our mobile unit:


 

When we’re ready to stock it with tools, we will have a community tool drive to stock the bus! After we get our feet wet with tool lending (home improvement, garden, kitchen, and craft) we will explore adding other categories (such as camping equipment) based on community demand. After all, we're here for our local community and want to do our best to serve your specific needs. YOU get to decide how we grow!

FOR SPONSORS: See our Sponsor Level perks to creatively advertise your business on our bus, on our website, in our marketing materials, and at special eevtns. 

    Risks & Challenges

    Contributions are critical to our success!  If our campaign does not meet its goal by deadline, we may have a difficult time securing enough additional funding to open.

    If worst case scenario happens and we are unable to proceed, then we will refund our backers and perks will not be fulfilled. 

    Time contributions count too!

    Want to give or help in some way, but out of cash? That's OK!

    Help us reach our goal by being our street team! Share online and off with your friends, family, and micro-communities. Make sure to use the Indiegogo sharing tools!

    Want to help beyond digital and word of mouth? Get in touch and we'll send you resources for boots on the ground campaigning!

story:
Who We Are

Mission: OffBeet Compost diverts household, restaurant and commercial food scraps from going to traditional waste facilities (landfills & incinerators) in the Greater Lowell Region.  We collect food scraps and bring them to our local composting site where food scraps are broken down into nutrient rich compost. Compost is then redistributed to participants and also sold to local farmers, gardeners and landscapers.

 

Vision: We are committed to creating a resilient green economy in Greater Lowell that generates local green jobs, empowers community members to be land stewards and contributes to an environmentally sustainable landscape.

What We Need 

OffBeet Compost was originally born as a 3 month pilot that turned into a full blown company on April 20th.  We are proud of what we have accomplished in Greater Lowell in just a short time and are ready to take our next steps!

Needless to say, 40+ tons of food waste is a lot to compost with just a few pitchforks and shovels and now we need your help to raise money four our very own tractor!

  • We plan to purchase a used skid steer bucket loader
  • This will help us turn our piles of food scraps into compost much more quickly and effectively
  • Used skid steers in good condition typically cost around $20,000 and so far we have reached half of the funds needed to reach our goal!

The Impact

By supporting OffBeet Compost, you will be supporting a movement towards a more sustainable future.  By sustainable, we don't just mean a future in which we are no longer combatting climate change, but also a  future where all people have access to fresh, affordable, culturally appropriate food and can dispose of it locally for the added benefit of replenishing our soils.  

We also mean a future where by supporting your local composter, you are investing in the regeneration of our soils, the enrichment of the food we eat and the strengthening of our economy by keeping the dollar longer in the community. We hope that OffBeet Compost helps foster the feeling that community isn't just a place where we live, but a place where we are all connected!

Other Ways You Can Help

Because we are an enterprise that strives to have a positive social and environmental impact, we encourage you to help us in more ways than one.  Hear are just a few additional options:

  • Help us spread the word! Please share our campaign, website, & social media with your friends & family!
  • Do you live in the Greater Lowell region? Sign up for our program: www.offbeetcompost.com
  • Do you live in another state? Find your own local composter and sign up for their services and/or start your own program! Feel free to contact us if you have any questions or need recommendations: kesiah@offbeetcompost.com

story:
Every summer, wildfires destroy thousands of square kilometers of green forests, turning them into black, burned areas.

Without our help, these areas would be left black and burned forever.

Paint it Back (Boranka) is one of the largest volunteer projects with an aim to ‘paint’ those black, burned areas into new green forests. We, the Croatian Scouts, with the help of thousands of other volunteers, have already planted tens of thousands of new trees, but there is so much more to do. 

We produced unique crayons made of the black ash from trees destroyed by wildfires.

By helping our reforestation project you can receive this special crayon to your address. Then you can use it to draw your own tree and upload it on our web page www.boranka.hr.

For every uploaded tree, Scouts and other volunteers will plant a real one in the burned areas. You can also have your personal tree planted or even a whole forest, by  visiting this link you can also donate via your online banking.

By doing that we can create new life from the ashes and create a better and greener world together.

With your help we can make even a bigger change, enroll thousands of new volunteers and plant many more thousands of trees.

All the money will be used to plant trees in burned areas in Croatia, with the help of Croatian Scouts and thousands of other volunteers.

  • 52,000 Euros will enable 2,500 volunteers to plant 25,000 new trees.  
  • Tree seedlings, planting material  and other organizational equipment = 18,500 EUR
  • Transport our volunteers to planting sites = 21,000 EUR
  • Refreshments for volunteers (food, water) = 12,500 EUR

The more funding we collect, more volunteers will be able to participate and more trees will be planted.

This campaign is run by the Scout and Guide Association of Croatia with the support of the European Scout Foundation (ESF).

The Scout and Guide Association of Croatia (Scouts Croatia) is the largest youth organization in Croatia and a proud member of the World Organization of the Scout Movement (WOSM), which has more than 50 million active members worldwide.

The European Scout Foundation (ESF) is a European based organization which raises funds to support Scout projects and the growth of Scouting in Europe. Donors are known as "Friends of Scouting in Europe" (FOSE).

Paint it Back (Cro. Boranka) campaign, since it started in 2018., has gathered more than 5,000 volunteers resulting in more than 50,000 new trees being planted in areas destroyed by wildfires: https://www.croatiaweek.com/photos-1000-volunteers-plant-10000-trees-to-reforest-fire-damaged-kucine/

The campaign is continuing and the number of volunteers interested in planting trees in burned areas is growing every day: https://worldscoutfoundation.org/news/scouts-lead-campaign-plant-12000-trees-split

For its efforts and results, the campaign, designed by the creative agency Imago Ogilvy, which helped with the creative part of the campaign completely free of charge, has already received numerous awards in Croatia and abroad. The most significant recognition for the campaign was received this October in Brussels where the campaign received the Golden Euro Effie award - the most prestigious European award for marketing efficiency - https://www.total-croatia-news.com/lifestyle/39055-boranka

In less than a year, the Paint it Back campaign has become the most awarded non-profit campaign in Croatian history and the largest European volunteer project to re-plant trees destroyed by wildfires.

The campaign is a "Messengers of Peace" supported project and is also supported by many Croatian and international institutions and organizations.

*** For every uploaded tree, Scouts and other volunteers will plant a real one in the burned areas. You can also have your personal tree planted or even a whole forest, by visiting this link you can also donate via your online banking.**

story:
NOTE: Select "contribution" to make a single donation, or select one of our special "perks" to make a commitment to sustaining monthly donations at the level indicated. This year we're making a special appeal for sustaining donors. Our monthly supporters are the lifeblood of our organization, making our actions and organizing possible.

We need direct action now more than ever, and the stakes have never been higher.

If recent events have taught us anything, it’s that the world is in crisis, and rebellion is our only hope. As people everywhere rise up against racist police violence, it’s become abundantly clear that racism and the climate crisis are inextricably linked. Now is the time to face these crises head on, building a massive resistance movement with the power to directly confront the fossil fuel industry and secure a healthy future for frontline communities.

Trans Mountain = Environmental Racism 

In the Salish Sea, there’s no greater example of the intersection between racism and the climate crisis than the Trans Mountain Pipeline Expansion, which is currently under construction without the consent of indigenous communities directly affected. This project, which would be the world's biggest tar sands pipeline, is a blatant violation of indigenous sovereignty, threatening coastal communities and the stability of our global climate. If completed, it would move an additional 590,000 barrels of dirty tar sands crude every day, increasing oil tanker traffic in the Salish Sea by 700% and emitting 15 billion metric tons of climate pollution every year. Tar sands oil sinks, making it impossible to clean up. A single spill would endanger our coastal salmon and spell extinction for southern resident Orcas. Put simply: TMX must be stopped. 

We’ve been battling this pipeline for 4 years. Through direct action and grassroots organizing, we’ve stopped trains, barges and ships in their tracks, trained countless activists, and helped build regional coalitions with indigenous communities. We’ve seen both victories and defeats, but we refuse to stop until TMX is defeated for good. 

This fight is far from over. After the Canadian courts recently refused to even hear the concerns of First Nations, it’s clear to us that the fate of this region will be determined by the power of our movement’s resistance. That’s why we need your support so we can answer the call from our allies to take action. Help us reach and exceed our goal of $10,000 so we can keep escalating the fight against Trans Mountain, and continue working to build a powerful grassroots movement for climate justice. 

Who we are:

The Mosquito Fleet is a regional network of activists fighting for climate justice and a fossil-free Salish Sea through creative on-water direct action and grassroots movement building. We're working to build a broad-based international resistance movement by directly confronting business as usual and supporting frontline communities with the tools to take action.

What we’ve been up to lately:

  • Planning a wave of future actions with frontline community leaders
  • Pressuring the insurance industry to drop coverage of TMX
  • Campaigning to close pipeline construction camps during the COVID-19 pandemic 
  • Developing socially-distant direct action tactics and new training resources
  • Supporting the #BlackLivesMatter uprising

What we need:

As a grassroots volunteer network, we do what we can with very limited resources, all of which go directly into our work. We know how to make a little go a long way, but we're currently stretched too thin to do all we're determined to accomplish in the coming months. We need to acquire crucial safety gear and PPE for socially-distant direct actions, repair and replace old equipment, prepare legal support, publish training resources, boost our on-the-ground organizing capacity… and so much more. 

Like many grassroots orgs, we too have been hit especially hard by recent events, and that’s why we need your help more than ever to keep fighting at this crucial moment. 

Thank you gifts for sustaining donors:

Join the swarm! Our sustaining donors make it possible for us to maintain ourselves as an independent grassroots organization. Sign up today as a sustaining monthly donor, and we’ll send you a Mosquito Fleet sticker pack, t-shirt or hoodie! Simply claim one of the perks above and we'll follow up with you personally.
