story:
Short Summary

We are William, Mary, our 4 year old daughter Maia, our 4 lovely dogs and 2 cats, we are a Venezuelan family that for many years we find ourselves in the search for a more sustainable life, since the year 2010 we live in a beautiful mountain in the Venezuelan Andes where we recover and rehabilitate a natural area that was being used like garbage dump. Today we have our house which we build ourselves using the resources we find around, much recycling and permaculture techniques. We have also developed a family garden and edible forest that have helped us to be more independent and autonomous in our food, especially because of the situation that is happening Venezuela.

 Today we are dedicated to teaching and promoting different ancestral, techniques of sustainability and permaculture in our community, through workshops, courses and guided tours to our home where we have founded the “Demonstrative Center for Sustainable Life”.

 

What We Need  & What You Get

 

Use of Funding

 

The funds will be used to grow our project, the further we can get more people we can help. The amount we need is for:

- For repairs and conditioning of the Sustainable Life Demonstration Centre

- A small second hand vehicle for transportation. This will help us reach more communities in the surroundings

- A camera with which to make video tutorials for social networks and live conferencing.

-Solar energy kit.

The Impact

These are some of the activities that we will deploy in the communities with your support

RECYCLING:

- Artisanal recycling workshop.
- Eco brick workshop.
- Bottle building workshop.
- Programmed obsolescence and how to overcome it class.

ANIMALISM
- Dog food making process.
- Pet first aid.
- Sensitivity towards the animals talk.
- Screening of "Earthlings" documentary.

NUTRITION
- Healthy food and natural eating workshop.
- Vegetarian food workshop.
- Vegan desert workshop.

ALTERNATIVE MEDICINE
- Natural gynecology.
- Medicinal plants workshop.
- Natural health.

AGROECOLOGY
- Urban agriculture.
- Seed production.
- Medicinal plant production and processing (ethnobotany).

PEDAGOGY
- Introduction to alternative pedagogy talk.
- Attachment parenting
- Child yoga class.

RENEWABLE ENERGY
- Intro to Permaculture workshop.
- Oven making and solar cooking workshop.

TECHNOLOGY
- Knowledge exchange and open source software.
- How to create and run a crowdfunding campaign.

SOLIDARY ECONOMY
- Barter market organization.

Risks & Challenges

Day by day the crisis in Venezuela is heightened and with it the difficulties to achieve our goals are greater, small things like transporting the material and the workshopers to the communities is uphill, but we understand the crisis as opportunity to somehow disassemble the ingrained life concepts such as consumerism, pollution and transform them into positive tools such as “do it yourself” and “recycling”.

Other Ways You Can Help

-Donating any amount no matter how minimal it is to us it will be very helpful. 
-Follow us in our social media and feel free to comment and share with us anything you want to know!

Facebook Escuela Nómada Sostenible https://www.facebook.com/Escuela-Nomada-Sosteni...

Instagram @escuelanomadasostenible https://www.instagram.com/escuelanomadasostenible/

Please! Share and disemínate our campaign with others  

And if you are nearby you can be a volunteer and help us  in any area you are able to by contact us in workaway    

https://www.workaway.info/744346629311-en.html

Thank you so much for reading!

 

*Special thanks to our team for always helping

Maga y Santi

 Armando Gomez

Karima

Omar Said

 

AYÚDANOS A ENSEÑAR SUSTENTABILIDAD EN VENEZUELA

 Recaudando fondos para promover y compartir conocimientos de sustentabilidad con las comunidades en Venezuela.

Creemos que el conocimiento de  técnicas sostenibles es la mejor manera de ser verdaderamente libres, esas técnicas ancestrales que nos permiten ser autosuficientes y enfrentar problemas muy sencillos  de resolver a pequeña y gran escala como el hambre, la vivienda y la energía, si somos  capaces de satisfacer nuestras necesidades primarias basando en la sostenibilidad.. Si estamos preparados para llevar una vida más consciente del medio ambiente, contribuimos a mejorar la calidad de vida en Venezuela y en el planeta.

Somos William, Mary, nuestra hija de 4 años Maia, nuestros 4 perros y 2 gatos encantadores , somos una familia venezolana que durante muchos años hemos estado en la búsqueda de una vida más sostenible, desde el año 2010 vivimos en una hermosa montaña en los Andes Venezolanos donde recuperamos y rehabilitamos un área natural que se utilizaba como basurero. Hoy contamos con una vivienda la cual construimos nosotros mismos utilizando los recursos que encontramos alrededor, mucho reciclaje y técnicas de Permacultura. También hemos desarrollado un huerto familiar y un bosque comestible que nos han ayudado a ser más independientes y autónomos en nuestros alimentos, sobre todo por la situación que está sucediendo en Venezuela.

Hoy nos dedicamos a la enseñanza y promoción de diferentes técnicas de sostenibilidad y Permacultura en nuestra comunidad, a través de talleres, cursos y visitas guiadas a nuestra casa donde hemos fundado el "Centro Demostrativo de Vida Sostenible".

LO QUE NECESITAMOS Y LO QUE OBTIENES 

 La cantidad que necesitamos es para:

 -Un pequeño vehículo de segunda mano para el transporte.

 -Una cámara con la que hacer tutoriales en vídeo, para las redes sociales y conferencias en vivo. 

-Para reparaciones y acondicionamiento del centro de demostrativo de vida sostenible.

-Kit de energia solar.

EL IMPACTO 

Estas son algunas de las actividades que implementaremos en las comunidades.

Reciclaje: 

-  Taller de reciclaje artesanal
-  Taller de eco ladrillos. 
-  Taller de construcción con botellas.

Alimentación:

-Taller de alimentación consciente.
-Taller de comida vegetariana. 
-Taller de postres veganos.

Animalismo:

-Taller de elaboración de alimento para perros. 
-Primeros auxilios para mascotas. 
-Charla sobre  maltrato de animal.

Medicina alternativa: 

-Ginecología natural. 
-plantas medicinales disponibles para todos. 
-salud natural. 

Agroecología:

 -agricultura urbana. 
-producción de semilla. 
-producción y procesamiento de plantas medicinales. Etnobotánica.

Pedagogía :

-Conversatorio: Introducción a las pedagogías alternativas. 
-Conversatorio sobre  crianza con apego. 
-Clase introductoria de yoga para niños.

 Energías renovables 

-taller de introducción a la permacultura. 
-taller de elaboración de horno y cocina solar. 
-transición y usos de energías renovables

RIESGOS Y DESAFÍOS

 Día a día la crisis en Venezuela se intensifica y con ella las dificultades para lograr nuestros objetivos son mayores, pequeñas cosas como transportar el material y los facilitadores de talleres a las comunidades es cuesta arriba, pero entendemos la crisis como una oportunidad para de  alguna manera desmontar malos conceptos de vida como el consumismo y la contaminación, y así transformarlos en herramientas positivas como "hágalo usted mismo" y "reciclaje".

OTRAS MANERAS DE COLABORAR 

-Donar cualquier cantidad no importa cuán mínimo para nosotros será muy útil. 
-Comparte y propaga nuestra campaña en las redes sociales.

Facebook Escuela Nómada Sostenible 

https://www.facebook.com/Escuela-Nomada-Sosteni...

Instagram @escuelanomadasostenible https://www.instagram.com/escuelanomadasostenible/

-Si estás  cerca puedes ser voluntario y ayudarnos en cualquier área.

Contáctanos en workaway https://www.workaway.info/Account-en.html

 

Especial agradecimiento a nuestro equipo por su colaboración y apoyo siempre.

Maga y Santi

 Armando Gomez

Karima

Omar Said

story:
Hello, we are a group of seven students at the Girls Athletic Leadership School going on a trip this fall to New York City. We will be partaking in an International Youth Earth Summit. This year is the first year for this summit and it has grown from the Montessori Model United Nations conference for middle and elementary aged kids. People from all over the world will attend this conference. At this summit, we will learn the tools to implement an action plan related to the environment. At this conference we will become social and environmental entrepreneurs, mentored by UN and NGO experts to create a project that will impact our own community.  We are very excited to gain more of the tools that can help us improve the environment and change the world.

If you are able to donate to our fundraiser, please visit our indiegogo account:  Any donation will be greatly appreciated. Also, if you would like to learn more about the International Youth Earth Summit, please visit https://montessori-mun.org/conference/internati... 

What We Need 

We are asking for $8000. This money will be used to help us with flying, lodging and food. 

New York City is a city full of expenses, and it will cost a lot of money to get there, stay there, and eat there. Please help us get to NYC to attend the International Youth Earth Summit. 

The Impact

This conference will allow us to develop ideas and then execute our projects to help us improve the environment in our world.  

Other Ways You Can Help

To find other ways to help our cause you can contact us at

galsiyes@gmail.com

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

About us: 

Help us to learn to swim! We need a swim and dive school, so we can protect the future of our coral reef.

Shoals Rodrigues is a marine conservation charity, which teaches local children and communities about marine wildlife. Rodrigues is isolated around 3,000 km from the nearest continent, surrounded by one of the most ecologically important marine zones in the world. However, most people feel disconnected from the ocean except as a source of food and only 30-40% of the population can swim.

We offer the only opportunity on Rodrigues for children who come from fishing communities to study marine wildlife and learn to swim. Our facilities are out of date and we desperately need new equipment to launch Rodriguan Reef Rescuers – a marine learning base, swim and dive school. 

 The Rodriguean Reef Rescuers 

Rodrigues Reef Rescuers will build on the foundations of our hugely successful “Club Mer” programme, which we launched in 2001 attracting over 3,500 members since it began. We now need a complete overhaul of our dated facilities to enable us to teach a new generation about the lagoon and reefs which encircle Rodrigues.

Children will gain a greater appreciation of the delicate balance of ecology and the importance of the conservation and sustainable use of the seas surrounding this remote island.

Learning to swim, snorkel and dive is an integral part of the learning process. Including swimming activities enhances knowledge retention and encourages participation and engagement in classroom learning. The children taking part will come from fishing families and communities. Children bring home their enthusiasm and share their new knowledge with their families, which has a positive influence on the sustainable stewardship of marine resources in the long term.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Please help us to reach our target of $20,000 so we can launch Rodriguan Reef Rescuers and teach a new generation how to protect their stunning marine environment:

    Your support will help us to pay for:

    ·  Classroom tables and chair

    ·  Biological microscopes

    ·  Transport to classroom and swimming/dive sites

    ·  Swimming and diving equipment such as buoys, armbands, swimming caps, snorkelling equipment and first aid equipment

    ·  Classroom materials and handouts

    ·  Toilets at classroom site

    ·  Safety fence around classroom site

    In return for your support we will offer:

    ·  In return for a donation of $25 we offer a special e-card from the Rodrigues Reef Rescuers team

    ·  In return for a donation of $100 we would love to include your name in the learning area. Your name will be hand-written as a thank you for your support. We will also send a special e-card and a photo showing your name in situ.

    ·  In return for a contribution of over $500, we will name a dive-site after you! We will also send a special e-card thank you and a map showing the location of the dive site.


The Impact

  Improved facilities will enable us to reach more children than ever with the Launch of Rodrigues Reef Rescuers. We have a target of 600 children and young adults in 2016 alone.

 Children will be inspired to share their learning with their families and local communities, spreading the impact of this project through communities across Rodrigues.

  Coral reefs not only provide a source of food, they also provide physical protection from extreme weather events. Therefore by encouraging sustainable fishing and marine protection, this project will protect the future livelihoods of Rodriguan communities.


  • Other Ways You Can Help


  • Please make some noise about our campaign if you can share this page through Facebook , social media and indigogo  share tools . 
  • Please help us to aid  young people to  protect the corals of Rodrigues. 
  • Thankyou

teach a new generation about the lagoon and reefs which encircle Rodrigues.
Children
will gain a greater appreciation of the delicate balance of ecology and the
importance of the conservation and sustainable use of the seas surrounding this
remote island.
Learning to
swim, snorkel and dive is an integral part of the learning process. Including
swimming activities enhances knowledge retention and encourages participation
and engagement in classroom learning. The children taking part will come from
fishing families and communities. Children bring home their enthusiasm and
share their new knowledge with their families, which has a positive influence
on the sustainable stewardship of marine resources in the long term.
What We Need & What You Get
  
Please help us to reach our target of
$20,000 so we can launch Rodriguan Reef Rescuers and teach a new generation how
to protect their stunning marine environment:
Your support
will help us to pay for:
· 
Classroom tables and chair
· 
Biological microscopes
· 
Transport to classroom and
swimming/dive sites
· 
Swimming and diving equipment
such as buoys, armbands, swimming caps, snorkelling equipment and first aid
equipment
· 
Classroom materials and
handouts
· 
Toilets at classroom site
· 
Safety fence around classroom
site


In return
for your support we will offer:
· 
In return for a donation of $25
we offer a special e-card from the Rodrigues Reef Rescuers team
· 
In return for a donation of $100 we would love to include your name in the learning area. Your name will be
hand-written as a thank you for your support. We will also send a special
e-card and a photo showing your name in situ.
· 
In return for a contribution of
over $500, we will name a dive-site after you! We will also send a special
e-card thank you and a map showing the location of the dive site.

    The Impact

  Improved facilities will enable
us to reach more children than ever with the Launch of Rodrigues Reef Rescuers.
We have a target of 600 children and young adults in 2016 alone.


 Children will be inspired to
share their learning with their families and local communities, spreading the
impact of this project through communities across Rodrigues.


  Coral reefs not only provide a
source of food, they also provide physical protection from extreme weather
events. Therefore by encouraging sustainable fishing and marine protection,
this project will protect the future livelihoods of Rodriguan communities.


Other Ways You Can Help

   Please make some noise about our campaign if you can share this page through Facebook , social media and indigogo  share tools . 
Please help us to aid  young people to  protect the corals of Rodrigues. 
Thankyou

story:
Short Summary

Hi, My Name is Jamal. I am a certified electrician and solar energy technician. I am passionate about creating renewable clean energy solutions that reduce pollution and dependence on fossil energy. My invention won a gold medal at INPEX, the largest invention show in the US and is patented by USPTO. All documentation is available upon request. My invention is a perpetual (Really, non-stop) power generator that can produce up to 20 KW with zero fuel and zero waste. It can be scaled into a 1 Megawatt power plant. This is not just a matter of capturing solar energy and saving it to a battery. It uses solar energy to start an actual generator that continues to produce clean energy for ever. An invention like this could end the dependency on foreign oil and provide energy for many deprived areas around the world in Africa, Asia, and South America.t can make the difference between a child getting an education or spending the rest of their lives in ignorance and poverty. It can help when natural disasters hit like in the case of hurricane Katrina or hurricane Sandy. It can save lives! My first goal however is to donate the first 100 to refugee camps and victims of natural disasters especially those impacted by the earthquake in Ecuador.

Why are we crowdfunding?

I was already approached by a number of large national as well as international companies to purchase this invention except that they all want to see the actual product (not the prototype) in action and have it run nonstop for at least a week. That is possible since I've already had the prototype run longer than that in the past. The problem is that I'm lacking the funding to build the actual generator.

Your contributions will help me turn my winning prototype into an actual product. It will pay for parts, custom molds and custom built components. It will also help me take time off from my hourly job and dedicate the time necessary to finish the generator.

How this is going to change the world!

One major advantage of the Jelma mini power plant over classic solar systems that simply capture the solar energy and save it to a battery is in the amount energy produced by each system. Jelma mini power plant produces 10X the amount of energy produced by a classic system by using some of the energy captured from the sun to power a perpetual generator that generates a lot more energy than what you'd capture from the sun into a battery. Technically the smallest version of the generator can produce up to 5KW on it's own perpetually without the solar panels. The panels are used with a larger generator to increase the amount of energy produced.

This mini power plant is ideal for folks seeking energy independence and those who live in remote areas where power is not available or not reliable. It can also provide electricity for over a billion people around the world that do not have access to electricity in places like India, Africa, and South America. It can even be used by our military, police, or even FEMA as a mobile source of power. The applications are endless and the beautiful thing about it is that it runs on literally zero fuel and produces zero waste. 

What are the Challenges?

Of course there are challenges. The main challenge is to convince investors and that is why I need to build the product and show them that it can run non stop for a significant period of time.

Please help us by spreading the word!

Please use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about this cause! 

Thank you all for your generosity and for your efforts to provide a cleaner future for our children.

story:
How We Can Make a Change for the Better & Define a New Kind of BAAH'D

I noticed a demand for Organic Weed Management when I started working in the Environmental Industry nearly a decade ago. I had a first hand look at what we were being exposed to and the impact it was having on us and our planet.

We are providing a solution. A real, eco-friendly, cost effective solution that really works, actually it works better. 95% reduction of Weeds. We are taking toxic, ineffective chemicals out of the equation and protecting our water, soil and bodies. Lets save our land, save money and lower healthcare costs. Check out several other Advantages on our Website or here in Our Brochure.

We use goats to target browse weeds. We live on-site with them in a eco-friendly 128 sqft tiny house. Our house is made of all up-cycled material and anything new we had made locally in Alberta. We recently took on a contract with the City of Calgary. The story broke and in moments went viral. By days end I was featured in 2 National Papers and T.V. Broadcasts. CBC radio, and 10 Alberta media outlets including CTV and Globals nightly news. I was interviewed again by another 3 reports yesterday and today. For Earth day I was featured on CBC Calgary Shaw Cable. My Baah'd Plant Management & Reclamation Facebook hits went from 68 to over 2000 in less than 24 hours, twitter erupted. I am a leader in Alberta for bringing non-toxic weed management to commercial, rural and urban landscapes. There is some great momentum we can do this and you can be a HUGE part of it!

What We Need & What You Get

Here it is in more detail:

  • Our bank and other potential investors are so excited about our business plan. It makes so much sense. So why do we need a crowd funding site? Well, because this business plan is so different, it doesn't fit into their normal boxes. We cant include the goats in with the loan. The bank wants the goats labeled as agriculture. We need to raise separate money to cover those costs.
  • We liquidated almost everything we own in a massive estate sale. We have raised half of the start-up costs and have purchased many of the assets we will need already. Consider nearly half of the project already funded by us. We just need help bringing the last bit home.
  • Help us make this a reality and give this to western Canada.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

    • In 2001, nearly 5 billion pounds of chemicals were used worldwide to kill weeds and insects; only 5% reached its destination.  Today studies show that glyphosate, the chief ingredient in Roundup, has been shown to cause Infertility, Birth Defects, Cancers, Parkinson’s, Autism, Alzheimer’s, Diabetes, overall negative impacts on bodily function and resistant bacteria and plants. The EPA reports in 2007, 185 million pounds of glyphosate was used by U.S. farmers. It is apparent that we are in crisis. The Canada Food Inspection Agency reported in 2002 that Leafy spurge alone reduced the value of land in Alberta and Saskatchewan by 30 million dollars. This is not including the 19 million dollars for lost yield, recreation and weed management. For the timber industry, even moderate infestations can reduce the growth of tree and shrub seedlings by 50-75% according to Alberta Agriculture and Forestry. The billions of dollars lost each year due to invasive weeds and the billions now spent on healthcare as a result of chemical exposure are evidence that we are fighting a losing battle. It’s time to change our strategy.
    • Target browsing is a form of organic weed management that can be a solution to all of these problems. There is a 95% reduction of weeds and it usually costs less. The best part, is there are no toxic chemicals! We can leave our environment clean and not have to worry about our children and pets playing in toxic parks or tracking toxic chemicals into our houses and cars. Advantages on the Radio of our program in Calgary.The liability is greatly reduced and it can be used in sensitive areas like waterbodies, hospitals and playgrounds. Goats can access steep hills mowers and spraying cant and they work in more types of weather than mowing or spraying. Unlike other weed control options, goats don't destroy the soil, they enhance it. Chemicals accummulate in the soil and change the pH, causing metals and nutrients to leach away. You don't have to worry about amending soil with fertilizer after, or fertilizers washing into our waterways.  Goats prefer weeds and enhance native forages for wildlife and grasses for other livestock. Goats can help with firesmart programs. Any way you cut it, goats are amazing gardeners.

    You can help us be a better type of Baah'd. You can help us take back our environment and help our economy.


Risks & Challenges

Our greatest challenge is the misconception about goats and educating clients. The concept may be hard to grasp for some folks, we have to work hard to ensure anyone interested in hiring us has all the information so they may present it to any clients or board of directors.

We have to stay one step ahead of any negative media coverage, one job gone wrong could have a detrimental effect on the whole industry. We want to work with any other goat owners who might be interested in starting up a weed management program. We are after all trying to bring positive change the world.

  • Our website is very informative and set up to facilitate sharing among co-workers and board members. I am always available to chat and give presentations. I have a strong network of other shepherds to help educate and be point of contacts.
  • We work to support other goat owners and streamline the weed management programs.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially you can contribute in lots of other ways, it will be appreciated and make a big difference:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Share on Facebook, twitter and with co-workers.
  • Ask your municipality, MLA and Environment Minister to explore goats as an alternative. Feel free to send them our Brouchure, you can print it from our website.
  • Talk to landowners and neighbors about goats for grazing.
  • Check out some of the News articles we made it in. There are many more on our website.
    • CBC Radio Home Stretch http://www.cbc.ca/player/play/2687236448/
    • The National Post http://news.nationalpost.com/news/canada/environmentally-friendly-and-sustainable-calgary-to-use-grazing-goats-to-control-weeds-in-two-city-parks
    • The Toronto Sun http://m.torontosun.com/2016/04/21/no-goats-no-glory-city-of-calgary-to-test-their-grazing-chops-in-weed-control-project
    • The Calgary Herald http://calgaryherald.com/news/local-news/citys-going-to-the-goats
    • CBC News http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/calgary/goats-weed-control-calgary-nose-hill-1.3546922
    • Global News http://globalnews.ca/news/2653555/goats-to-graze-at-calgary-parks-as-part-of-pilot-project/
    • CTV News http://calgary.ctvnews.ca/city-dispatches-goats-to-help-with-weed-control-1.2869246
    • The Calgary Sun http://www.calgarysun.com/2016/04/21/no-goats-no-glory-city-of-calgary-to-test-their-grazing-chops-in-weed-control-project
    • 660 News http://www.660news.com/2016/04/21/we-goat-this-city-explores-using-billy-and-friends-to-control-weeds/
    • Metro News http://www.metronews.ca/news/calgary/2016/04/21/calgary-goat-grazing-pilot-a-go.html

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

About two dozen people waited around a small roped off section of beach. Someone said, 'It is time.' As I navigated between the adults to get to a place where I could see, it seemed as if everyone was holding their breath. I dropped to my hands and knees and crawled across the cool sand. The crowd parted and I could see the slight depression. A collective 'ahh' sounded as a single Loggerhead sea turtle escaped its sandy nest. With that first escape, the unseen mob below must have felt inspired because within seconds, a volcanic explosion of baby sea turtles erupted...

Hello, my name is Alek and I'm 12 years old. I have been tasked with completing a year long research project for my 6th grade year. My inspiration came from the story above and seeing the described Loggerhead sea turtle nest hatch.

The volunteers that were on the beach that night, as well as many other nights, watching and waiting for numerous other nests to hatch were with the Navarre Beach Sea Turtle Conservation Center (NBSTCC). They are an incredible group of dedicated volunteers that work tirelessly to protect sea turtles and other marine life. Although I live near Boston, MA, I want to help.

I realized that although I am only 12, I can make a difference in the future of sea turtles, marine life and our beautiful planet. I am now asking for the world's help in my goal of financially helping the NBSTCC's mission. Show your support for my goal, contribute today and help save a sea turtle.


What We Need & What You Get

My goal is simple, expose the NBSTCC to a world-wide audience that may not otherwise get a chance to hear about this great organization.

100% of all funds raised will go directly to NBSTC.

 

The Impact

The mission of the NBSTCC is the conservation and protection of threatened and endangered sea turtles through community education pograms and partnered research.

Your contribution will go towards operating expenses, educational materials, merchandise for the Seamore Store, event expenses such as beach cleanups, summer camps and kids' activities. 


Risks & Challenges

 People are always being asked to contribute to causes. This is a grass roots effort by me, a 12 year old, who wants to make a positive impact on sea turtles and the world.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to contribute in other ways, make an effort to go to Navarre Beach, Florida, stop in the NBSTCC and ask how you can help. Please visit their website at www.navarrebeachseaturtles.org for more information on events.

story:
Local farmers Alex Weiser, Jon Hammond and Kimmie Durham have launched a Heritage Grain Revival in Southern California!  With your help, they will be building a local infrastructure to grow, harvest and promote Heritage Grains.  Their timing coincides with the keen public desire for drought tolerant, delicious GMO-Free grains and the aims of many California farmers to produce and supply these grains in a cost effective way.

California once led the nation in barley production and was second in wheat production, but in the early 20th century grain farming began to be replaced by higher value orchards, vineyards, and row crops.  However, grains(especially heirloom varieties) tend to have very low water requirements, and remain well-suited for California.  

As a matter of fact, our Mediterranean climate is ideal to the growing of annual grasses, commonly referred to as grains.  We are trying to bring back many unique types of heirloom grains, and we need your help to purchase the expensive equipment necessary for harvesting,cleaning and storing the ripened grain.

Be part of the movement to restore some of California's rich grain-growing heritage, and help us cultivate beautiful, healthy, non-GMO grains for home cooks, chefs, bakers and brewers.  We're bringing the Golden back to California!

story:
UPDATE:

Dear Friends,

My apologies, but this Indiegogo campaign  is now closed. While I get to keep what I managed to raise for the project, I haven't reached my fundraising goal. 

If, after reviewing the material below, you decide to support the Archipelago of Hope work, you can do so in a couple of ways:

1) Make an online contribution:

  • Go online http://landislife.org/donate/. 
  • Press Partner with Us and follow the instructions on the screen
  • When you get to MORE, enter "Archipelago of Hope project”. 
  • You will get a tax receipt for your contribution as well

2) If you prefer to write a check, you can mail a check to: 

Land is Life | 240 Kent Avenue | Brooklyn, NY | 11249, USA

Please make a note that it is for Archipelago of Hope. 

If you do decided to make a contribution, please let me know at this email address contact@gleb-raygorodetsky.com . You can also let me know which PERK you would like to receive. 

And now, please watch the video and read the material below to learn more about the Archipelago of Hope project.

In peace and respect,

Gleb

                                         _____________________



“We have the knowledge that can contribute to finding solutions to the crisis of climate change. But if you aren't prepared to listen, how can we communicate this to you?”  Marcos Terena, Xané leader, Brazil.

_____________________



FOLLOW ME ON A JOURNEY!

                     to the very EDGE of our changing PLANET 

                                       to learn about CLIMATE CHANGE 

                                                        from those who have known about it for decades 

                             THE WORLD'S INDIGENOUS PEOPLES!

I am a specialist in bio-cultural diversity conservation and an author. I have written about the relationship between people and their environment for Alternatives, Cultural Survival,  National Geographic, and other publications. I am a co-founder of Conversations with the Earth (CWE) - an indigenous-led multimedia initiative that amplifies indigenous voices in the global discourse on climate change. Over a million visitors saw CWE exhibits at National Museum of Denmark in Copenhagen, the Smithsonian’s National Museum of the American Indian in Washington DC, and United Nations Headquarters in New York. 

I now have a contract with Pegasus Books  to write ARCHIPELAGO OF HOPE - a book about climate change insights from the world's Indigenous peoples.

                                  _____________________

This book was waiting to be written and Gleb Raygorodetsky has the unique background and skills to tell these communities’ stories with clarity and insight. Dr. Donna Green – Climate Change Research Center, the University of New South Wales, Australia.                                             _____________________

I’ve spent the last two decades working with Indigenous peoples around the world, with the last two years devoted to doing research and collecting materials for the book. I've got half of the book written, but I need to dive deeper into some of the stories before I can deliver the finished draft to the publisher in early 2016.

 THIS IS WHERE YOU COME IN! I need your help to raise funds to enable me to go back to some of the Indigenous communities I write about in the book. I will conduct more interviews, update the stories, and spend time on the land with local people to better understand what it’s like to live at the edge of our changing planet. And I will SHARE WHAT I LEARN with the supporters like YOU, so that you become not only a BACKER (for which I would be eternally grateful!), but also an ACTIVE PARTICIPANT on this journey (which will make it all worthwhile!)

But first, let me tell you why this book is important.

                                _____________________

A restless and courageous chronicler of some of the world’s most endangered communities, Gleb Raygorodetsky is uniquely qualified to document not just the threat of climate change, but the remarkable leadership of Indigenous peoples who occupy the front lines of the most important battle of our time. Their resilience is a gift to us all, and Gleb’s work to document and share their knowledge will be a vital guide to help us save us from ourselves. Ian Gill  - Founding president of Ecotrust Canada, Author of All That We Say Is Ours.                                                                       _____________________

ABOUT THE ARCHIPELAGO OF HOPE

Less than two generations ago scientists were just beginning to consider the possibility of a world under a changing climate, yet, Indigenous peoples were already raising the alarm about climate change, because of the changes they were observing on their lands and seas.


Today, the rest of the world is slowly waking up to the reality of climate change, yet we remain largely ignorant of what it really means for us and our children's children.


To really understand the meaning of unfolding changes, we must pay closer attention to the experiences of those people for whom climate change has long been not just a political slogan, a model prediction, or a fundraising strategy, but a reality of their daily lives.  We must learn from Indigenous peoples.


A mere 4% of the world’s population, Indigenous peoples look after traditional territories that cover as much as 20% of the Earth’s surface, supporting over 3/4 of our planet’s remaining biodiversity.


Indigenous communities are islands of bio-cultural diversity rising above the ever-surging seas of development and urbanization. Though removed from each other geographically, these refugia of biological and cultural richness are interlinked into one ARCHIPELAGO OF HOPE by the very nature and history of the symbiotic relationship between Indigenous peoples and the EARTH.


From the original STEWARDS of this ARCHIPELAGO, we can learn not only what it takes to live with climate change, but also how to live on Earth in a way so that our wellbeing is not dependent on the disruption of the planetary live-sustaining balance.


The book ARCHIPELAGO OF HOPE documents my search for hopeful stories of Indigenous peoples' resilience from the frontlines of climate change:


From the mountains, the homeland of Altai peoples in Russia,


To the coastal territory of the Tla-o-qui-aht people in western Canada,


From the boreal landscapes, the home of the Skolt Sami in Finland,


To the ancestral rainforests of Sapara people in Ecuador.


We have much to learn from the experiences of Indigenous peoples living with, and crafting creative solutions to, the challenges of climate change. 


I HOPE you can JOIN ME on this journey!

By SUPPORTING the ARCHIPELAGO OF HOPE you can help bring these all-important stories of climate change resilience to the global audience, so that we can all LEARN from the experiences of the peoples who have been living with climate change for decades.

                                _____________________

Archipelago of Hope is at once a clarion call for action and an inspirational compendium of steps that indigenous peoples around the world are taking to address the world’s changing climate. We have much to learn from the peoples whom Gleb Raygorodetsky has met and his elegant, evocative writing will immerse the reader in the places and experiences of those peoples. Dr. Eleanor J. Sterling - Chief Conservation Scientist, Center for Biodiversity & Conservation, American Museum of Natural History.

                _____________________

HOW WILL I USE YOUR FUNDS?

I am VERY GRATEFUL for your support!

Your generous contribution will enable me to travel to the communities and spend time with local people, conduct interviews, and create a visual record of my journey. 

Any funds I raise in excess of this campaign's goals, as well as all of the royalties I earn from the sale of the book, will go directly toward helping the Indigenous communities I have been privileged to work with over the years. These and other funds I manage to raise, will be directed  toward supporting the ARCHIPELAGO OF HOPE project, through my long-term and trusted partner in this work, a non-profit Indigenous rights coalition LAND IS LIFE, in order to raise awareness of climate change and provide direct support to the communities featured in the book.

                                    IN PEACE AND RESPECT

                                                            Gleb

                                               Photos by Gleb Raygorodetsky and Nicolas Villaume       

      _____________________

KUDOS TO ARCHIPELAGO OF HOPE 

             There is an absolute beautiful interdependence and connection between the oceans, the soil, the air, the plants, animals, forests and all living things, including ourselves. Somehow many of us have forgotten it. Indigenous peoples wisdom, knowledge and way of life hold a key for us to remembering it and therefore have absolute contemporary relevance to modern society!!!!!!
             Traditionally, Indigenous peoples have lived in harmony with Mother Earth without exploiting and destroying their children’s future. Today, Indigenous peoples all around the world are on the "frontlines" of climate change and globalization. They are the gatekeepers to the last pristine places on Earth, where forests, minerals, water, and biodiversity are still abundant. There is much to learn from indigenous peoples’ traditional ways of life and there is much to reflect on when we listen to their stories about climate change.
           I met Gleb Raygorodetsky as we both worked in our own ways to help amplify and empower Indigenous peoples voices. I am looking forward to the important impact I know his book “Archipelago of Hope“ will have as a tool to share stories, lessons and messages our Indigenous brothers and sisters around the world hope to share with all of us and all future generations. Thank you Gleb for your dedication, research and open heart! 
Q’orianka Kilcher– Actress, Singer, Community Organizer | Action Hero Network

When Indigenous Peoples meet one another for the first time it’s as if we’ve always known each other.  Gleb’s powerful and knowledgeable book captures that essence and the intimate ties we have to our Mother Earth.  This book is like reading my own ancestry.  We say that “all things are connected” and these stories show us how related we all are.  Patricia Cochrane – Inupiat Eskimo, USA | Executive Director, Alaska Native Science Commission.     

As climate evolves from blessing to threat, and masses of humanity build levies and fortresses to protect themselves from something they will simply make worse with their efforts, Gleb Raygorodetsky takes us back to the communities we all descended from, in search of wisdom long forgotten about the the planet-wide ecosystem that sustains us, the one whose friend is climate. Mark Dowie - Writer and award-winning journalist, including four National Magazine Awards. Author of Conservation Refugees.

There could be no more accurate or prescient way to see our climatic future than through the eyes of Indigenous culture, people whose survival depends directly on the intimacy with which they interact with living systems. In Archipelago, longtime inhabitants of earth give us their eyes and ears, and we, who can be dumbfounded by an overwhelming onslaught of information, find a precious wisdom that is bestowed to those who patiently abide in the life of the world. Paul Hawken - environmentalist, entrepreneur, journalist, and a best-selling writer. Author of the Blessed Unrest.

Gleb Raygorodetsky has spent his life immersed in the trials and dreams of indigenous peoples around the world. ARCHIPELAGO OF HOPE presents his personal and professional experiences and insights in a lively and compelling set of stories from around the world. Much has been written about climate change, but little that displays the conviction, passion, and depth that Gleb brings to this task. Ultimately, his message is one of optimism: there is still time to act, if only we can show the patience and commitment to listen and learn from those, like Gleb, who have taken the time to earn their wisdom.  Henry Huntington - co-author of The Meaning of Ice and contributor to the Arctic Climate Impact Assessment and the Arctic Biodiversity Assessment.

Gleb Raygorodetsky, with his in-depth experience and knowledge, provides a framework on the climate issues that is at the heart  of Indigenous Peoples and Youth's experiences worldwide. Building on Gleb's vision, dedication and passion for this work and advocacy, the Archipelago of Hope will inspire and bring hope to people around the world.  Marifel  Macalanda – Igorot, Philippines | Cordillera Youth Center (CYC), Asia Pacific Indigenous Youth Network (APIYN).

This finite blue-green planet creaks under growing pressure. Solutions to world problems must come from within: we will all need to find ways of living that have a light touch on the planet, and yet at the same time bring well-being and contentment. This fine book develops a much-needed narrative of hope. There are peoples in diverse cultures worldwide who have insights and solutions. We should listen and learn. Dr. Jules Pretty, OBE, Deputy Vice-Chancellor and Professor of Environment & Society, University of Essex |  Author of The Edge of Extinction.

Gleb Raygorodetsky's journey through indigenous peoples of five continents shines an empathetic and sensitive light on the deepest sources of wisdom that we still have left on earth. While climate change is the focus, it is clear that such peoples have much to teach the rest of us about how to live responsibly towards the rest of nature, and towards each other. Powerful images and clear prose, both based Gleb's obvious immersion in the lives of these peoples, makes this book enormously educative, useful, and delightful.  Ashish Kothari - Founder-member Kalpavriksh Environment Action Group.

Nothing could better represent this journey through the world than its title: Archipelago of Hope. Although scattered throughout the world in oceans of change and conventional development, indigenous cultures are today - perhaps more than ever, islands of hope - for their historical roots, for their intimate connection with the land, for their wisdom and especially their resilience. This is what communicates the book by Gleb Raygorodetsky: beyond today's climate change, it is precisely the resilience of indigenous cultures to the historical changes of humanity and the planet which should be cause for reflection, learning, empathy, and solidarity. Gleb's book is obligatory reading for all those interested in studying and appreciating traditional cultures and their histories with nature, and for helping shape a vision for the future of the Earth.  Gonzalo Oviedo – Senior Advisor, Policy Program, IUCN - International Union for Conservation of Nature. 

Few non-native people understand the sacred ancient connection indigenous people have with Mother Earth better than Gleb Raygorodetsky. Here in the inimitable clarity and style for which we know him from his National Geographic Voices blog, Gleb takes us to every inhabited continent, to meet and converse with people who are witnessing the impact of climate change on ecosystems they have related with for countless generations. For them there is no need of abstract scientific data to show there is a real disturbance in our planet's life-giving force. Yet it is in these same forgotten corners of the world that Gleb also finds traditional knowledge of our planetary organism may well be our species' ultimate lifeline. David Maxwell-Braun, Editor, National Geographic Voices.

Gleb Raygorodetsky has a wealth of experience of living, working and communing with indigenous peoples.  His diligence, compassion and intelligence make him the ideal person to write this urgently needed and hugely important book.  Its scope, breadth and accessibility will greatly expand our understanding of how climate change is affecting indigenous communities -  the ‘canaries in the coal mine’ for the health of our global ecosystem.  This book will be a wakeup call for all of us. Dr. Stephan Harding, Head of Holistic Science, Schumacher College | Author of the Animate Earth.

The Archipelago of Hope shares important stories and sophisticated biocultural strategies for adaptation and mitigation to climate change that we all need to learn from and pay attention to. Respecting and making room for indigenous people's ideas and practices such as co-management, knowledge co-creation, interdependence, equal partnership, conservation economy, medicinal plants, mobility and traditional governance offers a hopeful set of counter-narratives to the status quo of neoliberal adaptation solutions being offered in the international policy arena today.  I highly recommend this inspiring book, with warm, loving photographs and many other resources, to lead students, researchers, professionals and indeed other indigenous peoples to a better appreciation of the rich biocultural diversity of our shared world, and a more inclusive and humble approach to stewarding it through these times and into the future. Dr. Rajindra Puri - Senior Lecturer in Environmental Anthropology,  University of Kent at Canterbury.

UPDATE:
Dear Friends,
My apologies, but this Indiegogo campaign  is now closed. While I get to keep what I managed to raise for the project, I haven't reached my fundraising goal. 
If, after reviewing the material below, you decide to support the Archipelago of Hope work, you can do so in a couple of ways:


1) Make an online contribution:

Go online http://landislife.org/donate/. 
Press Partner with Us and follow the instructions on the screen
When you get to MORE, enter "Archipelago of Hope project”. 
You will get a tax receipt for your contribution as well



2) If you prefer to write a check, you can mail a check to: 


Land is Life | 240 Kent Avenue | Brooklyn, NY | 11249, USA


Please make a note that it is for Archipelago of Hope. 


If you do decided to make a contribution, please let me know at this email address contact@gleb-raygorodetsky.com . You can also let me know which PERK you would like to receive. 
And now, please watch the video and read the material below to learn more about the Archipelago of Hope project.
In peace and respect,

story:
The Background

Trout Unlimited Canada is a registered Canadian not for profit organization. Our mission is to conserve, protect and restore Canada's freshwater ecosystems and their coldwater resources for current and future generations.

For more than a decade, Trout Unlimited Canada, in partnership with Alberta Environment and Parks, and our amazing volunteers and partners have been conducting an annual fall Fish Rescue to save fish from draining irrigation canals. 

To date over 850,000 fish have been rescued and returned to their home waters!

The project has historically been funded by Alberta Environment and Parks (AEP). This year AEP and Trout Unlimited Canada (TUC) are carrying out a study to investigate the ways in which fish utilize the canals. The information gathered will help us understand the number and rate at which fish are entering these canals and provide insights on how the problem might be mitigated. Since resources that typically go towards a large-scale Fish Rescue are being allocated to the study, TUC needs to find the funding to carry out the Fish Rescues which we have typically carried out. Due to the volunteer intensive nature of this project we hope crowdfunding can provide the answer.  


Fish in Irrigation Canals?

The fish we rescue from the canals enter through the headgates throughout the irrigation season while water is being drawn into the canal from the river. The headgates are the large structures which control flow into the canal from the river. Although some canals have screens to prevent fish from entering, many canals allow fish to be drawn into the canal from the river or reservoir that feeds them.


Why do They Need to be Rescued?

At the end of the irrigating season (May - October), the water supply to the irrigation canals is gradually decreased before eventually being shut off. With no way to return to the river from which they came, the fish are trapped in the canal while the last of the water drains away or freezes. Because these fish can't return to the river they are lost from the population.
In addition to returning these fish to their home waters, the rescue also provides a great opportunity for the public to get involved and gain hands on experience handling and identifying our amazing aquatic neighbors. Species, length, and weight data gathered during the rescue also adds to the ever-growing body of knowledge for these species.


How You Can Help

This is your chance to help Trout Unlimited Canada, and the Bow and Oldman River chapters save fish stranded in irrigation canals in Southern Alberta.
By donating to the Fish Rescue you are helping to fund this great volunteer based conservation and education project. Our funding goal is to raise $8200 towards the project. These funds will be used to support the biological staff needed to plan and implement the project as well as the costs of equipment rental and field costs. 
Tax receipts can be provided for donations of $20 and higher.

If we are unsuccessful in raising our target funding amount, or exceed our funding goal; the lesser or additional funds raised will be used towards other on-the-ground conservation projects taking place across Canada.

To learn about some of our past and current projects please click on the website link below!

story:
SUPPORTED BY    


VOICES 4 MOTHER EARTH - LOUD AND CLEAR, MORE THAN EVER!

Paris, 28 November 2015. In the aftershock of two weeks back, security for the COP21 is tight as never before. All public events speaking to Climate Change and for a Good Life on the planet, are banned.  

Just on the other side of Paris the World Wisdom Gathering stands like a rock!

Telling the new unfolding story. How people have already started to heal, adapt, restore and innovate a healthy and habitable planet. Elders who, in their wisdom, protect the old knowledge, making it available. Others, young people who just follow a different drum.

If you want this last place in Paris to speak out for humanity, loud and clear and share a very powerful message, a message for each of you, stay tuned and support your future!

Support us

Thanks to your support we can bear the costs for the ceremonial spaces, local transport, cook, food and drinks, para-medical support, communication, travel for those who need support and more! (Comment on Dec, 3 2015: it would have been good to offer live streaming or produce such a beautiful shortfilm like the one you see in the gallery everyday. As you can imagine, it is impossible with our budget. Sorry for that, we hope to serve you better soon! Help us!)

First impressions, with all our love.


We do not have gadgets to offer in return. The Voices 4 Mother Earth logo depicts the city of Paris with the river Seine and the Circles of Life we are creating from a bird's eye perspective.

Your money goes to the Netherlands Centre for Indigenous Peoples (NCIV). It has an ANBI-status which makes your gift tax deductible.

If you do not have a creditcard or a Paypal account and want to donate, you can do this here if you have a Dutch bank account. If you make a donation from another country see the instructions on the bottom of the NCIV page.

Set up your own event

The Ceremonial Drum is going to beat from the 30th of November until December 11, 12:00 p.m. in Paris. In many indigenous communities around the world ceremonies will be held simultaneously.

Grab your drum and resonate gently with the heartbeat of Mother Earth from the 30th of November until the 11th of December 12:00 p.m. together with your friends and thousands of drums all over the planet. Or accompany the Ceremony on the 6th of December in your own area.

Share your event >>>here <<<


YOUR SUPPORT WILL RESULT IN GROWING WORLDWIDE CONSCIOUSNESS ABOUT NEW WAYS TO COLLABORATE ACROSS BOUNDARIES, TO RESTORE EARTH AND CREATE VITAL COMMUNITIES.

Why we invited indigenous peoples.

Today they are at the forefront of protecting rivers, forests and land. They have proven to be excellent caretakers of Mother Earth as their territories belong to the most healthy areas of this planet. Ceremonies are their sacred way to maintain the balance with all that is living. We honor them for their willingness to share the ancient wisdom with us.

‘It’s going to get worse, unless men will embrace the Ceremonies.’ - Nowaten, Spiritual Leader of the Ojibway Three Fire Tribes

Voices4MotherEarth is supported by the Embassy of the Earth, Four Worlds International Institute, NCIV, and Nusaalifuru.

All are driven by volunteers.

story:
The vast amount of development, physical validation and associated intellectual property has been privately funded.

We have worked with one of the world's largest patents and trademarks management firm to secure its know-how and get a world-class competitive edge in green technology.

THINK DIFFERENT

We are proud to introduce”System 4™ - the new generation of buildings”

A great nation is one that buzzes with ideas, one that is full of innovative people doing big things, one that is ready to change!

With ”System 4™- the new generation of buildings” we will be honored to contribute to the United States of America´s strategy to improve building energy efficiency, striving towards a 21st century energy independence. 

Fact 

Buildings consume 54% of all energy used in the world.

As an example more than $220 billion is spent each year in the U.S. to provide heating, cooling, lighting and related services for buildings. 

Energy consumption in residential and commercial buildings is a major cause of acid rain, smog and global warming, accounting for 47% of U.S. sulfur dioxide emissions, 22% of nitrogen oxide emissions and 35% of carbon dioxide emissions.

Based on program analysis conducted for the Government Performance and Results Act (GPRA), an annual Federal investment of $300 million to improve the energy efficiency of buildings in the U.S. will:

• Save consumers a cumulative $65 billion by 2016 and over $320 billion by 2026 in energy expenditures.

• Reduce carbon annual emissions by over 45 million metric tons in 2016, and by 124 million metric tons in 2026.

• Provide comfortable and healthy indoor environments, improve worker productivity and reduce on-site construction waste.

• Increase competitiveness for the building industry and stimulate economic activity in communities.

Big things really need your help to making a difference


Our Master Units are the building heroes and upholds the top load, but for security reason we have an invisible anchoring load bearing system


System 4 the new generation of buildings are specially designed and will meet any climate conditions of any state in the United States of America, Canada and throughout the entire world.

Unit Solutions enables customers to quickly make available buildings (Homes, Garages, Tiny houses and sheds) of any type and shape with high standards by providing an innovative modular plug in principle prefabricated solution that can easily save tremendous amount of energy and therefore money savings. 

“Have you ever built a building in your life?

  You don’t have to,

  Not unless you want to.”

For the Do it Yourself community we offer the first easy to use construction principle which is very similar to what most of us can relate to as the Lego blocks combined with the IKEA assemble philosophies.

  You will have fun building for less with high energy efficiency.

If a financial contribution isn't possible for you right now, you can still help. We welcome all the assistance we can get just spreading the world. You can email friends, post to Facebook, Twitter and any other social networks you use, whatever you feel is appropriate to do. Indiegogo has some great share tools that make it easy.

  • 536 % more efficient than traditional construction processes.
  • 27 % positive carbon footprint impact before the building stands.
  • 20 % positive carbon footprint impact when the building is liven in.
Indoor air quality improvement:Through natural building ventilation, safe material without VOC.

Building energy consumption reduction:

86 % on heating/cooling/water heating



System 4™ - the new generation of buildings“, unique solutions meet customers and end users needs much better than substitute products.


PLEASE VISIT OUR HOME PAGE FOR MORE INFORMATION

http://www.unit-solutions.com

Customers

Versatile and yet very complementary:

• New private and public community projects where Unit Solutions is the builder of choice.

• Green contractors partnering with Unit Solutions within its chosen market.

• Unit Solutions Franchisee builders spread throughout the United States of America operating outside Unit Solutions chosen market.

• ”Do it yourself-er“ looking for new alternatives to enjoy the fun art of building simple, fast and efficient structures. Complete housing kits can be purchased on your chosen shopping channel (HOT) Home order television, chosen retailer or online at a Unit Solutions chosen e-commerce channel and delivered straight to the customer´s construction site.

Unit Solutions offers its wide customer base access to all its ”System 4™ - the new generation of buildings“ buildings (Homes, Garages, Tiny Houses and Sheds), proprietary planning tools, materials, and solutions as well as a modern-licensing or franchise type business model.

"System 4 - the new generation of buildings" new alternatives to enjoy the fun art of building simple, fast and energy efficient structures.


Just a few weeks ago, we witnessed a global consensus made by 195 nations during COP21 to fight climate change and transition to a clean energy economy worldwide. 

---> Link to Whitehouse climate act <---



We invite you to learn more below about System 4 - the new generation of buildings technology...               

Please visit our new home page  http://www.unit-solutions.com


In 2007, we conducted the first experiments with our new technology and realized that we could create something unique. We managed to move on to a new level of how to build quick, easy, energy efficient and sustainable.
we have created: the world's first easy to use building hero

Soon we will make it available for everyone, especially to those who like to build quick and easy and having fun reducing the use of energy.

Currently the world is divided into two parts:
simple things and high tech, we'd like to combine them. We believe that technologies should serve in simple things every day. Unit Solutions System 4 - the new generation of buildings is based on unique technology, but we would like you to enjoy it every day instead of thinking about its complexity.


The Master Units are made of modern high-tech Expanded Polypropylene (EPP) material, which is 100 % recyclable, both very lightweight and robust at the same time. Drastically reduce sources of allergies, are non-toxic with no volatile organic compounds (VOC).
For more than 40 years, this high-tech material has been used very efficiently in the automobile, aerospace and nautical industries and proven as a reliable and stable product.

Team GreenOvation T-Shirt Perk


Unit Solutions "System 4 - the new generation of buildings" is limited only by your imagination.

"System 4 - the new generation of buildings" basic units are prefabricated modular elements including windows, doors, units with sink, units with toilets etc. that can easily be combined with the Master Unit.
Unit Solutions offers a "Do it yourself" possibility to everyone - so dreams literally  become reality.

Unit Solution has developed several types of technical units as part of the "System 4 - the new generation of buildings" portfolio. By definition, each unit is a proprietary technical element which can be used individually or in any combination with one another.









We have designed a clear path to spreading our entire high tech construction solutions throughout the United States of America, Canada via a strategic network of contractor builders.

We are definitively offering a new alternative to the construction industry eager at (re)-starting (new) development projects as well as the end customer looking at getting into environment friendly, energy efficient building solutions.

As our "System 4 - the new generation of buildings" become available, we will coach, license, and certify our contractors in its secured TERRITORY.

Together we are simply bringing back - the fun art of building, simple, fast and energy efficient structures with 21st century high-tech material, processes and designs.

Each member will get access to a specific licensee's building  portfolio.

The contractor memberships are limited and exclusive in each region.


DIY Unit Solutions Storage Shed Kit - Green


DIY Unit Solutions 2 Car Garage Kit - John


DIY Unit Solutions 2 Car Garage/Work Shop - Niclas


DIY Unit Solutions Bungalow Loft - Chicago


DIY Unit Solutions Tiny home Loft - Malibu

DIY Unit Solutions Tiny home Loft - Florence


Unit Solutions has worked with one of the world's largest patents and trademarks management firm to secure its know-how and get a world-class competitive edge in green technology.


PCT Patent covers 256 countries, we also managed to cover several utility model protections including trade marks and design patents.

The vast amount of development, physical validation and associated intellectual property has been privately funded.

I would like to get involved but don’t have money!
You can still help. We welcome all the assistance we can get just spreading the word. You can email friends, post to Facebook, Twitter and any other social networks you use, whatever you feel is appropriate to do. Indiegogo has some great share tools that make it easy. Thank you for supporting Unit Solutions!

Will System 4 work on any foundation?
The building’s anchoring system accommodates any type of foundation.

Will I be able to choose a different building size?
We're also working to provide users future option with different styles and models.

Can system 4 be attached to me existing home, as an in-law house?
Yes and no, we only have a few systems, but you are able to attach the system to your home or garage... anything is possible - all you need to do is skip the walk-through or door opening of System 4 the new generation of buildings.

The buildings are limited by your imagination.

Will there be future add-on to the assembling kits?
At this point no, but we are working on several systems that can be easily adapted to your existing models.

Is there a builder’s support for system 4?
Yes, we have a support hotline lined up.

How long does it take to build the shed, garage or tiny home bungalow?
It differs in time, due to the fact that they are all different shape and sizes. It takes less than two hours for the shed. On your first DIY assembling kit it would take some time, but you will experience fun while building with System 4.

Will there be contractor team – to build my assembling kit?
We are working on contractor teams; they are the first to know how to build quick and easy, as it comes available.

Do I need to paint the inside or outside walls?
No. but it would look much better if painted. The outside siding is unfinished with no protecting paint, so if you ask me if I would paint the outside surface – yes I would – you would protect the outside and it definitely would look much better.  Some assembling kits come with drywall, so if you like to give it a better look, paint it. We would for sure.

What happens if something breaks?
If there is something we can replace, depending on the damage we will. A standard manufacturer warranty will apply. 

Where can I buy replacement master unit modules?
Directly from us and also through our preferred distributors, we are working as we speak to make them available in the major wholesalers from regular manufacturing Day 1.

When will I receive my order?
The first units are expected to be delivered in 2016. 

What countries can System 4 be delivered to?
System 4™ can be delivered to Canada and the United States only. We want System 4™ to be available worldwide.  

I am a distributor. How do I contact you?
Inquiries regarding future distribution opportunities of system 4 can be sent via email to info@unit-solutions.com. We will respond ASAP.

I am a Television Host - HOME ORDER TV - Who do I contact?
Inquiries regarding future Home order television opportunities of system 4 can be sent via email to info@unit-solutions.com. We will respond ASAP.

Why is shipping not included in the price?
Shipping costs vary depending on what you’re getting and where you are in Canada or in the U.S.A. therefore, we believe that it is fair if everyone pays for their own shipping.

Does Unit Solutions have a warranty? 
Yes a standard manufacturer warranty will apply. 

Do I need to add the cost of shipping & taxes to my pledge? Delivery costs through COD, VAT will be automatically added to your final purchase price when you choose your destination country. Other taxes, customs or import fees are not included.

I can't get my payment to work in PayPal, what should I do?
Email the Indiegogo Customer Happiness Team at support@indiegogo.com . They'll be able to track your transaction and help with any issues.

What if I have a question about something not mentioned above?
If you have questions during or after the campaigns have closed, you can always reach us at support@unit-solutions.com we receive a lot of special requests, and respond as fast as possible!

For press inquiries please contact press@unit-solutions.com

For questions related to the Indiegogo Campaign, you can contact support@indiegogo.com

Thank you for your interest in Unit  Solutions System 4 – the new generation of buildings!

"System 4 - the new generation of buildings" is not just a sustainable, technologically advanced solution to build quick and easy. Unit Solutions symbolizes our desire to change the world for the better. Using our resources responsively can affect our outlook on the day ahead but more importantly, it impacts our perspective, society and planet. With System 4 we believe that thoughtful design and technology can take us into the next generation of buildings, to create more effective and fun to build, ECO-friendly cities.

Unit Solutions will use your money to accelerate the execution of our development plan. We will be able to expand our technical and management staff and get access to the equipment and materials critical to build the first manufacturer plant. In all phases of expansion and development, Unit Solutions will continuously improve its entire offering by expanding its portfolio of sustainable, highly energy efficient technologies and solutions, as well as look for creative ways to optimize manufacturing and and logistics, while striving to further reduce overall costs and environmental impacts.

The more we raise, the more resources we can deploy to speed this technology into the hands of the people who need it.

We love the idea of involving the people directly and indirectly surrounding impacted by the building industry in a communal effort to bring about this revolutionary product, We know what we need to do, and your support would be great. We have been listening to your comments and concerns leading up to this Indiegogo launch, and they've been very helpful in refining out thinking about the Unit Solutions "System 4 - the new generation of buildings" and how to make it most useful to you. This is your chance to contribute directly to dealing with a major energy efficient building issue that affects tens of millions of people. But you have to exercise your vote to change the world of System 4. One at a time, collectively your contributions can be a powerful force in enabling us to realize the great solution potential of this technology.

We need to finish tooling to manufacture different parts such as our Basic Units - unit with sink, unit with toilet etc., that can easily be combined with the Master Units. This process is complex and requires time and money. Complications could potentially emerge and delay the manufacturing schedule. To tackle this we carefully select each partner and always have a Plan B.

At this point shipping is only possible for U.S.A. and Canada. We've given a conservative estimate for our delivery dates. We are committed to keeping you informed of our progress both during and following our campaign. We assure you that we are all working very hard to produce a sensational product that not only arrives on time but is of optimum quality!

Out team is comprised of seasoned entrepreneurs, architect designers, experience engineers with more than 40 years of entrepreneurial and manufacturing experience, so rest assured each building (houses, garage, tiny homes and sheds) will exceed your expectations.

We are perfectionists! We have done our homework, so the risks are minimal. We have identified and locked in our manufacturers who will start shipping within 90 days of successful project funding, so you can enjoy your very own quick, easy and energy efficient DIY building before the next season kicks in.

What you are seeing are prototypes, so expect the final product to be more efficient and fun to build, all with supreme quality. In particular, we are developing the best version of the plug in principle units and units with sockets, light switch and water supply for bath and kitchen. You will love placing doors and windows, as anyone who has built a simple shed, garage or garden house knows how complicated it is - all - Unit Solutions System 4 - the new generation of buildings - units are going through a detailed process requiring 3D modeling, molds and more.

If you have questions during or after the campaign has closed, you can always rech us at support@unit-solutions.com we receive a lot of special requests, and respond as fast as possible!

For press inquirier please contact press@unit-solutions.com

For questions related to the Indiegogo Campaign, you can contact support@indiegogo.com

We welcome all the assistance we can get just spreading the word. You can email friends, post to Facebook, Twitter and any other social networks you use, whatever you feel is appropriate to do. Indiegogo has some great share tools that make it easy

Thank you for your great support! We hope you join us as we revolutionize the fun art of buildings and empower builder everywhere.
