We managed to move on to a new level of how to build quick, easy, energy efficient and sustainable.we have created: the world's first easy to use building heroSoon we will make it available for everyone, especially to those who like to build quick and easy and having fun reducing the use of energy.Currently the world is divided into two parts:

simple things and high tech, we'd like to combine them. We believe that technologies should serve in simple things every day. Unit Solutions System 4 - the new generation of buildings is based on unique technology, but we would like you to enjoy it every day instead of thinking about its complexity.






The Master Units are made of modern high-tech Expanded Polypropylene (EPP) material, which is 100 % recyclable, both very lightweight and robust at the same time. Drastically reduce sources of allergies, are non-toxic with no volatile organic compounds (VOC).

For more than 40 years, this high-tech material has been used very efficiently in the automobile, aerospace and nautical industries and proven as a reliable and stable product.





Team GreenOvation T-Shirt Perk




Unit Solutions "System 4 - the new generation of buildings" is limited only by your imagination.


"System 4 - the new generation of buildings" basic units are prefabricated modular elements including windows, doors, units with sink, units with toilets etc. that can easily be combined with the Master Unit.

Unit Solutions offers a "Do it yourself" possibility to everyone - so dreams literally  become reality.

Unit Solution has developed several types of technical units as part of the "System 4 - the new generation of buildings" portfolio. By definition, each unit is a proprietary technical element which can be used individually or in any combination with one another.






























We have designed a clear path to spreading our entire high tech construction solutions throughout the United States of America, Canada via a strategic network of contractor builders.
We are definitively offering a new alternative to the construction industry eager at (re)-starting (new) development projects as well as the end customer looking at getting into environment friendly, energy efficient building solutions.
As our "System 4 - the new generation of buildings" become available, we will coach, license, and certify our contractors in its secured TERRITORY.
Together we are simply bringing back - the fun art of building, simple, fast and energy efficient structures with 21st century high-tech material, processes and designs. 
Each member will get access to a specific licensee's building  portfolio.
The contractor memberships are limited and exclusive in each region.



DIY Unit Solutions Storage Shed Kit - Green


DIY Unit Solutions 2 Car Garage Kit - John


DIY Unit Solutions 2 Car Garage/Work Shop - Niclas


DIY Unit Solutions Bungalow Loft - Chicago


DIY Unit Solutions Tiny home Loft - Malibu



DIY Unit Solutions Tiny home Loft - Florence







Unit Solutions has worked with one of the world's largest patents and trademarks management firm to secure its know-how and get a world-class competitive edge in green technology.
PCT Patent covers 256 countries, we also managed to cover several utility model protections including trade marks and design patents.
The vast amount of development, physical validation and associated intellectual property has been privately funded.


I would like to get involved
but don’t have money!You can
still help. We welcome all the assistance we can get just spreading the word.
You can email friends, post to Facebook, Twitter and any other social networks
you use, whatever you feel is appropriate to do. Indiegogo has some great share
tools that make it easy. Thank you for supporting Unit Solutions!
Will System 4 work on any foundation?The building’s anchoring system accommodates any type of foundation.
Will I be able to choose a different building size?We're also working to provide users
future option with different styles and models. 

Can system 4 be attached to me existing home, as an in-law house?Yes and no, we only have a few systems, but you are able to attach the
system to your home or garage... anything is possible - all you need to do is
skip the walk-through or door opening of System 4 the new generation of
buildings. 
The buildings are limited by your imagination.
Will there be future add-on to the assembling kits?At this point no, but we are working on several systems that can be
easily adapted to your existing models.
Is there a builder’s support for system 4?Yes, we have a support hotline lined up.
How long does it take to build the shed, garage
or tiny home bungalow?It differs in time, due to the fact that they are all different shape and
sizes. It takes less than two hours for the shed. On your first DIY assembling
kit it would take some time, but you will experience fun while building with
System 4.

Will
there be contractor team – to build my assembling kit?We are
working on contractor teams; they are the first to know how to build quick and
easy, as it comes available.
Do I need to paint the inside or outside walls?No. but it would look much better if painted.
The outside siding is unfinished with no protecting paint, so if you ask me if
I would paint the outside surface – yes I would – you would protect the outside
and it definitely would look much better. 
Some assembling kits come with drywall, so if you like to give it a
better look, paint it. We would for sure.
What
happens if something breaks?If there
is something we can replace, depending on the damage we will. A standard
manufacturer warranty will apply. 
Where
can I buy replacement master unit modules?Directly
from us and also through our preferred distributors, we are working as we speak
to make them available in the major wholesalers from regular manufacturing Day
1.
When
will I receive my order?The
first units are expected to be delivered in 2016.  
What countries can System 4 be delivered to?System 4™ can be delivered to Canada and the
United States only. We want System 4™ to be available worldwide.  
I am a distributor. How do I contact you?Inquiries regarding future distribution
opportunities of system 4 can be sent via email to info@unit-solutions.com. We will respond ASAP.
I am a Television Host - HOME ORDER TV - Who do
I contact?Inquiries regarding future Home order television
opportunities of system 4 can be sent via email to info@unit-solutions.com. We will respond ASAP.
Why
is shipping not included in the price?Shipping
costs vary depending on what you’re getting and where you are in Canada or in the
U.S.A. therefore, we believe that it is fair if everyone pays for their own
shipping.
Does Unit Solutions have
a warranty? 
Yes a standard manufacturer warranty will apply. 
Do I
need to add the cost of shipping & taxes to my pledge? Delivery
costs through COD, VAT will be automatically added to your final purchase price
when you choose your destination country. Other taxes, customs or import fees
are not included.
I
can't get my payment to work in PayPal, what should I do?Email
the Indiegogo Customer Happiness Team at support@indiegogo.com . They'll be able to track
your transaction and help with any issues.
What if I have a question about something not
mentioned above?If you have questions during or after the
campaigns have closed, you can always reach us at support@unit-solutions.com we receive
a lot of special requests, and respond as fast as possible!
For press inquiries please contact press@unit-solutions.com
For questions related to the Indiegogo Campaign,
you can contact support@indiegogo.com
Thank you for your interest in Unit  Solutions System 4 – the new
generation of buildings!


"System 4 - the new generation of buildings" is not just a sustainable, technologically advanced solution to build quick and easy. Unit Solutions symbolizes our desire to change the world for the better. Using our resources responsively can affect our outlook on the day ahead but more importantly, it impacts our perspective, society and planet. With System 4 we believe that thoughtful design and technology can take us into the next generation of buildings, to create more effective and fun to build, ECO-friendly cities.
Unit Solutions will use your money to accelerate the execution of our development plan. We will be able to expand our technical and management staff and get access to the equipment and materials critical to build the first manufacturer plant. In all phases of expansion and development, Unit Solutions will continuously improve its entire offering by expanding its portfolio of sustainable, highly energy efficient technologies and solutions, as well as look for creative ways to optimize manufacturing and and logistics, while striving to further reduce overall costs and environmental impacts. The more we raise, the more resources we can deploy to speed this technology into the hands of the people who need it.
We love the idea of involving the people directly and indirectly surrounding impacted by the building industry in a communal effort to bring about this revolutionary product, We know what we need to do, and your support would be great. We have been listening to your comments and concerns leading up to this Indiegogo launch, and they've been very helpful in refining out thinking about the Unit Solutions "System 4 - the new generation of buildings" and how to make it most useful to you. This is your chance to contribute directly to dealing with a major energy efficient building issue that affects tens of millions of people. But you have to exercise your vote to change the world of System 4. One at a time, collectively your contributions can be a powerful force in enabling us to realize the great solution potential of this technology.
We need to finish tooling to manufacture different parts such as our Basic Units - unit with sink, unit with toilet etc., that can easily be combined with the Master Units. This process is complex and requires time and money. Complications could potentially emerge and delay the manufacturing schedule. To tackle this we carefully select each partner and always have a Plan B.
At this point shipping is only possible for U.S.A. and Canada. We've given a conservative estimate for our delivery dates. We are committed to keeping you informed of our progress both during and following our campaign. We assure you that we are all working very hard to produce a sensational product that not only arrives on time but is of optimum quality!
Out team is comprised of seasoned entrepreneurs, architect designers, experience engineers with more than 40 years of entrepreneurial and manufacturing experience, so rest assured each building (houses, garage, tiny homes and sheds) will exceed your expectations.We are perfectionists! We have done our homework, so the risks are minimal. We have identified and locked in our manufacturers who will start shipping within 90 days of successful project funding, so you can enjoy your very own quick, easy and energy efficient DIY building before the next season kicks in.
What you are seeing are prototypes, so expect the final product to be more efficient and fun to build, all with supreme quality. In particular, we are developing the best version of the plug in principle units and units with sockets, light switch and water supply for bath and kitchen. You will love placing doors and windows, as anyone who has built a simple shed, garage or garden house knows how complicated it is - all - Unit Solutions System 4 - the new generation of buildings - units are going through a detailed process requiring 3D modeling, molds and more.

If you have questions during or after the campaign has closed, you can always rech us at support@unit-solutions.com we receive a lot of special requests, and respond as fast as possible!For press inquirier please contact press@unit-solutions.com
For questions related to the Indiegogo Campaign, you can contact support@indiegogo.com
We welcome all the assistance we can get just spreading the word. You can email friends, post to Facebook, Twitter and any other social networks you use, whatever you feel is appropriate to do. Indiegogo has some great share tools that make it easy
Thank you for your great support! We hope you join us as we revolutionize the fun art of buildings and empower builder everywhere.

story:
For the Love and Protection of our Wildlife


What is The Sacred Wildlife Project?

Imagine a world where wildlife is thriving and protected......

This campaign is an invitation to help protect as many wildlife species from extinction as possible, by engaging the leadership and gifts of thousands of animal-loving people across the globe.

The Sacred Wildlife Project is unique as it is about bringing people together that believe that animals have something to say and are open to learning from animals. Nature has taught us everything we know. To reach harmony in life, we all need to learn how to observe Nature and learn the laws that govern our Universe. We as humans are a part of Nature and its survival.

The Project will have two main focuses:

  1. Education - A resource of up to date and real time information, wisdom, insights, experience, expertise and knowledge of many wildlife activists and passionate contributors, to saving our sacred wildlife, from all over the world.
  2. Adventures - The other focus is to help as many people personally engage with their favourite animals through immersive Adventures,  to see them in their natural habitat. These Adventures, which we have successful hosted two already, have been life changing for participants. We have raised a large amount of money for the charities we were supporting and increased awareness of the plight of the white lions and African elephant.

 

What makes this Project unique?

This is what makes the Sacred Wildlife Project stand out amongst all the animal advocacy agencies, who are doing amazing things....

  • We want to bring the voice of the animals to the table so have the opportunity to learn from them and allow them to be our teachers, as they too are sentient beings.
  • Be the leading teachers of wildlife interspecies communication so we can all  learn how to deeply understand, love and appreciate what wisdom they have to share with us.
  • How to bring in the natural systems that work so well and are intrinsic in nature, into your own personal way of living or doing business  through the conscious living principles and practical tools.
  • Special interspecies collaboration and contribution opportunities for the success of all who engage in this unique level of work.

The platform (more than a website) will share a list of the most updated information about specific wildlife charities, crisis situations and initiatives happening all over the world. We will also partner with a variety of projects, trusts or charities to help fund and create awareness of their specific needs such as The David Sheldrick Wildlife Trust or the Global White Lion Protection Trust. They will always be those we identify to be the most 'grass roots' level projects where any contribution goes directly to the protection of a wildlife species that is highly endangered.

We will also be offering access to expert interviews, blogs, forums and discussions around the wildlife and environment challenges that face each of us on a daily basis and how and what we can do to help in our small way. Education through a variety of webinars, online courses, debates and forums.

 

Why are you needed?

The number of wild animals on Earth has reduced by 70% in the last 40 years, due to the over consumption, hunting, poaching and habitat-destroying behaviour of humans.

It’s time to change this...

“We have a responsibility to all these forms of life on our planet because we have power over them… We need to ensure that we have enough life forms on Earth to ensure the planet’s health. But how many is enough? We simply do not know the answer to that question – though I think we should assume that it is a fairly large number and that they need protecting.”
~ Sir David Attenborough

Every human has a sacred responsibility to look after ALL sentient beings that occupy this plant. With the devastation of natural habitats and the growth of the human population, we are threatening the well-being of millions of other species. The continued unbalancing of nature and the planet can not continue. We are part of the circle of life on this planet and therefore it is up to us to ensure it's survival.

Let’s unite as a global community.

The Internet is one of the most powerful tool ever invented by humans to empower people.

It allows us to access knowledge and wisdom from a global community. It also allows us to share meaningful experiences together in ways we’ve never been able to before, with each other and the more-than-human community.  

Would you like to be able to commune and engage with wild animals in their natural habitat, from your own home?!

The Sacred Wildlife Project platform will:

  1. Allow people to experience wild animals in their natural habitat, from their home.
  2. Increase awareness of the plight of our planet’s wildlife.
  3. Raise money to help protect endangered species through a variety of initiative.
  4. Offer courses, coaching and adventures for animal-loving people to make a difference and grow their nature connection.

 

Success so far...

We are already raising awareness and funds for the endangered White Lions of South Africa and the African Elephants in Kenya, through our immersive and purposeful ‘Avatar Adventure’ trips each year.

So far we’ve raised over $20,000 for the Global White Lion Protection Trust and The David Sheldrick Wildlife Trust, which has supported the re-introduction of White Lions into their natural habitat, and has sponsored several orphaned baby Elephants.

 

Who are we?

The Sacred Wildlife Project is a conscious, non-for-profit initiative co-created by three passionate, pioneering women; Tamar Peters, Christiane Pedros and Kate Solesti. We are like-hearted in our pursuit to reignite a globally culture of protection and nurturing of our wildlife.

We create opportunities for animal-lovers across the globe. to stand up for what they believe in: a thriving planet with wildlife where humans and wildlife live in harmony and respect of each other.


Why we need your help?

It's time to build a global community of thousands of animal-lovers, who want to connect with the wildlife they strive to protect. It will take each one of us joining together with the same intention for us to make a significant difference.

Your donation will fund the development of our new, interactive, online community platform - the crucial beating heart of our global network - and catalyze the growth of this movement.

What your contribution will fund:

We want to create a fully interactive and robust online portal (more than just a website) which offers extensive opportunities to take action, helps manage an increased volume of members, and course participants, and enables us to carry out wildlife campaigns that deliver our mission.

Our Project model is based on Contribution, Co-creation and Collaboration. We’re working with service providers that are emotionally invested in our project, believe in our cause and want to contribute some of their time and resources to help us. This helps us significantly to keep the budget as low as possible.

The Budget:

  • Branding ~ Logo design, look and feel of the platform that best reflects our mission $888
  • Design and Development~ Creating a very visual experience that is compelling and encourages interaction: $888
  • Build ~ Architecting the interactive platform to help increase our global network of women: $1,696
  • Content Creation ~ Recording, editing and creating the best quality and value online content to engage our supporters $888
  • Campaign Management Marketing Consultancy  ~ To help create and organize this campaign effectively $888
  • Outreach ~ Marketing and interaction $888
  • Video Production ~Development and build of the platforms promotional video: $888
  • Advertising ~ Increase our social media reach and influence: $88
  • Donations ~ 5% of all the monies raised through this fundraiser will be donate to the Global White Lion Protection Trust and The David Sheldrick Wildlife: $888
  • Indiegogo ~ Campaign Fees: $888

TOTAL: $8,888

(The use of the number 8 is of significant importance. You will see it in our Gift offerings and in the budget above. The reason for this is it stands for abundance, infinity, power and strength so all very relevant to our Project)

 

How YOU can be part of this movement.

This is an INVITATION to take ACTION and join a tribe of animal-lovers who have a shared longing to protect and nurture our wildlife. By donating today you’ll become part the Sacred Wildlife Project and you can choose from a variety of heartfelt gifts including:

$8  USD
~ Conscious Supporter - Our heartfelt gratitude and will feature your name on our new Sacred Wildlife Project Platform as a Supporter of our Project.

$18  USD
~ Contributor - Your contribution will be recognized as a Contributor on our Platform and you will receive our very special 'Messages from The Wild Ones' Recording.

$38 USD
~ Co-creator - You will be helping us to Co-create a great online portal. You will receive a free place on our ‘Communing With Wildlife’ Webinar with Tamar and Kate (plus all the above). Estimated delivery January 2019.

$58 USD
~ Gift A Friend - A meaningful present for Christmas or Birthday for a friend or family member? We will send you an Inspiring E-Card for you to give to them, with information about the Sacred Wildlife Project and 2 Exclusive Wildlife Council Recording of Messages (plus all the above). Estimated delivery December (Before Christmas) 2018.

$88  USD
~ Collaborator - Join our Sacred Wildlife Project Membership for LIFE and access to a specific selection of resources; Communing Educational Videos, Interviews, Recordings of Wildlife Council Messages, Community Forum and so much more (plus all the above). Estimated delivery May 2019

$128  USD
~ Culture Partner - A free place on our next online Conscious Living with Nature 3 week Course with Tamar Peters (plus all the above). Estimated delivery February 2019

$288  USD
~ Compassion Partner - A free place on our next online ‘Learn how to Photograph the Wild Ones’ course with Kathy Davis, an experience Wildlife photographer (plus all the above) Estimated delivery February 2019

$588  USD
~ Catalysing Partner - You’ll receive a free place on our 7 ‘C’ Principles of Conscious Living 7 Session Course at a major catalyst for change. In addition you get special discounts on Adventures and other Courses (plus all the above). Estimated delivery January 2019

$888 USD
~ Courageous Partner - A very personal 3 month journey with Tamar Peters and Kate Solisti as a Courageous Partner - 3 One on One Sessions - Personalized time with Kate and the Animals followed by time with Tamar and the Conscious Living Model (plus all of the above)

$2888 USD
~ Celestial Partner - Thank you for stepping forward with this powerful offering. You’ll receive an Honorary mention on our Platform as a Founding Member, 6 month Conscious Living and Mentoring One on One Programme with Tamar Peters and a $500 discount on one of our Adventures in 2019 or 2020. PLUS all the above.

Every amount is deeply appreciated and will greatly help our precious wildlife.

 

How YOU can help.

Every time you share this campaign with a friend, you help to inspire this movement. Thank you SO much for sharing it with your community. You can:

  • Share it on Facebook
  • Email it to five friends
  • Tweet about it
  • Invite your friends

With your generous donation we hope to gather 888 animal-lovers working with us to make the change we want to see in the world.  

Your generosity is invaluable, thank you so much!

The Sacred Wildlife Project Team,

Tamar, Christiane, Kate (and Sophie)

Video created and edited by: Christiane Pedros - Video music by: www.bensound.com

story:
Short Summary

My name is Za'Ria Thomas I am a 5-year Navy veteran and plant-loving herbalist from Jacksonville, FL.

My campaign is to fund my small business, My Melanin Skincare, which plans to become a non-health compromising, clean beauty skincare line tailored to catering and maintaining the health and appearance of melanin skin. While also giving people of color in lower income communities and urban neighborhoods the knowledge and resources to recycle and understand how their environmental impact also affects their skin and health. As a unisex product line we promise fewer organic, recycled, non-toxic, affordable ingredients tailored to those of darker skin tones and their specific needs. While simultaneously fighting climate change by giving communities not granted recycling bins and environmental resources the option to contribute to a healthier planet. Not only for the success of our company but for the success of their skincare journey, and providing the building blocks to black generational knowledge, success, and health. Since clean beauty is a popular term with no standard definition, we decided to ignore the fad and instead... create a movement. 

What We Need & What You Get


We need $15,000 to successfully start up our company. The funds are needed for:

  • Branding and design
  • Website
  • Photography
  • Samples & Testers
  • Marketing contribution to retailers
  • Public Relations
  • Product Testing and Certification

We plan to use our backers as the backbone of our start up, by sending free samples and letting YOU have first dibs of our formulas and be the first to review our products. Regardless what you can give, the funds shall be used to get closer and closer to our goal.

The Impact


 My Melanin skincare is beyond the trend of opening another organic line. It's about creating generational knowledge and resources for the urban community. Being a woman of color who has lived in both urban, lower class neighborhoods and modern, upper class neighborhoods, she sees the difference between health awareness and resource in the nation. People of color are shown to be the top spender in the beauty world, but yet still struggle to find safe, non-health compromising, organic skincare products that are affordable for the average middle to lower-class woman to keep up a regime. African Americans in the green industry also are beginning to address the lack of diversity. Black and Latina women have paraben levels 4x-8x higher than the general population due to the lack of clean skincare out there for us. People in Urban neighborhoods would have to live in subdivisions with HOA in order to receive recycling bins, and sometimes you'd still have to request that. The standard products one buys from the beauty industry are also contributing 120 billion units of plastic packaging annually, making it one of the top generators of plastic waste while using tons of water to create their products as well. Adding to the water crisis while the beauty industry, in terms of recycling and proper waste disposal, gives little-to-no effort.

  Since the FDA does not regulate a standard definition for "clean skincare", Za'Ria sought out to come up with a fresh concept. A clean, tailored BLACK skincare line must be health imperative from the outside in. Considering how the product benefits the skin and the community before and after the formula is received. From the product within the package to the package itself. As well as in the lives of our team and our customers. Teaming up with companies like "Ocean Waste Plastic" to reuse plastic waste in their packaging and reinvent a better, healthier future for melanated people and people of all colors, sizes, and shapes. Pushing other skincare companies to reuse plastic instead of producing more. Cleaning the ocean, and improving our environment which in return has a direct affect on the skin. 

"The direct impacts of climate change on the skin include the effects of extreme weather events such as heavy rainfall, floods, droughts, and hurricanes, which can attribute to an increase in skin infections, inflammatory skin diseases, and traumatic skin disorders." (Andersen, Louise K. "The Impact of Climate Change on Skin and Skin-Related Disease." 01 Jan. 1970. Web. 23 Jan. 2021.)

My Melanin Skincare is a non-health compromising, clean beauty skincare line tailored to catering and maintaining the health and appearance of melanin skin. While also giving people of color in lower income communities and urban neighborhoods the knowledge and resources to recycle and understand how their environmental impact also affects their skin and health. As a unisex product line we promise fewer organic, recycled, non-toxic, affordable ingredients tailored to those of darker skin tones and their specific needs. While simultaneously fighting climate change by giving communities not granted recycling bins and environmental resources the option to contribute to a healthier planet. Not only for the success of our company but for the success of their skincare journey, and providing the building blocks to black generational knowledge, success, and health. Since clean beauty is a popular term with no standard definition, we decided to ignore the fad and instead... create a movement.

Risks & Challenges


We have a unique offering, since our packaging will incorporate supporting an environmental movement rather than standard wholesale items, but there are other natural and organic black skincare providers online. These include small businesses creating small melt-n-pour soap shops mostly marketed on social media and their personal websites/blogs to large scale companies shipping across the country and even the globe. The beauty industry can also fund their own "recycle" campaign and drown our efforts by stealing the overall purpose of our business. But they'll never have first hand experience and understanding of what the black community feels like Za'Ria does. We differentiate ourselves by offering more concentrated products that focus on melanin skin issues, organic and non-toxic ingredients with no additional synthetics or parabens, and reused plastic packaging containers recycled from environmental waterways to create a thoroughly CLEAN company. But also making sure to connect with our community and become a resource rather than just a supplier.

Other Ways You Can Help


For those who are unable to donate, but believe in our vision, please help us spread the word. Remember to use Indiegogo's share tools, tell a friend, and if you know any small, black-owned green company let them know our mission. Inform them that we'd love to partner and start this journey.

Let's be the change the Earth needs. Will you be the start of a movement?

story:
Let's work together on a green future for Laos

We provide training, practical help & ongoing support for local Lao farmers. Our training helps farmers to improve their livelihoods, mitigate the effects of climate change, support local biodiversity and increase the diversity of the crops they grow.

When YOU take part in our crowdfunding campaign:

  • We can provide farmers with training in sustainable, climate-smart farming practices;
  • Farming communities benefit and;
  • EVERYONE gets to live in a safer climate!

Location

The Permaculture Farmer Training project location is at Pha Tad Ke Botanical Garden in Luang Prabang, Laos. 

The Problem

75% of the Lao population live on small-hold farms, many still using slash and burn techniques

The Global Hunger Index still defines the situation in Laos as “serious”. Latest UN figures indicate one-fifth of the population is undernourished. One of the reasons cited for malnutrition is that diets lack diversity.

According to the World Food Programmed vulnerability to climate change is a driver of food insecurity, affecting 14% of those living in rural communities and as many as 25% in the remote upland areas.

The climate in Lao PDR presents a challenge for year-round growing due to the long dry season and inadequate knowledge currently available on how to combat this issue without resorting to using large quantities of chemical fertilizer and extensive irrigation

Our Solution

We are raising funds to provide farmers with:

  • training in sustainable farming practices to become innovative, agri-smart food growers;
  • Money invested in training programmes. For every farmer we train, we expect another 10 or 20 farmers to be trained by those farmers in turn;
  • Villages plant a wider variety of crops throughout the year and improve yields over time;
  • Villagers eat a more varied and nutrient diverse diet;
  • Local biodiversity improves;
  • Climate-smart agriculture produces a reduction in the effects of climate change.

Our Permaculture Demonstration Farm

The Permaculture Demonstration Farm, designed by PTK landscape designer Phart, was developed during 2018. The design for the farm includes a low-land, mid-land and up-land set to allow the training to showcase specific ways to apply permaculture principles in these particular types of areas.

Meet Somdy

Somdy is the catalyst for this campaign. Head Gardener Somdy has been at PTK since the very beginning of Pha Tad Ke in 2008. He is the Trainer at the Permaculture Demonstration and Research Farm. With a diploma in agriculture, he says he loves plants and enjoys the teamwork at PTK. “It is good to have your own job to do, but I enjoy the way we can share ideas and learn from each other.”

Message from Somdy at Pha Tad Ke:
At our Permaculture Demonstration and Research Farm in Luang Prabang, we provide training
programmes for local farmers, Government staff and NGOs. We teach and showcase
sustainable agriculture principles to improve a sustainable way of agriculture. The results is less stress on forest biodiversity. The biodiversity increases as a result of this way of farming.
Farmers experience an improved livelihood and better way of living for themselves and the
village community.​

 

This is our Minimum Target

$2,500 Equals an additional investment in signs for the Permaculture Farm
$3,000 To launch the alley cropping project
$150 USD Provides seeds, tools and supplies for 1 follow up visit to a village
$300 USD Covers the trainers fees for 1 farmer training

Science Behind the Project

The permaculture training we use is a proven methodology. The Permaculture Handbook we have translated into the Lao language is from the IDEP Foundation. Copies of the manual we give free to farmers.

What is Permaculture?

Permaculture offers ideas and practices to create sustainable (and regenerative) community development. Based on a set of ideas brought together by Bill Mollison and David Holmgren in the 1970s,

Permaculture is underpinned by a set of ethics and holistic and ecological design principles to create healthy communities.

Permaculture uses traditional ways of managing the land as well as introducing and integrating modern, innovative, agri-smart practices.

The principles are applied as a community design to help to maximize efficiency and productivity and improve and protect the land, biodiversity, environment and community.

We need you!

We have already run a few training workshops. So, we know that our goals to improve livelihoods, increase plant diversity and food security through using agri-smart farming is achievable. And at the same time, we reduce the harmful effects that traditional slash and burn agriculture has on climate change.

We need to act fast, and we need to act now to address these issues. We have an ambitious vision and are determined to be the change for farmers in Laos.

We need your help to scale up the training and to meet the demand for farmers for this kind of knowledge.

Support by Sharing

At PTK, we deeply value our friends and supporters and are grateful for their compassion and belief in our community approach to changing lives from the grassroots up. Please share this campaign with your friends and family and help us grow the movement! 

Our Perks

We would LOVE to send you goody bags through the mail.  Unfortunately, the mail system is very expensive from Laos.  We are instead pre-selling excursion tickets at a discounted price.  We want you to come to join us on our journey. If you can't, you will still receive an online picture portfolio, and you can support our good cause! Pha Tad Ke is affiliated with the Luang Prabang Fund for Culture and Conservation, an American 501(c)3 non-profit organisation. All Contributions made to Pha Tad Ke through the crowdfunding campaign are through the LPFCC and are tax-deductible in the US.

 

“With your help, we can train more farmers and work together on a green future for Laos”.

 

Thank you in advance for your donation!

story:
Become a Bamboo Hero!

 

Ankobra Farms is a private social and environmental impact program. Based on successful pilot projects at ANKOBRA BEACH, the program contains four modules to be developed stepwise connecting commercially successful business units.

Core of Ankobra Farms is the sustainable production of bamboo charcoal

Ankobra Farms is now ready to lift the pilot project to a company level with a continuous production of bamboo charcoal and biochar distillate. To be able to achieve that we need a roof over our fabrication area, a paved road to the fabrication area, a tractor with accessories, funds to start continuous production, develop the market in Ghana and Europe and finally for some hectares of land to ensure perpetual supply with raw material.

Mission

With our visionary concept we can make a change for the people and the environment in Western Africa. It is our aim to enable business development for small-scale entrepreneurs and rural communities and at the same time preserve and restore nature. Also we aim for as many followers as possible to multiply and reach out into the whole world.

Our project uses the vast amount of bamboo, which is widely unused in West Africa by carbonizing it in state of the art retort kilns.

Bamboo is mostely seen as a waste plant in the region but we figured out it can be carbonized and replace about 70% of Ghana’s wood consumption for charcoal production. Besides, bamboo can be used to re-cultivate large areas of degraded land and using it with an intercropping concept could also contribute to food security.
On top of that bamboo can create new livelihoods to jobless fishers and people who simply flee from the environmental deasaster. It can offer alternatives to wasting the rivers and cutting preserved tropical trees.


It´s time for a Change, and we know how: with Bamboo.

We have successfully implemented three pilot projects utilizing bamboo as an alternative biofuel and producing organic off-farm inputs (fertilizer, plant improver, soil conditioner), using bamboo as construction material and for furniture production.
All projects form broad synergy effects and two of them will now be scaled up in four stages. The next stage is the widening of the pyrolysis project into a solid best-practice business case. A large intercropping farm will follow as stage No. 2, a micro biogas plant will be constructed as stage No. 3.
In order to attract and instruct entrepreneurs willing to copy Ankobra Farm‘s holistic concept of a „closed cycle farming“ or parts of it we will establish a training center. 

Our Vision: ARTiC

Our Vision is that of a green innovation center at Ankobra Beach (Ankobra Resarch & Training Center -ARTiC) establishing and spreading a new kind of landuse, our "closed cycle farming". MAXIME of Ankobra Farms is "fair commercial acting" which means any kind of corporate operation that generates profit while intending to improve, increase or transform livelihoods. In this context "Closed-Cycle Farming" is addressing two of the most emerging problems in Africa: supply with sustainable biofuel and food security.

 

“Closed Cycle Farming” (CCF) is a modern philosophy of organic landuse that follows the natural principle of a circular flow.  CCF is creates a local value chain based on bamboo biochar, biochar distillate, organic food and energy. Thus CCF can conibute to mitigate deforestation and toxic exposure while creating new jobs. CCF technologies promote waste management, e.g. the use of waste for biogas generation.

Help us to save the last preserved stands of rain forest from illegal logging and restore degraded land!

Want to learn more about Ankobra Farms?

Bamboo offers excellent opportunities to substitute the source of charcoal production from destructively cut primeval forests to a sustainably cultivated raw material. Bamboo grows up to 90 cm per day and can be harvested after as little as three to five years. The bamboo sticks can be harvested selectively and continually without clear-cut.

Bamboo absorbs 35% more carbon dioxide than any tree, thus producing more oxygen. At the same time bamboo improves the structure and health of soil where it grows because the risome/root system attracts a significant amount of moisture and sustains healthy microbe growth. Bamboo is naturally dense and strong and keeps these attributes when carbonized. Because of that bamboo charcoal achieves high temperatures while being burnt.

Our "adam-triplex-retort" is a modified model of a mature carbonization unit designed for demands of developing countries. Calculated from dry weight of wood (like bamboo) our kilns offers an efficiency of approx. 35% instead of 10-18% achieved by traditional systems. It reduces the emission of greenhouse gases significantly. 

With such a great material called bamboo, we do not only produce charcoal of course. But also organic vegetables, furniture and soil conditioner:

OR SPREAD THE WORD!

The world needs to know about our campaign, so please help us to make a better future by following us on social media and tell your friends about it!

Facebook: fb.me/AnkobraFarms

Instagram: instagram.com/ankobrafarms

Twitter: twitter.com/AnkobraFarms

We have proofed that bamboo works. But this is only half way: we need to establish it as an alternative biofuel in the minds of people. And we need scale up the production, improve logistics. In order to achieve that we need your help NOW.

We also want to thank our great volunteering supporters in this campaign:

Dennis Gajda, Arne Flekstad (graphics), Markus Strobel, Stefan Fütterer (film), Carina Wilhelm (PR), Felix Grundner, Mirja Aurnhammer, Maria Oyabide (outdoor team), Simon Ford, Hendrik Herberhold (texts), Monique Friederich (cutter), Doina Herberhold (online marketing), Sebastian Lübbers & all of our volunteers and our dancers!

YOU ARE BAMBOO SUPERHEROES!

THANK YOU!

 

What is fair commercial acting?

Fair commercial acting is any kind of profitable business activity, which is improving existing or creating new livelihoods by acting in a social, economical and ecological reasonable way.

 

What is closed cycle farming?

Closed cycle farming is a modern organic philosophy of landuse, which combines the production of organic fruits, vegetable and energy plants in order to establish a local value chain for sustainable solid biofuel, heating energy and food for self supply and sale.

 

Are any trees cut for Ankobra Farms?

No, not a single tree will be logged by Ankobra Farms. We use driftwood to produce our charcoal and biochar distillate. Our outgrowing team cuts bamboo from existing stands, which are widely unused. For our intercropping plantations we will use degraded land.

 

How can Ankobra Farms contribute to a mitigation of the local fishery crisis?

The use of bamboo and the concept of closed cycle farming can create new livelihoods for unemployed fishermen in Axim area and offer alternatives to gallamseys polluting the Ankobra river. Bamboo charcoal as an alternative solid biofuel takes pressure of deforestation from the mangroves, which are important breeding grounds for coastal fishery stands.

 

How can Ankobra Farms contribute to a mitigation of the soil crisis in West Africa?

The use of bamboo in intercropping acreages is consolidating the water balance of soil.
The use of bamboo charcoal according to the principles of „terra preta“ can restore depleted soils.
The adequate use of biochar distillate as a plant fortifier and soil improver can avoid abuse of agrochemicals.

 

How will Ankobra Farms use funds if the funding goal is not reached?

Ankobra Farms has a detailed investment plan and every Dollar can help us to establish a stable 365 days per year production of bamboo charcoal. First funds are spent for a roof over the production, little more money will help us to build a road, further funds will be used for a tractor and marketing activities. Every cent is spent useful!

 

Why is bamboo widely unused in West Africa?

Bambusa vulgaris, the species which is growing predominantly in West African bamboo stands, is nor a very endurable construction material neither to can it be used well as a solid biofuel as it burns away very quick without carbonization. Carbonization results in earth kilns are poor. A modern technique of carbonization and efforts of convincing people are necessary to introduce bamboo charcoal as an alternative biofuel.

 

Does Ankobra Farms have a good relation to Ghanain authorities?  

Our relation to Ghanaian authorities is brilliant. Even the energy minister Hon. Boah and Gifty Tetley from the ministry for renewable energy came to the inauguration ceremony of our charcoal production. Twenty years of development cooperation on a commercial basis at Ankobra beach have built a wide network to various kinds of stakeholders in the fields of tourism, education, agriculture and infrastructure.

Besides, bamboo can be used to re-cultivate large areas of degraded land and using it with an intercropping concept could also contribute to food security.On top of that bamboo can create new livelihoods to jobless fishers and people who simply flee from the environmental deasaster. It can offer alternatives to wasting the rivers and cutting preserved tropical trees.
It´s time for a Change, and we know how: with Bamboo.We have successfully implemented three pilot projects utilizing bamboo as an alternative biofuel and producing organic off-farm inputs (fertilizer, plant improver, soil conditioner), using bamboo as construction material and for furniture production.All projects form broad synergy effects and two of them will now be scaled up in four stages. The next stage is the widening of the pyrolysis project into a solid best-practice business case. A large intercropping farm will follow as stage No. 2, a micro biogas plant will be constructed as stage No. 3.In order to attract and instruct entrepreneurs willing to copy Ankobra Farm‘s holistic concept of a „closed cycle farming“ or parts of it we will establish a training center. Our Vision: ARTiCOur Vision is that of a green innovation center at Ankobra Beach (Ankobra Resarch & Training Center -ARTiC) establishing and spreading a new kind of landuse, our "closed cycle farming". MAXIME of Ankobra Farms is "fair commercial acting" which means any kind of corporate operation that generates profit while intending to improve, increase or transform livelihoods. In this context "Closed-Cycle Farming" is addressing two of the most emerging problems in Africa: supply with sustainable biofuel and food security. “Closed Cycle Farming” (CCF) is a modern philosophy of organic landuse that follows the natural principle of a circular flow.  CCF is creates a local value chain based on bamboo biochar, biochar distillate, organic food and energy. Thus CCF can conibute to mitigate deforestation and toxic exposure while creating new jobs. CCF technologies promote waste management, e.g. the use of waste for biogas generation.Help us to save the last preserved stands of rain forest from illegal logging and restore degraded land!Want to learn more about Ankobra Farms?Bamboo offers excellent opportunities to substitute the source of charcoal production from destructively cut primeval forests to a sustainably cultivated raw material. Bamboo grows up to 90 cm per day and can be harvested after as little as three to five years. The bamboo sticks can be harvested selectively and continually without clear-cut.Bamboo absorbs 35% more carbon dioxide than any tree, thus producing more oxygen. At the same time bamboo improves the structure and health of soil where it grows because the risome/root system attracts a significant amount of moisture and sustains healthy microbe growth. Bamboo is naturally dense and strong and keeps these attributes when carbonized. Because of that bamboo charcoal achieves high temperatures while being burnt.Our "adam-triplex-retort" is a modified model of a mature carbonization unit designed for demands of developing countries. Calculated from dry weight of wood (like bamboo) our kilns offers an efficiency of approx. 35% instead of 10-18% achieved by traditional systems. It reduces the emission of greenhouse gases significantly. With such a great material called bamboo, we do not only produce charcoal of course. But also organic vegetables, furniture and soil conditioner:OR SPREAD THE WORD!The world needs to know about our campaign, so please help us to make a better future by following us on social media and tell your friends about it!Facebook: fb.me/AnkobraFarmsInstagram: instagram.com/ankobrafarmsTwitter: twitter.com/AnkobraFarmsWe have proofed that bamboo works. But this is only half way: we need to establish it as an alternative biofuel in the minds of people. And we need scale up the production, improve logistics. In order to achieve that we need your help NOW.We also want to thank our great volunteering supporters in this campaign:Dennis Gajda, Arne Flekstad (graphics), Markus Strobel, Stefan Fütterer (film), Carina Wilhelm (PR), Felix Grundner, Mirja Aurnhammer, Maria Oyabide (outdoor team), Simon Ford, Hendrik Herberhold (texts), Monique Friederich (cutter), Doina Herberhold (online marketing), Sebastian Lübbers & all of our volunteers and our dancers!YOU ARE BAMBOO SUPERHEROES!THANK YOU! What is fair commercial acting?Fair commercial acting is any kind of profitable business activity, which is improving existing or creating new livelihoods by acting in a social, economical and ecological reasonable way. What is closed cycle farming?Closed cycle farming is a modern organic philosophy of landuse, which combines the production of organic fruits, vegetable and energy plants in order to establish a local value chain for sustainable solid biofuel, heating energy and food for self supply and sale. Are any trees cut for Ankobra Farms?No, not a single tree will be logged by Ankobra Farms. We use driftwood to produce our charcoal and biochar distillate. Our outgrowing team cuts bamboo from existing stands, which are widely unused. For our intercropping plantations we will use degraded land. How can Ankobra Farms contribute to a mitigation of the local fishery crisis?The use of bamboo and the concept of closed cycle farming can create new livelihoods for unemployed fishermen in Axim area and offer alternatives to gallamseys polluting the Ankobra river. Bamboo charcoal as an alternative solid biofuel takes pressure of deforestation from the mangroves, which are important breeding grounds for coastal fishery stands. How can Ankobra Farms contribute to a mitigation of the soil crisis in West Africa?The use of bamboo in intercropping acreages is consolidating the water balance of soil.The use of bamboo charcoal according to the principles of „terra preta“ can restore depleted soils.The adequate use of biochar distillate as a plant fortifier and soil improver can avoid abuse of agrochemicals. How will Ankobra Farms use funds if the funding goal is not reached?Ankobra Farms has a detailed investment plan and every Dollar can help us to establish a stable 365 days per year production of bamboo charcoal. First funds are spent for a roof over the production, little more money will help us to build a road, further funds will be used for a tractor and marketing activities. Every cent is spent useful! Why is bamboo widely unused in West Africa?Bambusa vulgaris, the species which is growing predominantly in West African bamboo stands, is nor a very endurable construction material neither to can it be used well as a solid biofuel as it burns away very quick without carbonization. Carbonization results in earth kilns are poor. A modern technique of carbonization and efforts of convincing people are necessary to introduce bamboo charcoal as an alternative biofuel. Does Ankobra Farms have a good relation to Ghanain authorities?  Our relation to Ghanaian authorities is brilliant. Even the energy minister Hon. Boah and Gifty Tetley from the ministry for renewable energy came to the inauguration ceremony of our charcoal production. Twenty years of development cooperation on a commercial basis at Ankobra beach have built a wide network to various kinds of stakeholders in the fields of tourism, education, agriculture and infrastructure.

story:
Hi there!

My name is Giuseppe, I'm a small olive grower in Tuscany, Italy. 

I started in 2010, restoring two olive groves which where abandoned since many many years. I settled down with my family in Montepescini, an old hamlet south from Siena. Here we produce oil since 2012 under our own label Oliveta della Torre, and we're certified organic olive grover and oil producers since 2015. 

You surely know Tuscany, a beautiful region and one of the top touristic destinations in the world.

But unfortunately the rural areas here are suffering an impoverishment which becomes more and more visible. And the abandon of olive trees is getting worse and worse every year.

The main causes for this disease are the production costs, which are the highest in Europe, and the commercialization of low cost EVOOs. 

To act against this impoverishment we decided to restore an olive grove with 90 old trees and enough land to plant 200 new ones.

It's a win win project, you, us and for the Environment:

Our gain

With your support we'll be able to

  • purchase the olive orchard,
  • buy new olive plants, and
  • increase our oil production. 

Your gain

In change of your investment you'll

  • get a certificate of adoption for 3 years,
  • give the name to the adopted tree,
  • visit it whenever you want, and most of all
  • receive at home one of the highest quality olive oil in the world.

Environmental gain

Thanks to your support and our farming skills, we'll be able to 

  • restore an uncultivated olive grove,
  • contribute to increase the potential carbon sequestration and slow the accumulation of greenhouse gases.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need 40'000 euros, which'll be allocated as follows:

  • 20'000 euros for the purchase of the olive orchard
  •   7'500 euros for the purchase and plantation of at least 100 olive trees
  •  12'500 euros for the purchase of mechanical olive picking equipment 

For your precious support, you'll get high value perks: from 30 to 300 euros, you can choose to adopt for a period of three years

an entire, a half or a fourth of a Senior Olive Tree,

 

or you can adopt an entire or a half Junior Olive Tree.

In all cases, you'll have the right to give a name to the adopted tree; the tree itself will bear a plaque with your name and, mostly of all, you'll receive at home a tin of exquisite, healthy and true tuscan oil, that we produce under our own organic label "Oliveta della Torre".

 

What if we don't make it?

 

If we don't reach the entire goal, we'll use the funds raised to purchase only the olive orchard, or to purchase the olive orchard and only one part of the junior trees, or to buy only the mechanical equipment. In all cases, the value of our organic olive estate will increase thanks to your investment!! 

 

Climate change and risks

Agriculture depends heavily on weather conditions and on seasonality. Due to the climate change, in the last years we've had mild winters, rainy springs and very dry summers. This has lead to extreme weather, like hailstorms, or to different diseases in the orchards, like bacteria, fungus and damaging insects. 

According to the disciplinary of organic growing, we don't use any sort of pesticide, so that we must take in account losses of production compared to conventional olive farming. 

We've partially fixed the problem taking out an insurance against damage caused by natural forces, but it doesn't cover the pathologies that affect the olive trees: olive fruit fly, bacteria and fungus are the main threat for an organic farmed olive groves.

As there are no ways to foresee such diseases,  we must take in account the fact that we may not be able to deliver your oil during 2017. But we would manage to do that over a period of three years: from 2017 to 2019, which corresponds to the adoption period of the olive trees. In any case, from January 2017, we'll take contact with you to arrange an individual delivery period.

 

Your support is paramount

 

You can do so much to help us! For example:

  1. Watch our video, if you already haven't, and share it with your friends
  2. Back our project by adopting one olive tree or a part of it
  3. Follow our small daily farmer's life on our social media: facebook, instagram, YouTube, twitter, LinkedIn and google+
  4. Spread the word on our campaign on your social media

 

Thank you for all the support you can give us!

Watch our video, if you already haven't, and share it with your friends
Back our project by adopting one olive tree or a part of it

Spread the word on our campaign on your social media

 
Thank you for all the support you can give us!

story:
Historia

En países tropicales como Colombia, son escasas y limitadas las ofertas de educación o formación en jardinería, además son muy pocos los medios escritos y audiovisuales que fomentan este oficio. Conocedores de modelos exitosos de revistas de jardinería en otros países como Estados Unidos, Brasil, Argentina, España y Europa en general, que se concentran en las recomendaciones de cultivo y horticultura en condiciones de climas de estaciones, en el año 2010 nos surgió la idea de ofrecer un proyecto editorial para las condiciones de climas tropicales, el cual busca educar sobre el manejo de plantas nativas, el uso de herramientas y productos responsables con el medio ambiente, la horticultura, la arborización urbana y el paisajismo tropical.

¿Quiénes somos?

Somos un grupo de profesionales con más de 20 años de experiencia,  que desde el año 2012 conformamos la Fundación Ezwama, una entidad no gubernamental y sin ánimo de lucro que desarrolla proyectos en biodiversidad, patrimonio y cultura.

Con nuestra experiencia, hemos articulado la botánica, la jardinería, el paisajismo, la producción de plantas, las comunicaciones y el periodismo, para darle vida a nuestro proyecto bandera; la revista DeJardines, que, hasta la fecha, ha circulado en su versión impresa con 17 ediciones. Durante estas ediciones, contactamos con el apoyo de botánicos y especialistas en diferentes grupos de plantas, así como: orquídeas, anturios, bromelias, heliconias, begonias, helechos tipo platycerium, palmas y plantas suculentas, entre otras más.

El trópico y su desconocimiento en jardinería

La falta de información en jardinería para climas tropicales ha generado diversas consecuencias a nivel económico y ambiental en los entornos naturales y urbanos, sobre todo debido al uso de especies inadecuadas y/o mal ubicadas, a la utilización indebida de productos agroquímicos y al mal desarrollo de las plantas sembradas. Disminuir estos problemas y mejorar la calidad de nuestros jardines y espacios verdes, es parte de lo que pretendemos con la Revista DeJardines, la cual busca el punto de referencia como fuente de información para el diseño y la selección de especies cultivadas en condiciones específicas.

Características de DeJardines

Con información profesional, educativa, y con un gran trabajo de investigación en campo donde se recolectan muestras botánicas, semillas y fotografías de especies, DeJardines se ha convertido en el medio que rescata el oficio de la jardinería para que botánicos, viveristas, investigadores, ingenieros, arquitectos, paisajistas y amantes de la jardinería, entre muchos otros, potencialicen desde sus territorios, espacios más ecológicos, sostenibles y biodiversos.

La Revista DeJardines, adicional a su versión impresa, actualmente está disponible en su versión online a través de la página web www.dejardines.com  para  los apasionados de la jardinería de todas las ciudades de Colombia y de otros países del trópico. Hasta el momento, hemos registrado visitas y suscripciones en nuestro portal web de personas provenientes de varios lugares de América Latina e incluso de otros lugares del mundo.

Asimismo, DeJardines tiene presencia en algunas redes sociales como Facebook, Instagram y YouTube donde ofrecemos tips y consejos sobre jardinería, además promovemos campañas educativas para la conservación del medio ambiente.

Nuestra puntería

Con nuestros propios recursos hemos publicado 15 ediciones de la revista DeJardines, cada una con un tiraje de 2000 ejemplares. Ahora necesitamos su apoyo para mantener viva nuestra revista y así tener mayor cobertura y circulación a nivel nacional e internacional. Pretendemos crear un fondo con un valor inicial de 15.871 USD y ejecutar la campaña durante seis meses a partir de la fecha de finalización.

  1. Darle continuidad a DeJardines: Buscamos que DeJardines continúe rescatando la labor de la jardinería. Abriremos un fondo permanente para cubrir los gastos de impresión y el trabajo de investigación que se necesitará para publicar las ediciones número 16 y 17 de la Revista DeJardines, cada una con 5000 ejemplares, los cuales se repartirán gratuitamente en jardines botánicos, bibliotecas universitarias, viveros comerciales, instituciones u organizaciones afines a la jardinería.
  2. Ampliar la cobertura de la edición impresa: Con el aumento del tiraje de la revista, obtendremos un mayor impacto para seguir rescatando la labor de la jardinería, infundir sus buenas prácticas y mostrar productos y herramientas relacionadas con la misma. Con su apoyo podremos llegar a muchas más personas.
  3. Disponibilidad de la información en línea: Durante la campaña pondremos a disposición 500 suscripciones gratuitas en la zona Premium de la revista DeJardines para que así más personas puedan disfrutar de nuestro material educativo. 
  4. Mitigar nuestra huella ambiental: Pensando en el bienestar de nuestros ecosistemas y apoyados en nuestra misión, queremos realizar una restauración ecológica con la siembra masiva de árboles nativos y/o en peligro de extinción en algunas zonas protegidas de Antioquia (Colombia), que nos permita compensar nuestra huella ecológica. Durante la ejecución de la campaña, sembraremos un árbol por cada dos revistas impresas, es decir un total de 5.000 árboles.  

Como agradecimiento por su contribución, hemos establecido algunos beneficios para ti

¡Descúbrelos!

¿Qué pasará después de la campaña?

Una vez finalizado el período de permanencia de nuestra campaña en Indiegogo, nos tomaremos seis meses para desarrollar las dos publicaciones de la Revista DeJardines, los cuales abordarán los siguientes temas:

Edición # 16: Cycas y Zamias

Hablaremos de uno de los grupos de plantas con semillas que aparecieron en el planeta hace por lo menos 250 millones de años, y que hoy en día, aún se conservan algunos de sus linajes, pero con grandes amenazas de extinción. Se trata de las Zamias y las Cycas, gimnospermas que alcanzaron su mayor diversidad en tiempos de los dinosaurios. Estas plantas hacen parte del orden de los Cycadales, los cuales son conocidos como “fósiles vegetales vivientes”.

Edición # 17: Plantas de interior y de sombra

Abordaremos los grupos de plantas, que por su crecimiento natural se adaptan a las condiciones de sombra en jardines o condiciones de interior para nuestras viviendas y oficinas.

 

Cronograma de actividades

Ahora ¿Qué pasa si no logramos el objetivo de financiación? Para nosotros cada aporte será muy importante y de gran ayuda para continuar con nuestro proyecto editorial, el cual ha sido pensado para rescatar y fortalecer las labores de jardinería en países tropicales. Nuestro equipo trabajará fuerte para lograr este objetivo, pues entre más fondos podamos recaudar, mayor será nuestro impacto y alcance para seguir ofreciendo una información consciente y con sentido sobre el manejo de plantas nativas, el uso de herramientas y productos responsables con el medio ambiente, la horticultura, la arborización urbana y el paisajismo tropical.

Por lo tanto, si obtenemos al menos el 30% del presupuesto esperado, procedemos a imprimir solo la edición # 16, la cual abordará las Zamias y Cycas. Además, destinaríamos un valor proporcional para la ejecución de la reforestación ecológica.

Nuestro equipo trabajará fuerte para lograr este objetivo, pues entre más fondos podamos recaudar, mayor será nuestro impacto y alcance para seguir ofreciendo una información consciente y con sentido sobre el manejo de plantas nativas, el uso de herramientas y productos responsables con el medio ambiente, la horticultura, la arborización urbana y el paisajismo tropical.Por lo tanto, si obtenemos al menos el 30% del presupuesto esperado, procedemos a imprimir solo la edición # 16, la cual abordará las Zamias y Cycas. Además, destinaríamos un valor proporcional para la ejecución de la reforestación ecológica.

story:
BIRD  RESEARCH AND CONSERVATION IN SARAWAK, BORNEO (FALL 2019)

 

Short Summary

The lowland rainforests of Borneo are among the most diverse and imperiled habitats on Earth. The International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) has listed nearly 30% of the 415 resident bird species in Borneo as either Near Threatened, Vulnerable, Endangered or Critically Endangered. The most significant threats are habitat loss from illegal logging, hunting pressure, and wildlife trade. Protected areas such as national parks and wildlife sanctuaries now serve as vital refuges for threatened bird species. Although protected areas exist, managing them is challenging because fundamental information is lacking for nearly all Bornean birds. Very few published studies on the behavior, diet, or life-history on Bornean birds exist. Almost 30% of Bornean species have no detailed nest description, and less is known about the biology of these species outside of the breeding period.

This project is a five-year collaborative research and teaching program focused on the conservation and ecology of birds in several current and proposed protected areas in Sarawak, East Malaysia (Borneo). Our professor, and ornithologist, Alison Styring, Ph.D. and ornithologist, Dan Froehlich work with colleagues from Sarawak Forestry and Louisiana State University to assess avian diversity and conduct detailed studies on avian life history. They also train local students and conservationists in field methods relevant to the study of birds. The anticipated outcome of this research is to gain a better understanding of the role of protected areas in preserving avian biodiversity, identify management needs for rare and threatened species, and establish a framework for long-term research and monitoring at the protected areas led by Malaysian researchers, students, and citizen-scientists.

 

The Students 

As students in conservation biology, we are thrilled to participate in important, hands-on work with Alison and Dan, and local scientists and technicians. We each have specific skills and experience to contribute and will learn field techniques, conservation management, and community building. This will prepare us for graduate studies and careers in conservation biology. We have committed to work full-time for six weeks as contributors to this project. Please consider supporting our work as students and members of a broader research community. Our travel costs are not covered by grant funding. Anything you contribute is greatly appreciated!

 

Phil Hyde

Phil completed his BS in Ecology and Environmental Science at Evergreen State College in 2019.  He conducted undergraduate research on the effects of urbanization on bird diversity in the Southern Puget Sound Region of Washington State, United States. He is trained in Monitoring Avian Productivity and Survivorship (MAPS) bird-banding protocol. Phil chose his academic direction based on a calling to protect nature and wildlife and is pursuing a career in conservation biology.

 

Laura Giannone 

Laura is completing a BAS in Sound Engineering and Acoustic Ecology at Evergreen State (2020). She is a field recordist, field technician for Quiet Parks International, freelance sound engineer, and intern with Northwest Soundscapes. Since winter 2019 she has assisted with University of Washington researcher Lauren Kuehne's study on the impact of flights over the North Olympic Peninsula in Washington. Laura helps with citizen science workshops to teach local volunteers to process acoustic data and acoustic analysis. She worked as the lead editor for Quiet Planet (2013-2016), a library of wilderness recordings. Laura is developing waterproof housing and C cell battery holder modifications for ten Open Acoustic Devices' AudioMoth recorders so they are ready for heavy rainfall and extended stays on trees in Borneo this Fall.  

 

Bow Tyler

Bow is completing a BS in Ecology with an emphasis in Ornithology at Evergreen State College. He is an experienced bird-bander, field technician, and avid hiker. Bow is particularly interested in avian vocal behavior, migration, and population dynamics.  He studied conservation biology at Navopatia Field Station in Sonora, Mexico (2018). Bow trained in Monitoring Neotropical Migrants on their Winter Grounds (MoSI) and MAPS bird banding protocols. He is pursuing graduate studies in ornithology as an avenue towards conservation work. Bow is currently studying alpine bird populations in Washington State and preparing for Bornean bird ID by studying species characteristics, vocalizations, and assisting with acoustic tests. Bow’s passion for the Pacific Northwest mountain environments drives his interest in protecting wilderness. 

 

What We Need

Funds raised through this campaign will assist in paying for:

Airfare ($4,500)

Travel costs ($1,500)

Funds will be utilized regardless of whether the total fundraising goal is met. All funds raised will go toward the above categories with priority on airfare.

 

The Impact

As a contributor to our campaign, you will be helping us access this once-in-a-lifetime volunteering opportunity and enhancing our potential to make meaningful contributions to this research. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our campaign on social media!

story:
Here we go......

 

Who am I?

My name is Sapphyre, and I have a dream....

Since going vegan over a year ago, and joining many vegan and environmental groups on different sites, it was quickly brought to my attention how much we need to do as individuals to create a better world for us to live in and to stop destroying our planet. Not just for us, but for future generations.

I tried to make a conscious effort to change the way I lived, and endeavoured to become less wasteful. I'm not perfect. Nobody is. But all it takes is one small step by many to make a huge impact. But the lack of resources and alternatives can sometimes prove to be a hindrance.

They say it takes more than one person to make a change, but perhaps by opening this store and providing people with not just what we want, but what we need, it will be the start of something good

 

So what's the deal?

Plastic waste has been at the forefront of the news recently, but this isn't a new problem. It has been around for years, but only now are we realising the extent of this issue.

Everywhere we look nowadays, almost everything is covered in plastic. Our food, our toiletries, even our household products. It uses a huge amount of resources to create or even recycle plastics. It is not sustainable, and much of our waste ends up in the ocean.

 

But it's not just plastic. We've become a 'throwaway' society. We live for convenience. But at what cost?

'Out of sight, out of mind' they say. Do we know what happens to the things we throw away? They clog up our landfills - if they ever get there. 

Whatever happened to the days when we used to keep and reuse things? Purchasing things that would last. A simpler time when almost everything was package free.

The average household in the UK produces more than a tonne of waste every year. Isn't it time something changed?

 

OK, what's the plan?

By going package free, we can eliminate the need for single-use plastics.

At Urban Forager, every item will be Zero Waste. For the bulk dry food products, oils, spices, etc. customers can bring their own container to fill up with the product of their choice or purchase a jar in-store for that purpose.

Other products (ie bamboo toothbrushes) will be packaged in recyclable or compostable material.

But it doesn't stop there. We are even planning to fit out the store with recycled/reclaimed materials and furniture. Zero Waste indeed!

 

How you can help....

By contributing, even just a little, you are helping to make this dream a reality!

You can help to put Eastbourne on the map as being  a pioneer, bringing us one step closer to being plastic free.

This store is for anybody and everybody. This store is for you.

For the new millenials looking to reduce their eco footprint by being 'greener', to the golden generation who can 'step back in time' to a simpler age when almost everything was package free. The store will almost certainly be a nostalgic experience.

I am keeping the crowdfunding as a 'flexible goal' as I am determined to open up the store regardless of how much is raised. We need this! We owe it to our planet!

But it's not just money that will help - volunteers are always welcome, as well as any advice, help in sourcing reclaimed materials and furniture. Anything will be received with the deepest gratitude! 

This store is for all of us!

 

What do we need?

The goal is £13,500. The breakdown is as follows:

  • Rent and fees                                                                                                     3,900
  • Shop Fixtures and Fittings (including dispensers and scales)         6,500
  • Initial Stock                                                                                                         2,500
  • Miscellaneous expenses (insurance, legal fees etc)                                600

                                                                                                                                       

 

Even if we do not reach this goal, I will attempt to open the store even on a small scale. Eastbourne will get their plastic-free store one way or another.

 

What you can receive

Various Perks available from reusable straws and bamboo toothbrushes to lifetime discounts.

Check the Perks Tab at the side of this page for more info.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Money isn't everything. If there is any other way you can help please contact us. We are looking for volunteers to clean up and fit out the store, ways to source reclaimed wood, material, furniture etc., and well, basically people to spread the word!

Please share this campaign! With your friends, family, co-workers, and anyone you think may be interested!

Check out our facebook page : www.facebook.com/urbanforagereastbourne and like and share.

Thank you all!

 

photo credit sea ~ survival equals action (facebook)

 

other credits:

drawings by Claire @clairesnaturefriendlylife
