story:
“ In the end we will preserve only what we love. We will love only what we understand. We will understand only what we are  taught“ 

"Al final conservaremos sólo lo que amemos; amaremos sólo lo que entendamos y entenderemos sólo lo que nos hayan enseñado"

                                                     (Baba Dioum)

Breve reseña 

Brief

Si estás leyendo esto es porque juntos crearemos Chiapas Legado Verde, libro dedicado especialmente a conocer y entender, admirar y amar el valor de la vida silvestre en este sureño rincón tropical de México.

Intérnate con nosotros en el lente de los fotógrafos de naturaleza: Jorge Silva Rivera, Sergio Pedrero Villanueva  y Luis F. Rivera Lezama, quienes a partir de múltiples viajes realizados dentro de la compleja geografía de la entidad chiapaneca, han sido testigos además de la gran belleza natural que aún existe; de la vulnerabilidad y enorme destrucción de las áreas silvestres en este estado mexicano, en donde el verde de la selva exhuberante y llena de vida se está transformando en un verde abiótico de pastizales y monocultivos.

If you are reading this, it means you are part of the ingroup that will help create: Chiapas Legado Verde (Chiapas, Mexico´s Green Legacy). Book specifcally dedicated for the knowledge and understanding, for those who admire and love the value of wild life in this southern tropical mexican corner.

Walk with us through the lens of nature photographers: Jorge Silva Rivera, Sergio Pedrero Villanueva and Luis F. Rivera Lezama, whom have travelled far and near through the complex geography of the state of Chiapas, Mexico, and have witnessed in addition to the marvellous beauty that still stands; the vulnerability and vast destruction of wild life in this mexican state, where the green and overabundant live forest is becomining abiotic green, with monoculture and pasture farming.

EXATEC del SURESTE te invita a que participes y te sumes al esfuerzo de estos profesionales de la lente, quienes documentarán fotográficamente durante un año, los diversos ecosistemas de las más de 70 áreas naturales protegidas de Chiapas y de sus zonas de amortiguamiento. El resultado de este esfuerzo expondrá en hermosas imágenes la compleja interacción de los seres vivos en su entorno natural y la importancia de conservarlos. Mediante el uso de la tecnología de realidad aumentada incluida en este libro, te sumergirás en una explosión de colores, formas y texturas de la vida en este  particular universo silvestre.

EXATEC del Sureste (Southeastern Monterrey Institute of Technology and Higher Education Alumni) Extend a cordial invitation to take part in this humanitarian project on an active based participation, in a joint effort with these professional photographers whom will document extensively during one whole year distinctive ecosystems found within more than 70 Natural Protected Areas and their buffer zones of the state of Chiapas, Mexico. As a result of this enormous venture, there will be a marvelous outcome of beautiful pictures portraying the most complex natural environment in which this wild life interacts. And most of all the importance of the conservation of their habitat for the preservation of wildlife. This pictorial book will include the use of Augmented Reality technology, adding a unique form of total immersion, that will allow the reader first hand view and a colorful on the scene experience.


¡Pónle color y calor! Abracemos juntos la iniciativa de legar a las futuras generaciones de una memoria gráfica de la gran riqueza natural de México en Chiapas.

Add warmth and color! Let us embrace the initiative for the most important legacy concerning a graphic memory of the vast natural resource found at Chiapas, Mexico.



Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Chiapas Legado Verde representa:

·  Más de 20 fotógrafos de naturaleza participando

·  Más de 300 días de trabajo de campo

·  Más de 100,000 imágenes de la situación actual que guarda nuestro entorno

·  Más de 1´276,000 hectáreas recorridas en las áreas silvestres

·  Más de 15,000 kilómetros por tierra

·  Más de 5,000 kilómetros por aire

·  Más de 300 kilómetros por agua


What do we need and what do you obtain

Chiapas Green Legacy represents:

. More than 20 professional nature photographers participating

. More than 300 field work days

. More than 100,000 pictorial images portraying todays natural environment

.  More than 3,153,064 Acres

.  More than 10,000 miles by land

.  More tan 300 kilometers of water resource


Realizar esta tarea tiene un valor de cuatro millones doscientos mil pesos mexicanos por lo que necesitamos tu apoyo para conseguir esta meta

Únete al interés de los egresados del Tecnológico de Monterrey que integramos la mesa directiva EXATEC del SURESTE y ayúdanos a crear conciencias y a permanecer en el tiempo.

This venture has an estimate cost of at least 250,000 USD, this is why we are in need of your collaboration to be able to reach the desired goal.

Unite and be part of this great project presented by the board of directors of (EXATEC del SURESTE) the Southeastern Monterrey Institute of Technology and Higher Education Alumni. And help us awaken the conscience of so many that can help preserve the wonders of wildlife and its habitat at this specific part of the world.

Elige tu recompensa

· Certificado de Agradecimiento

· Playera con diseño exclusivo Chiapas Legado Verde

· Calendario 2016 de la Reserva de la Biósfera “El Triunfo”. (Chiapas, México).

·  Fotografía seriada del Quetzal, el ave mítica de mesoamérica.

·  Serie de fotografías autografiadas

·  El Libro Chiapas Legado Verde en versión digital (Cd)

·  Tu nombre impreso en el libro LEGADO VERDE

·  Viaje a la Reserva de la Biósfera “El Triunfo”. (Chiapas, México).

Select your reward

.  A Gratitude Diploma.

. A specialy designed, exclusive T-Shirt displaying the Chiapas Green Legacy logo.

. A pictorial 2016 Almanac of the Biosphere Reserve in Chiapas, Mexico El Triunfo.

.  A unique serial pictorial image of the mythical bird of Mesoamerica. The Quetzal.

.  A collection of autographed photographies.

. The (CD) digital version of the Book Green Legacy.

.  Your name will be included as an active participant in the Book.

.  An only by special invitation to the Biosphere Reserve El Triunfo (Chiapas, Mexico).


El impacto

La ecología no se puede comprender con exactitud si insistimos en separarla del factor social. El camino indicado para la conservación es difundir, enseñar y hacer partícipe a nuestra sociedad de lo que realmente está sucediendo en el planeta en este preciso momento.

Chiapas Legado Verde es un proyecto dedicado especialmente a valorar la vida silvestre, la belleza de la naturaleza que aún permanece, que forma parte de un asombroso y único legado natural y cultural que nos comparte este mundo y para entender las circunstancias en las cuales la vida se abre paso a través de su convivencia con nosotros los seres humanos.

The Impact

Ecology can not be well understood if we insist on the study of it, as an independent science without considering Social Factors. The best road for conservation is through Promotion, Teaching, and active Participation of society, awaking what is really happening today.

Ecology can not be well understood if we insist on the study of it, as an independent science without considering Social Factors. The best road for conservation is through Promotion, Teaching, and active Participation of society, awaking what is really happening today.


Riesgos y desafíos

La fotografía juega un crítico, aunque rara vez reconocido papel en la conservación ilustrando la belleza del mundo natural y las formas en las cuales está siendo dañado y destruido. Aún es posible tocar el corazón de la gente y cambiar la manera en que pensamos y actuamos. La fotografía es una herramienta que lo hace de una forma en que muchas veces las palabras no pueden.

Risks and Challenges

Photography plays a critical but seldom acknowledged role in the conservation of wildlife, illustrating the beauty and wonders of nature, and the many ways that it is being harmed and destroyed. It is still possible to touch the heart and ways of the people, helping them change their thoughts and actions towards nature.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Si no puedes contribuir económicamente, no significa que no puedas ayudar:

  • COMPARTE, DIFUNDE, DIVULGA a tráves de las redes sociales.

Other ways you can help

If you are not able to financially contribute, this does not mean you cannot help:

  • SHARE, PROMOTE AND SPREAD the existance of this project through social networks.
story_txt:
“ In the
end we will preserve only what we love. We will love only what we understand.
We will understand only what we are  taught“ 
"Al final conservaremos sólo lo que amemos; amaremos sólo lo que entendamos y entenderemos sólo lo que nos hayan enseñado" 


                                                     (Baba Dioum)

Breve reseña 
Brief
Si estás leyendo esto es porque juntos crearemos Chiapas
Legado Verde, libro dedicado especialmente a conocer y entender, admirar y amar el valor de la vida silvestre en este sureño
rincón tropical de México.Intérnate con nosotros en el lente de los fotógrafos de naturaleza:
Jorge Silva Rivera, Sergio Pedrero Villanueva  y Luis F. Rivera Lezama, quienes a partir de múltiples viajes realizados dentro de la compleja geografía de
la entidad chiapaneca, han sido testigos además de la gran belleza natural que aún existe; de la vulnerabilidad y enorme destrucción de las áreas silvestres en este estado mexicano, en donde el verde de la selva exhuberante y llena de vida se está transformando en un verde abiótico de pastizales y monocultivos.If you are reading this, it means you are part of the ingroup that will
help create: Chiapas Legado Verde (Chiapas, Mexico´s Green Legacy). Book
specifcally dedicated for the knowledge and understanding, for those who admire
and love the value of wild life in this southern tropical mexican corner.Walk with us through the lens of nature photographers: Jorge Silva
Rivera, Sergio Pedrero Villanueva and Luis F. Rivera Lezama, whom have
travelled far and near through the complex geography of the state of Chiapas,
Mexico, and have witnessed in addition to the marvellous beauty that still
stands; the vulnerability and vast destruction of wild life in this mexican
state, where the green and overabundant live forest is becomining abiotic
green, with monoculture and pasture farming.EXATEC del SURESTE te invita a que participes y te sumes al esfuerzo
de estos profesionales de la lente, quienes documentarán fotográficamente
durante un año, los diversos ecosistemas de las más de 70 áreas naturales
protegidas de Chiapas y de sus zonas de amortiguamiento. El resultado de este
esfuerzo expondrá en hermosas imágenes la compleja interacción de los seres vivos en
su entorno natural y la importancia de conservarlos. Mediante el uso de la tecnología de realidad aumentada incluida en este libro, te sumergirás en una
explosión de colores, formas y texturas de la vida en este  particular universo silvestre.
EXATEC
del Sureste (Southeastern Monterrey Institute of Technology and Higher
Education Alumni) Extend a cordial invitation to take part in this humanitarian
project on an active based participation, in a joint effort with these
professional photographers whom will document extensively during one whole year
distinctive ecosystems found within more than 70 Natural Protected Areas and
their buffer zones of the state of Chiapas, Mexico. As a result of this
enormous venture, there will be a marvelous outcome of beautiful pictures
portraying the most complex natural environment in which this wild life
interacts. And most of all the importance of the conservation of their habitat
for the preservation of wildlife. This pictorial book will include the use of
Augmented Reality technology, adding a unique form of total immersion, that
will allow the reader first hand view and a colorful on the scene experience. 

¡Pónle color y calor! Abracemos
juntos la iniciativa de legar a las futuras generaciones de una memoria gráfica
de la gran riqueza natural de México en Chiapas.
Add warmth
and color! Let us embrace the initiative for the most important legacy
concerning a graphic memory of the vast natural resource found at Chiapas,
Mexico.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Chiapas
Legado Verde representa:

· 
Más de 20 fotógrafos de naturaleza
participando
· 
Más de 300 días de trabajo de campo
· 
Más de 100,000 imágenes de la situación actual
que guarda nuestro entorno
· 
Más de 1´276,000 hectáreas recorridas en las áreas silvestres
· 
Más de 15,000 kilómetros por tierra
· 
Más de 5,000 kilómetros por aire· 
Más de 300 kilómetros por agua
What do we need and what do you obtain
Chiapas Green Legacy represents:
. More than 20 professional nature photographers participating 

. More than 300 field work days 

. More than 100,000 pictorial images portraying todays natural
environment
.  More than 3,153,064 Acres

.  More than 10,000 miles by land

.  More tan 300 kilometers of water
resource
Realizar esta tarea tiene un valor de cuatro
millones doscientos mil pesos mexicanos por lo que necesitamos tu apoyo para
conseguir esta meta 

Únete al interés de los egresados del
Tecnológico de Monterrey que integramos la mesa directiva EXATEC del SURESTE
y ayúdanos a crear conciencias y a permanecer en el tiempo.
This venture has an estimate cost of at least 250,000 USD, this is why we
are in need of your collaboration to be able to reach the desired goal. 



Unite and be part of this great project
presented by the board of directors of (EXATEC del SURESTE) the Southeastern
Monterrey Institute of Technology and Higher Education Alumni. And help us awaken
the conscience of so many that can help preserve the wonders of wildlife and
its habitat at this specific part of the world. 
Elige tu recompensa
· Certificado de Agradecimiento· Playera con diseño exclusivo Chiapas Legado Verde
· Calendario 2016 de la Reserva de la Biósfera “El
Triunfo”. (Chiapas, México).
· 
Fotografía seriada del Quetzal, el ave mítica de mesoamérica.
· 
Serie de fotografías autografiadas·  El Libro Chiapas Legado Verde en versión digital (Cd)
· 
Tu nombre impreso en el libro LEGADO VERDE
· 
Viaje a la Reserva de la Biósfera “El Triunfo”.
(Chiapas, México).
Select your reward

.  A Gratitude Diploma.

. A specialy designed, exclusive T-Shirt displaying the Chiapas Green Legacy
logo.

. A pictorial 2016 Almanac of the Biosphere Reserve in Chiapas, Mexico El
Triunfo.

.  A unique serial pictorial image of
the mythical bird of Mesoamerica. The Quetzal.

.  A collection of autographed
photographies.

. The (CD) digital version of the
Book Green Legacy.

.  Your name will be included as an
active participant in the Book.


.  An only
by special invitation to the Biosphere Reserve El Triunfo (Chiapas, Mexico).El impactoLa
ecología no se puede comprender con exactitud si insistimos en separarla del
factor social. El camino indicado para la conservación es difundir, enseñar y hacer partícipe a nuestra sociedad de lo que
realmente está sucediendo en el planeta en este preciso momento.
Chiapas Legado
Verde es un proyecto dedicado especialmente a valorar la
vida silvestre, la belleza de la naturaleza que aún permanece, que forma parte
de un asombroso y único legado natural y cultural que nos comparte este mundo y
para entender las circunstancias en las cuales la vida se abre paso a través de
su convivencia con nosotros los seres humanos.
The Impact

Ecology can not be well understood if we insist on the study of it, as an
independent science without considering Social Factors. The best road for
conservation is through Promotion, Teaching, and active Participation of
society, awaking what is really happening today.
Ecology can not be well understood if we insist on the study of it, as an
independent science without considering Social Factors. The best road for
conservation is through Promotion, Teaching, and active Participation of
society, awaking what is really happening today.

Riesgos y desafíos
La fotografía
juega un crítico, aunque rara vez reconocido papel en la conservación ilustrando
la belleza del mundo natural y las formas en las cuales está siendo dañado y
destruido. Aún es posible tocar el corazón de la gente y cambiar la manera en
que pensamos y actuamos. La fotografía
es una herramienta que lo hace de una forma en que muchas veces las palabras no
pueden.Risks
and Challenges
Photography plays a critical but seldom acknowledged role in
the conservation of wildlife, illustrating the beauty and wonders of nature, and the many ways that it is being harmed and destroyed. It is still possible to touch the heart
and ways of the people, helping them change their thoughts and actions towards
nature.
Otras formas en
las que puedes ayudar
Si no puedes contribuir económicamente, no
significa que no puedas ayudar:

COMPARTE, DIFUNDE, DIVULGA a tráves de las redes sociales.


Other ways you can help
If you are not able to financially contribute, this does not mean you cannot
help:
SHARE,
PROMOTE AND SPREAD the existance of this project through social networks.

story:
Nicknamed God's Own County, Yorkshire is the greenest county in the UK, thanks to vast stretches of unspoiled countryside in the Yorkshire Dales.

For now.

Our countryside is under threat in the name of money. Government plans to create a "Northern Powerhouse", and energy company plans for fracking, mining, motorway extension and more put our land under threat.

The argument claims that the economic benefits outweigh the environmental cost.

My argument says "get off my land".

The problem? It's not my land. Not legally. Our birth right means nothing if a few people can get richer by destroying it.

Our goal is simple: Protect it.

Our immediate challenge is establishing a "base of operations" where communities can gather and meet, organise, and reverse some of the damage that has already been done.

For £10,000, we can buy a relatively small piece of land, and create a modest wildlife sanctuary, giving plants and animals facing habitat loss somewhere to survive.

We ideally want to reach a humble target of at least £50,000 pounds. This, and a bit of direct action, would allow us to create an off grid, environmentally sound neolithic community. Not only would be able to defend the land we owned, restore and protect the wildlife, but we could also live on it.

At £150,000 we can create a community, no direct action required, while also extending the amount of land we own. The logic is very simple - the more we own, the more we can defend. If our government won't say no to fracking, and potash mining, we can.

We want to take £1,000,000. This would give us enough acres to be a serious, influential force to shape the face of Yorkshire for generations. Yes, that's not going to happen, but we can dream, right?


If you don't understand my accent in the video, a transcript is available.

story:
Indiegogo

Self-sustainable Farm in Nepal

1.  Who are we ?

We are a Swiss-Nepali family of three.

A.     Caspar Eigelsreiter
He was born 29th of August 1990 in Switzerland. He speaks fluently French, German and Nepali. After finishing College, he went to do his duty in the Swiss Army during thirteen months, in which period he became a first lieutenant. The year after (2013), he went to Nepal for five months to experience Nepali culture and life and to learn Nepali, and it is during that stay that he met his future wife Jyoti Rana Magar. He went back to Switzerland for ten months to work and the next year (2014) he got married with Jyoti on the 5th of September. Since then he lives in Nepal and tries to build a self-sustainable farm.

B.     Jyoti and Sharaï Rana Magar
Jyoti was born on 30th of November 1993 in Carghare in Solukhumbu District (near Mt Everest) in Nepal. She worked for her grandfather and grandmother since her youngest age, be in the fields or helping out with the different animals of the household. She only went to school for three years, but learned to write and read in English and Nepali in those few years. Departing from her home district, she went to Nuwakot District to work for a Sherpa family in a farm for five years. It is where she met Caspar.
Sharaï was born on 1st of January 2016, seven months after the 2015 earthquake, which hit her parents house as well.

2.  Why do we campaign ?

A.     We are building a self-sustainable farm, to have the least possible negative impact on the environment.

B.     We hope to provide high quality goods, like vegetables, cheese, milk and meat to the local community.

C.     We try to improve our farming process, without machines and without any industrial chemicals to go back to a simpler agriculture, but with the modern understanding of farming, like permaculture.

3.  What would you achieve by helping us ?

A.     Improvement in the disposition of the terraces. Our land is steep and can only be cultivated after building terraces, which are prone to earth slides during the rainy season (June to September). To improve size and stability, the need for stronger, bigger walls arises, which would provide perfect growing places for rampant plants, like cucumber or pumpkin.

B.     Energy would be provided mainly by multiple solar panels for the electric needs of house and farm.

C.     Building a Biogas facility would provide all the gas needed for cooking and if need be to light the house.

D.     To make cheese, the need of a cellar arises.

E.     With the heavy rains of the monsoon and the colder days of winter, multiple greenhouse would enable us to grow all around the year, be it tomatoes or chilly pepper, or even green beans.

F.     Lastly, crops need a storage place, that is dry, but dark. We would build a warehouse for our different crops; potatoes, wheat, corn, sweet potatoes, soybeans, etc…

4.  Where do the funds go ?

A.     Terraces, cellar and biogas facility: 3000 USD

B.     Greenhouses: 500 USD

C.     Solar Panels: 3000 USD

D.     Warehouse: 3000 USD

Those numbers are an approximation and can vary a lot.

5.  Our perks ?

A.     We would be happy to have you as guests in our home, if you ever visit Nepal (max. 2 pers.)

B.     We can send you T-shirts or cups with your name on our farm’s photos background.

6.  What kind of impact do we have ?

A.     We lower our impact on the environment by seeking alternative energies.

B.     We provide organic healthy foods.

C.     We escape the capitalist and consumerist system to advertise an ideal based on collaboration and not money.

D.     We want to be an example for farmers of our region. We would give them hope, by constructing an economically viable self-sustainable farm.

7.  What are the risks you take and the challenges we face ?

A.     Problem: Even if the funds are ready, it can take a lot of time to start building, because we have a lot of daily work that has to be done before we can think of doing something else.

Solution: Building the different aspects of the project one by one, step by step, without starting it all at once.

B.     Problem: As our fields are used for crops during most of the time, we can only build between harvest and planting.

Solution: Thinking ahead during planting, by freeing the terraces that need to be modified.

C.     Problem: During monsoon, the project would be mainly at a still stand because of the amount of rain falling.

Solution: We will use the months without rain to do as much as possible.

D.     Problem: We do not have an access road to our house.

Solution: Carry the goods ourselves, or pay a local worker to get it done.

F.     Problem: We lack the knowledge to build efficient greenhouses and the biogas facility.

Solution: Seek out, in both instances, associations with the required knowledge before even thinking about starting to build.

8.  How can you help us ?

A.     Donate !

B.     Donate !

C.     Oh, I forgot: Donate !

D.     What ? You don’t have the means to donate ? No problem ! Share the project with all your friends and let them donate, yes ?

E.     What ? You don’t know how to share ? Go to Indiegogo.com and use their sharing tools to get the word out !

F.     Donate ! (Didn’t I say that already ?)

G.     And Thanks !

Solution: Seek out, in both instances, associations with the required knowledge before even thinking about starting to build.
8.  How can you help us ?
A.     Donate !
B.     Donate !
C.     Oh, I forgot: Donate !
D.     What ? You don’t have the means to donate ? No problem ! Share the project with all your friends and let them donate, yes ?
E.     What ? You don’t know how to share ? Go to Indiegogo.com and use their sharing tools to get the word out !
F.     Donate ! (Didn’t I say that already ?)
G.     And Thanks !

story:
BACKGROUND

Lions probably speak more directly to people than any other wild species. Through art, through literature, through symbolism and heraldry, through representations on flags and national emblems, lions have a universality that appeals regardless of culture, race, and national origin. Lions represent such a strong image to the world that words cannot but fail to express the true level of their iconic impact.

Lions represent hope and future, courage and strength, royalty and power. But they are also so very fragile and needing of our protection. We have all failed in the past to protect lions and to do what we innovatively could have done years ago. Lions are now an endangered species, and we have watched the decline from the sidelines for far too long.

It is now up to us to have the courage, fortitude, and strength to protect and conserve a species globally representative of the freedom and importance of wild animals. It can be done, but not without your dedicated support.

LionAid, together with an Ethiopian NGO (Alchemy World Projects) has the opportunity to engage with the Ethiopian Wildlife Conservation Authority and Provincial Authorities to lay the groundwork for a comprehensive lion conservation programme.

HEADING THE LIONAID TEAM

 LionAid, a charity dedicated to lions and new visions for their conservation in the future, is spearheaded by Dr Pieter Kat and Christine Macsween:

Dr Pieter Kat is an internationally acknowledged expert on lions and is regularly consulted by African governments on lion conservation issues. Pieter was born in Singapore (the Lion City) and spent his early life in Singapore, Malaysia and New Guinea where his interest in biology took root. His tertiary education took place in the USA where he gained a BSc at the University of Rochester (Biology and Geology), an MSc in Marine Biology at the University of Delaware and an MA and PhD in Ecology and Evolution at Johns Hopkins University.

Next he spent ten years working at the National Museums of Kenya to develop and enhance biological research programmes, including studies of biodiversity in the African Great Lakes, genetic diversity among bovid species (eg antelopes) of East Africa, genetics and ecology of predators of the Masai Mara and other areas (African Wild Dogs, Lions, African Wild Cats, Servals and Jackals), and diseases likely to affect predators across Kenya.

This was followed by two years at the University of California, Davis School of Veterinary Medicine and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention in Atlanta, USA researching rabies virus genetics, African horse sickness, canine distemper, Rift Valley Fever and bluetongue virus amongst carnivores.

Pieter was then invited by the Government of Botswana to study lion populations and to make recommendations for their conservation, and established the Okavango Lion Conservation Programme in northern Botswana. The lion research focused on ecology, reproduction, disease prevalence and human/wildlife conflict. After twelve years in Botswana, he is now focused on a diversity of activities through the charity LionAid to assist the conservation of lions such as working with decision makers in the UK, EU and African lion range states to ensure better protection of remaining lions, seeking sustainable means of reducing lion/livestock conflict, encouraging further research on diseases threatening lions and calling for lion population surveys.

Pieter continues to play an important role in scientific research and has authored more than 70 scientific papers to date. He regularly works with media (Radio, television and newspapers) sharing his deep knowledge of Lions.

Christine Macsween  is an integral and highly respected figure within lion conservation, whose diligent lobbying has resulted in ongoing, proactive, political, discussions addressing the plight of the species.

Her passion and wealth of knowledge regarding the Lion, is evident through her many media interviews, both nationally and internationally, making her a highly sought after contributor to the cause.

Chris obtained her BA in Manchester in 1979. In 1998 she was admitted as a Fellow of the Institute of Chartered Management Accountants (CIMA). She served on the CIMA Council between 2002 and 2006. She is also a Fellow of the Royal Society of Arts.  For the last ten years, Chris has been applauded as an engaging and educated public speaker, who has held court in large conservation events in the United Kingdom, the EU and beyond.

Chris also works with Dr Kat delivering higher education presentations and lectures. In addition to this, LionAid run regular skype lessons bringing lions into classrooms across the globe.

HEADING THE ALCHEMY WORLD TEAM

Carlo Tortora Brayda launched Alchemy World in 2006, a humanitarian aid agency based in East Africa focusing on delivering poverty alleviation and economic growth through private sector development and entrepreneurship. During this time he was Trade and Industry Advisor to the Ethiopian Government and its President. He also took assignments for the United Nations International Labour Organization, and the United Nations International Childrens Fund (UNICEF). He remains Non Executive Chairman of Alchemy World, and heavily engaged in Corporate Social Responsibility.

HIH Prince Joel David Makonnen Haile Selassie is the great-grandson of His Majesty Emperor Haile Selassie I of Ethiopia and 5th in the line of succession to the Imperial throne. His lineal ancestors are said to trace far back three millennia into Biblical history; all the way back to King Solomon "the Wise", son and successor to King David of ancient Israel. He is a Director of Alchemy World Projects and a Brand Ambassador for this campaign.

WHY DO ETHIOPIAN LIONS MATTER SO MUCH?

Both teams are increasingly concerned that lions are silently sliding into extinction pan Africa and feel strongly that the next country to lose its wild lion population could well be Ethiopia – whose lions are genetically unique but not yet internationally recognised as a fourth sub species of lion (a scientific paper written in 2011 and published in 2013 detailing the genetics of these lions can be accessed here), and with tremendous cultural and historical value in Ethiopia. Such a loss, and maybe only five years away would be nationally and internationally mourned and we must do everything we can to prevent this catastrophe from becoming a reality.

THE PROJECT IN DETAIL

It is clear that an URGENT programme is needed to assess the numbers of surviving populations of lions in Ethiopia, to stabilise their populations and secure their habitats and to eventually allow future population increases.

LionAid, together with Alchemy World Projects has the opportunity to engage with the Ethiopian Wildlife Conservation Authority and Provincial Authorities to lay the groundwork for a comprehensive lion conservation programme.

The funding we have called for in this campaign will allow us to do the following:

  • Identify and support an Ethiopian PhD student who will eventually assume local supervision and implementation of the project.
  • Conduct a full lion count in accessible regions of Ethiopia with reliable and replicable methods, concentrating initially on Awash National Park.
  • Place telemetry collars on selected lions to allow monitoring.
  • Establish continuous monitoring of lion trends, habitat quality, other carnivores and prey base throughout the lion range.
  • Research on lion ecology and relationship with local communities.
  • Create a database on human-lion conflict in the study area.
  • Research illegal trade in lion and lion products.
  • Establish a genetic and disease database for Ethiopian lions to identify populations of special concern and conservation priority – including establishing a central dedicated cryopreservation facility to allow long term storage of a diversity of wildlife samples.

 

Each of these goals could be achieved in isolation if we don’t raise the funding we need and in which case we will prioritise the goals in line with the monies donated to support the project. But obviously, the more money we can raise, the quicker we can achieve all the above and move the project to the next stage - to establish, with the full support of the Ethiopian Wildlife Conservation Authority, a comprehensive lion conservation programme.

RISKS

Ethiopia borders a number of unstable countries to the south (Somalia), to the west (South Sudan) and to the north (Eritrea). While there are reportedly lion populations along those border areas, this project will focus initially on lion populations with a high probability of immediate survival - those located in the centre of Ethiopia - Awash National Park. Another potentially problematic situation is the current structure of wildlife conservation authorities which is split between the federal government and the various autonomous provinces. However these different authorities have in the past worked well together to ensure survival of Ethiopia's endangered wildlife regardless of location of that wildlife. There is a huge willingness on the part of the federal Government to ensure that Ethiopia's national wildlife heritage is safeguarded for future generations - the Ethiopian people have a strong cultural connection to lions. 

 

WHAT YOU CAN DO TO HELP

Every single donation is valuable and will help us achieve each of the goals listed in the project details. It is now up to us to have the courage, fortitude, and strength to find the means to protect and conserve a species globally representative of the freedom and importance of wild animals. It can be done, but not without your dedicated support.

Your support can come in other ways too! Please share this campaign appeal with all your friends and family. Use the share tools that Indiegogo provides to spread the word to as many people around the world as possible. Together we can win for lions and save Ethiopia's unique lion heritage.
story_txt:
BACKGROUND
Lions probably speak more directly to people than any other wild species. Through art, through literature, through symbolism and heraldry, through representations on flags and national emblems, lions have a universality that appeals regardless of culture, race, and national origin. Lions represent such a strong image to the world that words cannot but fail to express the true level of their iconic impact.
Lions represent hope and future, courage and strength, royalty and power. But they are also so very fragile and needing of our protection. We have all failed in the past to protect lions and to do what we innovatively could have done years ago. Lions are now an endangered species, and we have watched the decline from the sidelines for far too long.
It is now up to us to have the courage, fortitude, and strength to protect and conserve a species globally representative of the freedom and importance of wild animals. It can be done, but not without your dedicated support.
LionAid, together with an Ethiopian NGO (Alchemy World Projects) has the opportunity to engage with the Ethiopian Wildlife Conservation Authority and Provincial Authorities to lay the groundwork for a comprehensive lion conservation programme.
HEADING THE LIONAID TEAM

 LionAid, a charity dedicated to lions and new visions for their conservation in the future, is spearheaded by Dr Pieter Kat and Christine Macsween:
Dr Pieter Kat is an internationally acknowledged expert on lions and is regularly consulted by African governments on lion conservation issues. Pieter was born in Singapore (the Lion City) and spent his early life in Singapore, Malaysia and New Guinea where his interest in biology took root. His tertiary education took place in the USA where he gained a BSc at the University of Rochester (Biology and Geology), an MSc in Marine Biology at the University of Delaware and an MA and PhD in Ecology and Evolution at Johns Hopkins University.
Next he spent ten years working at the National Museums of Kenya to develop and enhance biological research programmes, including studies of biodiversity in the African Great Lakes, genetic diversity among bovid species (eg antelopes) of East Africa, genetics and ecology of predators of the Masai Mara and other areas (African Wild Dogs, Lions, African Wild Cats, Servals and Jackals), and diseases likely to affect predators across Kenya.
This was followed by two years at the University of California, Davis School of Veterinary Medicine and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention in Atlanta, USA researching rabies virus genetics, African horse sickness, canine distemper, Rift Valley Fever and bluetongue virus amongst carnivores.
Pieter was then invited by the Government of Botswana to study lion populations and to make recommendations for their conservation, and established the Okavango Lion Conservation Programme in northern Botswana. The lion research focused on ecology, reproduction, disease prevalence and human/wildlife conflict. After twelve years in Botswana, he is now focused on a diversity of activities through the charity LionAid to assist the conservation of lions such as working with decision makers in the UK, EU and African lion range states to ensure better protection of remaining lions, seeking sustainable means of reducing lion/livestock conflict, encouraging further research on diseases threatening lions and calling for lion population surveys.
Pieter continues to play an important role in scientific research and has authored more than 70 scientific papers to date. He regularly works with media (Radio, television and newspapers) sharing his deep knowledge of Lions.
Christine Macsween  is an integral and highly respected figure within lion conservation, whose diligent lobbying has resulted in ongoing, proactive, political, discussions addressing the plight of the species.
Her passion and wealth of knowledge regarding the Lion, is evident through her many media interviews, both nationally and internationally, making her a highly sought after contributor to the cause.
Chris obtained her BA in Manchester in 1979. In 1998 she was admitted as a Fellow of the Institute of Chartered Management Accountants (CIMA). She served on the CIMA Council between 2002 and 2006. She is also a Fellow of the Royal Society of Arts.  For the last ten years, Chris has been applauded as an engaging and educated public speaker, who has held court in large conservation events in the United Kingdom, the EU and beyond.
Chris also works with Dr Kat delivering higher education presentations and lectures. In addition to this, LionAid run regular skype lessons bringing lions into classrooms across the globe.
HEADING THE ALCHEMY WORLD TEAM
Carlo Tortora Brayda launched Alchemy World in 2006, a humanitarian aid agency based in East Africa focusing on delivering poverty alleviation and economic growth through private sector development and entrepreneurship. During this time he was Trade and Industry Advisor to the Ethiopian Government and its President. He also took assignments for the United Nations International Labour Organization, and the United Nations International Childrens Fund (UNICEF). He remains Non Executive Chairman of Alchemy World, and heavily engaged in Corporate Social Responsibility.
HIH Prince Joel David Makonnen Haile Selassie is the great-grandson of His Majesty Emperor Haile Selassie I of Ethiopia and 5th in the line of succession to the Imperial throne. His lineal ancestors are said to trace far back three millennia into Biblical history; all the way back to King Solomon "the Wise", son and successor to King David of ancient Israel. He is a Director of Alchemy World Projects and a Brand Ambassador for this campaign.
WHY DO ETHIOPIAN LIONS MATTER SO MUCH?

Both teams are increasingly concerned that lions are silently sliding into extinction pan Africa and feel strongly that the next country to lose its wild lion population could well be Ethiopia – whose lions are genetically unique but not yet internationally recognised as a fourth sub species of lion (a scientific paper written in 2011 and published in 2013 detailing the genetics of these lions can be accessed here), and with tremendous cultural and historical value in Ethiopia. Such a loss, and maybe only five years away would be nationally and internationally mourned and we must do everything we can to prevent this catastrophe from becoming a reality.
THE PROJECT IN DETAIL
It is clear that an URGENT programme is needed to assess the numbers of surviving populations of lions in Ethiopia, to stabilise their populations and secure their habitats and to eventually allow future population increases.
LionAid, together with Alchemy World Projects has the opportunity to engage with the Ethiopian Wildlife Conservation Authority and Provincial Authorities to lay the groundwork for a comprehensive lion conservation programme.
The funding we have called for in this campaign will allow us to do the following:

Identify and support an Ethiopian PhD student who will eventually assume local supervision and implementation of the project.
Conduct a full lion count in accessible regions of Ethiopia with reliable and replicable methods, concentrating initially on Awash National Park.

Place telemetry collars on selected lions to allow monitoring.
Establish continuous monitoring of lion trends, habitat quality, other carnivores and prey base throughout the lion range.
Research on lion ecology and relationship with local communities.
Create a database on human-lion conflict in the study area.
Research illegal trade in lion and lion products.
Establish a genetic and disease database for Ethiopian lions to identify populations of special concern and conservation priority – including establishing a central dedicated cryopreservation facility to allow long term storage of a diversity of wildlife samples.

 
Each of these goals could be achieved in isolation if we don’t raise the funding we need and in which case we will prioritise the goals in line with the monies donated to support the project. But obviously, the more money we can raise, the quicker we can achieve all the above and move the project to the next stage - to establish, with the full support of the Ethiopian Wildlife Conservation Authority, a comprehensive lion conservation programme.
RISKS
Ethiopia borders a number of unstable countries to the south (Somalia), to the west (South Sudan) and to the north (Eritrea). While there are reportedly lion populations along those border areas, this project will focus initially on lion populations with a high probability of immediate survival - those located in the centre of Ethiopia - Awash National Park. Another potentially problematic situation is the current structure of wildlife conservation authorities which is split between the federal government and the various autonomous provinces. However these different authorities have in the past worked well together to ensure survival of Ethiopia's endangered wildlife regardless of location of that wildlife. There is a huge willingness on the part of the federal Government to ensure that Ethiopia's national wildlife heritage is safeguarded for future generations - the Ethiopian people have a strong cultural connection to lions. 
 
WHAT YOU CAN DO TO HELP
Every single donation is valuable and will help us achieve each of the goals listed in the project details. It is now up to us to have the courage, fortitude, and strength to find the means to protect and conserve a species globally representative of the freedom and importance of wild animals. It can be done, but not without your dedicated support.
Your support can come in other ways too! Please share this campaign appeal with all your friends and family. Use the share tools that Indiegogo provides to spread the word to as many people around the world as possible. Together we can win for lions and save Ethiopia's unique lion heritage.

story:
SHARE GOODS AND SERVICES FOR FREE OR FOR A FEE - WITH PEOPLE YOU TRUST

 

BE THE ONE TO START THE SHARING REVOLUTION IN YOUR NETWORK, WE'LL HELP YOU GET STARTED. 

Sharing assets with the world can be scary, but sharing resources with people within your network feels more safe. Cowedo Community gives you access to a Internet-based arena providing features such as booking, communication and payment where members can share goods and services with each other. As the driving force you'll get access to a workspace where you can manage members and keep an overview of the activity. 

 

 

 

WHY WOULD PEOPLE SHARE WITHIN GROUPS?

  •  Sharing with colleagues, neighbors or friends feels safer
  • Sharing with people in your network can be more convenient in the matter of time and location
  • A more efficient way to utilize the strength of a network/community
  • Space-saving 
  • A nice way to get in contact with neighbors, colleagues and co-members

 

IS YOUR NETWORK SUSTAINABLE?

The world’s population keeps growing and resources and free space are getting scarcer.
Combined with an increased consumption of physical goods, earth is faced with a non-
sustaining development. The globalization of sharing services enables people and
organizations to invest less, and benefit more from assets and resources owned by others,
which will be an essential contribution to the solution. Creating a more sustainable balance
has always been one of the three cornerstones kept in mind in the foundation of Cowedo.
We provide tools to enable this, by empowering people to share resources such as
apartments, meeting rooms, cabins, transport services and household items, in an
affordable, flexible and simple manner.

 

WE BELIEVE IN THE STRENGTH OF LOCAL COMMUNITIES

Both currently and historically, travel distances between fjords in Norway were complicated and substantial, creating very strong local communities. These compact communities have developed around the world, where resources have been shared, and people have been supporting each other. 

The world is evolving and becoming ever more globalized. Consequently, many traditional communities are changing, whilst new are being formed. 

We're developing Cowedo Community because we believe in the strength of traditional local communities. We have the ambition to create systems allowing local communities to develop, own and run their local business models. Driving forces who do not have the resources to create Internet based arenas will be supported through our sharing platform with global reach. Subsequently, allowing individuals, clubs and businesses to create their individually tailored communities to share resources within groups. 

 

100 COMMUNITIES ONLY

Your community can now become one of the very first to get access to a platform where your members can share goods and services with each other. By utilizing available resources within the community and engaging collaboration between members you can build a stronger and more efficient community. 

 

USE CASES

 

NEIGHBOURHOODS

SPORTS CLUBS

STUDENT ASSOCIATIONS

 

- Tutoring services between students

- Accommodations 

- Services

- Rental goods

EMPLOYEES SHARING NETWORK 

- Carpooling between colleagues 

- Help each other out in a hectic life by providing services such as baby sitting

- CSR 

 

WHAT YOU GET?

By signing up for a Cowedo Community you will get access to a closed site for invited members only where all members can share any goods and services with each other. Based on cut of the edge technology the product will provide booking tools, payment provider and communication as well as user friendly management tools to help you administrate community members and keep an overview of resources being shared within the group.   

 

Membership features

  • Create profile
  • Schedule & publish goods & services
  • Browse goods & services
  • Request goods & services
  • Realtime communication 
  • Safe payment

Admin features

  • Invite members to community
  • Resource pool overview
  • Member management
  • Configure theme & branding for community

 

WHO ARE WE?

Cowedo is founded and driven by people with passion for sharing economy and technology. By using sharing economy services to seek new adventures we’ve witnessed the strength of local communities. 

 

Team Cowedo

Werner Lindgård (CTO)

Kristoffer Skar (Product Manager)

Anders Lund (Graphic Designer)

Igor Koudrik (Mobile App Developer)

 

Founders & Board Members

André Årnes (Co-Founder & Chairman)

Alexander Samsonsen (Co-Founder & Member of the Board)

Arlene Pearce (ScrumMaster & Member of the Board)

Marita Nyheim (Treasurer & Member of the Board)

 

WOULD YOU LIKE TO BE A PART OF SUCH COMMUNUNITY, BUT NOT THE RIGHT PERSON TO INITIATE IT?

- Share the campaign with driving forces or discussion maker in your neighborhood

- Share the campaign with leaders in sports clubs you’re a member of

story:
We are a group of people sharing the same ideals. We love recycling, protecting the environment, enjoying a late afternoon and contributing in our society.

My name is Marcelo, inventor of GreenRoute Project. This project had its origin several years ago when I worked for the Government of Chile as a manager in the area of information technologies.

On a weekend the main server stopped working. We tried to fix it, but unfortunately was not possible. My colleagues and I had to improvise and we went to the cemetery of computers (computers discarded by other departments) and we made a new server.

It was fantastic, this old server worked for 3 weeks.

As the experience had been successful, we came back to the cemetery of computers and refurbished six  computers more. We were recycling, reusing and reducing.

Unfortunately, not all components of an electronic device can be reused and this is how the problem began.

The amount of global e-waste reached 41.8 million of tons in 2014, according to a new report issued by the United Nations University.  Chile, my country, ranks first in Latin America as a generator of electronic waste.

Then, I made two questions:

What can I do?

And my reply was to prevent the electronic waste goes into the environment.

How can I do it?

Through an electronic recycling plant.

One day, in an informal conversation with my friends, we realized that we all had the same practices. Recycle at home, use solar chargers and share our cars. 

Recycling and caring for the environment was part of our lives. That same day Gonzalo, Maria and Ivette decided to join the team. They gave form and structure to the project. Their mission was to define the structure and strategy of the Project.


On Environment
  • The plastic of the computers could take more than one thousand years to degrade.
  • A mercury battery could pollute 600 liters of water.
  • Lithium, Cadmium and nickel are present in some electronic waste and can cause irreversible damage to living beings, even death.


On Human Health





The main feature of our project will be the integration.

We want to create communities committed to keep up the environment and be a bridge between producers of electronic devices and consumers.




Through education, we will connect people with the care of the environment.

Recycling points distributed in public and private places, recycling fairs and strategic alliances with companies will be the mechanisms to recover electronic waste.

During the first year, our goal is:

  • To recycle at least 8 tons of electronic waste
  • To become a B Corp. 
  • To plan a “recycling day” in 7 schools

And create a large community of recyclers...

If we get the necessary funds, we can build a small electronic recycling plant, buying tools, recruiting people and developing this noble activity.





For every reward, we will give a donation to The WATERisLIFE Project. A Straw filter for school children and medical clinics.


For every reward, we will plant a tree in the forests of Patagonia.



For every reward, we will give a donation to WWF Gorilla conservation programs.



For each reward, we will give an environmental educational talk at a school.






En español

Greenroute Trabajemos juntos por un mundo mejor

Historia:

Somos un grupo de personas que comparten los mismos ideales. Nos encanta reciclar, proteger el medio ambiente, disfrutar de un atardecer  y contribuir a nuestra sociedad.

Mi nombre es Marcelo y soy el creador del Proyecto GreenRoute. Este proyecto tiene su origen hace varios años cuando trabajaba para el Gobierno de Chile como encargado del área de tecnologías de la información.

Un fin de semana el servidor principal dejó de funcionar. Tratamos de arreglarlo, pero por desgracia no fue posible. Mis colegas y yo tuvimos que improvisar y nos dirigimos al cementerio de computadores (computadores  desechados por otros departamentos) y construimos otro servidor.

Fue fantástico, este viejo servidor funcionó  durante 3 semanas.

Como la experiencia había sido exitosa, volvimos al cementerio y restauramos seis computadoras más. Estábamos reciclando, reutilizando y reduciendo.

Desafortunadamente  no todos los componentes de un dispositivo electrónico pueden ser reutilizados y es aquí es donde comienza el problema.

La cantidad de basura electrónica mundial alcanzó 41,8 millones de toneladas en 2014, según un nuevo informe de la Universidad de las Naciones Unidas. Chile, mi país, ocupa el primer lugar en América Latina como generador de residuos electrónicos.

Entonces me hice dos preguntas

¿Qué puedo hacer?

Y mi respuesta fue impedir que los  residuos electrónicos lleguen al  medio ambiente.

¿Cómo puedo hacerlo?

A través de una planta de reciclaje electrónico.

Un día, en una conversación informal con mis amigos, nos dimos cuenta de que  todos teníamos las mismas prácticas. Reciclar en casa, utilizar cargadores solares y compartir nuestros automóviles.

El reciclaje y cuidado por el medio ambiente era parte de nuestras vidas. Ese mismo día Gonzalo y María e Ivette  aceptaron ser parte del equipo. Ellos tendrían la misión de definir la estructura  y estrategia del proyecto.


Efectos de la basura electrónica

En el medio Ambiente:

·El plástico de computadores podría tardar hasta mil años en degradarse

·Una pila de mercurio es capaz de contaminar 600 mil litros de agua

·El Litio, Cadmio y Níquel presente en algunos residuos electrónicos producen daños irreversibles en los seres vivos pudiendo causar incluso la muerte.



Greenroute

La característica principal de nuestro proyecto será la integración.
Queremos crear comunidades comprometidas con el cuidado del medio ambiente
Queremos ser un puente entre los productores de aparatos electrónicos y los consumidores.




A través de la educación vamos a conectar a las personas con el cuidado del medio ambiente.

Puntos de reciclaje distribuidos en lugares públicos y privados, ferias de reciclaje y alianzas estratégicas con empresas serán los mecanismos para recuperar los residuos electrónicos.

Durante el primer año queremos:

·  Reciclar al menos 8 toneladas de residuos electrónicos.

  • Convertirnos en una B Corp

·  Organizar día del reciclaje en 7 colegios

Y crear una gran comunidad de recicladores...

Si logramos conseguir los fondos necesarios, podremos construir una pequeña planta de reciclaje electrónico, comprar herramientas, reclutar gente y desarrollar esta noble actividad.

El equipo

Recompensas

Por cada recompensa vamos a hacer una donación al proyecto WATERisLIFE HAITÍ. Un filtro de agua para los escolares y clínicas médicas.


Por cada recompensa vamos a plantar un árbol en los bosques de la Patagonia de Chile.


Por cada recompensa vamos a hacer una donación a la WWF en el programa de conservación de Gorilas


Por cada recompensa haremos una charla educativa medioambiental en una escuela


Línea de tiempo

Queremos ser un puente entre los productores de aparatos electrónicos y los
consumidores.



A través de la educación vamos a conectar a las personas con el cuidado del
medio ambiente.
Puntos
de reciclaje distribuidos en lugares públicos y privados, ferias de reciclaje y
alianzas estratégicas con empresas serán los mecanismos para recuperar los
residuos electrónicos.
Durante el primer año queremos:
· 
Reciclar al menos
8 toneladas de residuos electrónicos.

Convertirnos en una B Corp

· 
Organizar día del
reciclaje en 7 colegios 
Y
crear una gran comunidad de recicladores...
Si logramos
conseguir los fondos necesarios, podremos construir una pequeña planta de
reciclaje electrónico, comprar herramientas, reclutar gente y desarrollar esta
noble actividad.
El equipo




Recompensas

Por cada
recompensa vamos a hacer una donación al proyecto WATERisLIFE HAITÍ. Un filtro
de agua para los escolares y clínicas médicas.


Por cada
recompensa vamos a plantar un árbol en los bosques de la Patagonia de Chile.


Por
cada recompensa vamos a hacer una donación a la WWF en el programa de
conservación de Gorilas



Por cada
recompensa haremos una charla educativa medioambiental en una escuela



Línea de tiempo

story:
Kota Damansara Community Forest Reserve was gazetted in 2010 after a sustained campaign by civil society to safeguard the forest.  This 800 acres of forest remains today, a precious oasis of green amid the urban sprawl of Klang Valley, a refuge for biodiversity and humans alike.

Over the past 5 years, with our volunteers and sponsors, we are proud to have demonstrated the power of public participation by building 14 km of sustainable forest trails that are open to the public without charge. The trails provide an amazing pathway to recreation, education, and reconnecting with nature and well-being.

KDCF's forest trails are maintained by volunteers working alongside a dedicated team of Temuan Orang Asli that are the backbone of forest trail upkeep. We rely on the Temuan Team for rapid response - removing fallen trees from trails, replacing broken signage, even removing hornets nests! They also accompany visiting volunteers or school groups that come to learn about the forest environment. In sum, without them it would not be possible to keep our trails open, safe and serving our community.

KDCF Society is committed to ensuring that there is regular work and income for our indigenous neighbours. Each year we need approximately USD4,000 for trail maintenance. This year we have already managed to raise USD1,000 of this amount. With your help we can raise the rest of the funds we need to continue to engage the Temuan Team to maintain the KDCF trails for a further 12 months.

story:
Clean Up North Brooklyn 

Clean Up North Brooklyn 

North Brooklyn handles 40% of New York City’s solid waste. More specifically, we handle on average more than 7,000 tons of waste daily, by hosting 15 of NYC’s solid waste transfer stations. These dangerous garbage warehouses are often placed in low income communities and have been shown to be harmful to our health. In fact children living in our North Brooklyn community are many times more likely to develop asthma than the average NY state child. The public health and safety is compromised daily due to diesel fuel pollution, stench, rat infestation, and the powerful industrial perfumes that are used in an attempt to mask the dangerous odors coming from these facilities. The mission of Cleanup North Brooklyn is to demand better air quality, clean up delinquent waste transfer stations, educate our neighbors and fight trash inequity in our borough. 

Our Goals

  • Reduce truck traffic in North Brooklyn. PM (Particulate Matter) 2.5 aka diesel fuel soot is 2.5 microns in diameter, so small it becomes embedded in our lungs for long term health issues.  We need to slow the parade of trucks on our streets by diverting trucks away from heavily populated residential neighborhoods.  
  • Relocate Brooklyn Transfer LLC.  Anyone that lives or visits this part of Bushwick can see that the trash transfer facility at 115 Thames is too dangerous to be operating so close to our homes. Due to an inaccurate and unmerciful M1 (light manufacturing) zoning, hundreds of families and individuals have lived in the shadow of this trash facility since 2000. However this residential area has been here since the 1930's. We urge the trash facility to relocate to an M2 or M3 zone (heavy manufacturing) away from our children, and we wish to oversee an environmental cleanup of 115 Thames St. 
  • Renew the quality of life in North Brooklyn. The stench, noise, rats, and truck traffic is both uncomfortable and and dangerous for those that live here. We want to help transform North Brooklyn to a more peaceful, fresher smelling, more welcoming corner of our borough.
  • Give local residents a voice. It's not easy standing up to the powerful private carting industry. As individuals it's near impossible, but as a group we can have our voices heard. Please join in our fight. 

Our Momentum

Cleanup North Brooklyn has made tremendous headway in the two years we have been fighting for change.  After our town meeting on November 30th and with help from Councilman Antonio Reynoso, the NY Department of Sanitation chose to cut their city garbage truck traffic by 50% to the local trash transfer station. This is a massive win that was made possible by the community rising up and standing together.  But with this momentum we are at a critical stage in our cause.  


Our Needs

Our documentary short film, Brooklyn Transfer has been the sharpest weapon in our fight against trash inequity. It has helped get our message to the Daily News, the Department of Sanitation, and the Department of Environmental Conservation.

With your help we can finish the film and get it seen by more city agencies. Specifically your donations will go towards camera and sound rentals, editing, and mixing.  In addition, your donations will go towards air quality and noise monitoring. This environmental testing is crucial to our cause.  We also plan to lawyer up so we have a legal voice as we take on a powerful industry with many more resources than our community group. All of the above will help us face off with Five Star Carting which Councilman Reynoso called “the worst of the worst" in private carting. 

Our efforts have already made a difference, reducing city garbage trucks in our neighborhood by 50%.  To build on our momentum we need your support! Help us take it to the next level. 


Other Ways You Can Contribute

If you can't donate, please do not feel like you cannot help in other ways. 

  • Come to our meetings. Invite your friends and family that live in the neighborhood!
  • Visit our Facebook Page!
  • Spread the Word! Please share.
